The wind Southerly Thermometer at 36° above in morning and drizling rain The ground as bare as in July. at 10 am commenced snowing Helped G F Kingsley fill his ice house at 3 pm the Wind N.W. at 9 pm Thermometer down to zero and very blustering snowing dancing school at my house in the evening
The wind North West. Thermometer 2 degrees below zero. Work in the house jobbing Taking the Office for a work shop
The wind Westerly. Thermometer 10 degrees above zero work in house making Counter.
The wind Easterly. work in house making over a chair into a barbers chair for Warren Smith.
The wind Westerly Thermometer up to 35 degrees above zero.

The wind Easterly rainy in morning afterward snow and rain Went to West Gouldsboro With Wm Sargents house to see about the new mail Route came home in the afternoon dancing school at my house in the evening Thermometer at 9 pm 16° above
The wind North West Thermometer 5 degrees above zero in the morning and 12 degrees above at night. Work most of the day in J F Kingsleys shop. Turning. Went to Temprance Exhibition in Evening.
The wind North West. Thermometer at zero in the morning + 14 above at night Work about home all day

Calm all day, The Thermometer 2 degrees above in the morning Wrote letter to the Penobscot Mutual Fire Ins Co of Bangor. Work in the house making liba Recd letter from Capt E. V. Lynam. Long pond. Went to a religious meeting in the Evening.
letter_to: Penobscot Mutual Fire Ins Co of Bangor
notes: Penobscot Mutual Fire Ins Co was definitely a difficult phrase in one of previous journals, couldn't get penobscot

journal_entry: The wind E.N. East. Thermometer 14 degrees above zero. A little snow in the middle of the day. Work on the out side of the house. a part of the forenoon trying to stop a leak.
The wind Northerly Thermometer from 8 degrees up to 18 degrees above zero. Work in house finishing the Office
The wind Westerly Thermometer 16 degrees above zero in the morning
Calm all day. The Thermometer from 16 degrees above zero to 34 above very pleasant. Finished the joiner work in the Office and had it primed.

The wind Northerly + moderate Thermometer from 28 degrees to 35 above zero. Wrote letter to H.D. Coombs Augusta for a commission as Justice of the Peace. Helped J.K. Kingsley shingle the roof of his ice house Recd letter from Penobscot Mutual Fire Ins Co.
letter_from: Penobscot Mutual Fire Ins Co of Bangor

journal_entry: The wind Westerly Thermometer at 38 degrees above zero. Went in the woods often Cut timbers in the forenoon. And went a Crannberrying in the afternoon Not a particle of snow to be seen but Ice in swamps
Calm all day Thermometer at 44 degrees above zero. Wrote letter to C C Burrill Cut wood at the door Went to Dick Martz. Exhibition in evening
The wind Southerly Thermometer 39 degrees above zero. Went clamming and floundering in forenoon And in the afternoon had the office grained and in the Evening went to a Religious Meeting
The wind North East and rainy The Thermometer 35 degrees above zero. No snow to be seen Painted the floor of the office Recd letter from H.D. Coombs Augusta
The wind North East and snowy all day The Thermometer 20 degrees above zero all day.
The wind Northerly Thermometer from 18 to 20 degrees above zero. Snow enough to make quite decent sledding the first for the season except one day Work about home.

The wind West Thermometer at 20 degrees above zero. Wrote letters to American Office Ellsworth and Penobscot Mutual Fire Ins Co Went on sail in yatcht Water Lily Capt R Pendeleton Rect letter from C.C. Burrill
letter_to: American Office Ellsworth, Penobscot Mutual Fire Ins Co

journal_entry: The wind South Westerly Thermometer 32 above zero Clerk for J.D. Harrington for him and his wife to go to Colombia
The wind North West Thermometer from 7 above up to 20. Clerk for J D Harrington
Calm all day. Thermometer down to zero. Clerk for J.D. Harrington a part of the day until the arrival of him + his wife

Very light Northerly wind. Thermometer at 20 degrees above in the morning in the shade but gradually risind toward middle of the day. Wrote to H.D. Coombs + D A Ray Recd letter from Penobscot Mutual Fire Ins Co
letter_to: Hiram D. Coombs, D. A. Ray

journal_entry: The wind Southerly Thermometer 24 above zero. Went to Ellsworth in the afternoon with J.D. Harrington stoped at the Lake House
The wind Northerly got fifty dollars of C.C. Burrill. Left Ellsworth at 11 am took dinner with R.A. Heath came home in the afternoon Thermometer 12 degrees above.
The wind North West Thermometer at 20 above zero Wrote letters to A J Baker M.D. Postal Cards to N.H. Higgins and Galen H Smith.
letter_to: A. J. Baker M.D., N.H. Higgins, Galen H. Smith.

journal_entry: The wind Southerly in the afternoon and evening snowy. Thermometer at 24 above got supper for a dance at the ending of a dancing School
The wind North East. Thermometer at 20 above Recd Lizzie May Ulmers dramatic Company. for boarders Recd letter from C.C. Burrill
letter_from: Lizzie May Ulmers, Charles C. Burrill

journal_entry: The wind East fresh blow Thermometer at 20 above about the house waiting upon the company
The wind South East rainy most of the day Thermometer 38° above zero Recd an appointment from Secretary of state as justice of the peace
The wind North West. Thermometer 44° above zero.
The wind North West Thermometer made moddle for a new boat.

The wind North West. Thermometer 34 degrees above zero. Registered letter to Treasurer of State of Maine for a commission as justice of the Peace. wrote letter to R. Fickett + Son Mulbridge Recd letter from H.D. Coombs Postal card from Lizzie May
letter_to: Treasurer of State of Maine, R. Fickett and Sons

journal_entry: The wind North West Thermometer 36° above zero Work apart of the day mending stove
The wind South West Thermometer 40 degrees above zero. Recd letters from R Fickett + son Work in J F Kingsleys shop building boat for myself
Thermometer 24 above zero Wind North Work apart of the day on boat.

The wind Southerly Thermometer 32 above Work all day for Wm Handy splicing Sea Pigeons mainmast Wrote letters to Myses Maynard Gough & Co & R Fickett + Sons. Recd commission from the State as justice of the peace.
letter_to: Myses Maynard Gough & Co, R. Fickett and Sons

journal_entry: The wind South Easterly Thermometer at 40 degrees above zero. And heavy rain storm all day.
The wind N.N. West. and rainy all day Thermometer 40 degrees above Work on a boat building one fore myself.
The wind North West Thermometer 29 above 0 Work in forenoon on my boat. and in the afternoon for Capt. Wm Handy on Sea Pigeons mast Recieved letter from R. Fickett + Sons.
The wind Southerly Worked apart of the forenoon for Wm Handy on vessels mast. In afternoon went to Lower Harbor and took Mr Cranes boat of to go to Bar Harbor next day apart

The wind very moderate Southerly and foggy. Thermometer 38 above 0 Went to Bar Harbor with Chas Pendleton and L G Cranes boat after Lizzie May Ulmers Dramatic Company. Got home with them at 5 oclock pm Went to Theatre
location: Winter Harbor, Bar Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind North West and the Thermometer 52 degrees above zero in the Shade on North Side house Recd letter from Myses Maynard Gough + Company
The wind Moderate N.W. Thermometer 48 degrees above 0  Wrote letter to Messes Maynard Gough + Co. Worked a part of the day in J.F. Kingsleys shop on a boat building for my self.
The wind South West Thermometer 46 above zero Wind hauled around North West in afternoon
NA
NA
NA
NA
NA
NA
The wind Southerly Thermometer 38° above Went to Lower Harbor and Mark Island Recd letter Stephen Southard. Via Chas Norris
notes: letter received via Chas Norris does that mean 2 letters or 1 ?

journal_entry: The wind Easterly fresh breeze Thermometer 33°  a big snow storm the largest there has been for the Winter. and very blustering. Work apart of the day for J.F. Kingsley on on boat for James Knight.

The wind North West Thermometer 38° above went Court in forenoon case where B. T. Sowle arrested Fred Rice for disturbing the school verdict for Soule. Rice fined $200 & east. E. Colemans trial justice. In afternoon attended court in Hall in case B.T. Soule arrested G.L. Norwood for calling him a damn hypocrite. E.C. Caves Trial justice. my self councelor for G.L. Norwood court adjourned untill tomorrow at 9 oclock for Evidence Recd letter from Portland + Machias Boat Co.
letter_from: Genl Agt Portland Bangor & Machias Steamboat Co

journal_entry: The wind N.W. fresh breeze Thermometer 36° above zero Attended court at 9 am as per adjournment. any self Councellor for defendant B. T. Sowle Councellor for himself verdict for defendent

Wrote letter to E.W. Cleaves The wind North West Thermometer 18 above Went to West Gouldsboro. and took the stage & Went to Ellsworth after money got $100 of C C Burrill Was qualified as justice of the peace
The wind North West Thermometer 20 above Sent Post Office order to Wm. H. Earl from Ellsworth to Bangor. In the afternoon came to West Gouldsboro
The wind South West Thermometer 40° Came home at noon Mrs. Nathan Hammond died about 7 oclock pm
The wind Southerly. Thermometer 40°

The wind South West early in the morning blowing a gale and hauled to the West Thermometer 20° above worked apart of the day For J.F. Kingsley. Hauled out a load for my self Acknowledged deed for Mrs. Mary W Joy warantee deed

The wind West. Thermometer 36° degrees attended the funeral of Mrs. Lucinda Hammond Wrote letter to Freeland Rosebrook Recd letter from Chas Shaw Recd letter heads & envelopes printed from the American Office
The wind Southerly Thermometer 40° above zero. work apart of the day in J.F. Kingsleys shop.
The wind Easterly Thermometer 36° Wrote letters to Myses M Gallant &Co Henry Benson Chas Shaw & Geo Westcott Eldridge & Perry Commenced planking boat for my self
letter_to: Myses M Gallant &Co, Henry Benson, Chas Shaw, George Westcott, Eldridge & Perry

journal_entry: The wind N.N. East. Thermometer 36° above. Bought a horse of George Wescott
The wind N.N. East. and Snowy all day. Thermometer 33 above wrote letters to S.C. Forsaith
The wind Northerly Thermometer 35° above and rainy all day.
The wind Northerly Thermometer 36° and overcast, misty. Work apart of the day on my boat and commenced making Pile driver for Gerrish Tracy &Co.

The wind Northerly and overcast Thermometer 34° above Wrote letter to Myses. R Fickett + Sons. Work all day on Pile driver for Gerrish and Tracy. Recd letter from Eldridge & Perry. Alice Tracy died about midnight
letter_to: Myses M Gallant &Co, R. Fickett and Sons.

journal_entry: The wind Northerly Thermometer 46° Work all day on Pile Driver

The wind North North East and drizzling rain all day Thermometer from 34° to 40°  Work in the forenoon for J.D. Harrington putting up Iron sink. Mys. Alice Tracy burried in the afternoon Recd Postal Card from Mysrs. Maynard Tough &Co
The wind North East. and rainy and rainy all day. Thermometer 38° Finished Pile driver for Gerrish Tracy &Co. Wrote letter to Bertha Smallidge
The wind N.N.East. Thermometer 36° Wrote letters to Reg of deeds Mysrs Cobb Wight & Norton Work about home.
letter_to: Reg of deeds Mysrs Cobb Wight & Norton

journal_entry: The wind Northerly Thermometer 34° rainy all day by spells
The wind North East. Thermometer 40° jobbing abt home.
The wind South West and clear Thermometer 36° above work most all day on boat for my self
The wind Southerly and foggy in forenoon Thermometer 40° degrees Work all day on boat for my self

The wind Southerly and rainy foggy. Thermometer 38° degrees Went to Prospect Harbor to Carry Wm. Handy Finished planking boat at J.F. Kingsleys shop Recd letters from Mysrs S.C. Forsaith & Co. and R. Fickitt & sons.
letter_from: Mysrs S.C. Forsaith & Co.,  R. Fickitt & sons.

journal_entry: The wind Easterly fresh breeze and big rain storm the Thermometer 39. Moved boat from J.F. Kingsley shop to my house in morning
The wind very moderate Southerly Thermometer 44° Wrote letters to Genl Agt Portland Bangor & Machias Steamboat Co. and Capt. David Robinson Put gunwails on boat.
letter_to: Genl Agt Portland Bangor & Machias Steamboat Co., Capt. David Robinson

journal_entry: The wind North Overcast. Thermometer 48° Went to Sullivan to Cary Herbert E Tracy and accompanied by his Brother Charles E Tracy
The wind Northerly and fresh breeze. Thermometer 43 Filled out application for Bounty Claim for Mrs. Mary Tracy
The wind Southerly Thermometer 42 degrees. Painted boat inside.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 45° bought waggon of William Guptill. Went to Birch Harbor to Charles Cranes funeral.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 42° Went to Ellsworth with my horse after sheeting for bed
The wind North West Thermometer 55° Got the goods and came home in afternoon

The wind Southerly and clear. Thermometer 55° degree above. Caulked and painted boat Recd postal card from A.J. Chapman Esq Bangor. Filled out and acknowledged the Signing of an application for Pension for Nancy Joy.

The wind Southerly and foggy Thermometer 51° at noon Went to prayer meeting Preaching in forenoon. And in the afternoon went to Baptism in this place. Hannah Newman, Augustus Newman, Alphena and Daniel Bickford, Mary Ann Giles, Emma Jane Myrick, and Joseph Bickford In the Evening went to meeting of the Lords supper by Wm Whitten
The wind Westerly. The Thermometer 56° above Puttied the boat and painted her Bought pig of F Toft 5 weeks old
The wind North East. Thermometer 54° Wrote letters to Mrs Proctor Smallidge, S.C. Forsaith, &Co, Thomas Bunker & E.A. Baker Recd Hotel Register from Mysrs Maynard &Co.
letter_to: Mrs Proctor Smallidge, S.C. Forsaith &Co, Thomas Bunker, E.A. Baker

journal_entry: The wind Southerly and wet and foggy Thermometer 51° work all day on boat putting in seals &e
The wind Southerly and foggy Thermometer 48 Wrote letters to Capt H.C. Guptill Calais work a little while on boat.
The wind South Easterly and foggy Thermometer 50 work about the house all day
The wind South East. and rainy in morning Thermometer 50 degrees. Wrote letters to S.C. Muney &Co. Worked on boat apart of the afternoon. Recd letter from S.C. Forsaith Red Speech from Han & Hale
The wind South East foggy and rainy in morning Thermometer 50 degrees afternoon cleared up.
The wind North East and rainy Thermometer 57 hauled one load wood
The wind North East and heavy rain all day. Thermomter 49° wrote letter to Mrs. Martin Pendleton at Lynn Recd letter from Geo Bagley work about the house. C.J. Guptill made each as school agt.
The wind Easterly and overcast. Thermometer 46°, fixed pen for pig and hauled wood from Esqr Rands meadow
The wind South West and clear. Thermometer 54° Cut wood at the door wrote letter to G.W. Bagley
The wind Southerly Thermometer 50° hauled stone all day grading in front of house.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 52 foggy. Grading in front of house.
The wind Southerly and foggy Thermometer 48° Went to Religious meeting in Evening
The wind Baffleing or Calm all day and the Thermometer 55 degrees Went to Steuben to see abt getting lumber and to Millbridge to see R. Fickett & sons Came back at night
The wind Westerly Thermometer 56. Work in the house making Curtain Sticks and fixing windows. Had new Shoes put on the Horse. Recd letter from Mrs. J.D. Fernald Boston
The wind North West Thermometer 56° Went to Ellsworth. with my horse after dishes and Table linnes
The wind Easterly. and clear Thermometer  54 Came home from Ellsworth in afternoon.
The wind Easterly and rainy Thermometer 52° wrote letter to Mysrs Eldridge & Perry. Sold Massiah Southards horse to Mr W.F. Vose.

The wind South West Pleasant Thermometer 53 Wrote letter to J.D. Femeld and Stephen Southard. Went to Bar Harbor in my boat & back. Recd letters from S.R. Niles advertising agents. Boston & Abraham French & Co. Dealers in Crocking & glass ware.
location: Winter Harbor, Bar Harbor, Winter Harbor
letter_from: S.R. Niles advertising agents, Abraham French, Company Dealers in Crocking  and glass ware

journal_entry: The wind North West. Thermometer 50° Went up to the Shore for Baptism but candidate failed to come forward. At night went to the Marsh to be ready for a start To go to Steuben after lumber for outside hog
The wind Northerly & The Thermometer 49 Went to Steuben and got a load of boards and back to West Bay. had them planed and came home at night had Calvin Tracys horse with mine
The wind N.N.West Thermometer 41° degrees Wrote letters to Eldridge &  Perry also Rev Mr. Tripp of Surry
letter_to: Mysrs Eldridge & Perry, Rev. L. S. Tripp of Surry

journal_entry: The wind South Easterly and the Thermometer 55° Commenced building platform around the house Filled out an application for pension for F.P. Gerrish

South East wind overcast Thermometer. Wrote letters to American Office Chas Burrill (of Ellsworth) and F.W. Webber (Cambridgeport) Daily Courier (Lowell)  Mrs. Geddy. Commenced laying platform around house
letter_to: American Office,  Charles C. Burrill,  F.W. Webber,  Daily Courier,  Mrs. Geddy

journal_entry: The wind Southerly and Thermometer 52 finished laying platform on west side of the house

The wind very moderate all day. Thermometer 58° Work on platform around house Recd letters from E.A. Baker Springfield Republican Cambridge Cronicle Boston Courier L.S. Tripp of Surry and from American Office
letter_from: E.A. Baker, Springfield Republican, Cambridge Conicle,  Boston Courier,  Rev. L.S. Tripp of Surry,  American Office

journal_entry: The wind North East in morning hauled around South East in afternoon Went to the baptism of three persons. Mrs Julia Bickford Mrs Direxa Guptill and Mrs. Alma Moon by Mr Whitten The Thermometer 61° degrees high in the shade North side of the house.
The wind South East. Thermometer 56° Work around the House
The wind S.S. East Thermometer 49°  Wrote letters to S.C. Forsaith E.A. Baker Mrs. J.D. Fernald
letter_to: S.C. Forsaith,  E.A. Baker,  Mrs. J.D. Fernald

journal_entry: Calm and overcast in forenoon Started for Bar Harbor with Capt R. Pendleton Thermometer 45 at 11 am Took the wind North West and heavy rain came back in afternoon
location: Winter Harbor, Bar Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind North East fresh breeze and rain Squalls Thermomter 55 Work around the house recieved letters from Alice E Smith Rockland Mary Smallidge and D.W. Joy
letter_from: Alice E Smith, Mary Smallidge, D.W. Joy

journal_entry: The wind North East, in morning fresh breeze at 10 am wind moderate Thermometer 54° Went to Bar Harbor With R Pendleton after Mary Smallidge wrote letters to Mrs J.D. Fernald
The wind South Easterly Thermometer 49° Went to Ellsworth with my horse accompanied by my wife after dishes. Got a load of dishes and came back to West Gouldsboro. and stoped to Mrs. E Kingsley
The wind Southerly & foggy Wrote letter to American Office. and came home in forenoon Thermometer 55 degrees.
The wind South West Thermometer 60. Work about home on the house
The wind from N.W. to S.W. and the Thermometer 62 Wrote letter to F.W. Webber. Cambridgeport Recd letter from Boston Home Journal. Hauled wood from the wharf for T. H. Smallidge work around the House
The wind North West. Thermometer 65 degrees Work around the House
The wind Easterly at night Foggy Thermometer 56 wrote a Lease of James Banett peace to Nahum Fittzjerald Recd letter from Salem Post.
The wind Very moderate all day Southerly and the Thermometer 69 Working on water closet
The wind Southerly Thermometer 52° degrees Work on water closet. recd letters from Officer of Salem day Evening Express S H Paritin Advertising age Cincinnati
The wind Southerly Thermometer 56 degrees
The wind Southeast and foggy Thermometer 55 Work on water closet with the help of Frank Summer
The wind Southerly & Foggy Thermometer 55° Had Parlor papered by Frank Summer and worked around the House Wrote letter to Eldridge & Perry. and Recd letter from Mrs J.D. Fernald
The wind Southerly and foggy Thermometer 55 Work on water closet. Recd dishes from Eldridge & Perry by Express

The wind North West and fresh breeze and the Thermometer 55 degrees Work on house getting ready for boards Recd letters from Eldridge & Perry of Ellsworth and Hombmes & Dennison of Brewer and from the Hotel world
letter_from: Eldridge & Perry, Hombmas & Dennison, Hotel world

journal_entry: The wind from W.N.W. to S.W. very fresh breeze. Thermometer from 50° 60 Put down carpet in parlor and got Parlor and Office ready for use. and work around the House generally.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 54 Commenced farming in morning and finished at night with the help of Charles Harrington at night very heavy rain
The wind North East and very heavy rain until 8 oclock Cleaned up with the wind North West Thermometer 52° degrees above
The wind baffling and moderate all day. Thermometer 52 degrees Wrote letter to American Office work all day on house. on water closet.
The wind North East and rainy all day Thermometer 50 degrees Wrote letter to C.C. Burrill laid carpet in chamber Went Birch Harbor at night to Carry John McFarland of Lamoine and brought him back
location: Winter Harbor, Birch Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Southerly and by spells Showery Thermometer 52 degrees Took Wm Rands saw to the Lower Harbor with the help of Wm Rand + John Grover and loaded her with wood 5 cords got back to Henry's Cove at dark and grounded the Scow

The wind Southerly and Showery Thermometer 53° Went to the West Shore to Cary Frank Summer and his tool chest hauled 7 loads of wood from the Sem house Recd letters from Boston Times + Boston daily Transcript
The wind Southerly and thick with fog all day Finished hauling wood from Scow to the door at noon Worked on Liberty pole apart of the afternoon After Supper went to Prospect Harbor with my Honey
The wind Southerly and Foggy. Thermometer 53° made sign board for R Rand to paint Eureka House Recd letters from Boston Transcript Office Wrote letters to Frank Woodard
The wind Southerly and Foggy Thermometer 56 at night the fog scaled up.
The wind Southerly fresh breeze Thermometer 54° work all day around the House hauling gravel.
The wind Southerly & foggy Thermometer 58° Went to Sullivan to Mr Pettengills to see Abbie Crabtree wrote letter to Eldridge & Perry. Went to prospect at night. Recd letter from Emma M. Spurling
The wind Southerly fog cleared all the vessels went out Went to Prospect got Bbl flour. Thermometer 59 degrees Bought waggon of H.D. Coombs

Calm in morning and in afternoon wind Southerly Thermometer 70 degrees Recieved letters from American Office & Franck Woodard of Ellsworth. Had a Clapping match in afternoon and a dance in evening at House got wagon home of H.D. Coombs
The wind Southerly Thermometer 69 degrees work all day with horse grading in front of the house Wrote letter to E.A. Baker
The wind moderate Easterly Thermometer at noon 75 degrees in shade finished grading aroung the house and worked apart of the day leveling up the Grounds.
The wind fresh breeze and heavy rain all day Thermometer 48 degrees
The wind Southerly and foggy Thermometer 58 Work around the house. whitewashing & painting and fixing up things in general.
The wind Southerly and foggy in morning at night the wind W. Thermometer 60 degrees. Painted Hall floor and work around the house. Wrote letter to Emma Spurling.
The wind North West Painted hall floor and put down carpet, white washed and fixed up out buildings and leveled grounds &e. Thermometer 60 degrees
The wind North West and very fine weather Thermometer 68 degrees Work about the house put down the Carpet &e
The wind Southerly East Thermometer 60 degrees Work about the House all day. Put Sign up.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 84° at 5 p.m. Wrote letter to G.W. Bagley went to Prospect in afternoon. worked apart of the day making flying boom for the Schr Black Warrior

Calm in morning at 8 oclock and the thermometer in the shade was 80 degrees in the afternoon there was a very light air of wind S.E. and the Thermometer 90 Went to a Religious Meeting in the evening by Rvd Richard Mitchell
The wind Southerly Thermometer 78 degr Hauled up freight in morning and turned croquet mallets Worked apart of the afternoon on flying jibboom for black warrior recd letter from  G.W. Bagley
The wind South West Thermometer 85 degrees high in the shade wrote letters to G.W. Bagley and Frank Woodard

The wind Southerly & foggy most all day & the Thermometer 78 degrees made cushion for waggon seat and work about the house getting ready for summer boarders Went Mrs. Dr E.J. Frenchs Lecture on Manakin or keep good health.
The wind Easterly in morning then Southerly Thermometer 81 degrees. No Celebration at this place except fireing Canon and going on Pic Nic In the evening fireworks and a dance at my house.
The wind North West. Thermometer 80 degrees in the shade as it is on the North side of the House.
The wind North West Thermometer 70 degrees Went to Bar Harbor with R Pendleton Came back in Warren Smiths skiff My cook came on the Lewiston to Bar Harbor Came over with R Pendleton
location: Winter Harbor, Bar Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Southerly Thermometer 70 degrees Went on Isen Bound + Jordans Island
The wind Southerly Thermometer 76° Wrote letters to S.C. Forsaith & Co. Walter Wood S.L. Dennison owners of Str Magnet Genl Agt of Sto Chas Houghton A.J.Chapman Esq.
letter_to: S.C. Forsaith & Co., Walter Wood,  S.L. Dennison, A.J.Chapman Esq.

journal_entry: Not Available
Not Available
Not Available
Not Available
Not Available
Not Available

The wind Northerly Thermometer 52 Wrote letter to owners of Steamer Magnet Drove stage from Winter Harbor to W. Gouldsboro Recd letters from S.C. Forsaith & Co. & A White of Hingham Hired Mrs J.D. Fernald for cook for the summer
letter_from: S.C. Forsaith & Co., A. White of Hingham

journal_entry: The wind Southerly Thermometer 62 degrees Wrote letter to A White of Hingham work building steps to plat form and clearing up door yard.
The wind Southerly and rainy all day fresh breeze in afternoon Thermometer 55 degrees Cut door throng from dining room to store room.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 70 degrees work abt the house putting shelves in store room &e Recd card from G.L. Dennison
The wind Northerly in forenoon Went to Bar Harbor to Telegraph. The wind very moderate Southerly Started for home at 7p.m.
location: Winter Harbor, Bar Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Easterly Thermometer 68 degrees Wrote letter to Elias Hale & CC Vedall. Recd Letter from Elias J Hale

The wind Southerly Thermometer 62 Went on a ride to the sands and to the Marsh accompanied by my wife and child Went to a religious meeting in the evening advertised in the Boston Daily Evening Traveler $1878 to be paid in year
The wind Southerly Thermometer 62 degrees helped J.F. Kingsley in the afternoon get his hay. Bought one half ton of hay and put it in T.R. Hammonds barn
The wind Northerly Thermometer 68° in the forenoon and overcast in the afternoon clear weather Thermometer 72° help J Kingsley all day haying.
The wind North West. Thermometer 74 degrees Work for J.F. Kingsley haying. hauled in five loads
The wind Southerly Thermometer 72 degrees work for J.F. Kingsley hauled in two loads of hay.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 58 moderate rain in the afternoon. Hauled one load of hay in barn in forenoon for J.F.K

The wind S.S. East in forenoon and very heavy rain In the afternoon cleared up Thermometer 70° degrees wrote letters to Geo S Peters and A White of Hingham work apart of the day on Express wagon for my self turning hub &e
letter_to: Geo. S. Peters, A. White of Hingham

journal_entry: The wind North West Thermometer 72 degrees Help J.F. Kingsley haul in 4 loads of hay. had party from Bar Harbor to stay over night
The wind Southerly helped J.F. Kingsley on his hay finished mowing Company left for Bar Harbor Recd letter from Boston Post Went to W Gouldsboro at night and got some ice.
location: Bar Harbor, Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro

journal_entry: The wind moderate Southerly and overcast. Thermometer 58 degrees Hauled in load of hay and left it on the rack
The wind Easterly and overcast Thermometer 65 Work on exclusion in the Steamer Everett accompanied by wife & child to Sullivan + Bar Harbor
The wind Southerly Thermometer wrote letters to G.S. Peters M Gallery &Co & Eldridge & Perry. Recd letter from Mary Smallidge
letter_to: G.S. Peters, M Gallery &Co,  Eldridge & Perry

journal_entry: The wind Easterly and rainy all day The Thermometer 56° Work apart of the day Kneeing abt boat Went to West Gouldsboro at night to Carry Mrs Eunice Kingsley
The wind Southerly Thermometer 58 degrees Wrote letter to Mary Smallidge. finished the boat that was begun last winter Recd letter from M. Gallant &Co.
The wind Moderate South East and apart of the day foggy. Thermometer 56 Went to a religious meeting in the evening Took boat of for the first time that I finished yesterday
The wind South East Thermometer 58 1/2 degrees Wrote letter to Mr Vose Recieved Mrs Lizzie Amisden the first summer boarder for the season
letter_to: Mr Vose Recieved, Mrs Lizzie Amisden

journal_entry: The wind South East Thermometer 58 degrees fogg most all day. Went to Iron Bound in my new boat
The wind South East. Thermometer 61° racing in morning and again at night heavy showers Went to Lizzie May Ulmers Theatre at Winter Harbor.
The wind West North West in forenoon & clear Thermometer 68 Went to Prospect Harbor with horse work about home most the day Wrote letter to Louis Oshurn & Co.
The wind Southerly and overcast a little showery Thermometer 65 Went to Bar Harbor in Kay Waynard after freight and boots.
The wind Westerly Thermometer 67 1/2 degrees Made axletree stock for my wagon
The wind North West in forenoon and S.W. in afternoon Thermometer 72°
The wind Northerly in the morning Went to Bar Harbor in Kate Waynard to see abt a party comming over Thermometer 71 degrees Left Bar Harbor at 4:30 pm for home arrived at 6:30
The wind Southerly Thermometer 68 degrees put down carpet in forenoon And in the afternoon went to Bar Harbor after Mr Stevenson belonging to U.S. Survey boat
The wind very moderate Southerly and Easterly and thick with fog. Thermometer 79 degrees Went to Prospect with horse to Cary Mr & Mrs Amsden & Mr Stevenson. Recd Telegraph dispatch from Wm Pendleton.
Calm and foggy all day Thermometer 74 degrees Made over a pair of oars for myself Recd letter from Mefsr Louis Oshurn & Co. Put down carpet.
The wind South Easterly And thick with fog. Thermometer 69 degrees work apart of the day fixing up stable. Recd letter from the Capt of the U.S. Steamer Gedna
letter_from: Capt of the U.S. Steamer Gedna
notes: Looks pretty accurate but he might be refering to USC&GS Thomas R. Gedney

journal_entry: The wind Southerly and in the fore noon rainy afternoon foggy Thermometer 69 degrees Went to Bar Harbor in my boat to Cary the mail for the US Steamer Gedna
letter_to: Capt of the U.S. Steamer Gedna

journal_entry: The wind South Easterly Thermometer 62 degrees rainy most all day heavy with thunder and very sharp lightning
weather_condition_am: rainy, heavy with thunder and very sharp lightning
weather_condition_pm: rainy, heavy with thunder and very sharp lightning
weather_condition_night: rainy, heavy with thunder and very sharp lightning

journal_entry: The wind North West and pleasant most of the day until abt 2 pm when there came up a very heavy shower Work all day making main boom for A.G. Brooks Recd a letter from M. Gallant Thermometer 69 degrees
The wind North West Thermometer 72 degrees work all day on boom for A.G. Brooks Mrs Garvin came to board
The wind Northerly Thermometer 70 degrees work abt home.
The wind Northerly then Easterly and pleasant Thermometer 65 work abt home. Wrote letter to Mr. Wm B Viall of Bethel V.T.
letter_to: Mr. Wm B Viall of Bethel V.T

journal_entry: The wind Southerly Thermometer 68°  tending out about home with boarders
The wind Southerly fresh breeze. Thermometer 59° fixed rudder to my new boat and worked abt home Recd letter from Ascan Handy
The wind Southerly Thermometer 60 degrees heavy rain all day at night cleaned up went out Mrs. E.J. French religious meeting in the evening
The wind Southerly Thermometer 57 degrees put pump in sail boat. repaired buggy and work about the house
The wind moderate all day Thermometer 70 had 11 people in one party from the Rodick House to dinner.
moderate southerly wind Thermometer 68 degrees high. Took row boat and went of in the sound to Pogie Steamer and saw them Seine 300 Bbls pogies at one haul
location: The Sound (Frenchman Bay or Winter Harbor Sound)

journal_entry: The wind Southerly in the afternoon foggy Thermometer 62 degrees Acknowledged deed for Wm Rand & Elesher Bickford. Had horse showed made grain box had party of 6 from Sullivan to Supper Mrs Amesden & Mrs Garoin left for Prospect
The wind very moderate Southerly Thermometer 82 Went to Ellsworth accompanied by my wife to see Creditors and other buisness came home at night
The wind Southerly Thermometer 64 degrees hauled up new boat discharged the cook Recd letters from Hale & Emery. Boston Evening Traveller and Lovell Courier.
letter_from: Hale & Emery, Boston Evening Traveller, Lovell Courier

journal_entry: The wind South East Heavy rain all day. Thermometer 60 degrees
Calm all day and overcast Thermometer 75 degrees Commenced work for Wm Guptill finishing the inside of his house Work all day. At night went to Indian Harbor to Carry Rebecca & Emma Cranby
The wind Easterly Thermometer 68 degrees Work for Wm Guptill on house Recd notice from Wm B Viall he had accepted my offer to carry the mail
The wind Easterly Thermometer 65 degrees work abt home. mended Harness &c

The wind Easterly and moderate overcast and apart of the day foggy. Thermometer 65° Sent the contract to Wm B Viall taking upon my self the responsibility as mail carrier. Went to Bar Harbor to carry Capt David Move back in afternoon.
location: Winter Harbor, Bar Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Southerly Thermometer 70 degrees work in forenoon lathing in house for Wm Guptill at night heavy shower
The wind Easterly & clear Thermometer 64° Work all day for Mr Wm Guptill on house Wrote letter to Messrs J.W. Davis & son.
notes: Realized that Mysrs might be Messrs

journal_entry: The wind Southerly Thermometer 60 degrees. Went to Mrs. Dr E J Frenchs religious meeting in the evening.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 59° degrees. Went to State Election
The wind Southerly Thermometer 63 degrees Went up to the Marsh with my wife black-berrying back at night.
The wind Easterly and overcast Thermometer 58 work all day for Wm Guptill on house Went to Mrs. E J Frenchs lecture on health in evening.
local_place: Wm Guptill's, Mrs. Dr E. J. French's

journal_entry: The wind Easterly foggy and rainy all day Thermometer 60° Work all day for Wm Guptill on his house Recd letter from Wm B Viall Bethel  V.T. Wrote letter to Messrs J.W. Davis & son
The wind South East Fresh breeze and heavy storm Thermometer 65 Work all day for Wm Guptill on house.
The wind South West Cleared of blowing very heavy Thermometer 64 work all day for Wm Guptill Made oath as Mail Carrier before H D Coombs
The wind Westerly. Thermometer 65° Went to West Gouldsboro and back. wrote letter to Mary Smallidge Mt Desert
location: Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind very moderate Southerly Thermometer 65 Work all day for William Guptill on his house lathing.
The wind Southerly and the Thermometer 48 degrees high in the morning frost Recd Postal Card from H B Saunders Ellsworth Work all day fom Wm Guptill on house.
The wind Southerly & foggy Thermometer 65 degrees Work all day for Wm Guptill on house finish lathing over Head
The wind Southerly Thermometer 61 degrees Wrote letter to American Office. Work all day for Wm Guptill.
The wind Southerly and thick with fog all day Thermometer 60 work about home. Wrote letter to Saml Libby

The wind Southerly and very thick with fog Thermometer 60 degrees helped Wm Guptill clear chips out of his house in forenoon. And in the afternoon went to Prospect to Carry Mr Garvin. Recd letter from American Office & G W Davis at night showers
The wind North West and pleasant Thermometer 64 went to the Baptism of Alonzo Sumner & Mrs. I. B. Foss at the Sand Beach in Winter Harbor Went to the Lords Supper after the Baptism
notes: Is pleasant a weather condition or a wind speed?

journal_entry: The wind Westerly and the Thermometer 54 degrees Went to the ferry after a new two seated express waggon bought of JW Davis Ellsworth. back at night
The wind South West. Thermometer 59 degrees. Recd letter from Wm B Viall Went to Prospect to cary P A Sumner
The wind Westerly Thermometer 60 degrees Wrote letter to Messrs SC Muney & Co.
The wind South very fresh breeze and foggy Thermometer 59 degrees Wrote letters to NH Higgins & Wm B Viall Went to a Religious meeting in the evening very heavy rain at 9 pm
The wind North West Thermometer 58 degrees Painted boats bottom and got ready to go gunning tomorrow

The wind West North West Thermometer in morning 50 Went gunning With Martin Pendleton at Schoodic Island We got 6 birds home in afternoon. Recd letters from American Office and Second Post Master General.
letter_from: American Office, Second Post Master General.

journal_entry: The wind Southerly Went to Milbridge to Carry two men belonging to the US Steamer Gedney of the Coast Survey back at night the Thermometer 51 degrees
The wind Southerly Thermometer 63 degrees

The wind South West and foggy in forenoon Thermometer 60 degrees Went as one of the surveyors on the Schr Elizabeth at Tracys Dock at Winter Harbor and condemed her. dug my potatoes Recd Postal Card from Wm Viall
notes: Tracys Dock may be a locatable location

journal_entry: The wind South West Thermometer 58 degrees high weather foggy. Went down gunning in forenoon and in the afternoon went to Sullivan to see Stephen Kingley.
Very moderate all day with an air of wind all around the compass The Thermometer 73 above bought one ton of hay of J.T. Kingsley and hauled it home. Helped Colen Pendleton on his dora to make tight

The wind North West Thermometer 61 degrees Administered the oath to G.W. Tracy quarterly returns of Post office. Commenced driving mail for the first time on the new route by the way of Hammonds Corner
The wind North West and the Thermometer 55° Work about home waiting upon the traveling public maile jack to lift waggon Went to West Gouldsboro in afternoon.
The wind Northerly Thermometer 54 degrees
The wind North West in forenoon and S. West in afternoon Thermometer 63 Went to West Gouldsboro with the mail
The wind Southerly and overcast. Started to go a gunning commenced raining gave it up. In the afternoon the wind West South West Thermometer 52 degrees
The wind Southerly and very fresh breeze and overcast. Thermometer 59 at 8 PM heavy rain with thunder & lightning
The wind North West & Fresh Gale Thermometer 45
The wind from North East to South South East. and the Thermometer 40° Went to West Gouldsboro with the mail.
The wind Easterly & overcast. Thermometer 45 drove the Mail to West Gouldsboro by the way of Prospect for David Weare.
The wind North fresh gale Thermometer 42.
The wind South West Thermometer 45 degrees Went to West Gouldsboro with the mail. worked one fourth day for G.W. Tracy moving partiitions.
location: Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Southerly Thermometer 55 degrees Work one half day for G.W. Tracy fixing the partitions. Recd letter from Boston Daily Traveler
The wind Southerly and very moderate Thermometer 58 degrees Work apart of the day for Melvin Torrey Casing out door &c.
The wind Southerly and foggy. Thermometer 52 Work in the forenoon for Melvin Torrey hanging and in after noon work for Wm Guptill on house
The wind Southerly Thermometer 52 degrees weather foggy at dark heavy rain. Went to West Gouldsboro with mail.
The wind South East. Thick with fog & showery Thermometer 51 degrees work all day fro Wm Guptill on his house.
The wind Westerly overcast and fresh breeze Thermometer 43° wrote letter to Ida Hodgkins Lamoine
The wind Westerly Thermometer 47 degrees went to West Gouldsboro with mail.  Summonds to appear to Court in Portland to be held the 8th day of November
The wind Southerly Thermometer 55 work for Wm Guptill on the inside of his house wrote letter to SC Muney & Co.
The wind Easterly and overcast every appearance of a storm Thermometer 50 degrees. Went to East Sullivan to see C Hutchings
The wind East and very tough rain Storm all day with no ceasing. Thermometer 51 degrees Work all day for William Guptill on the inside of his house.
The wind North East and overcast Thermometer 47. Went to West Gouldsboro with the mail wrote letter to A.J. Blethen Esqr Portland Attorney at law. Recd letter from Mr AJ Blethen of Portland.
The wind moderate North and overcast Thermometer 45 Work all day for Wm Guptill
The wind South and overcast. Thermometer 45 Went to West Gouldsboro to see Frank Taft.
The wind Came of N.W. at 10 am. with a rain squall Went to West Gouldsboro with the mail.

The wind Northerly. Thermometer down to 28° Joseph Nickels from Cherryfield with a telegraph of the news of the wreck of the Schr Wyoming and the loss of Capt Tracy, at 1 oclock in the morning. worked 3/4 of the day for Wm Guptill.
notes: This is fascinating, the wreck of the Wyoming is a big deal but it must've been a different Wyoming bc the big one happened after this

journal_entry: The wind Easterly and the Thermometer 29° worked 7/8 of day for Wm Guptill Went to district meeting in afternoon Recd letter from Mary Stanley Cranberry Isle. at night heavy rain and the wind blowing hard
The wind all around the Compass. and overcast. at night showery Thermometer 45 Work all day for Wm Guptill on house
The wind North West work one fourth day for Wm Guptill Went to West Gouldsboro with mail Thermometer 43 degrees Recd letters from Wm B Viall and A J Blethen wrote letter to AJ Blethen of Portland
letter_from: Wm B. Viall, A. J. Blethen

journal_entry: The wind Southerly Thermometer 53 degrees work all day for Wm Guptill on house.
The wind North West Thermometer 38 degrees

The wind Southerly in forenoon Thermometer 22° Went to West Gouldsboro with mail And in the afternoon the wind Came of North West with snow squalls. At night the Thermometer 28 degrees Work one 1/4 day for Wm Guptill
The wind North West and snow squalls Thermometer 22 degrees Work turning for R Rand in JF Kingsleys shop
The wind North West thermometer 28 degrees Went to Sullivan to hire money got none
The wind Northerly in morning Thermometer 40 Went on Iron Bound and hired $30 of Mrs. Louisa N Young Recd letter from AJ Blethen Work 1/4 day for Wm Guptill
location: Winter Harbor, Iron Bound, Winter Harbor
local_place: Mrs. Louisa N Young 's, Wm Guptill's

journal_entry: The wind Northerly and Snowy all day Thermometer 32 degrees Went to West Gouldsboro with mail work 1//4 for Wm Guptill. Recd letter from Ida Hodgkins Lamoine Rhoda A Rand died at 5 pm
The wind Westerly Thermometer 32 degrees work all day for Wm Guptill on Hog House.
The wind North West Thermometer 32 degrees went to Ellsworth to settle some business tomorrow

The wind moderate Southerly Thermometer 40° Went to see the Estate of Joseph Moore three miles from Ellsworth down Water Street Paid the Int on $800 for 6 months at the bank and came home John Hancock drove mail
notes: Estate may be around 461-499 Bayside Rd

journal_entry: The wind Southerly and in the forenoon heavy the Thermometer 47 work 1/2 day for Wm Guptill Had County Lodge Members to supper about 27 in number
The wind Southerly Thermometer 50 degrees Work in the forenoon for Wm Guptill and in the afternoon went to Birch Harbor to Capt L.G. Cranes Funeral Wrote letter to A.J. Blethen
The wind North West work 3/4 day for Wm Guptill Went to Prospect Harbor Hired $40 of EW Cleaves for 14 days. Thermometer 32 wrote letter to AJ Blethen Ellsworth
location: Winter Harbor, Prospect Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind North West Thermometer 35 degrees Paid T R Hammonds note and $53 in cash to Port Master Winter Harbor for a reciept & Writ from SC Munsey & Co by AJ Blethen City H being for the Sea Flowers Sail property attached and cleared by the above Went to West Gouldsboro with the mail
location: Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Southerly and Thermometer 40 degrees Went to Lower Harbor to see Mrs. Grant. Recd letter from Stephen Southard
The wind Southerly Thermometer 41 degrees wrote letter to Warren Smith J A Stephens & Stephen Southard
letter_to: Warren Smith, J. A. Stephens,  Stephen Southard

journal_entry: The wind Easterly and the Thermometer 35 degrees went to West Gouldsboro with mail. In the afternoon rainy
The wind North East and rainy Thermometer 38 degrees Work all day for William Guptill.
The wind North East and rainy in the afternoon Thermometer 40 work 3/4 of the day for Wm Guptill wrote letter to Bessie E Grant.
The wind North West Thermometer 39 degrees work 1/2 day for Wm Guptill Went to West Gouldsboro to send note to Mrs. Bessie E Grant Camden by Express
The wind Easterly and the Thermometer 35 degrees wrote letters to SM Inmans and Bessie Grant Went to West Gouldsboro with mail. very heavy blow and rain in the afternoon and evening
The wind Southerly and showery with the Thermometer 38° Hauled up boat and washed waggon and put her away. Recd letters from M Gallant & Co.
The wind came of North W Thermometer 43 in the morning and night 33°
The wind Westerly Thermometer 40 degrees Went to West Gouldsboro with mail.
The wind North West fresh breeze Thermometer 32 work 1/2 day for Wm Guptill.

The wind Southerly and very pleasant The Thermometer 38 degrees high. At night the sky looked Stormy over cast. and the wind hauling to the Eastward work 1/2 day for Wm Guptill laying floors in his house.

The wind Easterly fresh breeze and big rain storm Thermometer 40 wrote letter to M Gallant work one half day for Wm Guptill Went to Prospect at night to Carry 40 dollars that I hired of E.W. Cleaves the fourteenth of this month. recd letter from J A Stevens
The wind North West in forenoon South West in the evening Thermometer 37 Went to West Gouldsboro with mail Had plum porriage party in the evening
The wind North West  Thermometer 33 degrees at night a little colder Work all day for Wm Guptill finished laying floors in the lower part of his house.
Calm all day and the Thermometer 32 degrees pleasant.
The wind S.S.E and fresh breeze Thermometer 35° wrote letters to Bessie E Grant Mrs Proctor Smallidge and Mary Stanley went to West Gouldsboro with mail very heavy storm at night.

The wind Southerly and heavy rain in morning the rain hauled around to the North West and cleared up the Thermometer 48 degrees. Went on Grindstone point and got up a load of stumps recd letter from Camden it being one sent to Bessie Grant and returned to me
The wind Southerly Thermometer 40° Hauled one load of stumps from Grindstone Point.
The wind Northerly and moderate snow and rain all day the Thermometer 38 degrees Made a little propeller for my boat.
The wind Westerly Thermometer 24° Went to West Gouldsboro with mail.
The wind North West the Thermometer from 22 degrees to 28 above zero.
The wind North West fresh breeze.

Calm all day with the exception of a light air westerly Thermometer 30 Went to West Gouldsboro with mail. Wrote letter and reg. it to Messrs M Gallant & Co. at night went in the woods and hauled out one load of wood on wheels
The wind S.S. East. rain & snow in the forenoon and in the afternoon the snow. went all of with rain big storm Thermometer 34 work 1/4 day for Wm Guptill.
The wind South West Thermometer 35 degrees Wrote Land Claim deed for G.W. Tracy in forenoon & in the afternoon killed my pig.
The wind W.N. West . Thermometer 28 degrees put tube in gun for John Myrick
The wind West North West fresh breeze Thermometer 22° Went to West Gouldsboro with mail Recd letter from M Gallant & Co. Dr SM Inman & Mrs. Bessie E Grant.
The wind North West Thermometer 22 degrees in morning and gradual rising all day. Worked 1/2 day for Wm Guptill went to West Gouldsboro to Cary Mrs Wright. Recd letter from Mary Smallidge
The wind moderate Southerly a little snow spell in the forenoon but melted in the afternoon at night rainy Thermometer 34 degrees

The wind North West Thermometer 20 degrees Wrote letter to Mrs. B.E. Grant hired John Hancock to drive the mail I staid at home and salted my pig and a quarter of beef. wrote letter to American Office
The wind North West fresh breeze Thermometer 20 Work for Wm Guptill on house
The wind North West Thermometer 25 degrees repaired my boat hauled one of load of wood home from J.F. Kingsleys.
The wind North West Thermometer 20° work on my boat putting a propeller on her.
The wind North West Thermometer 16° above zero. Went to West Gouldsboro with mail.

The wind very moderate Easterly Thermometer 18 degrees in the morning but gradually going up all day at night 35° in the evening commenced snowing and turned to rain. Work all day on my boat putting on propeller.
The wind blowing very hard Southerly tough storm. Thermometer 44 the wind hauled around to the Westard the Thermometer went down to 24 degrees.
The wind North West Thermometer 29 degrees Administered Oath to T.H. Smallidge & others in refrence & salt. Went to West Gouldsboro with mail.
The wind Westerly the Thermometer 20 degrees finished the work on the propeller and launched the boat. the propeller not being large enough considered a failure for the present.
The wind West Thermometer 22° Work apart of the day turning in JF Kingsleys shop Went to the Christmas tree at the Hall in the Evening
The wind South West Thermometer 30 degrees Recd letter from Post Office department and one from the Narraguagres Lodge. Cut wood at the door apart of the day.
The wind moderate and varying from North to East. Thermometer 10 degrees above zero. Went to West Gouldsboro with mail. recd letter from CC Burrill Wrote letter to Mrs Bessie E Grant of Camden
The wind North West the Thermometer 18 degrees above Wrote letter to C.C. Burrill Cut wood at the door.
The wind North West Thermometer 10 above zero in morning and went up to 18 in afternoon. The ground as bare as in July except what ice there is

The wind North East. Thermometer 8 degrees above zero in the morning at 10 oclock am moderate and commenced snowing Went to West Gouldsboro with the mail. Snowing fast all the afternoon. Wrote notices for wharf meeting.

The wind North West wrote letter to R. Cole Ellsworth some sleighing the first for the winter sleigh goes through in some places. Varnished my sleigh and tending out on the People stoping with me at the Eureka House

The wind Westerly Thermometer 22 in the forenoon 14 at night Helped make out Quarterly returns for Post Master. Proprietor of the Eureka House. not much Company at this season of the year Except the Rumers
noteworthy: Changed: "2 quarterly returns for Post Masher" to "Quarterly returns for Post Master"  Added period after "Eureka House" and changed "mueh" to much  and  "aftto Flar" to of the year changed confidence Rumers confidence level

journal_entry: The wind Easterly and in the afternoon commenced a snow storm. and high winds. Went to Prospect after a Horse blanket. Thermometer 22. degrees in the Evening, a gale of wind and a tremendous snow storm
location: Winter Harbor, Prospect Harbor, Winter Harbor
notes: entered gale instead of fale for wind condition night as it has the same phrasing but gale in next entry

journal_entry: Thermometer 14° above 0 The wind Northerly and a gale of wind tremendious snow strom. At 9 1/2 oclock started with the mail for West Gouldsboro accompanied by Geo Pendleton got Mrs to Wm Bunkers could get no further with the horse got Geo Pendleton to take it fast and I came home. deep snow
The wind North West. Thermometer 22 degrees abore zero. Work all the forenoon breaking out the roads. it being the first snow for the season for sleding or sleighing
The wind North West Thermometer 24 degrees above zero. Went to Birch Harbor with Jennie Tracy for a Sleigh Ride.
location: Winter Harbor, Birch Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind North West Thermometer 25° above zero. Wrote letter to Wm B Viall at Bethel Vt. Went to West Gouldsboro with mail with sleigh.
location: Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind North West thermometer 22 degrees above zero. Went to West Gouldsboro after freight for N. Hammond. Went to Steam boat Wharf meeting in the evening and was choosen Clerk.
location: Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor
noteworthy: Bunker chosen as clerk for Steamboat Wharf meeting

journal_entry: The wind Southerly. in morning hauled around Westerly with snow squalls with the thermometer 30° went in the woods up. river and got one load of wood home Went back + comming home broke down
notes: unsure in bold, LN - assumed westerly was wind direction for pm and therefore  snow squalls  and temperature weather condition for pm

journal_entry: Calm all the forenoon Thermometer 28° above 0 Repaired the sled in the forenoon and in ther afternoon hauled one load of wood out of the woods and the other load that was left on the way. Recd letter from C. C. Burrill

A very big snow storm The wind North West Thermometer 12 degrees above Wrote letter to C. C. Burrill Started with the mail to West Gouldsboro Got as far as Wm Bunkers with the horse and could get no further with him put him in the barn and Carried the mail on my back to West Gouldsboro
location: Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind moderate Westerly Thermometer 8 above. Changed the propeller from my big boat to the little one Shoveled snow apart of the forenoon Recd letter from Stephen Southard.
The wind Westerly Thermometer 22 degrees above. zero,
Calm in the morning wrote letter to Stephen Southard Went to West Gouldsboro with Mail afternoon wind westerly Thermometer 22 above Recd letter from Wm B Viall Mail Contractor Bethel Vt.
location: Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Westerly and moderate Thermometer 32 degree above zero. Went up river and got one load of wood
The wind N.N.West Thermometer down to zero and remained so all day without any change.
The wind North East Thermometer 2 1/2 degrees blow zero. snow moderate all day went up stream and hauled two loads of wood with my horse
Calm about all day The Thermometer at zero in the morning Went to West Gouldsboro with mail. Good Sleighing The Thermometer went up to 22 in the afternoon.
location: Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Southerly in the forenoon + snowy very damp the Thermometer 35 degrees above zero. Carried J.G. Hall to Hammonds Corner. Cleared up in the afternoon went up the stream and got one load of wood.
local_place: Home, Hammond's Corner, Up Stream, Home

journal_entry: The wind Northerly Thermometer 20 above Went to Prospect Harbor after a hired girl my wife being sick but got none. Sleighing good as can be
location: Winter Harbor, Prospect Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Northerly Thermometer 8° above zero Went to West Gouldsboro with Mail. Came back & carried Nathan Bickford to Milbridge to the Masonic Lodge and saw him made an Entered Apprentice Came back Steuben.
location: Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Milbridge, Steuben
notes: not sure about the location of "Steuben" in this sentence
noteworthy: Nathan Bickford made Entered Apprentic in Masonic Lodge

journal_entry: The wind North West Got home from Mill bridge at about noon In the afternoon clouded up and in the evening snowed.
The wind North West Thermometer 23 above work about home cutting wood. Could not get in the woods for the quantity of snow. fell

The wind from South Easterly to North Snowy all day Thermometer 32° about. Recd two letters from Wm B Viall and in one was a check of $24.75 in full. for Carrying the mail to West Gouldsboro from Oct 1st to Jan 1st.
The wind from West to South West Thermometer 32 Went to West Gouldsboro with mail Acknowledged deed for Nathan Shaw Settled accounts with Oliver Jones. Jennie Tracy and Nathan Hammond.
location: Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: Calm untill night when the wind breezed up Easterly and snowed hard Thermometer 33° above zero. Harnessed the horse to go in the woods but for the quantity of snow could not get there.
The wind North West The Thermometer down to zero and the snow drifted so the roads are impassable Twin boys born to the wife of Capt Alvin Foss
noteworthy: 2 babies, twins, born to Alvin Foss and his wife (Georgia Foss?)

journal_entry: The wind Easterly & Thermometer at 0 snow drifted badly Went to Milbridge to Cary Hubert & Jannie Tracy to take the steam boat for Boston. Went to the Mansonic Lodge in the Evening at Milbridge.
Calm and foggy all day. went to the lower steam boat wharf in the morning to Cary Hubert and Jannie Tracy. then came home. Thermometer 37 above zero
The wind North West Thermometer 20 above work about home made Axe handles & Went to Birch Harbor in evening to a mock Court
location: Winter Harbor, Birch Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind North West Thermometer 10° above 0. wrote letter to Narraguagus Lodge Cherryfield. Went up the stream after wood but the Stream overflowed could not get in woods
notes: unsure in bold, LN - put down unsure transcription in letter to column but will probably need to be corrected.

journal_entry: The wind Westerly Thermometer 22° above zero. Went to West Goudlsboro with the mail it being the last day from Winter Harbor to W. G. the route discoutinued from Winter Harbor to Hammonds Corner
location: Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind North West Thermometer 12 above went up the stream after wood broke through the Ice with the horse Could get no wood home.
The wind North West Thermometer 30° above Snowy in the morning
The wind WNW Thermometer 28 Went to West Gouldsboro with mail from South Goulsdboro
location: Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Westerly Thermometer 2 at hauled two loads of wood down the stream and home
notes: unsure in bold, LN - not sure about temperature so left blank

journal_entry: The wind very moderate Westerly Thermometer 28 above. Hauled two loads of wood down the River. with my horse. Went to Birch Harbor in the evening & Lyceum took our 9 on sled. The Question for debate Resolve. that money has more Influence then Can seem.
location: Winter Harbor, Birch Harbor, Winter Harbor
local_place: Home, Up Stream, Mock Court, Home

journal_entry: The wind Westerly Thermometer 28 above to 34 above. Hauled one load of wood home. Filed Wood saw for Augustus Dodge

The wind Westerly The Thermometer 22° above Took the mail to W. Goulsboro & hired it brought back to SG Carried N.A.Bickford to Milbridge Where he took the Second & third degrees in Masonry Then we Came home in the night.
location: Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro, South Gouldsboro, Milbridge, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind north West The Thermometer 18 above Went up the stream Cutting wood. Agreed to give one weeks labor in building a wharf at South Gouldsboro
The wind South South West In the morning the Thermometer was at 10 degrees above zero. and in the afternoon it was 28° degrees above and snowing most all day. Cleared up at night.
The wind West North West Thermometer. from 12 to 18 degrees above zero. Went to West Gouldsboro with mail.
location: Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Southerly Thermometer 38 above zero. Hauled two loads of wood to the upperdam and one load home. at night heavy rain.
The wind Southerly heavy rain storm. and tremendious blow all day. took away an immence quantity. of snow Thermometer 40 degrees above zero. at night cleared up Thermometer falling

Let the mail Route to Leonard Bunker The wind Westerly. Thermometer 18 degrees above work in forenoon cutting wood. And in the afternoon started for East Sullivan Exhibition brok one of the shafts and came back home.

The wind North West. Thermometer 12 above zero. Had the Horse Showed in forenoon. and in the afternoon went to Ellsworth via Trenton. to see Capt N. H. Higgins and pay the Insurance on house Stoped at the Lake house all night.
location: Winter Harbor, East Sullivan, Trenton, Ellsworth
local_place: Home, East Sullivan Exhibition, N. H. Higgins', Lake House
notes: Put east sullivan in location because there is an exhibition there and he says 'showed horse'

journal_entry: The wind moderate all day Westerly Thermometer down 4° degrees below zero in Ellsworth. Had stoughters made for a Harness and came home in the afternoon. Sold the Eureka House to Bessie E Grant of Camden and had the writings done by Wm Rand by attorney.
The wind South South West Thermometer 28 above 0. Carried Capt AGerrish and wife up to his fathers in the forenoon and went after them in the afternoon.
The wind North Easterly Thermometer 12 above Made shaft for Mr Nathan S. Bickford Pung in place of one I broke Thursday 13 going to East Sullivan Exhibition sent deeds to Ellsworth to be recorded
The wind East North East and snowing all day Thermometer 14 degrees above zero. Mended harness apart of the day. wrote letter to Bessie E. Grant and C.C. Burrill
letter_to: Bessie E. Grant, Charles C. Burrill

journal_entry: The wind North East. Thermometer. 12 above Went to West Gouldsboro to Carry James Bourgett to take the stage for Bucksport.
location: Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind North East and snowing and blowing all day Thermometer 14 above Made sled shaft. for my self.
The wind N.N. East snow and snow blowing all day. roads blocked the mail did not go Thermometer 13 above 0 Visited the School taught by Mr Phillips It being next to the last day of school.
The wind North Thermometer 14 above zero. hauled one load of wood for Geo Gerrish.

The wind Westerly Thermometer 35 above 0 Went on Mark island and Married John K Norwood & Mifs Lillian S Wilkinson both of Gouldsboro. They were married at 3 Oclock in the afternoon. and I came home before the Sun set.
location: Winter Harbor, Mark Island, Winter Harbor
noteworthy: John K. Norwood and Lillian S. Wilkinson married

journal_entry: The wind Westerly Thermometer 20 above wrote letters to Portland Transcript Ellsworth American Town Clerk. Mary Stanley E.S.Stevens of Ellsworth Hauled two loads of wood from upper damn.
letter_to: Portland Transcript, Mary S. Stanley, E. S. Stevens

journal_entry: The wind moderate Northerly Thermometer 22 above. Went to Cherryfield to the Masonic Lodge accompanied by Capt AGerrish & N.A.Bickford at 9 PM snowing stoped all night. Cherryfield Hos
The wind Southerly & wet foggy. Started at 8 oclock from Cherryfield for home. arrived at noon. Thermometer. 37 above zero. Wrote letters to the secretary of Narraguagus Lodge.
The wind W.N.West and snowing a little in the morning Thermometer 24 above zero. Wrote letter to Mrs Bessie E Grant. and kept a copy.
The wind Northerly thermometer down to zero. Hauled two loads of wood for my self and one for Capt Peleg Tracy
The wind North East in the morning and looked like snow. with the Thermometer 8 above 0 Went to West Gouldsboro with Mail via Prospect for Mr Weare. Reed draft of $24.75 from the P.D.Department
location: Winter Harbor, Prospect Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind North West Thermometer. 32 degrees
The wind Westerly Thermometer 35 above went to West bay to Town meeting was chosen Constable and sworn in Recd letter from E Stevens
location: Winter Harbor, West Bay, Winter Harbor
noteworthy: Freeland chosen as Constable in a Town Meeting

journal_entry: The wind South West Thermometer 37 snow melting very fast. work all day hauling wood wrote letter to Auditor of the Treasury for the PO Department. at Washington D.C.
letter_to: Auditor of the Treasury for the Post Office Department

journal_entry: Calm in the morning Thermometer 36 in shade snow melting very fast Hauled two loads of wood from Henry Sargents in the forenoon. and in the afternoon work for Wm Guptill on house Wind North west growing cold at night freezing
local_place: Home, Henry Sargent's, William Guptill's, Home

journal_entry: The wind Easterly Thermometer at zero work all day for Wm Guptill on house Wind hauled out Southly Thermometer 24° and snowing. Recd Postal Card from Wm B Viall.

The wind North East Thermometer 12 above 0 Went to West Gouldsboro to Cary Rebecca Tracy to take the stage for Hancock. Work one half day for Wm Guptill. Snowing all day Recd letter from Warren Smith Lamoine.
location: Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind North Thermometer 18 above zero. Hauled one load of wood for Peleg Tracy work one fourth day for Wm Guptill on house.
local_place: Home, Up Stream, Willliam Guptill's, Home

journal_entry: The wind Baffling and calm all day Went to Milbridge to the Masonic burial of Capt I Sawyer & wife who perished in the rigging at Barnegat. N.J. Came back home at 7 P.M. The sleighing good moderate rain in evening
The wind Southerly and overcast Thermometer 32 degrees above zero. Work all day for Wm Guptill on his house Recd letter from Mejrs Saloun &Co Cincinnatti O.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 34 above work in the forenoon for Wm Guptill. and in the afternoon went. to West Gouldsboro to see the Post Master abt Mail carrier on Route 365.
location: Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor
local_place: Home, William Guptill's, West Gouldsboro Post Office, Home

journal_entry: The wind North West Thermometer 20 above and pleasant Work all day for Wm Guptill on house Recd letter from the auditor of the Treasurer for the Post Office Department.
letter_from: Auditor of the Treasury for the Post Office Department

journal_entry: The wind Southerly Thermometer 32° above Went in the woods in the forenoon and got a spar for the A G Brook flying jibboom in the afternoon work for Wm Guptill Wrote letters to Wm B Viall & Mejses Sloan &Co.
letter_to: William B. Viall, Mejsis Sloan & Co.

journal_entry: The wind South East. Thermometer 39° above worked out half day for Wm Guptill on house. Went to West Gouldsboro to see about P.O.Business. wrote letters to Wm B Viall and Auditor of the P.O.Department Recd letters from Linda SMallidge & Wm B Viall
location: Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor
letter_to: William B. Viall, Auditor of the Treasury for the Post Office Department

journal_entry: The mail went on wheels The wind Westerly 36 above Work half day for Wm Guptill. Went to District meeting was Chosen moderator. and then Partitioned to the Agent to Call another meeting to Choose a Collector to Collect the district tax.
local_place: Home, William Guptill's, District Meeting, Home

journal_entry: The wind Westerly Termometer 32 degree Wrote letters to F.W. Webber Cambridge port & Han Elias J Hale & Francis whiting
letter_to: F. W. Wobbur, Cambridge Port, Han Elias, Yuraveis Whiting
notes: unsure in bold, yuraveis probably francis

journal_entry: The wind E S East Thermometer 20 above wrote letter to C.C. Viall Lowell & Nancy Ash Sullivan. Snowing all day. with fresh breeze. wrote letter to B. T Athon Sherriff of Mt. Desert.

The wind moderate Northerly Thermometer 33 degrees & clear Enclosed $2.00 and Recommendation to Sloan &Co Cincinnati O for a sample set Six wheel Castus for Sewing machine Sleighing good as at my time in the winter.
The wind from North to West moderate wind all day Thermometer 35 above 0° Sent Postal to post Master West Gouldsboro. Turned Lounge legs for Reuban Rand Went on Sleigh ride with M.J.Hammond at night.
The wind Westerly Thermometer 32 degrees Sent Postal to S.W.Libly Reed letter from Wm Viall work about home cutting wood at the door the sleighing good
The wind South East moderate Thermometer 22 Turned set lounge legs for Reuban Rand. Reed letters from Han Elias J Hale of Tux Cruft. and Wm B. Viall of Betherl At night was sick.
The wind Westerly. The thermometer 32° Was sick all day and unable to go out to work had medicine of Dr Moore. Reed letter from B.T. Atherton the Depty Sherriff of Mt Desert.
The wind North East Thermometer 30 degrees above zero. Hale and rain in morning. The sleighing complete.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 35 above. Went to West Gouldsboro to trade harness with Stephen Kingsley took Jennie Tracy up for a sleigh ride Reed letters from Sloan &Co and Annie Hammond.
location: Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Southerly Thermometer 34 above 0 Reed letter from Mr Francis Whiting of Pittsburg Pa
The wind North East Thermometer 33° Went to Bar Harbor to See John Clark
location: Winter Harbor, Bar Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Easterly Thermometer 30 above wrote letter to Eias Hale and Wm. P Joy Esq. Reed letters from Mejsis Sloaan &Co. X Wamn Smithal Calais
The wind Easterly Thermometer 40° above wrote letter Portland & Machias Steam boat Bo & Linda Smallidge work in the afternoon for G.W. Tracy on dora Reed Postal from L L Kingsley
letter_to: Genl Agt Portland Bangor & Machias Steamboat Co

journal_entry: The wind South East Thermometer 39. above above mail for David Weare to West Gouldsboro Via Porspect Route 191 Reed letter from Wm P. Joy Esqr at night misty or fine rain Crossed Jones Pond on may with the mail
location: Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind East South East Thermometer 36° degrees foggy and misty or rain all day with a fresh breeze.

The wind North East Thermometer 36 degrees hauled one load of wood out the woods near Mr Dodge's alongside of the road and in the afternoon it rained hard. wrote letter to Red of deeds Postal to Mssrs Sloan &Co
letter_to: Reg of deeds, Mejsis Sloan & Co.

journal_entry: The wind N.N. East. Thermometer 36 above raining hard. all forenoon. afternoon the wind N.W. cleared up worked apart of the day on the Schr Mary & Eliza acknowledged deed for Wm Rand quarterly return for post Master made oath to Wm Guptill P. Keeper

The wind North West Thermometer 35 degrees very fresh breeze all day work for Capt A J Gerrish on Schr Mary & Eliza putting in windluss bitss. &e Reed Sample set Castors from Stoan &Co Sold one set after supper
The wind West North West. Thermometer 35 degrees very fresh blow work all day for Capt A.J. Gerrish on Schr Mary & Eliza Making a windlass and putting on purchase. reed Postal from Reg of deeds.

The wind Northerly snowing and blusling all the forenoon. Carried the mail on route 191 to West Gouldsboro. for David Weare. in the afternoon cleared up Thermometer 36. Sold two sets costers after two.
location: Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Westerly Thermometer 34 work all day for Capt A.J Gerrish on vessel. Working all my spare time taking orders for Casters on Sewing Machines have accepted the agency.
The wind Southerly Thermometer. 37 above zero. and pleasant.
The wind South West Settled the Law business between John F. Clark and Warren H Smith work all day for A J Gerrish wrote letter to Isaac Tracy. and Helen Stevens

The wind North West. Work one half day for A.J. Gerrish in the afternoon worked half day for J A Stevens making bow sprit. Reed letter from Helen Stevens. Sold one set Casters in the evening Thermometer 38 degrees

Thermometer 50 degrees. The wind South West in forenoon and North West in the afternoon. Reg letter to Stevens &Co. for Sewing Machine Caster Work apart of the day for A. J. Gerrish on vessel and the rem for R Pendleton on boat Reed letter from Agt of Lts Lewiston.
letter_from: Stevens & Co., Agt of Lts Lewiston,

journal_entry: The wind Northerly in forenoon and S.W. in afternoon. Sold 3 sets Sewing machine Casters Bought two shark in Winter Harbor Steam boat wharf wrote letter to Mrs Chester Stevens
The wind E.N.East and the Thermometer. 30 above. Very tough snow storm. Went with the mail to West Gouldsboro vis Prospect on runners the Sleighing good.
location: Winter Harbor, Prospect Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Westerly with snow squalls Thermometer 37 above. Went to Steuben with a sleigh after Dr Moore for Geo. Gerrish boy.
The wind from West to South West. Thermometer 42 degrees the snow melting.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 45 very moderate rain all the forenoon and in the afternoon went to Birch Harbor selling Sewing machine Casters.
location: Winter Harbor, Birch Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Southerly Thermometer 45 degrees Set up leach barrel in the morning to make soap and then started out went to my horse to sell Sewing Machine Casters.
The wind Southerly and in the forenoon rainy Thermometer 44 afternoon Cleared up Reed letter from Stephen Southard Helped Char Pendleton work on dora.

The wind Northerly in the forenoon and Southerly in afternoon Thermometer 48 degrees Work all day for Capt T.H. Smallidge putting in stem for AGBrooks yawl boat. Reed Check of $16.50 from Wm B Viall for Carrying Mail Route 365
The wind North East. Thermometer 34 degrees worked 3/4 day for A.M Torry. on Schr Mars Hill at 3.PM commenced to rain stoped work. Reed letter from Sloan &CO.

The wind North East and snowing all day Thermometer 32 above Went to West Gouldsboro on wheels with the mail via Prospect. Wrote letter to Auditor of the Treasury for the Post Office Department Real letter from Mijr Linda Smallidge
location: Winter Harbor, Prospect Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor
letter_to: Auditor of the Treasury for the Post Office Department

journal_entry: The wind West North West Thermometer 40 degrees the roads all clear from Snow
The wind North West. Thermometer 39 degrees Went to Bar Harbor in the afternoon and sold three sets of Caster. back at night.
location: Winter Harbor, Bar Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: Wrote letter to Wm B Viall. The wind North West and very pleasant with the Thermometer 42 degrees. Went to West Gouldsboro and got one doz sets of casters. from Sloan &Co. I being their agent. for Hancock County. to see t sell the celebrated six wheel swing machine Castero.
location: Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind South West and overcast. and sprinkle of rain in the forenoon Thermometer 34 degrees at 10 Am. started for Bar Harbor to sell Sewing Machine castero Wrote letter to Mejrss Sloan &Co. Cincinnati O manufacturer Sewing Machine castero wind North in evening.
location: Winter Harbor, Bar Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind North fresh breeze Thermometer 35 degrees Went to Bar Harbor to sell Sewing Machine Casters. Went over on board of the A.G.Brooks.
location: Winter Harbor, Bar Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind South West Thermometer 50 degrees cut wood in the forenoon at the door. Wrote letter to Portland Bangor & Machias Steam boat Co. Capt Wm Handy agrees to give my wife his homestead place for his maintenance.
letter_to: Portland Bangor & Machias Steam boat Co.

journal_entry: The wind South West Thermometer 50 degrees. Went to Ellsworth to get the writings done for Wm Handy where he agrees to convey apart of his real estate to my wife for his maintenance. Got in Ellsworth at noon. The Deed executed by Mr Wiswell came back to Sullivan
The wind South South West Thermometer 55 degrees Came home in the afternoon. Reed letter from the Auditor of the Post Office Department.
letter_to: Auditor of the Treasury of the Post Office Department

journal_entry: The wind Southerly Thermometer 49 degrees wrote letter to Mr E.A.Baker. Made 2 vite Claim deed for Warren Smith and one for Charles E Smith reed letter from Wm B Viall and from Second assistant post Warts Gennd
The wind Southerly. Thermometer 38 foggy wrote letter Julra A. Barnard and Wm B Viall acknowledged for Curtis Stevens.
letter_to: William B. Viall, Julra A. Barnard

journal_entry: The wind South East Thermometer 37 degrees heavy rain storm all day wrote letter to A. Wisell Esq. and Gilbert L. Dennison worked most all day putting ceiling in Mr E A Bakers row boat.
letter_to: Arno P. Wiswell, Gilbert L. Dennison

journal_entry: The wind Southerly and apart of the day foggy. Work most all day cutting wood at the door Thermometer 48 degrees at noon
Calm in the morning Thermometer 45 degrees had the horse showed in morning then went to Hammonds Corner after potatoes and delivered Sewing machine Casters. Reed letters from Sloan & Co and P.M.
notes: not sure where this entry ends, and where the next one starts

journal_entry: Sond after Dr Johnson for Capt Handy The wind Northerly in the morning and South West at night. Thermometer 49 work apart of the day for Wm Guptill Reed letters from T.C. Woodman and Wm Viall. Capt Wm Handy Deeds his homestead to Mary E Bunker and she gives a Mortgage back for his maintainance Set
letter_from: T. C. Woodman, William B. Viall
notes: cannot read what is written on side of the page

journal_entry: The wind Southerly Thermometer 40 degrees chilly Set up with Capt Wm Handy all night at his house and we living at the Eureka House. Capt Handy's lacalth quite poorly.

The wind Southerly and rainy in the morning. the remainder of the day foggy. Work apart of the day for Capt Peleg Tracy on his house. Reed letters from Eldridge I Perry and the Boston Transcript office. Waiting up Capt Handy and set up with him all night
The wind Easterly and foggy Thermometer 40 degrees Wrote letter to Eldridge Perry Wm B Viall of Vermont. Cut wood apart of the day at home Set all night with Capt Handy.
The wind North West Thermometer 50 fresh breeze Sent to Steuben after Dr. Moore for Capt Handy and he came in the evening. Work about home apart of the day cutting wood.
The wind very moderate in the forenoon north West. and fresh breeze in the afternoon South West. The Thermometer 35 degrees Paid Dr. Johnson for his services to Capt. Handys
The wind South West The Thermometer 50 degrees above zero. Cut wood at the door. Let my horse go to Sullivan Falk Set up all night with Capt Handy
The wind Southerly Thermometer 48 degrees Paid Dr J.S.Moore. $5. for Medical attendan to Wm Handy Put my Epprese waggon togather. work apart of the day around home.
The Wind Southerly Thermometer 44 degrees Went to South Gouldsboro with my wife for a ride.
location: Winter Harbor, South Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Southerly and foggy Thermometer 45 Went to West Gouldsboro with mail Via Prospect Route 191
location: Winter Harbor, Prospect Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: Calm in morning Thermometer. 68 degrees Went to West Gouldsboro Via Prospect Harbor with mail for David Weare Southerly wind in the afternoon.
location: Winter Harbor, Prospect Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Southerly and foggy Thermometer 50 degrees Went to West Gouldsboro with mail Route 191 Via Prospect Harbor For David Weare
location: Winter Harbor, Prospect Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind South South East Thermometer 54. Went to South Gouldsboro after potatoes for seed
location: Winter Harbor, South Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor
