journal_entry: The wind South South East. Thermometer 50 degrees Commenced farming plowed all the forenoon with the help of Henry Sargents cattle. in the afternoon showery and foggy. Farming on the land formerly of the Stephen Rand Estate.
The wind Southerly and Foggy. Thermometer 54° rainy in forenoon. in the afternoon cleared up. harrowed a piece of land for beans and hauled out two loads of barn dressing.
The wind Southerly and Foggy thermometer 55 degrees

The wind Southerly Thermometer 60 and foggy. Hauled out dressing in the forenoon and in the afternoon rained hard. Reed letter from Portland Bangor & Machias Steam boat Co Reed Check from PODepartment
letter_from: Portland Bangor & Machias Steam boat Co.

journal_entry: The wind Southerly & Foggy. Thermometer 5 7 degrees and rainy all day.
The wind Southerly and foggy in the forenoon Thermometer 60 degrees In the afternoon the wind came of North West and cleared of pleasant.

The wind northerly in forenoon and pleasant Thermometer 60° and in the afternoon the wind South West Thermometer 45 work in the afternoon farming with the help of Simon Sargent and Joseph Bickford Saw the Genil Agt of Ln Lewiston
The wind North West. Thermometer 62 degrees work all day farming planting beans Corn Squashes &c
The wind Southerly Thermometer 54 degrees hauled rock out the field and hauled out dressing made of garden and sewed it.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 48 degrees and sprinkle of rain all day. Let my horse to go to Sullivan
The wind North. Thermometer 51 degrees sewed Cumbers seed and work on the place all day farming
The wind Westerly Thermometer 53 degrees work all day farming for my self.
The wind Southerly and apart of the day foggy. Thermometer 50 degrees put one bushed of potato seed in the ground Sewed my turnips. sent check to Wm B Viall from the P.O.Department.
Calm in morning. Thermometer 54 degrees finished planting in the forenoon. And in the afternoon worked for Rufus Bickford on the Schr Nauseag
The wind Southerly Thermometer 59 degree work all day on the steam boat wharf at South Gouldsboro building freight house.
location: Winter Harbor, South Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind very moderate Southerly and apart of the time foggy. Thermometer 60 degrees work all day on Steam boat wharf at South Gouldsboro. The ground very dry.
location: Winter Harbor, South Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: Calm all the forenoon with the thermometer 70 degrees above zero. in ther afternoon the wind Southerly. heavy shower in the evening.
The wind North East Thermometer 55 above work all day for Capt R.H. Bickford on Schr Nauseag doing various kinds of work
The wind North East Thermometer 54 and moderate rain all day work in house on Mr E. A. bakers boat putting in ceiling Wrote letter to the Boston Post.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 55 degrees rainy and foggy. all day work on EABaker boat in the house
The wind Southerly Thermometer 56: work apart of the forenoon for R.H.Bickford on Schr Nauseag. and apart of the day on E A Bakers boat.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 54 degrees work all day on the Steam boat wharf South Gouldsboro. building freight house. heavy thunder and lightning with heavy rain at night.
location: Winter Harbor, South Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind West North West and blowing a gale of wind Thermometer 51° Work in the house making an Attornan Reed letter from the Boston Post Agt.
The wind North West Thermometer 48 degrees
The wind North West untill about 4 PM then South West. Thermometer 50 degrees Made Sett Pump boxes for the A.G.Brooks. hired Ice chest of Mr Rice. Reed letter from Eldridge & Perry & A J Chatto
Calm in the morning and overcast rainy all day Thermometer. 50 degrees wrote letters Eldridge & Perry T.R. Hammond at New York and two to Mrs French Rochester & Philadelphia The wind Easterly
letter_to: Eldridge Perry, T. R. Hammond, Mrs French, Rochester & Philadelphia

journal_entry: The wind Easterly and Thermometer 50 degrees heavy rain. all day
The wind Southerly and foggy went on Iron Bound and hired $25. of Louisa Jound for 3 month Thermometer 48 degrees
location: Winter Harbor, Iron Bound, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Came of in the forenoon North West and pleasant. Thermometer 57 degrees wrote letters to Boston Post Daily Traveller and Chas Mckey all of Boston. Went to Prospect and got 450 lbs hay for myself settled with Jennie Tracy
letter_to: Boston Post, Daily Traveller, Chas Mckey
notes: cannot read the side of the page

journal_entry: Moderate North West wind in morning Thermometer 54 Went to Bar Harbor with R. Pendleton to collect debt for Sewing Machine Casters In the afternoon the wind blew very heavy West South West came home at 5 P.M. Reed letter from James W Davis of Ellsworth.
location: Winter Harbor, Bar Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: Calm all day and overcast in the afternoon Showery Thermometer 49°
The wind Easterly and Rainy Thermometer 49 degrees Commenced work on the road work 3 hour and stoped on account of rain

The wind Easterly Thermometer 52 degrees drizzling rain all day. wrote two bill of sales from Rufus H & Nathan A. Bickford to their wifes Reed letter from the Salem Post. Mrs Mary Tracy died at 3 oclock in the morning
The wind Northerly Clear Thermometer 52 degrees In the afternoon went down to Schoodic Island and built a tank to pall fish in for Jabez Myriek stoped on the Island all night
notes: wrote jabez myriek in local place but might be wrong and need to be changed

journal_entry: The wind North West in the morning Finished tank in the forenoon. And in the afternoon work on a shed frame. came home at night Wind South West. Reed letters from A.W. Gray Sons. and several from advertising agents of Boston. Thermometer 53 Mary Tracy burried in afternoon.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 54 degrees work about home. Wrote letters to Boston Traveller & Transcript Reed several letters from advertising agts.

The wind Southerly The thermometer 55 degree Finished cutting the wood at the door filed saur and work about home wrote letters to J.W.Davis at Ellsworth and Boston Courier & Boston Transcript Reed letters from Home Journal and 5 other advertising agents.
letter_to: J. W. Davis, Boston Courier, Boston Transcript

journal_entry: The wind Southerly and pleasant. The Thermometer 61°.
The wind North West and The Thermometer. 78 degrees made cart body Reed Postal from Mrs. Henry Chapis from Keene. N.H. making Inquires about board Wrote letter Janette Smith.

The wind very moderate Southerly Thermometer 70 degrees. wrote letter to Mrs Henry Chapin Keene N.H. Work on the road with horse in forenoon repairing it. Work in the afternoon for R Pendleton. Mijs Mary Gerrish died at 9 oclock in evening.
The wind Southerly. Thermometer 60 degrees wrote letter to Mrs Chester Stevens. Work all day on high way. with my horse. Iron Bound Spindle set on Guptills point.
The wind Southerly and foggy. Thermometer 59° Enclosed $5.00 and sent it to J.W.Davis for a aggern Work all day about house
The wind Southerly and foggy. Thermometer. 59 degrees. Finished repairing Mrs. E.A.Bakers row boat. and the rest of the day work about home finishing up the house inside.

The wind Southerly and clear Thermometer work for R Pendleton on how row boats. Reed letter from Walter G Maker of Boston. Making inquiry about the price of board at the Eureka House. Went to West Gouldsboro at night heavy rain
THe wind Easterly and rainy all day. Thermometer 62 degrees wrote letter to W.H. Maker Boston

The wind North West. and pleasant. Thermometer 72° Carried Almira Bourgett. to South Gouldsboro to take the boat for Bar Harbor. Work the remainder of the forenoon for R Pendleton putting row locks on boats Work all the afternoon for J.F. Kingsley framing barn for Home Guptill.
location: South Gouldsboro, Bar Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind North West. Thermometer. 70 degrees work all day for J.F. Kingsley on barn
The wind Southerly Thermometer 69. degrees Work all day for j.F.k. on Homer Guptills barn Reed letter from Mrs Mary Stanley.
Calm in morning Southerly in afternoon Thermometer 72° work in the forenoon for J.F.K on Homer Guptills barn in the afternoon work getting ready a supper for the 4th of July.

The wind Southerly in the forenoon Northerly at night Thermometer 70° A. celebration at Winter Harbor, a part of the Bar Harbor bass band played afternoon & evening Mrs French lecture afternoon. Grand display of fireworks at Serene Cottage. Winter Harbor I dinnered & Suppered day and evening at Eureka House 70 people. day ended with grand ball.
The wind Southerly and Thermometer 71 degrees work apart of the forenoon for Roderick Pendleton on his row boats. Reed letter from Mrs Chester Stevens.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 65 degrees
The wind Southerly and Thermometer 60 degrees Sent two deeds to Ellsworth to be recorded. wrote letters to Walter G Maker of Boston and Wm B. Viall Vermont Signed quarterly returns of P.M.
letter_to: Walter G. Maker, William B. Viall

journal_entry: The wind Southerly and rainy all day Thermometer 65 degrees wrote letters to Eldridge & Perry and Mrs Henry Chapin Painted my row boat.
Thick with fog in the morning at 8 Am the wind North West and cleared of Thermometer 76° plowed amoungst any potatoes getting ready to hoe them.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 69 degrees Had my horse shoed hoed potatoes for my self

Calm in the forenoon Went to Steuben after Mrs Chester Stevens for a cook to cook for me at the Eureka House. brought her home at 2.PM Thermometer 72 degrees and the wind Southerly Reed letter from Mr Walter G Maker of Boston.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 68 degrees Finished hoeing my potatoes and painted my boat. Wrote letter to Walter G Maker of Boston.
The wind South West Thermometer 72 degrees Went to the Back Shore and saw a dead whale striped. took out some of the whale bone
location: Winter Harbor, Back Shore, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind South and the Thermometer 76 degrees work all day for John D.Harrington on his cook house. Shinglell the roof &c.

The wind South West Thermometer 80° in the shade work 114 day for Mr John D. Harrington on his cookrun laying floo Took my boat in the afternoon and went to Bar Harbor to stop all night to take the Str for S.W. Harbor heavy thunder & lightning with rain in evening

The wind South West Thermometer 90 at Bar Harbor Took the New Steamer Mt Desert and went to South West Harbor & come back on the Lewiston to distribute some of my Hotel Cards among the passengers. Took the Str Sea Flower at Bar Harbor and came home at night
location: Bar Harbor, Southwest Harbor, Bar Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind West North West Thermometer 74 degrees Hoed my beans & Corn Reed letter from Mrs Henry Chapin and circulars from several advertising agents.
The wind Westerly in the forenoon and South West in the afternoon Thermometer 60 degrees work in my garden and unowed around the house.
The wind North East in morning Thermometer 68 degrees Work all day for J. D. Harrington on his cook room The wind Southerly in the afternoon

The wind Southerly Thermometer 70 degrees went to a Religious meeting in the forenoon by R C Richard Mitchel And in the afternoon by Mr. Pierson of Boston Mr Piersons meeting was held at Dr E.J.  Frenchs tent by C.J.Guptills house.

The wind Southerly and overcast Thermometer 50 Went to South Gouldsboro Steam boat wharf to cary Miss Greenleaf to take the Str Mt Deserrt. Mowed some hay in the afternoon and poled some in the barn at night.
location: Winter Harbor, South Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Southerly Thermometer 70 degrees mowed in the forenoon and in ther afternoon went to Bar Harbor to telegraph to Wm Cole at New York Stoped at Bar Harbor all night waiting for a dept
The wind South and rainy and foggy all day at 10 Am no despalh and came home Thermometer 51 degrees Reed letters from M Gallent &Co. & marden & Rowell.
letter_from: Mejsrs M. Gallent & Co., Marden & Rowell

journal_entry: The wind North pleasant Thermometer 59 degrees took care of hay that was mowed before the storm. The wind South West at 4.P.M.
The wind North West in the forenoon & South West in the afternoon Thermometer 62° work all day haying wrote letters to Mrs Bessie E Crant and M. Gallart &Co. Reed letter from Miss Guenlief
letter_to: Bessie E. Grant, Mejsrs M. Gallent & Co.,

journal_entry: The wind Easterly Thermometer 60 and overcast mowed in the forenoon but did not open or spread my for hay day
Page missing from the scan
Page missing from the scan
Page missing from the scan
Page missing from the scan
Page missing from the scan
Page missing from the scan
The wind South West Thermometer 70 degrees mowed in forenoon hauled in three loads of hay
The wind wind very moderate North West and South west baffling and hot Thermometer 90 degrees the hottest for the Summer so far Hauled in two loads of hay
The wind Southerly and foggy. mowed in the forenoon. Thermometer 70 degrees Raked up in the afternoon
The wind Southerly Thermometer 72 Finished mowing in the forenoon and hauled in two loads of hay
The wind North West Thermometer 75 degrees Finished haying hauled all into the barn Reed 3 Lady boarders at Eureka House
The wind North West. work apart of the day hoeing beans
The wind Southerly Thermometer 69 degrees Went to West Gouldsboro with mail
The wind Southerly Thermometer 70° work about home waiting upon boarders.
The wind South West Thermometer 71 degrees

A party of 9 from Bar Harbor to Eureka House to dinner. The wind Southerly Thermometer 69 Went to West Gouldsboro with ail Route 365Had a party of 9 at the Eureka House to dinner in addition to the other boarders. Reed Check for carrying mail from Post Office Department Route 365
notes: unsure of order to put it in (writings on top and side of page)

journal_entry: The wind South West Thermometer 65 in the morning in the afternoon it was 68
Thermometer 65 degrees Wind South West foggy Wrote letter to Dr S.M.Inman. and sent receipt for P.O.Check.
The wind Southerly very fresh breeze and foggy Thermometer. 60°
The wind North North West and very pleasant. Thermometer 72 degrees went to Bar Harbor after some groceries for the house hired the mail carried on route 365
The wind South East Thermometer 59 degrees Went to Ellsworth. to take advantage of the Insobuert act Employed A P Wiswell Came back at night moderate rain
The wind North East thermometer 59 degrees steady rain all day
The wind Easterly Thermometer 58 degrees heavy rain all day Went to West Gouldsboro with the mail.

The win Easterly and very fresh breeze and heavy rain Thermometer 60 degrees at noon the wind hauled to the north and stoped raining tremendeous heavy sea running Commenced putting at Mast step in the Hayward Yatch in afternoon
The wind North West Thermometer 67 degrees Finished the mast step in the Hayward yatch. Went to South Gouldsboro wharf with my boarders trunks
The wind very moderate Thermometer Settled up with my boarders and I carried them to South Gouldsboro Steam boat wharf.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 60° and thick with fog Went to West Gouldsboro with the Mail. Reed letter from A.P. Wiswell Esq

The wind Southerly Thermometer 75 degrees discharged Helen Stevens who has been cooking at the Eureka House. Her time being up thgh she agreed to work for. Acknowledged deed from N Hammond to Thomas Hammond
The wind Southerly Thermometer 72
The wind North East Thermometer 68 degrees work all day in the barn formerly of Wm Handy laying stable floor Mrs Helen Steven. went home by stage
The wind North East Thermometer 69 degrees work in the barn building stalls for horses
The wind North East. Thermometer 68 degree. work one halfday. for J.D Harrington. Acknowledged deed from Thomas Hammond to Wm Guptill.

The wind North East. Thermometer 70° Work one half day for my self on barn and in the afternoon work in JD Harrington. clap bourding wrote bill sale from S. C Pendleton to J.A.Y Reed letter from M Gallent &Co
The wind Westerly in the morning Thermometer 70 Went to Ellsworth Came home in the afternoon arrived at 10 P.M.
The wind North West Thermometer 74 degrees Wrote letters to A.P. Wiswell and Lowell Courier work apart of the day on barn. Had a party of 20 to supper from Steuben.
The wind North West. thermometer 74 degrees a very pleasant day.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 65 degrees Went to West Gouldsboro with mail Reed letter from Chas J Guptill of Steuben Sold my interest in a boat to Mr Ira Foss Reed $10
The wind Southerly Thermometer 77 degrees Sent Reg letter to A Wiswell wich $10 Enclosed Work on half day for J D Harrington
The wind Easterly Thermometer 74° Miss Leavy mared from the Capt Handy House.
The wind Easterly and Thermometer 68 degrees Went to South Gouldsboro wharf to Carry Miss Fannie Tracy to Boat In afternoon worked in the old house fixing it up to move in
Calm and drizzling rain all day Thermometer 62° Went to West Gouldsboro with the mail
The wind North West in the forenoon and South West in the afternoon Thermometer 73 degrees. Work all day on the Wm Handy house at being the one we are about going to move in fixing the inside
The wind Southerly and the thermometer 67 degrees Reed out last boarders at the Eureka House.
The wind S.S.E. Thermometer 58 degrees and rainy all day. Went to West Gouldsboro with the Mail then to the Town House to the State Election back to W. Gouldsboro took the mail and came home.
The wind South West in morning and came to the North West at 10 Am work all day. on the Wm Handy house morning partitouse and getting ready to move into it. Thermometer 65
The wind North West and Thermometer 67° work on the house Turned away Runners and people on the road for the first time at the Eureka House. as we are getting ready to move out we cannot take them.
Calm in the morning then the wind Easterly and then Southerly Thermometer 70° work all day on house Reed letter from A D Wiswell
The wind Southerly Thermometer 52° Went to West Gouldsbo with the Mail. Wrote letter to Mr Helen Stevens
The wind South West Thermometer 50 degrees work all day on the old house inside
The wind board out to the Southward and a very fresh breeze Thermometer 48°
The wind North West Thermometer 63 degrees Went to West Gouldsboro with the mail.
The wind North West in the forenoon and South West in the afternoon Thermometer 68 degrees work all day on the house
The wind South West Thermometer 64 degrees work all day on the house having plastering done &c. Fixed the papers of J C Wright for collecting lost pay.
The wind South West. Thermometer 62 degrees had a summons left to appear to the Court held at Ellsworth. from M. Gallent &Co. Went to Birch Harbor to carry Jennie Tracy. work all day on old house.
The wind South Easterly Thermometer 50 degrees and rainy send $25. to A P Wiswell by Reg letter work on the old house painting
The wind Southerly the Thermometer 42 at sunrise Painted the floors in the house.
The wind North West in the forenoon and Southerly in the afternoon the Thermometer 50°
The wind Easterly and overcast. Thermometer 49 degrees Went to West Gouldsboro with the Mail.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 58 degrees Reed letter from E.M Spurling commenced moving the things from the Hotel to the Capt Handy place.
The wind Southerly and foggy Thermometer 54 degrees Went Mackereling in the forenoon And heavy rain in the afternoon work in the Hotel in the afternoon packing up things to move.

The wind North West and fresh breeze. Thermometer 45 Work all the forenoon moving things out from the Hotel to the Capt Wm Handy place it being the place we are going to occupy. finished moving at noon
Calm in morning very heavy frost Thermometer 26 Went to West Gouldsboro with the Mail
The wind South West. Thermometer 45 degrees Went to Ellsworth to make out a list of Creditors I being Insolient. Came home in the evening
The wind Southerly. Thermometer 52 degrees
The wind Southerly Thermometer 45° Went to West Gouldsboro with the mail. Reed letter from Helen Stevens.
The wind North West in forenoon and Southerly in the afternoon and very moderate all day The Thermometer 80° at 10 A.M. Commenced digging my potatoes.
The wind South West Went to Cranberry Isles to see Emma Spurling Started for home at 5 oclock P.M. at dark the wind North West arrived home at 8 P.M. Reed notice
The wind North West. in forenoon and the Thermometer 80 degrees above zero. Work apart the day digging potatoes Wind South West in the afternoon.
The wind South West Thermometer 67 degrees Went to West Gouldsboro Reed letter from RH Kittredge &Co and wrote letter to R H Kittredge & Co and to A P Wiswell Esq. oath o G W Tracy as Post master.
The wind North West Thermometer 70 degrees. Went Clamming for bait getting ready to go fishing
Calm all day and the Thermometer 72 degrees
The wind from North East to South East and South West. Thermometer 49 degrees in morning Went down to Schoodic fishing and gunning
The wind West South West Thermometer very fresh breeze 62° started gunning bat the wind blew so hard I came back Acknowledged deed from Wm Rand to Chas Smallidge
The wind very moderate all day Thermometer 88° Went mackereling and roped a boat sail
Calm all day and the Thermometer 78 dgres Went to Shoodic Island gunning
The wind Easterly and drizzling rain Thermometer 52 degrees Went to West Gouldsboro with the mail.
The wind very moderate Easterly in morning. then calm the remainder of the day. Thermometer 62 degrees Work apart of the day making flying jibboom for the A.G.Brooks.
The wind very moderate Easterly Thermometer 54 and drizzling rain in the afternoon Went to South Gouldsboro to Carry E A Keating & family.
The wind North West. Thermometer 60 degrees. Work on flying jibboom for Schr A.G.Brooks Reed letters from Boston Trawler wrote letter to Helen Stevens
The wind North West Thermometer 62 degrees Finished making the flying jibboom for the A.G. Brooks
The wind North East. The Thermometer 54 Had the horse shoed Went to Bar Harbor in the afternoon to see Samuel Sargent and came back in the evening

The wind North East Thermometer. 70 degrees Went to Ellsworth in morning accompanied by Geo. Smallidge to attend the Court of Insolvency for the Creditors to prove their claims and choose an Assigner. G. H. Smith appointed came home in the afternoon
The wind Southerly Thermometer 60 degrees Work apart of the day for J.D. Harrington making a meal chest. Sent fifty names to the Independent a paper of New York City.
The wind South Thermometer 59 degrees Work apart of the day for J.D.Harrington and dug some potatoes for my self.
The wind South South East and rain in the fore noon Thermometer 60° In the afternoon the wind came of N.N.W and cleared up very fresh breeze.

The wind North North West. and a very heavy blow with the Thermometer 47 degrees finished digging my potatoes had about 25 bushels. Reed letter from Boston Traveller and Loring Short & Hamon. Portland
The wind South West Thermometer 59 degrees Work most all day hauling Rock weed and wood. gathered apart of my garden.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 48 degrees Wrote letter to A. P. Wiswell Made three Window frames for Capt Wm Handy to put in his house on Turtle Island.
The wind board out Southerly and rain all day with the Thermometer 57 degrees. Work in J. F. Kingsleys shop turning two setts of table legs for James B. Wright.
The wind North West And Thermometer 36 Went to West Gouldsboro with the Mail. heavy Snow Squalls in forenoon.
The wind N.N. West The Thermometer was down to 28 degrees in the morning. Helped J.F.Kingsley. get carrots down his cellar. Reed letter from A.P.Wiswell.
The wind West. North. W. in the forenoon and in the afternoon the wind out South West. Thermometer 57 degrees.
The wind South West Thermometer 60° Went to West Gouldsboro with the Mail Repaired the Schr AGBrooks wheel. Reed letter from Boston Traveler Office.

The wind Southerly Thermometer 50° Commenced Shighing the roof of Capt N.A.Bickfords house In the afternoon it rained at 2 oclock Wrote bill of sale of 1/2 of the Schr Nauseag from Celestia Bickford to Henry C Tully sinatd
The wind came of from the North West in the morning. to shingle the roof of N.A.Bickfords house Then came rain squalls and gave it up. the Thernometer 45 degrees My birth day 34 years old
The wind South West Thermometer 50 degrees work all day shing fing roof of N. A Bickfords house
The wind West N. West. and a very fresh breeze Thermometer 33 degrees went to West Gouldsboro with the mail.
The wind West North West Thermometer 36 degrees and a very fresh breeze Worked apart of the day turning in J F. Kingsleys shop.
The wind Westerly Thermometer 44 degrees Went to South Gouldsboro to get Leonard Bunker to Cary the mail for me tomorrow.

The wind Easterly and the Thermometer 25 degrees early in morning and gradualy went up to 35 degrees. Work apart of the day for J.D. Harrington. and in the afternoon for N. A. Bickford late in the evening commenced snowing
The wind Northerly & Thermometer 40 degrees about 6 inches of snow on the ground it being the first snow on the ground for the season
The wind North West Thermometer 40° Work about home

The wind Easterly In the morning the Thermometer down to 20 and gradually went up to 40 degrees. Went down on the Southern part of Turtle Island and got 2 boat loads of wood. In the afternoon thick with snow.

The wind Easterly Thermometer 35 degrees Snow and rain to gather Went to West gouldsboro with the mail, good Sleighign at West Gouldsboro Hauled wood from the shore to the house at night Let David Weare have my horse to go on Mail Router.

The wind West South West Went down Turtle Island to work for Wm. Handy putting in Window frames in his house. getting it ready fo Wm Leavy to move in. Very fresh breeze and the Thermometer 40 degrees. came home at night.
The wind South west and pleasant. Thermometer 55 degrees.
Calm in the morning at 8. AM. the wind breezed up to the North. Went down on Turtle Island and worked all day for Wm Handy hanging doors and setting partitions &c.
The wind North West Thermometer 34 degrees Work apart of the afternoon for N. A Bickford. on his house.
The wind South West. Thermometer 45 degrees Wrote letter to C.C. Burrill hauled Rockweed to bank up the house.
The wind North East and drizzling rain Thermometer 42 degrees made a pattern or model for a Wind Mill
The wind Southerly Thermometer 50 degrees Work about home cutting wood and cleaning up.
The wind Southerly and rainy and the Thermometer 44 degrees Worj in J.F.Kingsley's Shop.
The wind very moderate all day North West. Thermometer 70 degrees
The wind North West. fresh breeze thermometer 48 above work all day for Mrs Chas Pendleton in the house connecting two bed rooms by a door.
The wind North East. Thermometer 35 degrees Wrote letter to Wm B Viall thick with snow.
The wind Northerly Thermometer 45° and very pleasant. hauled Rock weed and banked up the house.
The wind North East and hard snow storm all day. The Thermometer 32 degrees wrote lease for Wm Rand Work apart of the day in J. F. Kingsley shop
The wind North West Gale Thermometer 22° above. work about home getting ready for the cold weather.

The wind North West in the morning Thermometer 12 above. Wrote letter to the Treasury for the Post Office Department. Went to the Lower Harbor Claming. at night the wind out Southerly and Thermometer 30 degrees.
The wind South South East. Thermometer 40 wind blowing a gale and heavy rain all day accompanied with hail and thunder and lightning at night more moderate wind South West and cleared up.

The wind North West fresh breeze and the Thermometer 28 degrees Went to West Gouldsboro with the Mail on Route 191 Via Prospect. Reed check from Mr Wm. B. Viall for $12.38 for carrying mail one gr on Route 365. West Gouldsboro
The wind South South West. very fresh breeze and heavy rain Reed letter from Han. A. P. Wiswell.
The wind West North West Thermometer 32 degrees work about home fixing the stalls in the barn.
Thanksgiving day Wind from North East to South. Went out fishing with James M. Sargent.

The wind Southerly Thermometer 45 degrees Went to West Gouldsboro with the Mail. Capt L.B. Tracy burried at Winter Harbor in the afternoon. Who died on board his vessel at Kittery Point. at night rainy.
The wind South South East. fresh breeze and a very heavy rain it rained it torrents all the forenoon. Thermometer 50° Salted fish got Thursday fixed up the barn inside
The wind North West Thermometer 20 degrees all day. without any variation.
The wind North West in morning the Thermometer. 18 degrees In the morning Started to go out fishing and before we got on the fishing ground the wind blow South West so hard came back
Calm in forenoon and Thermometer 50 degrees moderate Southerly in the afternoon. had horses shoer set getting ready to go to Ellsworth Tomorrow.

The wind North East overcast Thermometer 32 degrees. Went to Ellsworth to the Second meeting of my Creditor at the Court of Insolvency accompanied by G. W. Tracy. Took my horse as far as Sullivan then got Asa Whites. Went to Ellsworth. and back to Sullivan with his Then took mine and came home in the Evening
location: Ellsworth, Sullivan, Ellsworth, Sullivan, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Easterly and rainy in the morning. at 9 AM cleared of the wind North West Thermometer 40 degrees
The wind North and Easterly Thermometer 28 degrees. Started to go a fishing gave it up come back. Hauled two loads of freights from the wharf to N. A. Bickford house.
The wind South East Thermometer 35 degrees Work all day for J. D. Harrington building a wood shed.
The wind Southerly. and a very heavy rain all the forenoon. In the afternoon it cleared of with the wind from the Westward Thermometer 40 degrees.
The wind Westerly and Thermometer 41 degrees not any snow. or ice took some dishes out the Hotel Went to So. Gouldsboro and got. Leonard Bunker to carry the Mail.
The wind North East. Thermometer 20 degrees
The wind South South East Thermometer 40 degrees Sawing out boat timbers
The wind Southerly Thermometer 48° wrote bill of sale of the Schr Nauseag from Julia A Bickford to N. A. Fitz jerald. wrote letter to Mrs Mary Stanley
The wind Northerly Thermometer 30° worked 7 hours for Nathan Bickford Shingling on his house finished the North Side. Reed letter and hand bills from the Bentist S M Inman.
The wind North East very moderate the Thermometer from 18° down to 12 above. Wrote letter to Dr S.M. Inman
The wind South East Thermometer. at night commenced snowing
The wind Northerly Thermometer 30 degrees Went to West Gouldsboro to see the Assignee not snow enough for Sleighing
The wind Westerly Thermometer 32 degrees Filed saw for Wm Tracy. and hung door for my self.

Wind Easterly and a Snow storm in the forenoon. In the afternoon the wind W.N.West & cleared of pleasant had horse showed and Thermometer 35 degrees Reed postal card. from Mrs. Dr. Inman. good sleighing.

The wind North North West Thermometer 10° above at Sunrise at noon 29° at 9 1/2 P.M. down to 4° above. G. H. Smith the Assignee of my Estate Appointed by the Court of Insolency called up on me to look out for my property.
The wind Northerly Thermometer from 30° down to 20° above. Went to Bar Harbor in the Schr Washington and came back at dark.
The wind all around the compase and Snowing most all day Thermometer 30 degrees Reed letter from Wm B. Viall
The wind Northerly The Thermometer 6 degrees below zero in the morning at noon 10 above and at night 7 below zero The vapor very thick

wrote letter a Wm B Viall The wind North East Thermometer 10 degrees below zero. untill night Thick with snow and vapor all day. at dark the wind hauled out Southerly and the weather more moderate at 9 PM Thermometer 35 above & ram noted protest of the Schooner Claressa Ferson
The wind West North West Thermometer 25 degrees. Wrote letter to the Auditor of the Treasury for the Post Office Department. Reed letter from A J Blethon. Repaired gun lack for Colon Bunker.
The wind North East. and snowing all day Thermometer from 14 degrees up to 32 degrees. Went to Prospect Harbor and had sleigh shoes put on by E.W. Cleaves
Christmas Wind N.W. Thermometer 10 degrees above zero. Went to the Hall in the evening to the Christmas tree. At 11 P.M. the Thermometer 6 degrees below zero.
The wind Northerly Thermometer 8 below in the morning in the afternoon was summosed to. appear as a witness at South Gouldsboro in a Case against Ivory Sargent. Wm Sargen and Edmond Sargent

The wind North wind moderate Thermometer at zero in the morning Went to So Gouldsboro according to the Summons. the defendents were arranged before judge Cleaves and settled it without coming to Trial wrote deed to Wm H Sargent in Evening.
The wind very moderate all day. Light snow in the forenoon Thermometer 35 degrees above zero.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 40 above moderate rain and snow all day. Went to West Gouldsboro. with the mail.

The wind Northerly rain and snow in the forenoon cleared up in the afternoon clear Thermometer 30° in the morning and 12 at night above. zero. Cut up a hog for J. F. Kingsley and work in his shop the remainder of the day.
The wind North East Thermometer 15 degrees below zero at 8 oclock A.M
The wind North West pleasant Thermometer 32 degrees.

The wind from South West to W. Thermometer 40 degrees above 0 Went to West Gouldsboro with mail. Reed letter from the Auditor of the Treasury for the Post Office Department stahing check sent me No 14872 lost and payment stoped at Po in Portland
The wind North West. Thermometer 32° at noon Went to West Gouldsboro to carry shup pilts for J.F.K.
The wind Southerly and rainy all day with the Thermometer 35 degrees Went to Sullivan Steam boat whard to carry Mrs Almina Bourget
The wind North West Thermometer 28 degrees Went to West Gouldsboro with the mail. Wrote to Town Clerk to get Charles E. Kingsley and Hannah C Grover Published both of Gouldsboro

The wind South East. Thermometer 33 degrees bought. and hauled home one half cord of hard wood from Wm Rands wood shed In the evening went to the Steam boat Wharf meeting Was chosen Clerk and adjourned untill tomorrow night
The wind moderate Easterly and fine weather Thermometer 50 Commenced repairing Warren Smith Skiff in the fish house In the Evening Steam boat wharf meeting.
The Thermometer 55 degrees above zero Calm and pleasant. Made two sliding sleds for children.
The wind Easterly and pleasant. Thermometer 47 degrees Went to West Gouldsboro with Mail. Wrote to Port Master at Portland to know if lost check 14872 had been cashed.

The wind South West Thermometer. 40 degree down to 20 above at night the wind North West. Went to Geo S. Bunkers with N. A Bickford Reed certificate of the Inteded Marriage C. E. Kingsley from Town clerk.
The wind Westerly and very moderate. with ths Thermometer 50 degrees above zero. Went to a Reglisious meeting in the evening,
The wind Westerly. Thermometer 32 above Reed letter from the Post Master Portland certifying the mail Route 365 No 14872 had not been paid.
The wind North East Thermometer 18° above and thick with snow all day. Was Power  of Attorny for Capt J B Foss. Reed Card from Wm B Viall
The wind North West Thermometer in the morn at 0 in the afternoon 20 above. Wrote letter to the Bangor Commerilal Reed Card from H B Sandrs
The wind South West. Thermometer 32 degrees Wrote letter to Wm B Viall In afternoon went to Prospect with E Kingsley
Calm all day and the Thermometer 40° Wrote letter to Mejsrs Sherman &Co. Marshall Mich. Reed the first copy of the Bangor Communicae
Calm all day and the Thermometer 42 degrees Wrote to Auditor of Treasury for a duplicate check No 14872
The wind Southerly Thermometer 38 degrees above Went to Sullivan Steam boat wharf to cary Geo. Pendleton J.W. Anthony and trunks &c. In the afternoon heavy rain.
The wind North West. Thermometer 37 degrees Reed letter from Hugh Mckay Lotterie Agent at Canada.

The wind North East. Thermometer 33 degrees above Work in the woods in the forenoon cutting firewood. In the evening witnessed the Solemnzing of the Marriage of Charles E Kingsley and Mijs Hannah Grover by Mr Palm
The wind North East and heavy snow storm all day thermometer 18 above,
The wind North West in the morning Thermometer 32 and very pleasant. at night the wind out Southerly and indications of a Storm. Went to a Lyceum at Pacific Hall Winter Harbor
The wind South South East and heavy rain all day Thermometer 40° above Reed Circular from Sherman &Co Marshall Michigan. A large body of snow matter
The wind Westerly and pleasant Thermometer 37 degrees above Went to West Gouldsboro with passengers. Reed notice from Narraguagus Lodge.
The wind South West and pleasant all day and the Thermometer 37 above. Went to a Religious Meeting in the evening
The wind South West and pleasant Thermometer 39° wrote letters to Sherman &Co Marshall Mich. and to Hugh Mc Kay Canada. Went to East Sullivan for Geo Pendleton.
The wind very moderate Southerly Thermometer 42 and pleasant untill night when it began to rain.
Calm all day Thermometer 50 Administered the oath to the New P.M. Jennie Tracy in lieu of G.W. Tracy.
The wind North West Thermometer 20 above. hauled one load of wood on home lot.
The wind South East. Thermometer 40 degrees above Reed duplicate check from the P.O. Department for the Quarter ending Sept 30. Wrote letter to G H Smith Reed letter from Hugh Mc Kay Canada.
The wind Westerly and Thermometer 37 degrees wrote letter to Wm B Viall of Bethel Vt. and Auditor of the Treasurer Washington
letter_to: William B. Viall, Auditor of the Treasurer Washington

journal_entry: The wind Southerly and Thermometer 32 degrees above zero. At Pm the wind came off N.West cold with snow squalls
The wind North West Thermometer 6 degrees below zero
The wind East fresh breeze and big snow storm Thermometer 10 above zero. Went in the woods cutting firewood stormed so hard came out at noon Reed letter from Helen Stevens
The wind North West Thermometer 22 above Went in the woods and got one load of wood. Reed Card from the Bangor Commercial.
The wind Westerly and Thermometer 30 degrees above Repairing harness.
The wind Westerly Thermometer 18 above Made sinlk for Capt N A Bickford. Reed card from Wm B Viall
The wind moderate all day baffling. Thermometer 27 above. light snow in the evening. Work all day on harness getting ready to go in the woods
The wind South West and very fresh breeze Thermometer 28° Wrote letter to Helen B Stevens at Laurence.
The wind North West and the Thermometer went from 28 above down to zero. Went in the woods all day hauling out firewood from the stream lot to the Town road.
local_place: Home, Woods, Stream, Town Road, Home

journal_entry: The wind South East Thermometer at zero in morning. Went to South Gouldsboro. and paid Charles L Bunker for Carrying the mail on Route 365. up to Jan 1 1880.
The wind North West Thermometer 18 above. Sent 60 cts to the Bangor Commercial one month pay. Wrote Warranty deed from Silal Foss to Ira B Foss.
The wind South East. and snowing in the morning Went in the woods and got one load of wood at 10 AM heavy rain and spoiled the sleding Thermometer 37°
The wind Southerly moderate Thermometer 40° work in the afternoon for Capt N. A Bickford
The wind North East and rainy forenoon and in the afternoon wind North Thermometer 32 degrees work all day for Capt N. A. Bickford on the inside of his house.
The wind North East. and the whole sky looked like snow every minute of the day. but no snow fall. Went to a Religious meeting in the evening
The wind Northerly Thermometer 30° Wrote letter to Geo H. Brown Ellsworth for Geo Gerrish Work all day for N.A.Bickford
The wind Southerly Thermometer 33 degrees Went to Milbridge to Cary N A Bickford Stoped all night at Capt Josiah Bunker
The wind Southerly Came home from Milbridge at noon Thermometer 37 degrees
The wind North West in the morning moderate in the afternoon the wind breezed up to a gale Thermometer 15 above at night and growing cold work all day for Capt N. A. Bickford.
The wind North West. Thermometer 20 above the wind blowing a gale work all day for N.A. Bickford
The wind South West Thermometer 32 degrees wrote letter to Capt Horace Handy at Portland. Cut wood at the door.
The wind Westerly and Thermometer 35 degrees Went to a Religious meeting in the evening at the Hall
The wind South South East Thermometer 32 degrees above at noon commenced snowing. Started for Milbridge on wheels to Masonic Instalation went as far Prospect snow hard came back
The wind North East Thermometer 32 degrees snowing moderate all the forenoon. about 18 inches snow fall. The biggest storm for the winter so far. Work 1/2 day for N A Bickford.
The wind Westerly and Thermometer 35 degrees work in the afternoon hauling wood.
The wind South South East Thermometer 44 degrees foggy. at night rainy hauling wood all day Reed Check from the Post Office Department
The wind Southerly Thermometer 50° Work all day hauling wood from the Stream lot across the Health to the town road.

The wind Southerly. Thermometer 48 degrees work all day for N. A. Bickford The Sleighing about spailed More wagons than sleighs used. Sent Post Office Check of $12 38 to Wm B Viall Vermont Sent the recipt to the P.O.D
Wind South South East Thermometer 43 degrees heavy rain most all day at night the wind South West and clear.
The wind West North West. Thermometer 30 degrees worked on half day for N A Bickford and finished work for the present all the lumber used up.

The wind North West Thermometer from 16 above up to 33 and down to 14 above at night. Wrote a bill of sale of the Schr Nauseag from Celestia A Bickford to n. A Fitzjerald afternoon cutting Ice fo J. F. K.
The wind South West Thermometer 34 degrees Work all day hauling Ice for J. F. Kingsley from the Ice pond to the Ice house.
local_place: Home, Ice Pond, Ice House, Home

journal_entry: The wind North West. Thermometer 42 degrees the ground to soft to haul Ice. Cased out and hung a door for my self in the kitchen.
The wind Easterly & Southerly heavy rain all day. work in the forenoon on Ice. finished cutting the Ice and took it out of the water and stacked it up ready to haul Thermometer 40.
The wind North East Thermometer 34 degrees Work for J.F.Kingsley. on Ice and finished cutting Ice house full.
local_place: Home, Ice Pond, Ice House, Home

journal_entry: The wind Southerly Thermometer 33 degrees and overcast and the appearances of rain

The wind southerly and thick with snow. Started at 4oclock Am for Sullivan Steam boat to Carry Capt. N.A. Bickford and Dora Rand. At 10Am the wind northwest and clear. Thermometer 20 above. Reed letters from Emma M. Spurling
The wind North East and in the morning Thermometer at zero. In the afternoon snowy. Reed letter from Henry Geyer. Wrote letter to Mrs. Emma M. Spurling
The wind North North west. Work all day on boat for Warren Smith in the fish house. Thermometer 35 degrees above zero.
The wind Westerly and Thermometer 30 above. hauled wood on wheels fro Mrs. Chas Pendleton. James Gerrish had wrote letter to Mr. Jerry Woosten of Hancock
local_place: Home, Chas. Pendleton's, James Gerrish's, Home

journal_entry: The wind North East in the morning and snowing untill noon hauled one of wood for myself on wheels. at noon. wind westerly and the Thermometer 20 above.
The wind North West Thermometer at zero in the morning. Made a chart of the mail Routes in Gouldsboro to help establish a Post Office in Birch Harbor Work on Warren Smith boat.
The wind South East and snowy all day but not snow enough for Sleighing on sleding Thermometer 22 degrees
The wind North East in the morning and South West in the afternoon Work most all day for Warren Smith on boat.
The wind Easterly and snowing all day the Thermometer 28 degrees Made Organ stool for Georgie Tracy.
The wind North West Went to West Gouldsboro in forenoon with sleigh and in the afternoon hauled wood for James Gerrish on sled
The wind North East Thermometer 32 degrees Work one half day for James Gerrish hauling wood Reed letters from J. Wooster
The wind South East Thermometer 47 degrees above Made oath to Amasiah Southard as road surveyer work in forenoon hauling wood for John Gerrish with bled at noon the sun had spoiled the sleding.
The wind North East & South Thermometer 43° Turned Lounge legs for R Rand. in forenoon and traded my row boat called the Stella with Warren Smith for a skiff work repairing her in the afternoon.
The wind North West. Thermometer 37 degrees Went to a Religious meeting in the evening it being in Mr Palmers farewell sermon 55 people talked in meeting besided about 15 or 20 rose for Prayers
The wind South West. Work most all day on skiff Thermometer 31 degrees at night snow squalls.
The wind Westerly Thermometer 35 degrees work all day on skiff for my self At night Calm and Thermometer falling to 24 degrees.

The wind South East in the morning. Commenced moving The wind hauled to the N. East and snowed awfully. Worked apart of the forenoon laying floor for J.D. Harrington at night the toughest storm for the winter.
The wind North blowing & snowing fearfully The roads blocked with snow so the mail could not go out. the only time for the Winter. Painted my skiff. Thermometer 20° above zero.
The wind North West. and a fresh breeze Thermometer. 24 degrees in shade. Work in the afternoon turning heads for wheel barrow fro R Rand.
The wind North West in forenoon & South West in afternoon. Painted my skiff inside
The wind North East fresh breeze & clear Thermometer 24 degrees Went to a Prayer Meeting in the evening R M Torrey leader for the evening.
The wind North East fresh breeze & clear Thermometer. 29 degrees Went to South Gouldsboro. with Sleigh in forenoon and in the Afternoon made Rudder & Center board for my skiff.
The wind North East fresh breeze & clear Thermometer from 25 to 35 degrees Acknowledged a deed from Warren Smith to Desisle Work apart of the day in J. F. Kingsleys Shop turning.
The wind North East fresh breeze Thermometer 30 wrote letters to Chas Shaw & Eastern Express Agent at Milbridge Filled out the paper for the new P.O. at Birch Harbor.
The wind North East Thermometer 35 degrees Administered the oath to the P.M. quarterly returns took my boat out of the fishouse that I have been repairing.
The wind Southerly and Thermometer 37 degrees work most all day for Ambrose Bourget on door.
The wind South South East The Thermometer 34 degrees rainy in the afternoon Went to Prospect to Cary R. H. Bickford
The wind South West Thermometer 52 degrees
The wind West South West Thermometer. 48 degrees Acknowledged from Wm Rand als to E A Baker Commenced making oars for boat.
THe wind North West. Thermometer 37 degrees Finished making oars.
The wind from North East to North West Thermometer 30° made rudder Irons for boat and made mast.

The wind North West and in the morning Thermometer 25° Went to West Gouldsboro Oath to the P.M.So.Gouldsboro Hired Wm Bunker to Cary the Mail for a Quarter at $10 home at night Reed letter from Geo Hopkins Millbridge.
The wind South West. Thermometer 38 degrees high Went to Prospect Harbor after Trall fixings bout to Deasy & Handy to the amt of $8.02
The wind South West Thermometer 40 degrees Repaires Wagon seat for Calvin Hammond
The wind South South West Thermometer 50 degrees at noon
The wind Westerly and a very fresh breeze Thermometer 20 on the morning. Measured the Black  maniors foremast for a new one.
The wind North East in morning South West in afternoon. Work all day about home cutting wood had a pump put in the well Thermometer 35 degrees
The wind South Easterly Thermometer 40 degrees.work apart of the day rigging troll.
The wind South west. and Thermometer. 4 degrees. Work apart of the day on Fred cranes dora. Wrote letter to APWiswell.
notes: It does says 4 in the journal. Probebly he made typo while writng

journal_entry: Thermometer 50 The wind North West Pleasant Went to Duck brook after saw - dust for J.Kingsley in Wm Handys boat took in 20 bags in afternoon In the night the wind Easterly with rain hail & snow. got the boat underway and beat from the shore
The wind Easterly very fresh breeze. at daylight anchored in the les of Crabtrees neck until afternoon then got underway and came home at 5 P.M blowing heavy Thermometer 30 degrees Wind North East.
The wind North East. Thermometer 47 degrees
The wind Southerly Thermometer 42 Went to Steuben to Cary Chester Stevens and see Lawyer Byther Came home at night
The wind South West & Thermometer 27 finished repairing Fred Cranes dora and mended Capt Handys boat-sail
Calm in forenoon with the Thermometer 55 degrees and at noon started for Duck brook in Wm Handys boat after saw dust for J.F.Kingsley. got there at 5 P.M. and took of 50 bags nearly half a load

The wind South South West. Finished loading the boat Saw dust at 11 AM and Started for home The wind blew so hard could not get home in boat. Landed at South Gouldsboro & walked home Thermometer 50 degrees.
The wind Northerly fresh breeze Thermometer 40 degrees Went to South Gouldsboro. & by land and came home in the boat and landed the Saw dust. And in the afternoon work on troll
The wind very moderate South West Thermometer 37 degrees. Went to South Gouldsboro in the forenoon In the afternoon finished hoiking up troll.
A very fresh breeze from the South West. Thermometer 42 degrees.
The wind South South East and moderate and foggy. Thermometer 39 degrees Work on day for Solomon Pendelton on dora. Wrote letter to L. A. Emery
Calm in forenoon and overcast. In the afternoon wind North West fresh breeze. and pleasant. Thermometer 44 degrees Work one half day for Solomon Pendleton Reed letters from L A Emery & A P Wiswell
letter_from: L. A. Emery, A. P. Wiswell

journal_entry: Wind Northerly in forenoon Southerly in afternoon Thermometer 50 degrees In the forenoon Shingling for Capt N.A. Bickford Wm Handy Cancels the Mortgage on homestead given by Mary E. Bunker for his maintainance also gives a quit calm deed for the Consideration of $500. $50 down yearly payments
The wind Southerly Thermometer 47 degrees Work all day for N.A. Bickford shingling house. Wrote letter to John Crabtree. of Hancock

The wind South East Thermometer 39 degrees A heavy gale of wind and rain untill afternoon. when it cleared up. And I commenced building fence. on Harbor Point on the line between E.A.Bakers lot & this one.

The wind Westerly and the Thermometer 42 degrees Work all day and finished building fence on line between E. A. Bakers lot and the lot of land recently conveyed from Wm Handy to my wife Mary E. Bunker
The wind Southerly and rough Thermometer 48 degrees at night thick with fog.
Wind North East. work 3/4 day shingling for Capt N.A.Bickford & finished work. and at night baited troll ready to go a fishing Thermometer 44 degrees
Calm in morning went out fishing and set troll in Egg Rock Channel got one 1 a half tubs of fish back in the afternoon wind South West fresh breeze Thermometer 57 degrees
Wind Easterly and heavy rain in morning Cleared up in the afternoon made a floaling stage to dress fish on Thermometer 70°
Wind South West Thermometer. 60° Work about the fish house all day putting it in order to take care of fish.

Wind North in forenoon fresh breeze went out to my troll wind blew so hard I could not pick it. In afternoon moderate went out to my troll and baited it at night very fresh Southerly Thermometer 49 degrees
The wind Easterly in forenoon went out to my troll got two tubs of fish and came back about 4 oclock. wind Southerly and the Thermometer 37 degrees.
Wind Southerly heavy thunder and lightning in the morning and pleasant through the middle of the day. and very heavy thunder and lightning at night. Thermometer 59
The wind South East Thermometer 50 degrees went out to my troll fishing wrote letter to A. P. Wiswell
The wind South West Fresh breeze Thermometer 54 degrees. Went to Prospect Harbor after suit Oil Clothes and up to Stave Island after bait.
Wind North Thermometer 45 went to my troll in the morning found moorings parted and apart of the troll in a snarl. Took the troll up carrid it hom cleared it & baited and at night set it.
Wind North East. Thermometer 44 went to the troll in the morning wind blew very fresh had to leave it & come in.
The wind North East. Thermometer 38 degrees very fresh breeze. Went to Prospect Harbor after Hhd and hanging twine for nots
The wind North West in forenoon went out to my troll South West wind in afternoon Thermometer 59°
The wind North West Thermometer. 65 degrees
Wind North in forenoon Went out to my troll wind Southerly in afternoon. Thermometer 60 and Showery tarred a herring net
Wind Westerly Thermometer 65 Registered letter to A.P.Wiswell with $15. enclosed the ballance due on my Insolvency Staid in from fishing to put Cork rope and sinker line on net.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 55° Took up my troll to do other work with the intention of heeping it uo untill after I do some farming. Turned Acorn and ball to go on Spire of Chapel.

The wind Southerly and foggy all day Thermometer 50 degrees. took six Hhds salts out of the Black Warrior to use fishing Worked 1/2 day for Barney Foss on his boat to make her tight. Reed letter from Clarance Hale. Portland.
Wind Southerly heavy thunder and lightning early in the morning. Thermometer 52 degrees making out buoys apart of the day.
Wind Southerly Thermometer 48 Went to So. Gouldsboro Steam boat wharf. and sent Express wagon to Ellsworth via Lamoine for J.W.Davis. Foggy all day.
Wind South South East. thick and rainy all day. Thermometer 47 degrees.
Wind Southerly & foggy Commenced farming plowed all day with the help of Henry Sargent. Acknowledged deed for A.J.Baker Thermometer 65
Wind Northerly in morning went out fishing and set troll wind Southerly in the afternoon took up troll and went home. Thermometer 70°
Wind Southerly and pleasant Thermometer. 65 degrees Work about home farming Mr Asher Palmer Ordainedin the evening.
Wind South West Thermometer 74 degrees hauling out dressing and getting ready to plant potatoes.
Calm and hot in the forenoon. Went to West Gouldsboro after seed wheat and grass seed. at noon heavy shower with thunder. Wind came of from the Westward sewed wheat in afternoon Thermometer 70°
Wind West North West Thermometer 68 degrees Work all day farming. plowing and hauling dressing. Received a Check from the Post Office for $12.38 for Carrying mail. Route 365

Wind South East Thermometer 60 overcast and afternoon rainy. At 3 oclock PM Went to a baptism at Steam boat wharf Winter Harbor. and the following persons were baptised. Henry Sargent. Daniel Southard. Jalez Myrick R.M. Torrey. Sarah Torrey Mary Rand Martha Bickford Flora Gerrish Joan Sargent Ruth Pendleton Lillian Namond Sally Bunker Maria Gerrish Alicia Riley Rufuss Bunker Sarah Bunker all by Asher Palmer.
Wind Easterly and heavy rain all day. Thermometer. 52 degrees. Work in afternoon For F. H. Smallidge hewing nails for fence.
Wind Southerly nd moderate Thermometer 74° Went up new road after piece to make stem for Barney Foss.
Wind South East most of the forenoon rainy. Wrote petition for J. D. Harrington He applying for the Post Office work in the afternoon for Barney Foss on hos boat stopping leaks Thermometer 64
Wind East fresh breeze and clear Thermometer 65 work all day farming covering potatoes and hauling dresing
Wind North East in forenoon. Thermometer 56° finished planting potatoes beans & corn Wind South West in afternoon.
Wind South West. Thermometer 64 degrees Spaded up the gardens
Wind South West Thermometer 61 degrees
Wind Easterly and Thermometer 59 degrees Started out fishing no bait came back and worked on place
Wind East Thermometer 56 drizzling rain. Went out fishing Fannie Pendleton burried in afternoon
Wind Southerly and Thermometer 77 at noon Went ou and set my troll in the morning and back at noon Went to Prospect Harbor at night.
Wind Southerly Thermometer 78 degrees Work all day for Reuben Rand at his shop ceiling up boat.
Wind Southerly, and Thermometer 62 degrees Sowed garden in forenoon and in the afternoon went out and took up my troll. Wrote Deed for R H Bickford
The wind West North West Thermometer 80 degrees in shade Work all day for P. A. Summer. repairing Dora at R Rands shop
Wind Westerly. and the Thermometer. 82 degrees at noon. In the afternoon went to West Gouldsboro after Edmond Kingsley
Wind North all day Thermometer 71 degrees Went to the Lower harbor Claming bought a Dora of S.C Pendleton $2,50
Wind North West in the forenoon and South West in the afternoon and Thermometer 74 degrees Washed my wagon and worked apart of the day repairing dora for my self.

Wind Northerly in forenoon Went to Ellsworth to attend the Court of Insolvency to get a discharge from my debts Thermometer 85 degrees on main street Wind Southerly in afternoon. Got home at about 10 oclock P.M.
local_place: Home, Hancock County Superior Court, Home

journal_entry: Wind North West in forenoon Thermometer 80° Work the most of the day repairing dora.
Calm in morning Wind Southerly in afternoon finished repairing dora and set net at night Thermometer 68 degrees.
Wind Southerly all day Thermometer 71 degrees Went out fishing
Wind blowing very fresh from the South ward. Thermometer 65 degrees
Wind Southerly all day Thermometer 62 degrees. Went to my net but not bait enough to go afishing baited my troll at night
The wind North West. Thermometer 60 degrees wind blew fresh went out fishing in dora. Heavy rain Showers at night wind form the North.
Wind North West very fresh breeze to much wind to go a fishing Thermometer 59 work a bout the fish house all day.
The wind Southerly and the Thermometer 65 degrees Went out fishing
The wind baffling from North East to South East moderate and overcast Went out fishing from home in dora.
Very early in the morning wind Easterly and very heavy thunder and rain. at 8 Am. moderate and cleared up went out fishing Thermometer 69.
weather_condition_am: very heavy thunder, very heavy rain

journal_entry: Went to Stave Island after bait The wind South West. Thermometer 75 degrees In the afternoon went to the Baptism of Ambrose Bourgett. Nathan Bickford William Guptill and Caroline Guptill baptised by Mr. Palmer at Winter Harbor
The wind South West. Thermometer 67 degrees Went out fishing. Wrote letter to G. H. Smith
The wind South South West Thermometer 79 degrees Went out fishing. foggy in forenoon cleared up in afternoon
Calm in the morning went out fishing from home in dora. At noon heavy shower. Afternoon Southerly wind and foggy. Ther Thermometer at noon 81 degrees.
Calm in the forenoon South West wind in afternoon. Thermometer 72 degrees at noon Went out fishing
Southerly wind in morning Went out fishing at 10 Am heavy thunder with rain squalls at night foggy Thermometer 67 degrees,
Calm and rainy all day Thermometer 60° Went out fishing
Wind South West Thermometer 76 degrees

Wind Southerly Thermometer 70° Celebrated this day for the fourth. With Yatch races Canoe race by the Indians and foot race. in the evening an Indian Pow wow. and fireworks at Chas Guptill by Mrs Freneck M.D.
The wind Southerly and foggy Thermometer 60 degrees Filled out papers for J. D. Harrington who has been appointed Post Master in Lieu of Jennie Tracy. Julia Cole died at 2P.M.
The wind Southerly and Thermometer. 72 degrees Worked 3/4 of a day for Alexander Bickford on the Schr Henry Clay fishing foremast
The wind South South West Thermometer 65 degrees Work on troll in forenoon and in the afternoon Went to the Funeral of Julia Cole as one of the Pall bearers. at the house. She died with Consumption
Wind Southerly went to Stave Island and got some herring for troll bait and baited the troll wind blowed hard could not sett it. Hiram D. Coombs died at Prospect at 11 A.M  Typhoid fever
The wind Southerly and the Sea rough Went out fishing Thermometer 85 degrees

The wind Northerly in morning and Thermometer at 8 A.M 82 In the afternoon went to Prospect Harbor to the funeral of Hiram D. Coombs as one of the Pall bearers he being burried under the Masonic Order Wind Southerly
The wind Southerly Thermometer 70 degrees Plewed among my potatoes in the afternoon.
Wind Easterly and rainy Thermometer 65 degrees work most all day making a new troll.
Wind North West fresh breeze and clear. Thermometer 74 degrees Work all day hoeing potatoes finished at night with the help of Amaziah Southard
Wind Southerly and overcast. Thermometer 67 degrees. Work all day for I.H.Smallidge on barn.
Wind Southerly foggy Thermometer 62 degrees Work all day on barn for I. H. Smallidge
The wind Southerly. Thermometer. 60 degrees Foggy. fixed wagon seat for Capt J. P Foss. and mowed some around the door of our house.
The wind Westerly and Thermometer 87 degrees Went to C. Y. Bunkers to dinner accompanied by my wife and child
Wind Southerly and moderate went out fishing Thermometer 69° plenty of Mackerel to be caught in nets
The wind Easterly and moderate Thermometer 70° Went out fishing from home in dora and back in the afternoon. That being my business this summer when there is bait to fish with
The wind South Easterly and thick with fog. Thermometer at noon 75° Put mast step in my dora and cut a sail for the same. rain in the morning. the mackerel in great abundance.
Wind South Easterly and thick with fog Thermometer 68 work about house. wrote letter to C. Y. Bunker Commenced haying for my self.
The wind Southerly Thick with fog Thermometer 70 degrees went out fishing
The wind South and thick with fog. Went out fishing Thermometer 61 degrees
The wind South West Thermometer 85 degrees Went on Iron Bound Island
The wind Southerly and thick with fog. work apart of the day finishing dora sail that I had been making Thermometer 65 degrees Reed letter from S. Libby Town Treasurer.
The wind Southerly and thick with gof untill 10 am when the wind came from the westward and the sun came out work all day haying at 4 P.M. wind Southerly again and thick
The wind North West in forenoon & South West in afternoon. Work all day haying Thermometer at Noon 84 degrees ar night cooler
The wind North West in the forenoon & South West in afternoon work all day haying hauled in 12 stacks of hay Thermometer 86 degrees at noon
The wind North West untill the middle of the afternoon. then South West Thermometer 78 degrees Work all day haying hauled in 77 stacks of hay

Wind North West in forenoon South West in afternoon work all day haying hauled in 51 stacks of hay. Thermometer at noon was 78 degrees high Reed letter from C. J. Abbot. Atty at Law. Casting called for advertising in Boston Traveller.
Wind Southerly all day Thermometer at noon 81° hauled in one load of hay about 24 stacks.
Wind Southerly and over cast finished mowing in the forenoon Thermometer 69 degrees at noon
Wind Southerly and overcast finished mowing in the forenoon Thermometer 69 degrees at noon
Wind Southerly and foggy Thermometer 68 Went mackereling in sand cove for bait
Wind South South West. Thermometer 67 catching mackerel for bait
The wind Southerly and overcast partially foggy went out fishing Thermometer 71 degrees,
The wind Northerly in forenoon went out fishing Wind Southerly in afternoon Thermometer 72 Wrote letter to Geo M Waren Castine.
The wind very moderate all day and fine weather went out fishing from home in dora. Thermometer in the afternoon when I came in from fishing 80 degrees. Reed letter from Helen Stevens at Leadsvelle
Very moderate North East wind in forenoon Southerly in the afternoon Thermometer 75 degrees
Thick with fog in morning at 10 Am cleared up Went out fishing very fresh breeze Southerly Thermometer 74 degrees
Wind Southerly and moderate all day. Went out fishing Thermometer 79 degrees Catching mackerel morn and night for troll bait
Wind Northerly in morning Went out fishing Wind Southerly in afternoon Thermometer 78 degrees Reed Check from the Post Office Department for &12.38 for Mail service on Route 365
Calm in the morning went out fishing from home in dora. Wind South West in afternoon came home Thermometer 79 degrees
Moderate Southerly all day. Went out fishing from home in dora. back in afternoon Thermometer 75 degrees
Very fresh Southerly all day and rough Went out fishing from home in dora Thermometer 62 degrees
Wind North West all day and very fine weather Thermometer 78°
Wind North West all day Thermometer at Sun rush down to 50 degrees but warm in afternoon. went to my troll
Wind North West in forenoon South West afternoon Went to my troll used salt bait bait very scarce mackerel has been plenty but have left Thermometer 71°.
The wind South Easterly and moderate. Went to my troll fishing from home. and using salt bait. got about 3/4 of a tub of fish Thermometer 68°
Wind South very fresh breeze and Rough by a long hard pull got to my troll. bait from the Weir. Thermometer 60 degrees at 5 PM. Reed letter from Geo.M.Warren Esq
Wind South Easterly Thick with fog and rain did not go to my troll Thermometer 52 degrees.
Calm and thick with fog. Went out fishing heavy rain at noon Thermometer 57 degrees.
Wind Southerly all day Caught some mackerel at night for bait. Thermometer at 8 AM. 84 degrees.
Wind South West Went out fishing to the South of Egg rock using mackerel for bait from home in dora Thermometer. 71 degrees
Wind Southerly Went out fishing Thermometer 79 degrees.
Wind North all day very fresh breeze. blew so hard I could not go fishing staid home and Coopered Hhds &c Thermometer 71 degrees
Wind North West in forenoon Went ou fishing Wind South West in afternoon Wrote deed for P L Tracy in evening. Thermometer 60 degrees
Wind Southerly and moderate went out fishing from home in dora. Thermometer 70 degrees.
The wind South with a very fresh breeze and rough. Went out to my troll Thermometer at 4 P.M. 68 degrees.
The wind Northerly and pleasant with the Thermometer 80 degrees
Wind North North West Went out a fishing from home living on the Wm Handy place purchased by my wife May 28th Thermometer 61 degrees
Wind South West Went out fishing using herring for bait. fish not very plenty, a good school of haddock in the spring but hake are very scarce.
Wind South West Staid in from fishing to do other work went to Prospect Harbor to Cary My wife to make an Endorsment . on note
The wind South West and rough Went to my troll hake very scarce Thermometer in afternoon when I got home 70°
The wind Southerly and a very fresh breeze did not go a fishing Thermometer 70 degrees
The wind Southerly and thick with fog. did not go out to my troll Wrote letter to A.P. Eiswell Esq and John Bruinmer Thermometer 61 degrees
letter_to: A. P. Eiswell Esg, John Bruinmer

journal_entry: The wind Southerly Thermometer 82 degrees

Wind Southerly and Thermometer 70 degrees Wrote letter to Wm Handy Owner of Schr Old Chad Geo. M. Warren and to the Post Office Department last named letter for David Weare. Went out fishing afternoon
letter_to: William Handy, George M. Warren, David Weare

journal_entry: Wind Northerly in the forenoon. Went to my troll Wind Southerly in the afternoon. Thermometer 80. degrees
Wind North in the morning and hauled around to the Eastward. Went out to my troll overcast weather. and at night when I got home from my troll. the Thermometer 59 degrees.
The wind North East and blowing very fresh all day. could not pick my troll get a plenty of herring for bait. Thermometer. 69 degrees

Wind North East went to my net at the Southern point of Mark Island got 1/2 Bbl of herring wind bley very fresh could not get to my troll. Went ashore to the Silver Mine at Schoodic in the afternoon heavy rains
The wind North West very fresh breeze in forenoon but went down in afternoon. Thermometer 72 degrees at 3 P.M.
Wind Southerly Thermometer 80 degrees
Wind Southerly thick with fog. Thermometer 60 degrees. Went to State Election at the Town house in Gouldsboro.
The wind moderate Southerly and moderate rain all day. Thermometer 57 degrees. Work most all day at home on troll.
The wind Easterly and a very fresh breeze and tremendious rain all day at night wind went down Thermometer 55 degrees
The wind Southerly. Thermometer at 6 AM 54° Commenced making a wheel Schr Ella.
The wind South. rough weather for fishing Thermometer 49 degrees
The wind North West in forenoon and Calm in afternoon Went outfishing Thermometer 60 degrees.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 71 degrees
Wind Southerly Thermometer 50 degrees very fresh breeze and overcast. Work all day on wheel for Capt Sherman Spurling for the Schr Ella heavy shower at night
Wind South West finished making vessels wheel at noon. and in the afternoon went to West bay to cary the wheel. Thermometer 67°
Wind North West and a very fresh breeze to much wind to go fishing Thermometer 55 degrees
Wind North West and very fresh breeze Went out fishing in dora from home making the fishing business my general employment. Thermometer 45 degrees.
Wind North West in the morning got 2 bushels of herring for bait in my net. Went out fishing Wind South South West in afternoon. and the Thermometer 31° in morning very heavy frost
Wind Southerly and thermometer 75 degrees did not go a fishing for the want of bait washed out fish for my self Reed letter from R H Bickford wrote one to Clarance Hane & Geo Warren.
Moderate Southerly wind all day day thick with fog in the forenoon and clear in the afternoon
Wind Southerly and thick with fog and drizzling rain all day Got new shoes on horse Thermometer 52°
Wind South Easterly and rain all day turned table legs for Reuben Rand Thermometer 50 degrees
Wind Southerly and clear Thermometer 74 got no bait in nets and. did not go a fishing Work most all day on wagon wheel for my self. A man hired to dig potatoes.
The wind West South West and thick with fog. Went out and set my troll at 10 Am Wind blowing a gale fog cleared came in an left my troll setting Thermometer 59°
Wind West North West fresh breeze in forenoon Made out quarterly returns for P.M. at Birch Harbor work apart of the day digging potatoes at 3 P.M Thermometer 62°
Wind Southerly and heavy frost Thermometer 34 in morning Went out fishing got a little. more than one tub of fish. Heavy frost at night.
Wind Southerly and pleasant all day Thermometer 72 degrees at noon.
The wind South South West blowing heavy and big sea running could not get out fishing and worked about home. Thermometer 47 degrees at sunset.
The wind Southerly & heavy sea running Went out to pick my troll and found it parted at both Ends and could not get it. Thermometer 61 degrees
Wind South West. Went out early in the morning and swept for my troll untill past noon could not get it Thermometer at 3 P.M. 59 degrees
The wind North West and a heavy breeze Went down and tool up my net torn badly Worked a while in the afternoon turning for R Rand Thermometer 32
Wind Northerly in morning went out fishing and swept for the lost troll got it in the afternoon Winf South west. Thermometer 61 degrees,
Wind South west. fresh breeze Went out a fishing Thermometer at sunset 49 degrees
Wind South Easterly and overcast all day Thermometer 58°
Wind South West thick. and blowy. Went out fishing Thermometer 59 degrees

Wind Southerly and thick with fog Wrote letter to J. H. Smallidge Boston. Thermometer. 49 degrees Went. Cherryfield to the Narraguagus Lodge Masonic With Reuben Hammond. late in the aftenoon wind North West rain squalls evening cleared of Came home in night.
Wind North West and fresh breeze Thermometer in morning 33 degrees and at noon 60 degrees work about home on fish

Wind North West. Thermometer at sun rise 31 degrees. and at noon. 54 degrees. In afternoon wrote deed for E. A. Baker and one for H L Norwood In evening started for Ellsworth Went as for West Gouldsboro

Calm in morning left West Gouldsboro at 6 A.M for Ellsworth to see if the Court of Insolvency had discharged me from my debts. the 16th of June Came home in thr afternoon. Wind Southerly and the Thermometer 59 degrees.
Wind North in the morning Went out fishing with Barney Foss. got one tub of large hake to my part wind southerly in afternoon Thermometer 54 degrees Reed letter from W. F. Vase.
Wind Southerly and overcast with fog and clouds In the evening went to a Prayer meeting at the Hall Thermometer. 62 degrees high
Wind Westerly. and a very fresh breeze with Thermometer 37 degrees at noon Washed out some fish for myself.
Wind Westerly and fresh breeze with the Thermometer 38 degrees worked on my troll in forenoon and in the afternoon. Made window frame for the fishouse that Geo Gerrish fixing to move in
Wind Northerly in morning Thermometer 31° heavy frost. Went out fishing Wind Southerly in afternoon Thermometer 50 degrees
Wind South fresh breeze and cloudy Went out fishing. Thermometer at dark when I got home 49 degrees. Reed letter from Henry Handy
The wind South East Thermometer 54 degrees Wrote letter to Henry Handy at night Commenced raining and blowing very heavy and at 10 PM. rain fell in torrents with a gale of wind.
Wind South South West Thermometer 50 degrees and a very heavy rain in the forenoon cleared up in the afternoon. very heavy sea on the shore
Wind hauled from S.W.to N.West with rain squalls. Thermometer. 44° at noon.
Wind North West heavy blow. Thermometer 41° hauled to bank the house In afternoon Went to the Marsh acknowledged Administrator deed for Daniel Deasy.
Wind North in morning Thermometer 47 degrees In afternoon wind S. East finished digging my potatoes Geo Gerrish moved in the fish house
The wind Southerly in morning and rainy. and hauled around North West and cleared of. Thermometer at noon 39 degrees. Work in the afternoon on N. A. Bickford Clapboarding front end of his house.
The wind North West Thermometer 33 Registered letter for R.H. Bickford to Geo M Warren. $25 Enclosed
The wind North North West Thermometer in morning 31° Started out fishing went as far as Spectacle Island got no bait and came home.
The wind South South East Thermometer 51 degrees In forenoon diped of oil to ship. and in the afternoon Went to Prospect to Sell my horse. E. A. Baker moves his store
The wind South East. very fresh breeze and a tremendious rain Thermometer 45 degrees Cleared of at night with a gale of wind North.
The wind Westerly. Thermometer 59 degrees work about home.
The wind North West Thermometer 65 degrees. Hauled up 10 loads of Rockweed and went to Presidential Election. Garfield Candidate. Republican and Hancock Democratic Candidate

Wind Northerly in morning Southerly in afternoon Thermometer 52 degrees at noon Wrote two deed for Sewall Hancock put a cask of oil on board the Schr A. G. Brooks. Subscribed for the N.Y.Sun weekly for three months.
The wind Southerly and very moderate all day Thermometer 61 at noon. Went to So. Gouldsboro and worked all day for Charles L Bunker on shed back at night. Reed letter from Geo M. Warren

The wind South Easterly and Thermometer 40 degrees Went to South Gouldsboro and worked all day on house for Leonard Bunker. Jointing in windows doors &c came home in evening very heavy rain all the afternoon
Wind Southerly and rainy all day. Thermometer 52 degrees Went to Prospect to take up note from my wife
Wind Southerly and heavy rain all forenoon at noon cleared up and the sun same out hight

Wind South West fresh breeze. Commenced putting fore foot on the Black Warrior work untill noon left on account of tide Thermometer 40 In the afternoon worked in J. F. Kingsleys Ice house heaving over saw dust.
Wind North West. Work in forenoon on black Warrior and finished the fore foot. Thermometer 60° work in the afternoon for Edmund Grover laying floor in barn
The wind North West and a very fresh breeze in afternoon wind moderate went out fishing on Schr head ground. back in the evening Thermometer 50
The wind Easterly and overcast Went on Martins ground fishing alone. Wind increased to a moderate gale. got home in afternoon Thermometer 48°
Wind Westerly and quite moderate in the afternoon wind came of with rain squalls. Thermometer 42° Salted fish caught yesterday. and getting ready for other work.
The wind North West. and a very fresh breze at 8 oclock A.M the Thermometer 33 degrees. Work about home all day making soap. Reed the first copy of the New York Weekly sun.
The wind North West and a very smart blow with clear weather. Thermometer 28 degrees high when the sun rose.

Wind Easterly Thermometer in morning at 6 oclock 28° Went to So. Gouldsboro & worked for Leonard Bunker Clapboarding At. 9. Am it commenced snowing and snowed all day hard. The first snow for the season. Came home at night

The wind Southerly and rainy in morning and about three inches of snow on the ground at 9 Am cleared up wind West. snow melt fast Thermometer 47 degrees. Work in afternoon for J. A. Stevens on the house of Ida Spofford
Calm in forenoon with Thermometer 47 degrees. Worked in afternoon on Schr Agnes Balch repairing on making cleats.
The wind Southerly and Thermometer 40 degrees Went to Birch Harbor after a buck sheep for J F Kingsley Work apart of the day for Thomas Bickford on house claploarding
Wind North West very fresh breeze Thermometer in morning 28 degrees. Work apart of the forenoon for Thomas Bickford in afternoon took fish out of bults ready to ship
location: Winter Harbor, Birch Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Easterly moderate Thermometer 26 degrees at sunrise. Wind increased to a gale with rain in the afternoon put my fish on board of the Ida C Spofford to ship by Capt James A. Stevens
The wind West North West and blowing a perfect gale. The Thermometer. at sunset 27 degrees above zero.
The wind West North West Thermometer in morning 22 degrees above zero. Wrote letter to Stephen Southard the wind blowing a gale.
The wind West North West and blowing a gale Thermometer 12 degrees above zero in morning cut wood at the door
Wind West North West Thermometer 18 degrees above in morning. had wagon wheel tire set in forenoon and in the afternoon work for J. D. Harrington on barn Wrote letter to A P Wiswell
local_place: Home, Shop, J. D. Harrington's, Home

journal_entry: Wind North West Thanksgiving day Thermometer 12 above Wrote letter to Dr Porter worked a while in afternoon for J D Harrington.
The wind moderate North but the Thermometer in the morning 10 degrees above 0 Went to Prospect in afternoon
A very light air of wind from the North with the Thermometer 4 degrees below zero. Work all day for J. D. Harrington on barn at noon Thermometer 32 degrees above zero Wind West Southerly.
The wind moderate South Thermometer 20 above

Calm nearly all day at night Wind North West Thermometer 32 degrees in the shade. Work in forenoon for J.D. Harrington on barn. in afternoon on freight house on Steam boat wharf repairing Reed letter from W. F. Vose.
local_place: Home, J. D. Harrington's, Freight House, Home

journal_entry: Wind North West blowing heavy. Thermometer 12 above Wrote letter to W. F. Vose. Went to West Gouldsboro after J. F. Kingsleys horse cart.
Wind Easterly Thermometer 18° above commenced snowing in morning and snowed all day. hauled wood and Rockweed all day for my self on whole not snow enough to be of any use.

The wind North West and fresh breeze. Thermometer 12 degrees above zero. Work about home all day putting things in their proper places and getting reasy for winter Reed several Circulars from different advertisers
The wind North West blowing fresh Thermometer 32 in shade at noon above zero. Wrote letter to Wm B. Viall hauled wood and cut it at the door.
