The wind North West and the Thermometer 22 degrees. Went to West Gouldsboro and West-Bay. and Prospect and sold my horse to W. F. Vose. to be delivered monday. Reed Post Office checks for carying mail Route 365
The wind Easterly and at night snow and rain Thermometer 32 degrees
Wind westerly Thermometer 30 Sent horse to W. F. Vose. at Prospect Harbor work about home. all day
The wind Northerly in fore noon and hight snow afternoon wind North West Thermometer. 27 degrees work all day getting ready to go with Thomas Smallidge herringing

Wind North West and the Thermometer 16 degrees above 0 In the morning went on board of the A.G.Brooks and went out for Red beach with a load of staves. at sun Sunset wind N.N.East went into Crows Island at dark.
Wind North and snowing in the morning Thermometer 4° above got underway in the morning and got to Lubec Narrows just before sunset. fresh breeze in the morning but moderate at night

Wind Easterly and North East got underway at Lubec in the morning with a very fresh breeze and turned the tide through the narrows and double reefed the vessel and anchored at Red beach sunset commenced onloading at dark

Wind very light Northerly In morning Thermometer at zero at noon Thermometer 28. Finished taking out all the staves that are to come at Red beach and hauled of from the wharf inn the Evening and anchored

Very light wind North North West got underway at Red beach at day light for Eastport. Thermometer 18 degrees above zero twenty thousand of staves to be landed at Eastport before taking in herring wrote letter home
The wind Southerly and Thermometer 34 degrees hauled the vessel on the beach to paint after painting a while it commenced raining and gave up painting.

Wind Westerly Thermometer 34 degrees. Work all day on vessel painting. finished painting vessels bottom and hauled of to an anchor with the intention of hauling in tomorrow and discharge stave & take in ballast

The wind East heavy blow could not haul into the wharf to finish discharging cargo of staves on account of an approaching storm got underway and went to broad cove for a harbor Thermometer 37. heavy rain P.M.
The wind North West Thermometer 34 degrees high got underway at broad cove and went homed to Eastport Took out all the staves on board and took in ballast from the Schr Reght Bowes Wrote letter home.
The wind North West Thermometer 22° above work in vessel hold all day. built one bulk head and filled in with saw dust by fore port the house. stowed ballast away. and commenced to ceal hold
The wind North north West Thermometer 24 degrees build one bulk head & and cealed the after hold getting ready for a load of herring. And painted the out side of the waist.
The wind North and Snowing Thermometer 34 lay at anchor at Eastport Wrote letter home.
The wind North and Thermometer 32 degrees built forward bulk head and sheathed the fore hold and now we are all ready to load with herring. Reed letter from home.
The wind North by East Thermometer 26 degrees above got under way at Eastport for St Andrews at noon Sent letter home. Arrived at St Andrews at 4 P.M.
The wind North and Thermometer 30 degrees above bot cold enough to freeze herring Wrote letter to Charley Kingsley.
The wind Northerly Thermometer 34 degrees not cold enough to freeze herring lay all day at St. Andrews work apart of the day on the vessel.

The wind moderate Northerly Thermometer standing all day at about 32 degrees above zero consequently we cannot load with frozen herring. Hoisted the vessels boat in on deck and worked all day repairing her.
The wind North East Christmas day Thermometer 33 degrees plenty of herring but to warm to take them. Sent a letter home. COmmenced making a fife rail Schr A. G. Brooks
The wind North Easterly Thermometer 30 degrees overcast all day and look like Stormy Wrote letter home
North East fresh breeze Thermometer 30 degrees high all day and thick with snow. work apart of the day in hold on fife rail
Wind West and fresh breeze Snow in morning Thermometer 20 degrees above. Work in vessels hold most all day.
Wind North North East and snowed all day with out stoping and Thermometer 17 above zero Commenced taking in load of herring and took 167,100
The wind West North West very heavy blow Thermometer 8 degrees above zero. took in 27,200 herring finished the fife rail on board A.G. Brooks
The wind W.N.W Thermometer at zero. Am on board the the Schr A.G. Brooks with Capt Thomas Smallidge lying St. Andrews with frozen herring for Boston. took in to day 37,500 Wrote letters home

The wind West North West. and the thermometer 10 degrees above zero. On board the Schr A.G. Brooks with Capt Thomas Smallidge lying at St. Andrews N. B and loading with frozen herring for Boston. Took in 30000 in morning which finished the load Gor underway 9.30 am got to Eastport at noon set the Supercargo a shore and filled water and went out. at dark flood tide made and anchored in little River

At one oclock in the morning went out of Little River with the wind very moderate North West and the Thermometer at 12 above at daylight abreast of Moosepeak. all the forenoon very moderate calm Got abreast of Schoodic Island frost after dark and took the wind from the West and anchored in Winter Harbor at 9 PM
location: Little River, Moosepeak, Schoodic Island, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: At one oclock in the morning went out of Little River with the wind very moderate North West and the Thermometer at 12 above at daylight abreast of Moosepeak. all the forenoon very moderate calm Got abreast of Schoodic Island frost after dark and took the wind from the West and anchored in Winter Harbor at 9 PM

The wind Northerly and the Thermometer 8 degrees above zero. Got underway at N. E. Harbor at day light and went through the Western way. at noon very moderate. At 3 Pm becalmed near the Sugar Loves. and anchored for one half hour when the wind breezed up from the Eastward very moderate. Got underway and anchored in Owls head Harbor at dark. In the evening commenced snowing and at midnight is snowing hard.
location: North East Harbor, Owls Head Harbor

journal_entry: Snowing hard at 3 oclock in the morning. Wind about North, and at day light clear weather Got underway at Owls Head early in the morning. Thermometer at 30 degrees above zero. At 12 am went through Davis Straits. At dark wind N. E. and passed Seguin the weather looked threatening after running several miles passed Seguin hauled up for Portland and at midnight passed Portland head light bound in weather looking very bad.

Anchored at 1 oclock am Wind North East and at 4 oclock in the morning is was snowing very hard and snowed until noon we lay to an anchor in Portland Rodes. In afternoon drizzling rain Thermometer 32 above zero.

Calm in the morning & at 8.30 oclock A.M. the wind breezed up from the Westward. Got under way passed Cape Elizabeth at 10 stood in shore and when stood of shore we single reefed at 4 P.M passed Cape Porpoise at 4 Boon Island at 11.30 PM passed Thatches Island the wind hauling from the North West and growing cold the vessel under two reefs at midnight shook one reef out the foresail and bound toward Boston Thermometer 10 above
location: Cape Elizabeth, Cape Porpoise, Boon Island, Thatches Island

journal_entry: The wind continue to blow from the North West and at 5 oclock in the morning anchored above Long Island in Boston Harbor. and after Sunrise took a tug boat and towed to Commercial Wharf and took out 32 baskets of herring The Thermometer in the Sun at noon 40 above zero. and at night went down 15 20 above
The wind baffling from North to Easterly and apart of the time over cast at 9PM it was snowing moderately. Thermometer 22 degrees above. Lying at Commercial Wharf ready to discharge herring
The wind Easterly & heavy rain all day raining from early in the morning until in the evening. could not take out any herring Thermometer 32 degrees above zero
The wind Northerly and wind moderate and the Thermometer 24 high in the forenoon took out 16,000 herring during the day.
Wind Northerly and the Thermometer 22 degrees in the morning and went up to 29. took out 20,000 of herring out of the A. G. Brooks.
The wind South West. Thermometer 33 degrees high in the shade Took out of the vessel 17,300 herrings Made top for the vessels pump

The wind Southerly Thermometer 36 degrees high and over cast took out 12,000 herring In the afternoon rainy put hatches on. made pump brake at 8 oclock in the Evening wind came of North West and Thermometer fell to freezing.

The wind North west Thermometer 11 degrees above zero in the morning Took out of the Schr A. G. Brooks 21,500 herring in the forenoon. In the afternoon done nothing towards discharging and lying along. side of Commercial Wharf Boston.

The wind Southerly and moderate Thermometer in the morning being 20 degrees above zero Wrote letter home and to Chicago Lying at Commercial wharf Boston Went to the Seamen's Bethel Hanover street in the evening
Wind moderate N. W. Thermometer 35 degrees at noon Took out of the Schr AGBrooks 17,400 of herring. In the evening to a Gospel Temperance meeting at the Seamen's Bethel on Hanover Street
Wind Westerly thermometer 27 Took 15,900 herring out of the Brooks Put fashion piece on Port side of vessel
The wind South West Thermometer 32 at 10 oclock in the forenoon got all out the fore hold and commenced snowing cleared up at night got out 14,900 herring
The wind N.W. by W. Thermometer 22 and clear Took out 5,600 herring put check on A.G.Brooks.

The wind Easterly and overcast Thermometer 30 degrees Took 20,500 herring out the vessel At noon commenced snowing and put the hatches on no more herring to come out for the day. at night the wind increased to a very heavy gale
The wind hauled around from North to West. Took 14,800 herring out of the vessel in forenoon. In the evening went to a Temperance meeting at the North End mission Thermometer 31 above zero.
The wind North West Thermometer 24 above zero at night colder Went to Religious meeting at Tremont Temple on Tremont Street
Wind North Westerly Thermometer 12 degrees above zero Took out 20,000 herring
The wind Westerly Thermometer 27 above zero. Took out of the Schr A.G. Brooks 25,600 herring

The wind West Thermometer 32 degrees above zero at Commercial Wharf Took out 33,000 herring out of the vessel which finished the discharging it being all that was left in yesterday. Towed to the Elevator in East Boston at dark to take in some corn to be landed at Winter Harbor.

Took in 500 bushels of corn in the forenoon and went out for home The wind from the N. W. blowing heavy. after getting clear from Boston Harbor Two reefed mainsail and foresail and went into Gloucester at 1 P.M. blowing very heavy Thermometer. 15 above 0 anchored in outer part of Harbor

The wind North West and blowing a perfect gale with the Thermometer at zero at Sunrise Made no attempt to get underway Layed at anchor all day in Gloucester vessels came in with broken booms and leed very badly.
The wind still blowing a heavy gale from the North West while the Thermometer at day light was only 4 degrees above zero Layed at anchor allday in Gloucester Harbor
The wind Northerly & moderate and snowy no chance to get East Thermometer 20 degrees above zero Just before noon weighed anchor and dropped of farther in the Harbor.

The wind North W. by W.Thermometer 12 degrees above in morning at 8 A.M. Got under way and went out and went inside of Thatcher Island to Silvages Wind blowing very heavy. and rough vessel staid  wore ship and reefed down and went back to Gloucester at night more moderate.
The wind North Thermometer 20 degrees at 10 oclock A.M. Went out and got as far as Silvages The wind inclined Easterly and rough tacked ship and went back into the Harbor of Gloucester.
The wind North North West And a very fresh breeze Thermometer 4 degrees below  zero. and Ice making over the Harbor  layed all day at anchor without making any attempts to get under way
The wind about North North West Thermometer gone up to 10 above zero, fresh breeze and Easterly rote all day
The wind North West and although the Thermometer was only about 20 degrees above we did not make any effort to get under way. as it is reported the Wind was about North North East & very rough.
The wind Northerly & moderate and snowy no chance to get East Thermometer 20 degrees above zero Just before noon weighed anchor and dropped off farther in the Harbor.
location: Gloucester, Thacher Island, Isles of Shoals, Portsmouth

journal_entry: The wind North East Got under way in Portsmouth Schr A. G. Brooks for home. Got out by the Whales back and found it very rough gave it up and went back into Portsmouth Sun out clean and Thermometer. 35, degrees above zero in the shade.

The wind N.N. West. and moderate. Got underway at day light. rough outside  Got abreast of York. at 10. A.M. and got becalmed. At two oclock the wind breezed up from South West very moderate and hauled westerly and Northerly at midnight nearby abreast Wood Island and becalmed. So ends these 24 hours.

Calm or nearly so until abreast 3 oclock in the afternoon when the wind breezed up South West The Thermometer 45 degrees above in the Shade. Passed Seguin outside at 5 P.M. Passed Monhegan at 8 PM the wind breezed up Passed Owls head at 11.30 P.M. and run for the Northern Head of Fox Island the sky overcast and look like a storm.
location: Seguin Island, Monhegan Island, Owls Head, Fox Islands

journal_entry: Thermometer midnight Anchored at Northern head of Fox Islands at 2 am at daylight got underway for home Wind South West good breeze, and overcast with a little drizzling rain Running through merchants row ran into thick ice and vessel stopped. Lowered boat took her under the bom and out the through ice more than one foot thick worked three hours and got  through it with the help of a smart breeze of wind. Went through Long Island head and got home at 4 oclock in the afternoon more maunatu
The wind Southerly commenced taking the corn out of the A.G. Brooks. that was put on board in Boston
The wind West North West Thermometer 39 degrees at noon in the shade. Finished taking the corn of the Schooner A.G. Brooks.
The wind East South East commenced making flying jib boom for Schr Lebanon. at 11 commenced snowing and raining went home Thermometer 32 degrees
The wind from South East to West rainy in forenoon and snow in afternoon Thermometer from 35 in forenoon down to 22 at night
The wind West North West Thermometer 24 degrees Wrote deed from Enoch Newman to Rufus H and Alexander Bickford
Wind Westerly Thermometer 29 above Finished the flying jibboom for the Schr Lebanon.
The wind East South East. Commenced snowing at 9 A.M. and snowed hard until dark at night wind came from North West Work apart of the day in J F Kingsleys shop turning for myself.
The wind North West Thermometer 20 above Work in the afternoon cutting firewood
The wind Southerly Thermometer 28 above zero. Work about home
The wind Northerly Thermometer 32 degrees At home weighing hay for J. H. Kingsley & JennieTracy.
The wind very moderate Northerly Thermometer at noon. 37 degrees

The wind Easterly thermometer at noon 18 degrees above zero. Sent to the Town Clerk to get Mr Joseph Smallidge and Annie hammond Published, aslo in this Town and Town of Deer Isle Daniel McNeal of Gouldsboro and mifs Maria Tracy  Worked apart of the day for H E Tracy on Schr Lebanon
letter_to: Town Clerk of Gouldsboro, Town Clerk of Deer Isle

journal_entry: The wind Westerly Thermometer 35 above Work all day on fore boom for Schr Lebanon. The Sleighing and sleding to day good as can be.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 40 above Worked in forenoon for H.E. Tracy and finished making fore boom In afternoon went on the head of home lot looking after fire wood at dark commenced raining.
The wind North West and blowing a very heavy gale all day with thermometer down to zero To cold to work out
The wind North West and wind very moderate but Thermometer down to zero in the morning and at noon went up to 15 above hauled wood all the afternoon
The wind North West Thermometer 10 above Went to West Gouldsboro accompanied by wife and child visiting and to see about taxes. Stayed all night
The wind Southerly Thermometer 35 degrees above at noon. Went home from West Gouldsboro in afternoon with A Bickford horse

The wind South by East Thermometer 35 degree about 9 AM commenced to rain, and rained the remainder of the day, and very late in the night. Reed the certificates of Joseph Smallidge and Daniel MC Neal from Clerk of this town

The wind East and Thermometer 34 degrees Rained very heavy all day with a fresh breeze Reed the certificate of Daniel MC Neal from the town of Deer Isle. of the Intention of Marriage. Turned caulking mallet for Herbert Tracy
The wind North East Thermometer 33 degrees above zero; Painted decoys for Thomas Bickford in the forenoon and commenced connecting two Bedrooms at home by putting a door between. Rainy
The wind Easterly. Thermometer 34 1/2 Went to Capt Nathan Bickfords visiting with my wife & child Snow and rain moderate all day Mary Jane Hammonds baby died at 11 P.M.
The wind Easterly Thermometer 32 degrees snow squalls all day accompanied by rain cased outdoor cat home.
The wind Southerly and rough Thermometer 30 degrees above. The first Time shiny day since last Monday.
The wind North NorthEast and pleasant Thermometer 32 degrees above zero
The wind North Thermometer 43 degrees Started for Town Meeting. Went home and went to putting up fence.
The wind Southerly Thermometer 42 degrees above zero at noon Worked 3/4 day for J F kingsley cutting Ice He commenced to day to cut ice

The wind South East Thermometer 37 degrees Worked in the forenoon for J. F Kingsley cutting Ice. At noon was notified that I was chosen a Constable at the annual Town Meeting held last monday. of which i was absent. In the afternoon work for Herbert Tracy putting in piece of wace in his vessel the Lebanon

The wind Easterly Thermometer 40 above Went on board of the Lebanon to work in the morning. at 9 AM it commenced raining and rained the remainder of the day. Was sworn as Constable by N. Hammond Justice of the Peace and sent the return to S.W. Libby Clerk of the Town of Gouldsboro.
The wind Easterly and rainy all day Thermometer 38 degrees work in the house fixing it up

The wind North East Thermometer 33 degrees Snow squalls until 10 am and cleared up Had a small amount of plastering done in a bedroom in the forenoon and in the afternoon put Stem post in yawl boat of the Lebanon.
The wind moderate Northerly and squally overcast half of the day Thermometer 40
The wind Easterly Thermometer 32 degrees snow squalls all day accompanied by rain chased outdoor cat home.
location: Winter Harbor, South Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind North East in forenoon and Southerly in afternoon Mixed paint and painted the bedroom
The wind South East Thermometer 33 degrees Work in the forenoon for H E Tracy. In the afternoon weighed hay for Jennie Tracy
The wind Easterly Thermometer 38 degrees Wrote bill of sale of Barney Fross Boat to G Winslow Jones & Co.

The wind Southerly and very moderate Thermometer 40 Work apart of the forenoon for H E Tracy on vessel Went to District Meeting in afternoon I was elected Clerk and adjourned until monday. evening at 7 oclock.
The wind Easterly Thermometer 38 degrees Weighed hay for Jennie Tracy and worked on my dora
The wind East South East Thermometer 35 degrees rain and hailstorm all day. Ira B. Tioso baptised in afternoon by Mr A .T. Palmer

The wind Southerly and rained early in the morning The wind hauled around South West and cleared of Thermometer 40 degrees Work all day papering bedroom. Went to District meeting in evening A. T. Palmer Chose School Agent.
The wind Southerly thermometer 42 degrees Work in the forenoon for Capt N.A. Bickford and in the afternoon on my dora Acknowledged deed for Hannah M Newman
Wind North West Thermometer 40 at noon Painted outside of dora in forenoon
Wind North West Thermometer 42 above made centre box for my dora sold and weighed hay for Chas Smith
The wind West North West Thermometer 45 degrees mailed nailed centre board box in dora and caulked it made thorts and painted the inside of dora
The wind West North West thermometer 46 at noon Work about home all day. Married in evening Mr Joseph L. Smallidge & Annie A. Hammond both of Gouldsboro
The wind West North West Thermometer 28 in morning and went up to 34 in afternoon
The wind West North West Thermometer 35 degrees Work about home made centre board for my dora
Wind Westerly thermometer 41 degrees Took some straw matting and stove out the Hotel

The wind Easterly & clear Thermometer 45 above 0 Went to the Lower Harbor and filled out the application of Prize money for Clarinda H crane Whose late husband Lemuel G Crane commander of the W. S. Steamer Uncar during the Rebellion
location: Winter Harbor, Lower Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind East North East blowing and snowing all day thermometer 32 degrees Put straw matting down on bedroom floor at home. Was appointed highway surveyor by the Selectmen for this district

The wind very moderate Northerly in morning thick with snow. Went on the road and shoveled snow in forenoon wind hauled around Westerly Thermometer 46 taped a pair of boots for myself and worked on dora in afternoon for Geo. Pendleton Signed the quarterly returns for the Birch Harbor Postmaster.

The wind West North West fresh breeze Thermometer at noon 38 degrees work in the forenoon for Geo. Pendleton and finished his dora Thermometer at dark 26 degrees In the evening Married Mr Daniel Mc Neal of Gouldsboro and mifs Maria Tracy of Deer Isle.
The wind West North West Thermometer 35 degrees.. at noon at freezing
The wind Westerly fresh breeze Thermometer in morning 22 degrees at noon warmer. Work most all day on a gun stock for Llewellyn Pendleton
Wind west North West Thermometer 40 degrees at noon Work in forenoon making a derick for the Schr A. G. Brooks. and in the afternoon worked on the Brooks repairing
The wind Westerly Thermometer 32 degrees commenced work in afternoon making fore gaft for the Schr Nevada
Wind North West. Thermometer 42 degrees Finished making gaft for the Nevada in forenoon. Took the oath as highway surveyor of highways. Lizzi Bunker sells Crow Island to E.A. Baker.
The wind Westerly Thermometer 30 work in forenoon finished painting my dora
The wind South West Thermometer 60 degrees finished the gun stock and launched my dora
The wind South East and pleasant. thermometer 57 degrees
The wind Southerly Thermometer 38 degrees Jarred trall ganging Catecued herring net Wrote petition for EA Baker. to the Select Men
The wind North West in forenoon and South West in afternoon. Work all day on the Schr Ida G. Spafford for Capt James A. Stevens
Calm in morning then the wind breezed up South East . Thermometer 41 Work all day about home on trall
The wind North East light snow in the morning then turned to drizzling rain Roped dora sail and getting ready to go fishing
The wind North East. and a perfect gale of wind with snow hail and rain all day. at night the snow not more than three inches deep and raining hard thermometer 32 degrees made net buoys

The wind Easterly & clear Thermometer 45 above 0 Went to the Lower Harbor and filled out the application of Prize mooney for Clarinda H crane Whose late husband Lemuel G Crane commanander of the W. S. Steamer Uncar during the Rebellion
The wind North West and very pleasant Thermometer 50 degrees Stephen Torrey died at 5 oclock in the morning
The wind North West Thermometer 50 degrees hauled wood from Baker & Smiths store for myself
The wind North west Thermometer 39 degrees bailed trall ready to go fishing tomorrow Stephan Torrey buried in afternoon a prayer at the house by A.T. Palmer

The wind Northerly in morning went out fishing for the first time for the season got 9 wind Southerly at noon came home. Thermometer 35 degrees Jennie Hammond buried in afternoon Services at the house by A T Palmer

The wind Southerly in morning and the Thermometer below freezing Went to the Lower Harbor clamming for bait. The wind came North West and blew fresh put sail on dora and beat home in afternoon the Thermometer 50 above Caused Repairs in Cross way in light ways

Calm in morning went out fishing picked the troll twice got 14 fish at noon the wind breezed up South west and came home. Wrote Notice for District meeting in district No. 12 which is at the Lower Harbor Thermometer 37.

The wind Southerly in morning and the Thermometer below freezing Went to the Lower Harbor clamming for bait. The wind came North West and blew fresh put sail on dora and beat home in afternoon the Thermometer 50 above Caused Repairs in Cross way in ligh ways
The wind Southerly Thermometer 41 degrees in forenoon Late in the afternoon wind Westerly and very pleasant and the Thermometer 50.

The wind North west and pleasant with Thermometer 65 degrees at noon Finished labor on one dora for Mr Petlee of Brooklin and commenced on an other one for his son Filled application for Baker & Smith to carry on business in manufacture tobacco. Acknowledged Bill of Sale for A. J. Gerrish Wrote lease from Isaac P Joy to Amasink Southard recd check from the P.O. Department to Carry mail on route 365
The wind Southerly work all day on dora Thermometer 60
The wind Easterly Thermometer 49 at noon Went to Bunkers Harbor and bought a set of Chira dishes for Annie Smallidge of Mrs Emma Emerson work on dora in afternoon
location: Winter Harbor, Bunkers Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: The wind Southerly Thermometer 61 degrees at noon Got Ira B. Foss & A. J. Gerrish to sign my bond as constable Wm Handys note was taken up amount of $ 50 and int

The wind South East and rainy. Wrote deed for Abbie L Harrington to Mrs D. M. Summer thermometer 38 Left sum noons for Simon J. Andrews to appear at a justice Court and answer to Curtis Stevens of Castine
The wind North West Thermometer 50 work on doras
The wind Southerly Thermometer 49 not well all day
Wind South South East and forenoon rainy thermometer 37 degrees not well unable to work.
The wind North West Thermometer 65 degrees Annie Smallidge moved in one part of the house

The wind North west and pleasant with Thermometer 65 degrees at noon Finished labor on one dora for Mr Petlee of Brooklin and commenced on another one for his son Filled application for Baker & Smith to carry on business in manufature tobacco. Acknowledged Bill of Sale for A. J. Gerrish Wrote lease from Isaac P Joy to Amasink Southard recd check from the P.O. Department to Carry mail on route 365
location: Winter Harbor, Prospect Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: Wind Westerly and Thermometer 65 degrees above zero Work about home doing various kinds of work
Wind South East Thermometer 33 moved Geo. Gerrish from the fish house to the one recently bought by Mark Joy. In afternoon made made sink for room occupied by Joseph & Annie Smallidge
Wind Southerly thermometer 42 degrees work apart of the day setting up sink & building meal chest Helped J.F. Kingsley mark his lambs & c
Wind South South East Thermometer 52 degrees pleasant
The wind South Easterly and showery. build fence out of barb wire to step up E.A. Bakers cattle Thermometer 41 degrees
The wind Southerly Thermometer 49 degrees Sawed out wheelbarrow side for myself
The wind South Easterly fogg and rainy apart of the day.
The wind South East made wheel for Isaacs Joys wheelbarrow in forenoon and in the afternoon work for E.A. Baker laying floor in his store Thermometer 52
Wind moderate Southerly made head for a wheelbarrow for my self Thermometer 58

The wind Northerly in forenoon Went out fishing and found my hall parted and the most of it lost. Took up the moorings and one end of trace swept for the rest but could not find it. Wind South west in afternoon came home. Mr Timothy Damton buried in afternoon Thermometer 60 degrees brought potatoes out of the cellar to pick over
The wind South East Thermometer 60 degrees overcast
Wind North East and afternoon rainy Thermometer 55 degrees work about home all day fresh breeze
Wind East and blowing a gale with a tremendous heavy rain all day without ceasing Thermometer 50 degrees Commenced rigging trall in place one I lost.
The wind East North East Thermometer 45 rainy all day fresh breeze Finished rigging my troll.
Wind East and a gale tremendous rain all day. Thermometer 40 Work apart of the day for Almia Bourgett Wrote Notices for Jennie Tracy warning people to take care of their cattle
Wind Easterly and heavy rain work apart of the day for myself on henpan Thermometer 39
The wind North East Thermometer 42 degrees wind moderate but the rain very heavy work all day on hen pew for myself
The wind hauled around Northward and in the afternoon sun came out very pleasant. Went to Herm Island to see E. A. Bakers weir. Thermometer 69 degrees.
very light rain Northerly went out fishing and to sweep for my lost troll but did not get it. Wind Southerly in afternoon and fogy came home but left a new troll out there to catch the lost one.
The wind South West Thermometer 49 degrees went to Bar Harbor after bait but got none. came back home in the afternoon.
location: Winter Harbor, Bar Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: Very moderate in the morning went out to my troll. The wind struck from the North East in a squall and blowed a gale cast the troll of and came home Thermometer 47 degrees.
The wind Easterly and hauled around Southerly went out fishing and got my lost troll by hauling it up on the one I was fishing with Thermometer 57 Had organ put in house
Very moderate in the morning went out to my troll. The wind struck from the North East in a squall and blowed a gale cast the troll off and came home Thermometer 47 degrees.
The wind North East in morning and hauled around Easterly Southerly and S.W. went out fishing all day. Thermometer at night 49 degrees
The wind Southerly and in the forenoon very pleasant with the Thermometer 63 In the afternoon cloudy at 4 PM commenced raining
The wind Southerly Not having any bait did not go to my troll but worked about home Thermometer 65 degrees
Wind Easterly and thick with fog. Went to my troll without any bait and took of what fish there was on it. afternoon cleared up with the Thermometer 57 degrees
Wind Easterly not having any bait did not go to my troll but worked about home
The wind South East Thermometer 67 degrees Commenced farming done all ploving Recd execution against J. L. Andrews for me to collect as Constable from the Office of Geo M Warren G. Stevens Plaintiff
The wind Easterly hauled out dressing to plant and harrowed one piece Thermometer 60
The wind North East fresh breeze and heavy rain all day. work apart of the day on wheel barrow. and examined the papers of Wm. Bunkers for carrying the mail
The wind Southerly fresh breeze but pleasant Went to So. Gouldsboro with J. F. Kingsley Thermometer 68 degrees
location: Winter Harbor, South Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: Wind North West Thermometer 59 Put centre board in boat from Capt Ephraim Alley
The wind South West work all day farming with J.F.Kingsleys horse and the help of Geo. Gerrish Finished hauling out dressing and planted corn beans & c. Thermometer 50
The Wind South Easterly and overcast and in the afternoon thick with fog and looked like rain Thermometer 47 degrees Finished planting potatoes
The wind North by East in forenoon clear and pleasant Work in forenoon on garden. In afternoon wind South East. Went out and took up my troll Thermometer 61

Wind Easterly with fresh breeze. Filled out Notices and sent them to all Taxpayers notifying them of the amount of their tax on highway & the date and place of commencing work myself being the Highway surveyor at night commenced raining Thermometer 57 degrees
The wind E. S. East and pleasant Thermometer 62 degrees bought of James A Stevens 2 Hds salt and got it a shore finished sewing garden and all farming for the spring Recd letter from J.H.West
The wind Southerly moderate and pleasant Thermometer 60
The wind Southerly and in the forenoon thick with fog. Commenced working on the Highway on new road my self surveyor. Thermometer 47

The wind Southerly and thick with fog all day Went to Franklin with Wm Sargents horse to see about going in the Sea Queen came home at night S. C. Pendleton duty sworn surveyor protem until I got ready to take charge Thermometer 64 degrees
The wind came off from the North West in the morning. and the fog left. Good fresh breeze. Worked on road all day. from foot of Mr. Newman's Hill to the Post. Office. Thermometer 58
The wind North West and fresh breeze Thermometer down to 50 degrees. Work on the roads all day. from the Post Office to Amaziah Southards
The wind South West Work about home Thermometer 59
The wind So: West Thermometer 55 Work about home Grinding tools getting ready to go to Sullivan to work on the Schr Sea Queen
The wind Southerly and showery Went to Spectacle Island after bait Thermometer 52
location: Winter Harbor, Spectacle Island, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: Calm in morning went out fishing and and in the afternoon Wind Southerly came home. At night Showery. Thermometer 56 degrees
The wind North West washed out some Cod fish headed up salt dried trolls nets & c to put away Thermometer 57 degrees
The wind North West washed out haddock and put fish on the flaker. In the afternoon went with my sister fining up the graves of our Father & Brother. Thermometer 62 degrees
Wind North West in forenoon Work in forenoon for J. H. Smallidge on front yard fence In the afternoon Wind Southerly work for my self on out building Thermometer 68
The wind North West in forenoon . Work all day for J. H. Smallidge on Schr A.G. Brooks yawl boat Wind Southerly in the afternoon. Thunder shower Thermometer 72

Calm in morning Went to W. Gouldsboro to see S. L. Tracy and in the afternoon getting ready to go to Sullivan to work on Schr Sea queen expected to go in her after she is repaired Thermometer at noon 70 degrees Wind Southerly in afternoon
location: Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: Calm in the forenoon Thermometer 72 degrees At noon the wind breezed up Southerly Started for Sullivan in my dora with tools bedding & c to go on board the Sea queen arrived at Sullivan at 3 1/2 oclock not finding the vessel walked to Franklin to see the owners and learned the vessel had not got back from her trip Then I walked back to Sullivan got there at dark and stopped through the night on board the Steamer Mt Desert

The wind Southerly & thick with fog in the morning At 8 oclock cleared up The Thermometer at A. Simpsons Jr Store in the shade was 80 At one of the clock P.M. the Schooner Sea Queen arrived and I put my things on board and stopped all night on board alone. The Capt and crew all had left.

The wind Easterly and raining until noon very hard when it's cleared up in the afternoon did not commence work on vessel as there is nothing here yet to work with. At dark the vessels knees were brought down from Franklin in a scow
The wind Easterly & heavy rain until 11 oclock in the forenoon Got the vessel under way and went into the wharf ready to work.
Nearly calm all day with a very moderate wind South West Worked all day on the vessels boat alone
Wind Westerly Commenced work on the vessel by getting the hanging knees sided out Mr Johnathan While, at work on vessel
Calm in the forenoon and Wind West South West in the afternoon Got the knees ready to put in at three oclock got in dora and started for home Landed at Hoss shore at 5 and walked home
Wind Southerly and pleasant
Celebration day Calm and very pleasant in forenoon and in the afternoon Wind southerly and some very heavy showers

moderate Westerly in forenoon Went to So. Gouldsboro accompanied by my wife and went to dora to stop on board the Sea Queen the remainder of the week while repairing arrived a little past noon work in the afternoon on the Schr Sea Queen
Wind South West work all day on vessel bolting of hanging knees
The wind South and very hot Work all day on vessel
Calm in the forenoon and very hot all day Finished fastening the hanging knees and keelson and got the main boom shaved

Calm in the forenoon and very hot but not having any Thermometer on board could not tell how hot it is. Worked all the forenoon on the vessel and in the afternoon the wind breezed up Southerly. Got in the dora with my wife and started for home. Landed in Frosses Cove and walked home arrived at Sunset.
The wind Southerly with a very fresh breeze at 4 P.M.  left home for Sullivan went to Frosses shore took the dora and arrived on board the Sea Queen at sunset in Sullivan
The wind North East and apart of the forenoon rainy Work all day on the Sea Queen very cool Alonzo Stevens commenced Caulking
Wind Southerly all day Work on Sea Queen at Simpsons wharf Sullivan
The wind South Easterly and most all day rainy but did not hinder us from working in hold
Wind North West and cleared of pleasant At work on Sea Queen healed vessel on beach to give the caulkers a chance to work
The wind North West and very fine work all day on vessels bottom

Wind Southerly & overcast Healed the vessel on this beach to clean and caulk the caulkers finished one side. At 2. P.M. vessel floated hauled along side of wharf & at three got in dora and started for home at 4. P.M. heavy rain and blow at 6PM tremendous rain with a gale of wind southerly with thunder & lightning landed at Martin Myricks at 7 Pm and walked home arrived at dark
weather_condition_pm: heavy rain, tremendious rain, thinder, lightning

journal_entry: The wind North West heavy breeze left home at 3 P.M. walked up to Martin Myricks shore got in dora and started for Sullivan strong Ebb tide & heavy North West wind arrived on board with Sea Queen at Sullivan at ten oclock P.M.
Wind North west in morning South West in afternoon Healed the vessel on beach to caulk crew came on board

Wind South west healed vessel on beach and the caulkers finished their work and vessel considered done & hauled of from the wharf ready to go to East Sullivan to load with staves for Red beach & Eastport rain squalls at sunset
Calm in the morning got underway for East Sullivan at noon the wind breezed up Southerly at 1:30 anchored at East Sullivan at 5 PM hauled into the wharf and took in 15 Staves
Wind Easterly and moderate showers Nearly finished loading with staves

Wind Northerly and showery finished loading at 8 in the forenoon at high water but not tide enough to get clear from the wharf and laid along side of the wharf until next high water at night and hauled of to an anchor.
Wind North East & overcast got under way in the morning and went in home at 10 am showery at night
Wind Southerly and showery laid in Winter Harbor
Wind Southerly and thick with fog all day filled water and getting ready to sail
The wind S.S. East and blowing heavy with heavy rain all day

Wrote notice for dis. meeting The wind Easterly and thick with fog work at home in the garden the ground very wet. Annie Smallidge moved out of the house Wrote Notice for a District Meeting by a petition of 5 words
Wind out Southerly no chance to go away in vessel Staid at home hoed corn beans & c
Very moderate all day the sun shining by spells but the fog very dense Work all the forenoon on the vessels Yawl boat and in the afternoon painted the vessels wait outside
Calm all day Fog cleared up a little while in the Harbor made lower pump box for the Sea Queen
Fog cleared up over the land but thick outside and calm Tried to get out the Harbor but could not

Wind Southerly and thick with fog underway in the morning and tried to get out but not wind enough to get by the Harbor point and anchored in Sargents cove In the afternoon wind breezed up Southerly Started again to go out got down as far as Ned Island and the fog so thick gave it up and went back and anchored in the Sand cove
location: Winter Harbor, Sargents Cove, Sand Cove

journal_entry: The wind Southerly and thick with fog Took the vessels Yawl boat in the Sand Cove and caught a Barrel of Mackerel on hook
Wind S by West and thick with all day laid at anchor in sand cove. went to district meeting in the evening as called by Notice of July 27

Wind S.S. West and thick with fog got under way at noon and went out for Red Beach at 3 in the afternoon the fog cleared up 5.40 passed Petit manan and at midnight passed Moose peak light fog shutting down very thick winds from S.W. to West so ends these 24 hours
location: Sand Cove, Petit Manan, Moose peak

journal_entry: This day begins at midnight of the 4 the thick with fog of moosepeak wind W.S.W moderate at 6 Am herd the bell on little River head at 12 oclock M anchored in West Quaddy by the sound of the whistle without seeing the light house aroundsick at 4 weighed anchor and went through Lubec Narrows and anchored at Red Beach about dark.
location: Moose peak, Little river head, West Quaddy, Lubec Narrows, Red Beach

journal_entry: Wind South West and thick with fog Hauled into the wharf in the morning and during the day took the decload most all of Thermendious thunder storm in the evening commencing at 8 oclock
The wind Southerly and overcast laid along side the wharf at Red Beach
The wind Easterly & rain all the forenoon very hard did not do anything towards discharging In the afternoon did not rain untill in the evening worked apart of the afternoon onloading

very moderate all day and most of the day overcast The wharf being blocked with staves we did not have much chance to put them out in the afternoon the staves were taken a way and we worked the best we could it being low water at night rainy

The wind moderate Southerly Finished unloading staves at 9. Am hauled of from wharf made sail for Calais got to the Devils Head at noon. Took Tug boat for Daniel Hill for Boston Send check to Eugine Simpson for $14.49 on Red Beach Plaster Co. for provisions.
Wind North West and fair weather the first plesant fair day for three weeks with off shore winds Commenced loading with lumber for Daniel Hill
Wind South West and very hot The vessels hold full at noon and waist full at night
The wind South West Laying at Hills wharf in Calais loading with lumber
The wind North West and pleasant
