NA
Wind Westerly, and pleasant. about home in Winter Harbor. The "Schr SeaQueen of which I have been in has hauled up one week.
Wind Northerly and in forenoon blustering snow storm and cold afternoon clear and cold
Wind West North West and cold. Work all day on cold Schr A. G. Brook laying deck that was begun the last day of Dec 1881. also putting in beam and watch combing.
Wind North North West and very cold. the vapor very dence. Work all day on A. G. Brooks laying deck
Wind North West the air the air very keen Thermometer in the morning at zero Work, all day on A. G. Brooks. Thermometr at night 10 degrees above zero.
Wind Northerly in morn Thermometer 3 degrees below zero, at day light. Work all day on A.G.Brooks. In afternoon wind Southerly and warm. The weather threatening a storm
Wind Easterly and snowing in the morning. wind hauling in Northerly in afternoon and cleared of warm and pleasant.
Calm all the forenoon, and pleasant Thermometer at 33° above zero In aftern wind East and cloudy and wind hauling out Southerly. at dark commenced snowing wind breezing.

Wind Southerly and rainy in morning At 9.30 cleared up, and went on board the A.G.Brooks to work. At night hauled westerly Reed by Express the patent gas burner and washing compound from Charlotte Mich Frank A  Ells and CoAgts Wrote to Town Clerk to leave Eugene B. Tracy and Florence L. Joy published
Wind North West with very fresh breeze blustering. Work all day on the Schr. A.G. Brooks Completed main deck
Wind North East work all day on A.G.Brooks. At noon it commenced snowing and snowed hard all the afternoon and Evening. Finished work on Brooks.
Wind North West. Fresh breeze Took orders for lamp burning
Wind South South East with fresh breeze. In afternoon commenced snowing. evening commenced raining. Filed saw for F. P. Gerrish. Took orders for gas burners to use in lamps
Wind NorthWest. Fresh breeze. Staid at home and filed saws.
Wind South West very fresh breeze. and fine weather In the Evening. Married Mr Eugene B. Tracy and MiSs Florence L. Joy both of Gouldsboro:
Wind Westerly and weather threatening for snow Showered snow from the high way Mended Rocking chair for Annie Smallidge
Wind North all day. Thick with snow in the forenoon, and in the afternoon it cleared up pleasant.

Wind Northerly in the morning. Vapor very dense. Thermometer 10° below zero at 8 AM. Wind hauled Easterly and Southerly. The Thermometer 18° above zero at noon Shoveled some snow in the highway Filed saws etc. In evening went to Lyceum Question Resolve that amous conscience is his true moral guide.
Calm in forenoon with rain and snow. at noon cleared up wind Northerly Hauled the Schr Egret from the head of wharf to the side
Wind Northerly in morning and South Easterly at night. Worked in the after noon for G.W. Tracy making sled rack. In the evening it commenced snowing.

Calm all day and warm. atmosphere wet and thick with fog Work in the forenoon putting up joiners bench in fishhouse to be used for a carpenters shop. and in the afternoon went on board the Grampus to see about putting on a house
Calm in the morning and rainy. In the afternoon wind of North West and commenced to grow cold

Wind NorthWest Thermometer at zero at sunrise. 6 degrees above, during the warmest part of the day and at night the Thermometer falling Set stove up in the fishhouse that I am going to use for a work. shop
The wind North Went Thermometer at 8 AM was 12 degree below zero, and gradually grew warmer the entire day yo cold to work out of door
Wind Southerly and wind moderate. Went to Franklin With Alex Bickford In the evening went to Lyceum Question Resolved the drunkard is not entitled to commom sympathy.
Wind Southerly and rainy in the forenoon SouthWest and clear in afternoon Work about the shop at home
Wind South West and warm forenoon Wrote two deeds for N.A. Bickford Afternoon Wind N.W and blowed fearfuly
Wind South East in morning Went on board the Grampus to make out schedule of the lumber for her house. In afternoon Wind South East and in the evening snowing
Wind W.N.West. with considerable light snow on the ground Sleighing. good.

Wind Westerly Thermometer about 18 above zero. Signed document for Francina Guptill to obtain pension of Charles Watson, alias Peter Verrill The being her son by adoption. He serving in the Navy and now dead
Wind South West and warm Measured the Sea Queen for a fore topmast and delivered for burners to some that has subscribed.

Wind North East fresh breeze in forenoon but pleasant Work apart of the day on boat for myself In evening went to Lyceum. Question Resolve that a murderer whether Sane or Insane shall suffer the same penalty.
Calm all day and very warm Sold lamp burner
Calm in forenoon Sent the SeaQueens top mast down to refit-rigging etc. In the afternoon work for R. Pendleton on the Lucy R. Day to stop a leak around her rudder part.
Wind moderate N.E. But Thermometer down to zero. Work apart the day in Shop.

Wind North East In the forenoon with a tremendious big snow storm wind blowing a gale and the Thermometer down to zero. In the afternoon wind hauled Northerly cleared up Thermometer 10 above zero. Snow drifting and blocking the roads
Wind North West. Fresh breeze. Work all the forenoon shoveling snow from the highway In the afternoon roads blocking again wich snow kept it clear enought so the mail could get along
Moderate all day Wind Westerly Shoveled snow all the forenoon from the highway with a big crew. In evening commenced snowing Thomas Bickford came Trespass

Wind Southerly in morning and rainy at 10 A.M. wind hauled Westerly. Went on round shoveling snow. In evening went to the Lyceum "Question" Resolve that inventions does not bennefit the condition of the laboring class
Wind Westerly and moderate all day Work in carpenters shop at various kinds of work.
Wind Easterly fresh breeze and a very heavy snow storm all day and fast blocking the roads
Wind North West. Fresh breeze. Work in forenoon. Shoveling snow
Wind South West Fresh breeze and Thermometer 40 degree in shade
Wind South West and rainy most all day snow. melting fast.
Wind South West and very warm. Work most all day in shop, at home.

Moderate Southerly and warm. Work most day getting ready for a mock trial preparing evidence etc. to be tried in evening Myself one of the Lawyers for the defendent. Emma Surgent alleges Herbert Tracy promised to mary her and sues him for a breach of promise. damage to the amount -$40,000 Verdict Guilty.
Wind Southerly warm work about home filing saws etc.
Wind South Easterly in forenoon and very heavy rain. and at noon cleared of wind North West and commenced to grow cold. Wrote Mortgage deed of Henry Sargents own to Deasy and Hauely
Wind North West and Thermometer down to zero most all day Work in shop apart of the day
Wind West North West in forenoon and at night calm and in the evening it commenced moderate snow storm.
Wind North North West Put top streak around my boat in shop
Wind North East Clear in forenoon but in the afternoon it commenced snowing and at 10 of the clock in the evening blowing a gale from the North East and still the wind increasing

Wind North East fresh breeze and thick with snow In morning at 8 oclock found the Sea Queen ashore on harbor point with her rudder broken. Also the Henry Clay ashore at the same place. Run a line across the Harbor and haul them of at high water at noon.
Wind North North East Work all the forenoon Showling snow on highway In afternoon work about home
Wind Northerly and warm. Turned hub for wheelbarrow for Capt T.R Hammond Acknowledged deed for Wm Rand.
Wind North West bleared vessels anchors and turned spokes for Wheel barrow for T R Hammond
Wind Southerly and very warm
Wind North West Work in shop In evening went to Sociable got up by Ladies aid Society
Wind Southerly Work on board the vessel getting the ice of deck etc.
Wind South South East moderate breeze and overcast weather threatening Went to the Lower Harbor after stick for topmast but got none on bring vessels rudder to repair it and took it ashore
Calm all day and a hard rain storm an immense quantity of snow melted Thermometer 40 above all day
Wind NorthWest Work all day on vessels rudder repairing it. The fields and roads almost as bare as in summer time except where it was drifted.
Wind N.N.East. and moderate rain by spells finished Sea Queens rudder and hung it
Wind Northerly and pleasant Thermometer 45°

Wind Southerly Thermometr abt 32 Moderate rain and snow all day. Went to the Town House to Town Meeting Elected Francis Taft J.R.Hammond Select men and Winslow Joy Collector S W Libby Treasurer went to town meeting with wagon Sleighing prior
Wind North East and snowy in the forenoon went in the woods after a stick for a topmast but got none.

Wind Northerly Got the SeaQueen from her moorings in the harbor and went into the dock to clean. at night cleaned one side of vessel Personally appeared before me T R Hammond and took the oath as surveyor of high ways Also surveyor of lumber wood and bark.

Calm in morning Wind SouthWest at 9 AM and growing warmer while at daylight Thermometer down to zero. Cleaned one side of the SeaQueen early while the tide was down. Wrote Notices for district meeting
Wind North Easterly Snowy all day very wet. hauled one load of hay to J F Kingsley barn for my sheep work about home
Wind Northerly in forenoon and South West in afternoon. Turned wheel spokes for vessel. Sleighing good.
Wind South West Thermometer 36 degrees above zero: at cooler and snowing
Wind North North West Got ShipStores onboard hauled from the wharf all ready to sail on board the Schr Sea Queen. Wrote deed from Lydia C. Norwood to Gilman L. Norwood
Wind Northerly and fresh breeze Made no effort to get underway but worked on vessel

Wind North North West Got underway in forenoon and went out for Calais. at noon between Schoodik and Petitmenan becalmed. In afternoon wind breezed up South West. Not liking the looks of the weather run for moose a peak reach. and as the weather looked better continued on Wind hauled N.W. and at midnight almost to West Quoddy Head. So ends these 24 hours_ _ _ __
location: Winter Harbor, Calais, Petit Manan, Moose Peak

journal_entry: Calm at 1.30 oclock tried to get into West Quoddy but the tide took us by. and at sunrise passed East Quoddy. and anchored to keep the tide from taking us ashore. a little above the light. Calm all the forenoon. In afternoon Wind breezed up SouthWest Got the anchor and at 8 P.M. anchored between. Robinston and Red Beach becalmed. overcast
location: West Quoddy, East Quoddy, Robinston, Red Beach

journal_entry: Wind very moderate N. got underway at day light and anchored above Bog Brook at 10 A.M. In afternoon went to Calais by land and back to the vessel at night. Got underway and went to Calais. alongside of Hills wharf at dark. wind North East and a very fresh breeze looking very much like snow.

Wind Easterly and hard snow storm. Took up to load with spruce boards for Boston at $2.50 per M Towed the vessel to the lumber wharf at noon in the afternoon commenced loading for J. Murche's & son snowed so hard quit work between 3 and 4. Considerable ice in the docks which bothered us considerable
Calm and a snow storm in forenoon. but in the afternoon it cleared of and was fine weather

The wind from the Westard. Work all day loading with small spruce boards and could not get in only about 20 M. It is considered here in Calais to be the best sledding and Sleighing that there has been for the winter as there is a plenty of snow and the Sun runs high which keeps the snow moist during the day which heretofore the snow has been dry.
Wind North East. Snow melting very fast Work all day loading narrow spruce boards nearly filled the hold

Wind North East in the morning. Finished filling the hold at 8 oclock A.M. vessel carrying 48 M. Put up stanchions and cleared the deck. caulked hatcher etc and at 9 A.M. commenced to put on deckboad.
Wind South West and very warm the snow and ice melting very fast. Work all day loading the Sea Queen

Wind Southerly in the morning with snow and rain. Finished loading at 10 in the forenoon and after dinner took tugboat and towed down to the ledge. and made sail Wihin by the Devils Head took a squall from the NorthWest hauled down the main sail. When a brest of Robinston cleared up wind moderated set mainsail and at 5.30 anchored at Perry. weather growing cold.
location: Hill's Wharf, Devil's Head, Robinston, Perry

journal_entry: Wind West North West And very cold vapor flying. Got underway at Perry. at 8.AM and went down the River to Rumerys Bay and waited for the tide until one oclock. when got underway and went through Lubec Narrows Wind hauled Northerly Passed Little River at 5.20 and passed Petitmenan at midnight. blowing heavy and very cold. So ends these 24 hours.
location: Perry, Rumerys Bay, Lubec Narrows, Little River, Petit Manan

journal_entry: Passed Schoodic Point at 2 oclock in the morning. and beat in home to get the Sea Queens Yawl boat which was lent the A.G.Brooks Arrived at Winter Harbor at day light and went along side of the wharf At noon Wind South West.
Wind Southerly and fresh breeze. Took of the vessels deck about 2 M feet of lumber that was ordered at Winter Harbor In Afternoon it rained hard
Wind came of NorthWest in the morning and blew heavy all day with a tremendous heavy sea out side.
Wind Easterly with a heavy Sea running Got underway at the wharf in Winter Harbor and went out for Boston. At dark anchored at Fox Islands at dark

Wind South West by South Got underway in the morning and beat over to Mouraes Island near Owls Head. Carried away main throat aloft and went into Rockland In the afternoon snow and rain. At night wind came of NorthWest.
Wind North West. and blew a gale got underway and went to Owls Head Could not carry sail to go further.
Calm in the morning Then the wind breezed up Southerly and South West. Got underway and beat through the mussle Ridge and into Tennants Harbor. In the afternoon snow squalls.

Wind South South West Got underway in the morning and went out to beat our to Herring Gut Shut down thick with fog and went back to Tenants Harbor. at 11 AM came up a thunder shower and in the afternoon wind came of Northerly. Got under way at 3.30 and went around to Gerring Gut at South St Genge. Herring Gut is now called Port Clyde. Late in the evening wind blew very hard from the North.

Wind North. fresh breeze Got underway at daylight at Port Clyde and went out for Boston. Passed Seguin at 9 oclock in the forenoon. Wind hauled Easterly and Southerly. Reped of and went into Portland anchored at 4 in afternoon.
The wind South West. Laid at anchor all day in Portland Harbor

Wind East North East and fresh breeze. At 8 oclock in the morning other vessels got out of the way so I could get the Sea Queen underway. Passed Cape Elizabeth at 9 AM. Passed Boon Island out side at 2.30 P.M. Wind East and moderating. and at midnigh abrest of Thatchers Island becalmed. Nigh very pleasant.
location: Portland, Cape Elizabeth, Boon Island, Thacher Island

journal_entry: At day light the wind breezed up East South East moderate and all the progress we made since midnight was what the Sea hove her ahead. the Wind hauled out South East and breezed up. went into Boston at 11 in the forenoon It being past day 2 could not see my Consignee. Consigned to Jos. F. Paul and Co: at the South End through 7 bridges.

Wind Southerly and moderate Saw my Consignee in the morn and went back on board and commenced hauling through the bridges at the South End got into the berth to discharge at one in the afternoon and went to work taking the deckload up.
Wind Easterly Work in the afternoon on high water and finished taking the deckload of and cleared up the decks and washed the vessel of for Sunday.
Wind North East. and pleasant Went to Prayer meeting in the Evening.
Snowy in the morn. Wind Easterly Worked on the high water in the morning and at night on the deckload

Wind Easterly with sunshine Worked a while in the morning and at night and finished onloading. recieved freight money 240. and hauled through 5 bridges there being 2 more to go through but on account it being dark and the wind ahead hauled along side the wharf to wait untill morning

Wind Westerly and blew very heavy all day. Hauled through 2 bridges in morn and went into Russia Wharf to take in freight At 4. P.M was ready to sail got clear of the wharf and went. down to Long Island and anchored. blowing so hard dare not go out. with Snow squalls.

At one oclock in the morning the Schr Crusoe of Machias came across our bow and damaged the bow sprit to the amount of 5.00. At daylight got underway and went out Wind W.S.W. Passed Thatchers Island at 9 A.M. at 1.15 P.M. passed Boon Island at 5 P.M. passed Cape Elizabeth. At 8 P.M. passed Segim W.N.W. Wind at midnight about 4 miles N.E. from Monheigan and running for White Head.
location: Long Island, Thacher Island, Boon Island, Cape Elizabeth, Seguin Island, Monhegan

journal_entry: Wind West North West. Passed White Head at 1.30 in the morning Got to Fox Island at 4 A.M. just as daylight Wind hauled more Northerly. Passed Bakers Island at 10 and be at home arrived at 2 in the afternoon hauled into the wharf at 3 P.M. Wind South West
location: Whitehead Island, Fox Islands, Baker Island, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: Wind North West in forenoon and South West in afternoon took out freight in the morning and discharged Wilson Lindsey with the intention of going one man short handed.
Wind North North West in the morning Got underway and went out for Calais. at noon passed Petitmenan at dark Libby Island at midnight off West Quaddy becalmed with Ebb tide. So ends these 24 hours
location: Winter Harbor, Petit Manan, Libby Island, West Quoddy

journal_entry: Calm until daylight When the wind breezed up North West. Went around East Quoddy and up the River as for as Red Beach when the tide turned against us and anchored very fresh breeze at 12 oclock. at 5 PM tide turned flood got underway and beat by the Devils Head as far as the Ledge and anchored just after dark
location: East Quoddy, Red Beach, Devil's Head

journal_entry: Wind very moderate all day N.N.W. Tood tug boat and towed to Calais at 10 AM. Hunted around the remainder of the day for a freight but could not find any.

Wind Easterly Chartered to go to Marble Head with Spool Edgings and boards for Henry Eaton $2.84 1/2 per cord on edgings " 2.25 per M on boards. hauled into Mr.Gates wharf at noon to load the edgings for Mr Eaton. At night had about 1/2 hold full. Wind hauling little Southerly
Wind South East. and blew a gale with a tremendious fall of rain untill 2 oclock in the afternoon cleared up wind. moderated. went to work loading Sea Queen with Edgings.
weather_condition_pm: tremendious fall of rain, cleared up

journal_entry: Wind North Easterly Finished the hold full at 9.30 A.M. Commenced putting on deckload at 2 P.M. had the edgings all on board. there being about 53 cords Took tug boat and towed to Eatons upper wharf to finish the load with long lumber want about 25 M feet
N/A
N/A

Wind from North East to East, and snowing very hard. did not get underway until 7 in the morning then went down to Welch Pool. on Canpobello and anchored. at Noon stoped snowing and sun came out Calm. At 5 P.M. Wind came of from the North Got underway and went out by East Quaddy Wind moderate passed West Quaddy at 10 P.M. and at midnight -Boatmans head.
location: Canpobello, East Quaddy, West Quaddy, Boatman's head

journal_entry: Wind from the North at 2 in the morning passed Little River at 4 passed Libby Island at 6 passed Moosepeak at 8 passed Petitmenen. at 12 M of Schoodic becalmed. At 2 P.M. Wind breezed up Southerly and Westerly. Went into Winter Harbor and went home at 4 P.M.
location: Little River, Libby Island, Moose Peak, Petit Manan, Schoodic Peninsula, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: Calm until Eleven oclock when the wind breezed up very moderate Easterly. did not go out thinking should not get far Staid at home built fence. Split wood etc. Wind hauled Southerly in afternoon.
Calm in morning. At 7 am wind breezed up South East. Very moderate Got under way and went out for Marble head. Passed Bakers Island at noon. Wind hauled East. Anchored at Fox Island at Sunset.
location: Winter Harbor, Marblehead, Baker Island, Fox Islands

journal_entry: Wind N.N. East with rain and snow at 11 A.M. cleared up got underway and went out wind moderated at 5 P.M. was becalmed of George Island at dark there was an air of wind from the South West and at midnight off Pemaquid Point drizzling rain and fog with no prospect of getting in before day light So Ends these 24 hours

Wind continuing South W. untill 3 in the morning when it hauled out South. and breezed up thick with fog and rain Laid by untill 4. AM. when day light began to dawn and went into Booth Bay anchored at 5.30 A.M. Cleared up in the Harbor but thick with fog outside

Wind Easterly and thick with fog. At 10 AM the fog scaled up. got under way and went out passed Seguin at noon After passsing Seguin the wind very moderate and apart of the time Calm. At 7 P.M the wind breezed up S.W. thick with fog and was abrest of Halfway Rock. at 10 the fog lifted Wind breezed up and at 12 midnight went into Portland Roads and anchored.
location: Seguin Island, Halfway Rock, Portland Roads
weather_condition_am: thick with fog, fog scaled up

journal_entry: At 9 AM got underway wind Westerly and went out at noon abrest of Wood Island took the wind South South West blowing fresh. Went into Wood Island at 1.30 P.M.

Wind South South West in forenoon. And at noon wind hauled around NorthWest At 2 P.M got under way and went out of Wood Island. At 4 P.M took avery heavy squall from the NorthWest. hauled down all sail The squall only lasting a few minutes reefed sails and set them at 7 P.M. passed York Nubble at 10 PM passed inside of the Isles of Shoals under reefed mainsail and jib at 10.30 Thatchers Island in sight.
location: Wood Island, York Nubble, Isles od Shoals, Thacher Island

journal_entry: Wind more moderate since 12 oclock this morning and at 1.30 A.M. Passed Thatchers Island. Set all sail Wind hauled Westerly beat to Marblehead and arrived at 11 in the forenoon. did not haul into the wharf as dare not ground the vessel. at the wharf where the lumber is going as big rocks had fallen of the Granite wharf

Wind South West at 10 oclock in the fore noon hauled into the Wharf and put of all the lumber there being 20 M feet long lumber 50 M shingles. Went away from the wharf without grounding the vessel and to the wharf where I am going to discharge spool edgings

Wind Easterly and pleasant. Went to Boston to see about Chartering the SeaQueen to go some where to load. but found nothing. Came back to Marblehead at night by train Left the crew on board the Schr SeaQueen to discharge while and was gone to Boston. Paid $23 to Mr Mosley for owners
Wind Easterly and moderate Finished discharging Edgings at 2 P.M. and was ready to sail but could not get from the wharf as the wind blew on.

At 2 oclock in the morning the wind about North. Set sail and and filled away from the wharf and fetched out of the Harbor Wind hauling Easterly  tacked ship South from Cape Ann. and headed Northerly. Passed Thachers Island at noon Wind hauling Southerly At 10 in the evening very moderate SouthWest At midnight Calm Cape Elizabeth lights bore North North West and Seguin light bore N.E by 1/2. N.
location: Cape Ann, , Thacher Island, Cape Elizabeth, Seguin Island

journal_entry: Calm from midnight untill noon nearly a dead calm the whole 12 hours. The Sea had hove the vessel ahead some. Seguin bore N.N.W at noon when the wind breezed up very moderate Southerly. Passed Monheigan at 3 oclock in afternoon Passed White head at 6 oclock and anchored at Fox Island at dark. blowing fresh
location: Seguin Island, Monhegan, Whitehead Island, Fox Islands

journal_entry: Wind South Got underway in the morning at 4 Passed Schoodic at 2 oclock in afternoon and Petitmenan at 4 And at 5 oclock took the wind N.N.E. fresh breeze. Tacked ship and went back home to Winter Harbor anchored at half past 8 in the evening.
location: Schoodic Peninsula, Petit Manan, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: Wind North Got underway at 8 oclock in the morning. passed Schoodic at 10 wind died out and breezed up Southerly Passed Moose apeak at 2 PM. and abest of Cross Island 6 P.M. and dead calm. at 8 oclock in the Evening took the wind from the Eastward. and went to Machias for a Harbor.
location: Schoodic Peninsula, Moose Peak, Cross Island, Machias

journal_entry: Wind North East. Went ashore at Machias port and agreed for a load of lumber to go to Boston at $225 per M Hauled into the wharf at night to be ready to begin loading tomorrow

Wind Easterly at 10 in the forenoon the Surveyor came and commenced loading The lumber being surveyed so very slow did not make much progress in loading Loading for Cornelias Sullivan Consigned to Peters for Boston.

Wind South Easterly overcast Sprinkle of rain in the morning but not enought to stop work Took the Yawl boat on the wharf and put a stern host in her filled the hold with two inch plank and put the hatch: at 6 oclock in the afternoon.
NA
NA
Wind Southerly and pleasant. Work all day puting on deck load as it came from Whitneyville on cars.
Wind North. North. East. good breeze. Worked all day putting on deckload as fast as it is coming from Whitneyville which does not keep us busy all the time. Got Bills of Laden Wind Southerly at night

Wind East North East Finished at 8 oclock in the morning puting on deck load. And hauled from the wharf and came away from Machias port against the tide. At 11.30 AM Passed Libly Island Light house at 1.30 P.M passed Moose peak from 4 untill 5 PM rain and hail passed Petitmenan at 6 Schoodic Island at 10 and abrest of Mark Island at midnight
location: Machias, Libby Island, Moose Peak, Petit Manan, Schoodic Island, Mark Island

journal_entry: Anchored in the Sand cove at 2 oclock in the morning. Calm. At 10 AM Wind breezed up. Easterly but did not go out work about home all day.
Wind North East moderate and rainy all day. Got underway and went out for Boston Anchored at Deer Isle about Sunset Calm.
Got underway at noon at Deer Isle after the wind breezed up. Southerly and at dark got to Fox Island and anchored.
Wind very moderate all day and baffling Got underway at Fox Island at 4.30 and at 2 in the afternoon got to lobster cove in the mussle ridges. Wind most of the time South East or calm.
Wind East South East. Fresh breeze and rainy Got underway in the morning and anchored in Boothbay at 11.30 heavy rain all day.
Wind SouthWest and rough. Laid at anchor all day in Boothbay The fleet of Western bound vessels went out and all came back but one or two
Calm in morning at 9 oclock in forenoon the wind breezed up S.S.W. got underway and beat out at 6 oclock in the afternoon passed Seguin at 10 PM Calm
NA
NA
Wind Southerly laid at anchor all day at Wood Island.

Wind North North East rainy in the morning Got underway and went out of Wood Island Cleared up Wind North North West Passed Boon Island at 2 P.M. and Isles of Shoales at 4 P.M. Thatches Island at 8 and Eastern Point at 8.40 after passing Eastern Point and got abrest of Bakers Island got becalmed So ends these 24 hours in Boston Bay
location: Wood Island, Boon Island, Isles of Shoales, Thacher Island, Eastern Point, Baker Island, Boston Bay

journal_entry: The wind breezed up Westerly very moderate and at 9 oclock in the morning passed Long Island head in Boston Harbor. Tide turned Ebb. Wind breezed up and blew fresh and at 11 AM Anchored at East Boston flats. After dinner went ashore to see the consignee Geo H Peters and Co. and it being a Holly day There were no Offices open and therefore could not find out where to haul in to
location: Long Island, Boston Harbor, East Boston flats

journal_entry: Wind South West and a fresh breeze ofwind. Went on shore and saw the Consignee who gave me orders to haul into John W. Leatherbus at South End through 7 bridges. The tide being up could not get there until afternoon at 3 oclock took a tug boat and towed to the first bridge. and went through 6 bridges before dark when the wind blew so hard could not get any further hauled into the wharf and made fast for the night

Wind South South West gale of wind and rain hauled through one bridge and got to the berth to discharge by heaving all the way with the windlass Took of a small quantity of lumber after we got into the wharf.
Wind Southerly Worked on the high water at noon and night - and got the deckload of
Wind South South West Commenced on the hold full at 10.30 in the forenoon when the tide is up and worked about 4 hours.
Wind Easterly and Showery. Went to East Boston with my wife visiting to W M Pendletons.
Wind from South to North West Commenced work at noon and at 6 oclock in the afternoon the vessel was all discharged ready to go through the bridges

Wind Easterly Commenced at 2.30 of the clock in the morning and had through all the bridges. Went ashore and settled up for the freight money and went of on the flats and anchored at Sunset. wind Southerly got underway and went out and at midnight most down to Eastern Point. So ends these 24 hours

Wind very moderate West at 3 oclock in the morning passed Thatchers Island at 4 A.M. Wind hauled South West and at Noon breezed up. At 7 PM. Passed Monheigan and run out side of Matinicus Rock and passed it at 9.40 P.M. Fresh breeze and growing rough At Midnight out of sight of the Rock Lights
location: Thacher Island, Monhegan, Matinicus Rock, Execution Rocks Light

journal_entry: Moderate wind and rough. When the sun rose was a breast of Duck Island at 8 oclock AM abrest of Backers Island. go in home at 10. AM
location: Duck Island, Baker Island, Winter Island

journal_entry: Wind Southerly. hauled the vessel on beach to clean Cleaned one side of vessels bottom. heavy rain most all day with hail
Wind Southerly all day huled vessel down on other side and finished cleaning bottom and went to painting vessel.
Wind North East in morning and went around to the Southard in afternoon.

Wind Northerly in forenoon Clement Bunker Came to do my farming. In morning I held plow untill 9 oclock in forenoon and left him and went on board the Sea Queen to go out for Franklin Island. At one PM took the wind out when abrest of onter end of Iron Bound. Anchored at Sullivan at 3 Went ashore got new Coasting Licence. At 5 got underway and went over Falls and up to Franklin At Sunset went ashore and agreed to load for J.P. Gordon with Granite paving blocks for New York at $26 per 1.000
location: Winter Harbor, Iron Bound, Sullivan, Falls, Franklin

journal_entry: Calm in morning at noon wind breezed up Southerly Commenced loading at noon with having blocks received three Scow loads each scow having 1.000 blocks
Calm in forenoon. At noon received 2 scow loads of granite paving blocks each scow carrying 1.000 blocks. in afternoon wind breezed up Southerly

Wind Southerly and a very fresh breeze at noon got one scow load of paving and another scow was loaded but could not get her of along side for fear her sinking the wind blowing so hard. The scow we got had a deck and was safe to move.

Wind South South West and moderate. Got 3 scow loads of granite which finished our load it making 9 scow loads which is 9.000 blocks. Got bill of Laden at 26 dollars per 1.000 filled water and at dark was all ready to sail.
Wind very moderate Southerly and Easterly Got the vessel under way and went down to the anchoring ground. On the high water at noon the wind was out S.S.E. and could not get over the falls

Wind Southerly and thick with fog. went ashore and walked down to John W. Hill hired his horse and went home got there soon after dinner late in the evening very heavy thunder and lightning with tremendious rain.
weather_condition_night: very heavy thunder, lightning, tremendious rain

journal_entry: NA
NA

At One oclock in the morning. Wind breezed up West by South. Headed of S.S.W the remainder of the night and the forenoon Tacked ship loaded North West. At 3 in the afternoon sighted Matinicus Rock bearing North. At 8 PM took the wind very moderate Westerly

Wind West South West at 3 in the morning. Matinicus Rock bore N.E. by. E. and Manhegan N.N.W Course S.W. At noon Lat 42°, 54°, afternoon course S.S.W. wind hauling out at. 7 P.M Wind SW by W Midnight North West very moderate all the time. So Ends these 24 hours.

Wind North West in the morning at 3 sighted Cape Cod Light hearing S.W. by S 1/2 S at 8 oclock abrest the old Cape becalmed. At noon wind breezed up South West At dark abrest of Chatham Weather looked very bad. At midnight anchored South of Chatham fresh breeze with sharp lightning.

At 4 oclock in the morm got underway with the wind West South West blowing fresh with heavy thunder and sharp lightning. Beat on to the shoals after passing Pollock Rip Light Ship had a terrific rain storm untill about 10 oclock in the forenoon. when the rain ceased. after beating passed the Handkerchief. run North West for the Bishop and Clerks and went into Hyannis in the afternoon blowing fresh overcast. and rough.
location: Pollock Rip, Handkerchief, Bishop and Clerks, Hyannis
weather_condition_am: heavy thunder, sharp lightning, terrific rain storm, rain ceased

journal_entry: Wind West South West blowing very fresh Laid at anchor all day at Hyannis Harbor.
Wind West North West in morning got underway and went out of Hyannis. Took the wind West South West and beat to Vineyard Haven. It being as far as could get on account of tide.

Wind North West in morning and when tide turned West. got underway and went out at noon abrest of Gay head and took wind West by South. Moderate and by spells calm. at 6 oclock at night abrest of the Sow and Pigs Light Ship

Very moderate Westerly wind almost the same as none. At 6 oclock in the morning abrest of Benton Reef Light Ship. In the afternoon wind hauled out but still kept moderate at 7 PM Watch Hill light house bore. West about 3 miles Wind died out calm and Ebb tide setting out.
Wind Northerly. Hair breeze Passed through the Race at 8 oclock A.M. at 7 PM abrest of Falkners Island.

In the morning at 6 oclock abrest of Eatons Neck Wind Northerly and moderate. When abrest of the Execution rocks anchored the tide turned ahead and Calm. At night got the anchor went in by Throggs point and anchored. Heavy rain
location: Eatons Neck, Execution Rocks Light, Throggs point

journal_entry: Calm and thick with fog. Took tug boat and towed through the gate. Went to the Office but could not get any chance to discharge vessel anchored at Red Hook.
Wind North West and blew very fresh laid at anchor at Red hook.
Wind Westerly Most all the Offices closed ashore as tomorrow being a holly day they have two holly days instead of one.
Wind North East and showery It being celebration day could make no effort to even try to get a place to discharge.
Wind Easterly and rainy all day
Wind Westerly Took Tug boat and towed to Harlem at 113th Street to discharge
Commenced in morn discharging with Stevedores and finished at night vessel had 9.100 blocks at $26. per M Stevedores bill $3. per M Wind South West.
Wind Southerly Settled up for freight on paving blocks and tried to get a coal freight but failed in the attempt.
Wind Southerly in forenoon. Took tug boat and towed down from Harlem where go discharged stone to the Red Hook In afternoon late Wind from the North around South East.

Calm, all the forenoon Went a shore at N.Y. got coal order at III Broadway of M. E. Robinson to go to Charlestown. Mass with coal to J. C. Ginn through Chelsea Bridge on Charlestown side 10 feet water guaranteed. Wind Southerly in afternoon got underway at night and went to Halen Island.

Wind South West got underway at day light and at noon towed into the coaldock at 3 commenced loading and at 5 was loaded towed out made sail and went to the Red Hook and anchored just after dark. Vessel has on board 150 50/100 tons coal.

Calm. Took tugboat and towed through gate very early and anchored untill after noon there being no wind. At One PM wind breezed up Southerly got under way. and at midnight almost abrest of Old Field Light Rainy and very dark and quite thick Wind breezing
Wind South South West at two oclock took in Staysail at 5 AM took in topsail and at 6 AM took in main sail blowing very heavy. at 11.30 Went into New London Conn

Calm in morning at 10 AM Wind breezed up SouthWest. Got underway at New London Went through Fishers Island Sound passed Watch Hill at One P.M. And Pont Judith at 4 P.M. At dark Vineyard Sound Light Ship in sight. Moderate with heavy sea. At midnight the Light Ship bore West and Gay Head South South West Fog closed in thick tide ahead
location: New London, Fishers Island, Watch Hill, Point Judith, Vineyard Sound Lightship, Gay Head

journal_entry: Very moderate wind and baffling at 2 Am fog lifted. saw Gay head bearing S.W run N.E. fog closed in at 3 sighted Tarpaulin Cove Light fog partly lifted. and dead calm Then the flood tide made and carried through the Viney and Sound by East Chop. And where the Ebb tide mad carried us back abrest of Vineyard Haven and then anchored untill 6 P.M. when tideslacked got the boat a head and towed in to Vineyard Haven
location: Gay Head, Tarpaulin Cove, Vineyard Haven
weather_condition_am: fog partly lifted, fog cleared in

journal_entry: Calm all the forenoon and untill 2 P.M when breezed up moderate S.W. Got underway and went out at 8 oclock passed pollock Rip. and at midnight almost to the Handkerchief and calm

Calm untill after day light. at 5 am passed the Handkerchief The Ebb tide had taken us back so we did not pass the Handkerchief Light Ship untill the flood tide made. Wind South passed Nausetts Light houses at 2 P.M. Passed Cape Cod Light house at 6.30 P.M. Wind S.W. At midnight the fog closed in thick had seen Minots Rock Light bearing N.W. by. W. and judged at was about 10 miles distant So Ends these 24 hours.
location: Handkerchief, Nauset Light, Highland Light, Minots Light

journal_entry: Wind moderate Southerly At 3 A.M. the fog lifted and saw Minots Rock light and nearly abrest it Also saw Boston Light Went into Boston on the flood tide about noon and at 2 P.M. was along side the wharf to discharge at Charlestown
Wind Southerly most all day Had two very heavy rain squalls which would change the wind from South all around the Compass Commenced discharging coal in morning and was all out at night

Wind Southerly and Easterly hauled from the wharf at day light went through Chelsea Bridge and of on point of flats and anchored at 8 in forenoon Went ashore at No 15 Doane St. and saw Consignees which was J.C. Ginn and Co settled up freight got ship stores and at noon was ready to sail At 5 PM Wind came of West got underway and went out. at midnight most down to Eastern Point

Wind Westerly. and very moderate at 2 A.M. passed Thatchers Islands and wind continued Westerly untill noon when it hauled out Southerly and without breezing up. At midnight Saw Monheigan bearing North So Ends these 24 hours
The wind hauling westerly very early in the morning Passed Matinicus Rock at 8 AM at noon passed Isle ahaut. at dark Bakers Island Midnight Mark Island So ends these 24 hours becalmed
location: Matinicus Rock, Isle ahaut, Baker Island, Mark Island

journal_entry: This day begins perfectly calm. ahead and towed into Winter Harbor and anchored at two oclock in the morning and went home.
Wind very moderate Southerly. did not do any work in particular
Wind very moderate Southerly Hauled the Sea Queen into the Wharf and took one ton of coal out. that was left in by the Stevedores when we discharged in Boston.
Wind Southerly heeled the vessel down on the beach and cleaned the Starboard side
Wind Southerly. healed the vessel down on beach and cleaned the port side working all alone.
Wind NorthEasterly Work about home Shingled little home had blacksmeth work done for the vessel
NA
NA
Wind Easterly and hauled around Southerly. Went on board the Sea Queen to go out but the wind moderate and only one man with me did not go out.
Calm in morning Wind breezed up about 9 oclock moderate. beat out and went up to the Falls but did not get up time nough to get over and anchored below.
Wind in forenoon NorthWest Went over the Falls and anchored not knowing where I was going to load Wind Southerly in afternoon.

Calm in forenoon In afternoon wind breezed up Southerly got the vessel under way and went to Franklin. agreed to load for Charles Macombu with Hemlock bark for Salem at 2.25 per cord. The bark to be brought along Side and onloaded
Wind Southerly. One scow was loaded and brought along side ready to discharge
Wind Southerly from Early in the morning and very hot. discharged the scow load of bark that was brought along side yesterday.
Calm all the forenoon and very hot Went to meeting forenoon afternoon and evening In the afternoon the wind Southerly. late in evening showery.
Wind Southerly and the air very close Had two scow loads of bark brought along side. and on loaded. one and half of the other Late in the evening had a very heavy shower. with thunder
Wind Southerly and the fog very thick At 9 A.M. the fog lifted and an Excursion partly went down the bay by us Onloaded one scow and a half The Scow average about 11 to 12 cords
Wind South South East and thick with fog Work all day loading
Wind North East and at 9.30 heavy shower. afternoon wind Southerly Work all day loading
Wind Southerly in forenoon. and W.S.W. in afternoon finished loading at night making in all 8 scow loads of bark.

Calm in the morning Got underway at day light and drifted down with the tide. as far as the lower End of Burrying Island the tide turned flood and anchored. at 10 An the wind breezed up S.S.W. got the anchor and undertook to beat down and run a shore one the musslebed. run Cage and and leave it home at dark run small anchor. and at midnight hove of went down abrest of Crabtrees stone and anchored
location: Burrying Island, Winter Harbor, Crabtrees stone

journal_entry: Wind North West. With fresh breeze Tide served at noon Got underway and came down over the Falls. Not having but one man with me I beat in home at Winter Harbot after a man.
Wind Westerly in morning South West the remainder of the day. Could get no man to go to Salem with me and could not goout.
Wind Southerly and thick with fog laid at anchor all day in the Sand Cove. Work apart of the day for Jennie Tracy on the Riazza getting it ready fot the lettuce work
Wind Southerly and very thick with fog made no attempt to go out.

Wind Southerly and thick untill 4 P.M. when it cleared up and the wind came of with a squall from the N.W. but it did not last long enought to get underway. when it was board out to the South and Work apart of the day on boat. belonging to the vessel.
Wind SouthWest Got underway at 6.30 in the morning. 830 passed Bakers Island and at 8 oclock in the evening. passed Matinicus Rock Light Wind moderate
Wind North North West untill 10 A.M. when it hauled out Southerly at 6 P.M sighted Cape Ann ahead at 8 PM Calm Midnight becalmed Thatchers Island bore South West by West

Wind breezed up NorthWest passed Thatchers Island at 4.30 AM. wind moderate at 8 am becalmed at 10 am Wind Southerly Went into Salem Harbor at noon. at 2 P.M was into the wharf where I am going to discharge bark Consigned to C H Clark.
Wind SouthWest Work all day discharging bark got 40 cords of
Wind Southerly Got deckload of at noon and commenced taking bark out the hold

Wind South. Finished discharging at noon and in the afternoon. Settled up for freight. filled water cleared up deck and at 5 oclock in the afternoon commenced hauling down to the bridge and at 6.30 P.M Made sail and left Salem for home Amount of bork had on board 84 5/8 cords at $2.25 per cord freight amount $194.16 at 10 oclock in the evening passed Thatchers Island
NA
NA

Wind North East. Vessel headed NorthWesterly from from midnight untill 8 in the morning. the vessel just fetched the Old Cilly Ledge Eastward of Georges Island. and kept on heading for White Head untill one P.M. when the wind hauled out SouthWest moderate all day passed White Head at 1.30 PM and at 10 oclock P.M. anchored at Fox Island wind very moderate
location: Old Cilly Ledge, Whitehead Island, Fox Islands

journal_entry: Wind Easterly and thick with fog. at 4. A.M. fog cleared up got underway. tide running in got to Channel Rock at 10 a.m wind hauled Southerly went through Deer Isle Thorough fare at one P.M. at sunset anchored on Bass Harbor Bar untill 10 PM when the tide turned ebb and at midnight abrest of Bakers Island so Ends thsese 24 hours
location: Channel Rock, Deer Isle, Bass Harbor, Baker Island
wind_speed_night: thick with fog, fog cleared up

journal_entry: At 2 Am thick with fog with a light air baffling at 10.30 fog cleared with a light breeze from the Southard. Got in Winter Harbor at one P.M. At 10 in the Evening hauled the vessel onto the Beach to clean.
Commenced cleaning the vessel at day light and cleaned one side in the forenoon Wind breezed up South at noon healed the vessel down on the otherside and in the afternoon finished cleaning the vessel

very moderate Northerly in the morning Got underway and went out for Franklin Got down as far as Neds Island took the wind Southerly and went up the bay anchored below the Falls on account of the tide.
At 10 AM wind breezed up Southerly. got underway and went over the Falls and up to Franklin in afternoon went ashore but did not agree to load for any one

Wind Southerly and partialy cloudy Went all the forenoon after a freight walked over to Mr Cards Mill Agreed to load with hab wood for Mr C.H. Macombu and W.H. Card for Boston could not get any scows to load with therefore in the afternoon went huckle berrying
Wind Southerly Got a part of a scow load of wood at dark

Wind SouthWest Went to ----- Meeting at the Town Hall Franklin with my wife. In the afternoon went to a baptism at Georgies pond about 2 1/2 miles from Franklin Village where 6 people were baptised Came back to the vessel at 5 oclock P.M.
local_place: Town Hall Franklin, Georgies pond, Franklin Village

journal_entry: Wind South Easterly and moderate rain all forenoon Got one scow load of hab wood at night The scows are all in use therefore we load very slow.
Wind Northerly Got two scow loads of slabs at night. In Evning went to Republicun lecture by Hon. R.G. Horr of Michigan.
Moderate Northerly in the morning and southerly wind in the afternoon. did not have any scow load of wood to day but stoved up the wood that was brought of last night
NA
NA
Wind moderate N.E. in morning S.W. in afternoon Finished loading Sea Queen with Hab woods. Consigned to Nasser Choate Burnham and sons South Boston. The load made up by W H Card and C H Macombu.
Wind N.N. West. and very moderate got underway at day light and went down to the anchoring ground abrest of Chabtrees store

Calm in morning Wind South Easterly in afternoon No chance to get over the Falls. In the afternoon hired Win. Goodwins team took in My wife and Girl carried them as far as West Gouldsboro Then I went to the Town house and voted came back to West Gouldsboro Staped untill after tea took in wife and girl went home. then it was raining quite hard got home at dark The Electron was for Governor Representatives Shevell and Co.
location: Winter Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: Wind NorthEast and in the morning raining. After it held up raining harness up the horse and went back to West Sullivan When the tide served right about noon the Wind N.N.E. Got under way Went over the Falls and went to Bass Harbor anchored a little before sunset.
location: Winter Harbor, West Sullivan, Falls, Bass Harbor

journal_entry: NA
NA
Wind SouthWest in morning and hauled around NorthWest and blew a gale the big anchor that was hove up in the morning was let go again. So we lay here all day.

Wind West in morn more moderate. hove the big anchor up and at 10 A.M. the wind hauled North West. Let go the big anchor again and laid with both anchors ahead the remainder of the day blowing very heavy.

Wind NorthWest. Fresh breeze in forenoon Some vessels came in here loaded from the East and anchored which discouraged those lying at Port Clyde getting underway. At noon We got under way and at dark becalmed out side of Damiscove Islands. Then the Wind baffling from West to SouthWest At midnight Seguin bore West about 2 miles dist The sky cloudy and dark So ends these 24 hours.
location: Bass Harbor, Herring Gut, Damiscove Islands, Seguin Island

journal_entry: At 2 in the morning the wind breezing up South. and Seguin bearing N.N.W. Run for Portland. at day light very overcast and a big storm expected Got in Portland in forenoon and at 12 M. very moderate and quite clear.
Wind Southerly The Storm Signall up at the Custom House no vessels went out of Portland
Wind Easterly but nearly calm most all day. In the afternoon thick with fog
Wind NorthEast thick and raing got underway and went from the Break water to the Roades in morning.
Wind North East and very rough heavy rain all day
Wind Southerly and thick with fog rainy all day The fog trumpet at Portland head going all day lay at anchor all day in Portland roads.
Wind NorthEast and all the forenoon thick and heavy rain In the afternoon rain held up. but very overcast. laid at anchor.
NA
NA
Wind North East Sold the wood at $4.75 per cord and in the after noon hove some wood of but the wood not being taken away did not get Much out
Wind North East blowing heavy Got a little of the deck load of but it had to be hauled a long way therefore did not get much of deck got Money order to send to Messco Perley Russel and Co Portland
The wind NorthEast and rainy all day Finished getting the deck load of
Wind North East Worked apart of the day on hold full The wood having to be carted 1/2 mile the vessel is discharged very slow.
NA
NA

Wind North East. and moderate all forenoon. and at noon wind breezed up South got underway and went out of Salem. At 4 .PM Passed Thatchers Island at 8 P.M. Thatchers. went out of sight astern. The wind hauled Westerly and at midnight Wind NorthWest

Wind North at 2 A.M. At 4 A.M. Sighted Monheigan Rock at 12.30 PM Wind hauled to the W fresh breeze. Passed Long Island Head at 5 P.M. Wind W.S.S. after passing Bakers Island the wind died out and then an air North East at midnight most over to Schoodic Island so Ends these 24 hours
location: Monhegan, Long Island, Baker Island, Schoodic Island

journal_entry: Nearly calm all the forenoon with an air N.N. East at 8 oclock got up as far as Mark Island and anchored left the vessel and went home untill noon when the wind breezed up SouthWest Went down to the vessel got anchor and up to Winter Harbor and anchored in sand cove Fresh breeze in afternoon
location: Mark Island, Winter Harbor, Sand Cove

journal_entry: Wind Southerly vessel layed at Winter Harbor. got a shore wood and other thing that did not belong aboard.
Wind West South West My crew left and shiped new crew.

Wind Southerly and in forenoon thick with fog. In the afternoon fog cleared up got underway of Winter Harbor and went out for Franklin went over the Falls about Sunset with the boat ahead Calm. Anchored abrest of Burrying Island after dark.
location: Winter Harbor, Franklin, Falls, Burrying Island

journal_entry: Got underway in Morning and drifted up with the tide Wind Southerly Went to Franklin but did not take up to load But agreed to take the Chromo on her arrival from Boston. The principal owners of the Sea Queen are owners of the Chromo J H West and others.
Wind NorthWest and fresh breeze agreed to load the Sea Queen with slab wood and lumber for Boston although I dont expect to goin her. The wind blew so hard did not get any wood for the day.
Wind North West and moderate got onescow load wood along side and unloaded it
Wind South East and overcast. Got a new mainsail on board for the Sea Queen In the afternoon got a team from the Stable and went home to get ready to go in the Chromo got home at dark
Wind South East Staid at Winter Harbor all day getting ready to take the Chromo
Wind Southerly left home at 9 AM for Franklin arrived at noon. In the afternoon heavy rain. The vessels hold filled at noon with slab wood
NA
NA

Wind Southerly And showery Gave the Sea Queens papers up to Nahum Stevens Went ashore with him at West Sullivan got John Blaisdell's team Went to the Custom House at Sullivan The papers was endorsed and Capt Stevens takes charge. I carry him towards home as far as West Gouldsboro with Blasdells with team he gets me to look out for vessel while loading. Got back on board at Franklin at 3 P.M.
location: Franklin, West Sullivan, West Gouldsboro, Franklin

journal_entry: Calm all day. Finished loading at night but did not get bill of laden
Wind North East and and all the forenoon raining got bill of laden and droped down to the anchorage anchored at dark very moderate.
Wind Northerly all day The tide to early to get over the Falls. Not wind enough at night
Wind North West and moderate. Got under way in morning but could not get over the Falls not wind enough. At 9 A.M. started for home on foot arrived at 2 P.M.
Wind North East pleasant and very moderate Staid at home all day
Wind North East and rainy all day. Changed front stairs and Celler way in house at home.
Wind Easterly and rainy Work about home all day Mrs Torrey moved in one part of the house.
Wind North by West fresh breeze Put out side windows on house. Went down on Grindstone point to wait for the Sea Queen. From Franklin, went on board to help beat her up as she had no Capt on board.
Wind South West Went on board the Schr Sea Queen and got some things out That was left on board When I was in Franklin
Wind West. At noon went on board of the A G Brooks and went to Sullivan to find out if the Chromo had arrived in Boston Got to Sullivan at 4 P.M.
Wind North West. Went over the Falls in the Brooks in the forenoon and in the afternoon helped take freight out of the Brooks
Wind South by East Fresh breeze. In the afternoon went to Franklin to learn about the Chromo heavy rain came back on board the A G Brooks at dark.
Went on board the Str Mt Desert at Sullivan for Rockland arrived at 1.30 P.M. and at 8 PM took the Str Penobscot for Boston to take the Chromo. Wind SouthWest.

Wind Westerly. arrived in Boston at 9 A.M. on the Str Penobscot. found Capt Wooster and went on board the Schr Chromo at 11 AM vessel had not commenced to discharge at 2 PM they commenced to discharge vessel loaded with cement. took out 350 barrels.
Wind Westerly took out 250 barrels of cement out Chromo in forenoon and hauled down to another wharf to discharge the remainder.
Wind Northerly Finished unloading the Cement at dark.
Wind North North East Took tug boat and towed to Battery wharf to get freight for ballast. To go to West Sullivan Me

Wind East North East Went to Custon House and had papers of Chromo Endorsed from Capt Wooster to myself. Took on board 60 Bbls and went to East Boston and took 500 bushels of corn from the Elevator and then hauled of to an anchor all ready to sail when the wind changed
Wind North East and all ready to sail but no chance laid at anchor all day near East Boston
Wind North East fresh breeze could not go out to get East
Wind North East and drizzling rain laid at anchor all day.
Wind Easterly and no chance to get clear of Boston Went on shore to see how the Election went for Governor yesterday in Massachusetts.
An air of Wind Westerly got under way in morning and at noon anchored above Long Island in Boston Harbor becalmed

In Boston Lower Harbor Got underway at one oclock in the morning very moderate Wind SouthWest At day light becalmed Then an air all around the Compass. At noon Thatchers Island bore N.N.E. All the afternoon becalmed and thick with fog

At Sea. This day begins with the wind baffling and calm and thick with fog all day vessel headed North in forenoon and made Cape. Porpoise at 10 AM anchored at Wood Island at 4 P.M. It had been so thick and our courses so numerous. could not tell which way of Boon Island we passed.
location: Cape Porpoise, Wood Island, Boon Island

journal_entry: Wind S.S.W. Got under way at day light wind blowing fresh reefed fore and mainsail passed Monheigan at one P.M Then it was moderate Shook out reefes and anchored at Lobster cove at dark
Wind North East Thick with fog and rain. Got underway and beat through the mussle Ridges and anchored at Owls Hear Harbor at 4 P.M. Wind hauled SSW and blew very fresh with rain.
Wind Westerly. Got underway in morning at Owls head. Went through Cranberry Isles Harbor at 1 P.M. Wind hauled Northerly anchored at Sullivan at dark. hired team and went home in evening with team
location: Owls Head Harbor, Cranberry Isles, Sullivan, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: Wind North fresh breeze Went back to Sullivan with team in forenoon with family but the wind blew down the bay and did not get under way.
Wind NorthWest did not get over the falls on account of the Wind blowing down the bay
Wind North East with light snow Got underway at noon at Sullivan and went over the Falls to J H West Wharf West Sullivan.
Wind North East Took freight out of Chromo and ready to take in stone for a load
Wind N.N.E. Fresh breeze all day.

Wind North East. Town 4 oclock in the morning untill 6 A.M. thick with snow. Work all the forenoon and accomplished nothing It being the intention to load with random Stone for Philadelphia and worked the forenoon getting ready and hove up charter as could get no crew to go and took up to N.Y.

Moderate Northerly Wind. Commenced boarding with block paving for J.H.West for New York. At 2 oclock in the afternoon while getting a sluice for the stone from the wharf over the rail the strap parted from the takle and the Sluice fell on my foot bruising it very badly. Dr Bridgerin was summoned. He pronounced the bones not broken but very badly bruised. Foot sweled badly with severe pain Recd Postal from J H Smalledge announcing death of R.H.Bickford

Wind Continuing N.N.E. I unable to get out of my berth on account of crushed foot. severe pain My wife gets Ms. Blaisdell team to go to Winter Harbor to R. H. Bickfords funeral The vessel to which I belong is the Chromo of West Sullivan loading stone. My wife returned from Winter Harbor at night With T.R.Hammond my mate.
Wind North North East and very pleasant. Men work all day loading vessel. I kept my room. Finished loading at night
Wind South East. Fresh breeze. got bill of Laden for the Sum of $400. to New York. took the Str Electer and towed over the Falls and anchored near the Salt works Sullivan.
Wind NorthWest and blowed very heavy Got underway and Went to Winter Harbor
Wind WestNorthWest and blowing vey heavy laid at anchor all day

Wind Northerly. Went on board to go out and finding one the men sick wraped him up and put him a shore. And in the afternoon Shiped anotherman and at 4 P.M. got underway and went out of Winter Harbor for New York At 7.30 P.M. anchored at South West Harbor. flying Jib badly torn

Wind NorthWest. Moderate. Got under way at S.W.Harbor in morning and went out unbent the flying jib and. bent the outer jib for a flying jib at 9.30 got to Fox Islands and anchored in the Thorough fare.

Wind North East. and fresh breeze Got underway at Fox Islands at 5.30 A.M. and at day light just going into the mussle Ridges. at one P.M. passed Seguin and as the weather looked threatening run for Portland. passed White Head at 3 P.M. and anchored at 3.30 PM
location: Fox Islands, Seguin Island, Whitehead Island

journal_entry: Wind moderate NE and snowing all the forenoon laid at anchor.
Wind SouthWest snowy in forenoon no chance to go out. Laid in Portland Roads all day.
Wind North East lay at anchor in Portlandroads
Wind North by East snow squalls laid an anchor
Wind NorthWest. at one oclock AM got underway and went out at 10 AM becalmed at 2 PM Wind S.W. blowing fresh. Kept of and went back to Portland

Wind SouthSouthWest and very rough no chance to go out My leg and foot which was hurt. Nov 21 while loading is getting better as fast as time will let it My crutches is laid aside and I get about with the use of a cane
Wind Southerly in morning and heavy rain at 8 AM cleared up and wind hauled Westerly Crew work all day repairing flying Jib torn Nov 24

Wind South in fore noon accompanied with rain. In the afternoon wired came of W.N.W. snow squalls and blowing very heavy. Worked all day on flying Jib and finished at night weather growing cold. Evening perfect gale W.N.W
W by North and blowing a gale. very cold. No attempts made to go out. My lame foot getting better very fast I get a long now without any crutches or cane and able to attend to duty on deck.
Wind from SouthWest to West NorthWest and back to W.S.W. When the wind was SouthWest very moderate When W.N.W blowing a gale. no vessels went out bound Westerly.
Wind N.N.E. and thick with snow in the afternoon very thick
Wind North East and big snow storm No western bound vessels has gone out of Portland since I have been in here except those that has come back

Wind North North West. Got underway at Portland in the morning and went out In the afternoon wind very moderate At 1.30 PM passed Boon Island. At 4 PM passed Isles. of shoals. At 11. P.M. abrest of Eastern Point Kept of S.S. by S. for Cape Cod wind very moderate. At midnight no particular change sky quite clear heavy sea running from the E. N. E.

Wind very moderate untill 4 oclock this morning when it all died out and the sky began to grow overcast At 6 A.M. the wind began to breeze up South by West about this time we are 15 mites from Cape Ann Turned the vessels bows to the NorthWest and at 9.45 AM. anchored in Salem At noon commenced snowing afterward it turned to rain and blowed a gale of wind
wind_speed_am: very moderate, died out, breeze up

journal_entry: Wind Westerly and blowing fresh. Got underway at dark in Salem and went out to go around Cape Cod. Run of about 10 miles and the Wind was S.W. by W. and blowing very heavy tacked ship and beat back into Salem anchored at 11.30 PM The wind in Salem about West. beat from Backers Island up

Wind Westerly got underway in the morning and went out run of about 10 miles and went back to Gloucester blowing a gale. Got in at noon Afternoon and evening Wind West SWest and more moderate and at 12 oclock midnight no change although two or three vessels went out bound to N.Y.

Wind West North West quite moderate got underway and went out of Gloucester at 9 oclock in the morning Passed Cape Cod at 5.20 in afternoon. Nausetts at 4 afternoon and anchored South of Chatham at 930 P.M Wind breezing up fresh and at midnight blowing very fresh. The vessels that went on to the Shoals the day gone past had to come of and anchor South of Chatham
Wind West North West blowing fresh all day Lying at anchor all day. South of Chatham on board Schr "Chromo"

This day begins with the wind West North West Got underway South of Chatham at 5 A.M passed Pollock Rip Light Ship at 7 AM and Handkerchief at 8.15 A.M Wind hauled N. N. W moderate at noon Near Cape Poge Wind hauled W.N.W. at 4 P.M. Wind North and overcast looking very much like snow. tide a head passed Vineyard Haven at 5 PM and anchored in Tarpaulin Cove at 7. PM
location: Chatham, Pollock Rip, Cape Poge, Vineyard Haven, Tarpaulin Cove
weather_condition_am: overcast looking very much like snow

journal_entry: Got underway in the morning Wind North Passed Vineyard Sound Light Ship at 8 A.M. Point Judith at 11 AM at 12 noon calm At 3 P.M wind commenced to breeze up Northerly. At 7 P.M. went through the Race into Long Island Sound At Midnight abrest of Falkners Island wind breezing
location: Vineyard Sound Lightship, Point Judith, Long Island Sound, Falkner Island

journal_entry: Wind North fresh breeze and clear At 3 oclock in the morning passed between Stratford Light and middle Ground and at 10 AM passed Heart Island Wind North East Anchored at Rickers Island at noon. At 3.30 PM when the tide served right took tug boat and towed through the gates anchored at Poor House flats New York at 6.15 PM overcast.
location: Stratford Shoal Light, Heart Island, Rickers Island, Poor House flats New York

journal_entry: Wind Easterly. Went on Shore in morning saw Consignee (Chas Guidet) Found out where to haul in. And at noon commenced raining afternoon took tug boat and towed to place to discharge at Pier 36 New. North River raining hard.
NA
NA
Wind Westerly. Laid along side Pier 36 North River
Wind NorthWest and pleasant It being Christmas no business is done kept quiet all day
Wind Westerly in forenoon then it hauled out more Southerly. Took tug boat and towed to Brooklyn Dry dock to have vessels bottom painted did not get on
Wind North West Laid along side of Railway all day. Did not get on as it is already occupied and must wait for my turn. Expect to load for Point a Petre Guadaloupe but have signed no Charter.
Wind North West and pleasant Had vessel taken out on Rail way and painted at Brooklyn. The Charter to go to Guadaloupe that Expected has been hove up and dont know where I shall go.

Wind SouthWest had vessels bottom painted and vessel put in the water. Being discouraged about getting a suitable Charter to go upshore I took a coal order to go to Port Johnson and load with coal for Portsmouth NH at $1.35 per ton. Went Port Johnson at night.

An air of wind Westerly. hauled to the coal wharf and loaded with coal for Portsmouth N.H. at #1.35 per ton have 194 tons of stove coal. Went to New York by the way of Jersey City and settled up business Hauled out from the coal dock at Port Johnson at dark. and anchored of the wharves.
location: Port Johnson, New York, Port Johnson

journal_entry: Got underway. At 5.30in the morning at Port Johnson loaded with coal. On board the Schr. Chromo. My first trip in her. Wind West Went through Hell gate with a pilot at noon. at 8 o.clock in evening passed between Stratford and middle ground. At midnight the end of this year 1882 Abrest of Falkners Island. in Long Island Soud bound to Portsmouth. N.H. The sky overcast and very dark.
location: Port Johnson, Hell gate, Stratford, Falkners Island, Long Island, Portsmouth

journal_entry: The first hours of this year in Long Island Sound of  Falkners Island on bound of Schr Chromo From New York bound for Portsmouth Wind West and very dark and overcast. At 5 in morning passed out of the Race, and at 8 am of Point Judith at noon of vineyard Light Ship, at dark between Tarpaulin Cove and Vineyard Haven At 10 PM down to Cross Rip. not liking looks of the weather tacked ship to beat lack. Midnight tide turned E. Anchored. Commenced snowing moderately
notes: unsure in bold, wind direction entered in am as do not specify, same with "overcast"

journal_entry: Snowing from midnight untill day light. where it cleared up Wind WNW Got underway at 2 miles West from Cross Rip and went back to Edgartown. In the afternoon wind hauled Northerly
notes: unsure in bold, "WNW" entered in am as do not specify

journal_entry: Wind Easterly and hauled around South and looked like a storm. In the afternoon wind hauled Westerly and in the evening West South West and cleared up
wind Northwest and looking like snow. dare not go out of Edgartown at night wind North
notes: wind direction entered in am as do not specify, same with weather cond

journal_entry: Wind North East and thick with snow all day. Laid at anchor all day at Edgartown
notes: wind direction entered in am as do not specify

journal_entry: Wind Easterly all day. and thick with snow quite blustering and cold. Lay at anchor all day at Edgartown
Wind South West and thick rain all the forenoon At night wind hauling Northerly Laid at anchor all day at Edgartown
Wind NorthEast and pleasant. at night very cloudy. and in the evening Stormy. Laid at anchor in Edgartown Schr Chromo
notes: wind direction entered in am as do not specify

journal_entry: Wind North untill night blowing fresh and very overcast wind hauled Easterly at 8 PM let go another anchor
notes: unsure in bold, wind speed entered in am as do not specify, same with weather cond

notes: wind direction entered in am as do not specify same with weather condition

journal_entry: Wind South South West got underway at day light Passed Pollock Rip at 10.15 AM Passed Nausett at 12.30pm Cape Cod 1.45 PM and hauled down mainsail and double reefed it also foresail and took in flying jib. blowing a gale, After vessel passed Race point She was hit very bad. Passed by Thatchers Island 9.30 PM. raining bound to Portsmouth midnight most over to Isles of Shoales weather looking very bad
location: Pollock Rip, Nausett, Cape Cod, Race point, Thatchers Island
notes: unsure in bold, wind direction entered in am as do not specify, same with weather cond

journal_entry: At one oclock in the morning passed Isle of Shoales under double sails blowing fresh South west and rainning anchored at Portsmouth Outer Harbor at 2 AM at 11 AM took Pilot Wind Westerly and drizzling rain beat to Portsmouth at the coal dock ready to discharge pleasant weather in the afternoon
Wind NorthWest and pleasant Stevedores rigged up purchase tp discharge coal in forenoon and in the afternoon commenced taking out coal and in the afternoon commenced taking out coal
notes: unsure in bold, wind direction entered in am as do not specify same with wind speed

journal_entry: Very moderate all day wind NW finished discharging at 2 oclock pm then there was not wind enough get down river against the tide So we laid at the wharf where I discharged
Wind very moderate North Easterly. Got underway from the wharf Portsmouth and anchored in Sperse cove on kittery side In the afternoon it commenced to snow and wind hauled more Easterly

Wind West in the morning got underway passed whales Back at 8AM and Cape Elizabeth 12.30 Wind blowing very heavy WNW at 2PM wind moderated and hauled to the south at sunset between the Cuckholds and Squirrel Island went into Booth Bay and anchored

Got underway at 2 oclock in the morning Wind North West and moderate. after got out of Boothbay wind hauled North. Then baffling from North to North East got into the mussle Ridge at 10 AM.  with head tide then calm and drifted out by White Head. When the flood tide made got through the mussle Ridge and anchored at Owls Head at dark nearly Calon
Wind North East moderate and very overcast all day looking very much like snow lay at anchor all day at Owls Head at dark win ESE
notes: "NE" entered in am as do not specify

journal_entry: At one oclock AM commenced raining. rained the remainder of the night and untill nearly noon when the wind hauled South West and blew fresh at noon reefed sails and got underway went by the Northern Head of Fox Island and through Deer Isle thorough fase at 5 pm went through yorks narrow wind moderated Arrived at Winter Harbor at 8PM Wind West
Wind West North West Fresh breeze Vessel lying at Winter Harbor Went on board and took out some things
notes: wind direction entered in am as do not specify, same with wind speed

journal_entry: Wind North West and cold. Went on board of Chromo and took out the Cabin stove to use in the house in setting noon at home
notes: wind direction entered in am as do not specify, same with weather cond

journal_entry: Wind North West and moderate at night snowy Went to Lyceum at the Hall Question resolved that money is more desirable than Education
notes: wind direction entered in am as do not specify, same with wind speed

journal_entry: Wind Westerly and moderate about home very cold weather Chromo lying at Henrys cove and to much ice to get her in to the Harbor
notes: wind direction entered in am as do not specify, same with wind speed

journal_entry: Very moderate all day with an air of wind N.W. Staid at home all day not doing anything in particular Thin ice most all over the sound
notes: wind direction entered in am as do not specify, same with wind speed

Wind North West and moderate & warm took coal out vessel that the Stevedores left on board

Wind South by East Went on bound Chromo and cleaned snow of deck In afternoon wind, South East. heavy rain and very peak breeze

journal_entry: Wind Westerly Went on board the Chromo and moved then. In evening went to Lyceum Question Resolve that is would lie better for the People of the United States to have the property equaly divided

journal_entry: Wind North West Work in shop setting up stove and getting for work
notes: unsure in bold, wind direction entered in am as do not specify

journal_entry: Wind North East and snowy all day, hung grind stone, and mended rocking chair Ive

journal_entry: Wind Southerly fresh breeze and snowy all day
Wind NorthWest work in shop on various kinds of work. In the afternoon Henry Sargents house and barn was burned. to gather with 3 1/2 tons hay & a years wood prepared for the stove, furniture saved

journal_entry: very moderate Westerly in forenoon. Wind southerly in afternoon Work in the afternoon in the shop
Very moderate Westerly. Work in the afternon in Shop on boat And in the evening Went to Hall to a Lyceum. Question Resolved. there should be no restrictions in voting on account of sex

journal_entry: Wind North East and cold. Work in shop most all day

Wind North East and hauled around South East at night Work all day in shop on boat in evening snowy

journal_entry: Wind Southerly in morning at 10 AM wind came of North West Work in shop on boat the ice in the Harbor was cut clean and sent a drift A Lyceum in the evening but I did not go. At night growing cold
Moderate Westerly in forenoon and in the afternoon Calm in evening wind North Easterly work all day in shop on boat
Wind North East and stuck with snow. then hauled around North Work all day in shop on boat and finished planting

journal_entry: Wind North West wind moderate but the air cold in morning Went on board of Chromo. to measure for wooden whelps for windlass Work in shop filling saws. and various other kinds of work. at night calm
Wind S. S.East blowing fresh and in the morning thick with snow and later turned to rain
Wind North West & moderate Work in shop caulking boat

journal_entry: Wind West North West thermometer 10 degrees above zero. Work in shop filing saws for different people

Wind North East and thick with snow in forenoon. in the afternoon cleared up Work in shop acknowledged deed for Emma Summence Went to Lyceum in evening Question Resolved that the works of Nature is mroe pleasing to the eye than the works of Art. Decided in affirmative
notes: wind direction entered in am as do not specify, same with temperature

journal_entry: Wind Westerly in forenoon SouthWest at night and in the evening fresh Southerly. Work in shop
Wind Southerly in forenoon and gradualy hauled Westerly at night Wind SouthWest Work apart of the day making whelps to put on windlass
Wind NorthWest and pleasant good sleighing painted my boat in shop out sail and in

journal_entry: Wind Easterly and moderate rain all day Ice melting very fast
Wind Southerly snowy and rainy all day at night wind came NW
Wind West North West Geo Shaw goes on pay to day. Get provisions on bound Chromo & getting ready to sail as soon as the ice is out at Sullivan
notes: wind entered in am as do not specify

journal_entry: Wind Southerly and moderate Work on board of Chromo in forenoon cleaning anchored and in afternoon cut wood at the door

journal_entry: Wind South West Hearing the ice was out at Sullivan. got underway and went up in the afternoon. On the Ebb Tide at 1030 oclock in evening heavy ice came down and the vessel cut through it untill midnight. Let the big anchor fall from the Cat Head on the ice. but the ice so heavy it held the anchor up
notes: unsure in bold, wind entered in am as do not specify

journal_entry: Calm in morning then the wind breezed up NNW lay below the falls all day
notes: wind entered in am as do not specify, same with "breezed up"

journal_entry: Calm in morning and overcast. At 9 AM wind breezed up Southerly, about high water. Weighed anchor and went over the Falls to Crabtree & Haveys wharf to load random stone for Philadelphia for G.H. West. The Howard Havy being into the wharf a head of us we have to wait untill she finishes loading. at noon commenced snowing and in the afternoon turned to rain
Rainy in forenoon In the afternoon cleared up. Rigged up purchace to hoist stone. but did not get into the berth

very moderate and calm with very light snow got into the berth to load. but not being filled and not having the proper gear to work with Yhrat when it came night and the men went home we had taken on bound three stone
notes: unsure in bold, wind speed and weather cond entered in am as do not specify

journal_entry: Wind westerly and very fine Went to Geo Lyname and back to Chromo
notes: unsure in bold, wind direction entered in am as do not specify

journal_entry: Wind South West fresh breeze, work all day loading at night had on board 500 cubic ft or about 50 tune
notes: wind direction and speed entered in am as do not specify

journal_entry: Wind Southerly work all day loading stone
notes: wind direction entered in am as do not specify

journal_entry: Wind East South East fresh breeze and cloudy In the afternoon rainy got new foresale on board. Broke purchace block and quit work in afternoon at night got another block ready for work
notes: wind direction, speed and "cloudy" entered in am aas do not specify

journal_entry: Calm most all day at 3 oclock in the afternoon finished loading but not wind Enough to go over the Falls Filled water got bills of Laden & in the evening rainy
notes: unsure in bold, wind speed entered in am as do not specify

journal_entry: Rainy all forenoon then cleared up. wind N.E. at 3PM. tide served took pilot and cast of from wharf set sail. And struck in the Falls at 5PM on the inner point eastern side When the tide went vessel hueled down very large. ice cakes would strike bow of vessel with tremendous force vessel laying quiet on starboard side and at midnight vessel not leaking any
notes: unsure in bold, wind entered in am as do not specify

journal_entry: Wind N.E. and fine. At One AM vessel righted with the tide and heeled over on other side At 2.30 AM vessel came of stricking rocks with great force Causing the water to flow in hold 6 in 15 minutes with both pumps going. Got help and got in the Eastern Eddy. At noon 5 feet water in hold. On Ebb tide vessel began to tighten by sitting in mud both pumps going untill 11 oclock at night which reduced it to top of keel son and stayed pumping Crew played out
notes: unsure in bold, wind direction and speed

journal_entry: Wind South West Commencing pumping in the morning and got a suck on her at 11 AM Went to Franklin to sue owners on shipper of stone by counting the number of stroked pumped in one hour. It is estimated that 200.000 strokes was pumped out without the pumps resting one minute In the afternoon went to Hancock Neck and got the Str Electa towed down over the Falls at dark and anchored on flats near old Salt works
notes: unsure in bold, wind direction entered in am as do not specify

journal_entry: Wind Southerly vessel not leaking very bad on high water dont leak any on low water as the tide above it leaves her, have not formed over yet. what the damage is to the vessel.
