journal_entry: Wind South West fresh Passed through the Race into Long Island Sound at one oclock AM Wind blowing heavy At day light abreast of Hortons Point. tide turned ahead Wind hauled more Westerly. kept of and went back to New London. anchored at 9 AM. At 3 oclock PM wind of North West.
location: Race, Long Island, Hortons Point, New London

journal_entry: Wind West South West blowind fresh Chromo at New London Conn
Wind Northerly Got underway at New London at 8 AM Passed Falkners Island at 4 oclock P.M. Passed Eatons Neck at 8.30 P.M. Wind North North East Anchored at City Island at 11 P.M.
location: New London, Falkners island, Eatons Neck, City Island

journal_entry: Wind North East. fresh. Lay all day at City Island for orders

Wind Southerly Vessel at City Island N.Y. Telegraphed to New York City in morning for orders and got answer the laths was not sold. In the afternoon went to the City of New York by land. Got my orders where to go to discharge. then went back to City Island on board of vessel

Wind Southerly and overcast. Towed vessel from City Island N.J. to Hunters Point. where it is the intention to discharge the laths as per order of Consignee. on arriving there I find a Barge along side of the wharf and I cannot discharge untill she is out
Wind East North East blowing hard and heavy rain storm Vessel at Hunters Point New York

Wind East North East and and drizzling rain. In New York a half holly day unveiling M. Bartholdi Statue of Liberty We discharged a few laths by putting them of over the bow. could not get into the berth
Wind Easterly and drizzly all day. Got the laths all of deck and settled the wharf age AM 41 years old

Wind North East. and overcast Worked all daay to find out where I was going with the hold full of Staves, and find apart of them is going on board of the Bridgeport Steamer monday forenoon but do not know how many. Vessel in New York
Wind North North East Chromo in N.Y..

Wind North North East Vessel towed from Hunters Point to the Froot of Catherine St Pier 35 New York City and put on board Steamer Waterbury 2100 bundles of staves going to Bridgeport Coon It was the intention to put on board 3500 but as we only had two hours to work we did not have time to put on board any more than 2100

Wind Westerly Chromo in N.Y. Pier 35 E.R. foot of Catherine St at the Bridgeport Steamers wharf. and put on board 1400 bundles of staves, and with that we put on board yesterday make 3500 the amount required. And for which I have agreed with Mr. Peters to have fifteen dollards in addition to my freight for landing the amount of Staves before going to Rondout. In the afternoon took the tow for Rondout. N.Y
Wind Southerly Arrived at Rondout at sunset and went into the wharf where it is the intention to discharge the remainder of the staves
Wind northWest Chromo at Rondout The Agt of the James cement Co. being absent in the forenoon did not begin to discharge untill in the afternoon. then took out 2000 bundles of staves.
Wind South West fresh breeze. Finished discharging Staves at Rondout at noon. for the James Cement Co. and in the afternoon Commenced loading cement. bound to Boston Mass freight 18 cts
Wind South Easterly Chromo loaded at 4.30 PM with 1262 Bbls cement under deck at Rondout. Took the tow at dark for New York. when it commenced raining
Wind Easterly and raining untill 5 oclock AM when the wind came North West and blew a gale. Cast of from the tow at 2.30 PM and anchored at Haboken from Rondout yesterday

Wind Westerly Got underway at Haboken at 2 AM and went down on Jersey flats & anchored. At 6.30 took tug boat towed through Hell gate. Passed Eatons Neck at noon. At one PM double reefed mainsail blowing heavy. Passed Falkners Island at sunset Went through the Race at 10 P.M. At midnight half way from Watch Hill to Block Island. mainsail two reefed so ends these 24 hours
location: Haboken, Jersey City, Eatons Neck, Hell Gate, Falkners Island, Watch Hill, Block Island

journal_entry: Wind Westerly fresh breeze. Chromo with a two reef mainsail. Passed Tarpaulin Cove at 7 AM Vineyard Haven at 8 AM. Pollock Rip at 2 PM wind moderated Passed Cape Cod Light at 7 PM at 8 PM set all sail. Midnight about 15 miles from Cape Ann bearing N.N.W.
location: Tarpaulin Cove, Vineyard Haven, Pollock Rip, Cape Cod, Cape Ann

journal_entry: Wind moderate West at 2 AM tacked ship near Thatches Island. Passed in by Boston Light at 10 AM nearly becalmed anchored in Boston at 2 oclock P.M.
Wind Southerly Got into the dock to discharge at noon. and went to work and put out 300 Blocks of cement.

Wind Easterly Vessel at D Roby H. wharf discharging cement. In the evenin went to the Masonic Temple. and visited Winslow Lewis Lodge F. &. A.M. work on second degree. At 11 PM fresh breeze and heavy rain.
Wind North East and heavy rain Towed from Robys wharf to East Boston and discharged the bollanes of Cargo which is 100 blocks cement & settled freight
Wind North West heavy, laid at wharf East Boston all day, bound home. the wind blowing to hard to move

Wind North West by West Filled away from the wharf East Boston at 8 oclock am. Got down the harbor as far as Deer Island. and it blew so hard. anchored and laid untill 10 PM when got underway. Passed the Graves at midnight. so ends these 24 hours
location: East Boston, Deer Island, The Graves

journal_entry: Wind West North West Passed Thaches Island at 3 oclock A.M bound home. blowing heavy. At 10 A.M. moderated set all sail. Passed Seguin at 230 P.M. and anchored at Owls Head Harbor at 8 oclock P.M.
location: Thatcher Island, Seguin Island, Owls Head

journal_entry: Calm in the morning Got underway at Owls Head when the wind began to breeze up Westerly about 8.30 AM. At noon snow squalls then turned to rain Passed through Yorks Narrows at 3 oclock PM bound home Wind hauling Northerly and Easterly At dark wind East and thick with rain. Got to Bass Harbor at 8 oclock PM very moderate. At 11 oclock PM got anchor and went up in the Harbor thick and dark. and looks like heavy storm bearing
location: Owls Head, York Narrows, Bass Harbor

journal_entry: Vessel at Bass Harbor Wind East South East. heavy rain and a gale of wind. At 8 oclock the wind from E.S.E to S.S.W. and increased. At one P.M. let go the small anchor. At 2 PM Hedged in to the shore. paid out 45 fathoms on big anchor. and 30 fathoms on small anchor. and she stoped dragging. At 5 P.M. put a new line on the Hedge anchor and let that go At dark packed up my baggage ready to leave At 9 PM wind moderated and the vessel all right
Wind West North West and blowing a gale "Chromo" At Bass Harbor. and could not get out.

Wind Westerly and a very fresh breeze Got underway at Bass Harbor in the forenoon. and went home. In the afternoon the wind moderated. And got Capt. H. E. Tracy to take the vessel to go a trip as it is to early to haul up. and I do not care to go away again myself
Calm in the morning and a little snow but soon cleared up with the wind N.W. with fine moderate weather. Chromo at Winter Harbor

Wind Northerly. Capt. H. E. Tracy. Takes the Chromo to go a trip and gets her underway at Winter Harbor to go to Franklin to load. and I go with him to Franklin to help load Anchored at Mt Desert Ferry at 8 oclock P.M. paid Capt Ira B Fross five dollars his dividend of Sch Chromo

Wind South Easterly. Got underway at Mt Desert Ferry at day light and went to Sullivan but no boat there to tow over the Falls the vessel staid below. In the afternoon rainy Paid J P Gordon $85.00 for Franklin owners and Geo C Lynam $3500 for Sullivan owners of Sch Chromo

Wind North West. Towed over the Falls to J.P Gordons wharf at Franklin. in the forenoon, and commenced loading paving blocks for New York. The vessels papers will be endores to Capt. H. E. Tracy before going to sea.
Calm all day. Chromo finished loading at night. In the afternoon rainy Evening heavy blow

Wind North West. very heavy. The tug boat could not tow the Chromo from the wharf at Franklin, and my servises being no longer needed I walk to Sullivan take the Steam boat to So. Gouldsboro and go home. As I do not wish to go away again this fall H E Tracy goes the trip for me.
Wind Southerly Took the old Hog house down from my old place and moved it over to where I now live at My Sisters place. The building is to be put again to be used for a temporary blacksmith shop
Wind South West. moderate. about home.
Wind South West. done blacksmith work for the Sch Chromo by my forge out of door
Wind Southerly work on blacksmith shop. Evening heavy rain.
Wind South South West blowing very heavy work all day on a blacks smith shop. for myself. Paid Lewis Fross the balance of his wages for his time where he was with me in the Chromo.
Wind Easterly and at 10 AM commenced snowing In the afternoon the wind hauled around SouthWest and kept on snowing
Wind West fresh Thermometer 12 degrees above zero and went up to 23 degrees in the afternoon To blustering to work out of doors
Wind North West. and quite cold. Reg letter to O.W. Young So Hancock sending him 10 the dividend due him for 1/16 of Sch Chromo.
Wind North East. Thermometer at zero. Evening snowy
Wind North East Thermometer 18 degrees above. Work about home. little snow in evening
Wind North East fresh. snow blowing and blustering Filed saws and work in shop as it is two bulstering to work out.
Wind North West Fresh. work all day in my blasmith shop
Wind North West moderate Delivered on ton hay to Capt. Northern Bickford Shingled one side of the roof of my blacksmith shop Hired forty dollards of Crabtree & Havey payable on demand
Wind very moderate in the forenoon in the afternoon S.W. Hauled a load of hay from my old barn to Jemie Kingsleys my blacksmith shop
Wind very moderate Northerly and westerly Thermometer up to 40 degrees melting snow very fast. Helped Rodnie Pendleton haul up a large boat put out side windows on house. and worked about the shop.
Wind North East. Thermometer 32 degrees overcast.
Wind North East Sleet storm. Helped Capt. Chas David haul his vessel up to my wharf.
Wind North West in the afternoon fresh Sent N.E. Keene $10.00 dividend to 1/16 of Sch "Chromo" for O.W. Pitcher jobbing in shop
Wind South West fresh. Helped Charles Hampleton Moore the Schr C.H. Dexter in the Harbor. In the afternoon work in the Blacksmith shop for Samuel Sargent on his sled.
Wind North North East rain and sleet all day. made a ring bolt to set in ledge to make vessels fast to. work in shop all day.
Wind Westerly. Set Ring bolt in Ledge South of my wharf to make vessels fast to lying at the wharf
Wind Southerly fresh went in the woods on the head of our lot to look out a chance to have some wood choped came out at noon In the afternoon heavy rain. work in the Blacksmith shop.
Calm all day. Thermometer 45 degrees
Light air North East. work in the shop in the forenoon & made a ring bolt And in the afternoon set the ring bolt in a ledge at the North of our wharf to make vessels fast to.
Moderate Southerly wind. made a ventilator for my blacksmith shop. In the evening went to a Sociable at the Hall. Got up by the Baptist association
A very light air of wind North West in forenoon. and calm in the afternoon. Work about home all day. In the evening went to the Hall to attend a Masonic meeting.
Very moderate North West wind Thermometer 32 Work all day in the blacksmith shop for myself was married 25 years ago to night
Wind Southerly and rainy all day. work in the shop at home. In the evening went to the Hall to see the presents on the Christmas tree
Christmas day. heavy rain early in the morning At 8 AM the wind North West and clear blowing fresh About home.
Wind N.N.E and overcast Staid about home all day.
Wind out Southerly in morning and hauled around westerly during the day. work about home on various jobs both in the Carpenters shop and Blacksmith shop
Wind westerly fresh. Commenced to rebuild Geo Tracys fish boat by raising her one streak and putting wash boards on.
Wind North West Work all day in the Blacksmith shop In the evening went to the Masonic Lodge at the Hall
Wind Northerly Thermometer 12 degrees below zero. at sunrise At noon at 0 To cold to work in the shop without any fire. Therefore I staid in the house and worked on a toy boat for a house ornament.

Wind North East. Thermometer 6 degrees above zero in the morning. The ground all bore of snow. But at night it commenced snowing to cold to work in the shop having no fire. Living in ine part of Jennie Kingsleys house. have lived here since her husband died. In the evening raining
Wind Southerly and heavy rain all day. No snow on the ground. Work all day on Capt. G.W. Tracy's boat in shop of my sister. whose home I occupy apart
Wind Northerly and snowy
Wind NorthWest Thermometer at 0' at sunrise. worked one half day on GW Tracys boat
Wind Westerly and cold work in shop
About calm all day weather overcast work in shop. went to the Hall in evening to a masonic meeting
Wind Easterly and a mixture of snow and rain work in shop at home on G.W. Tracys boat and finished the Carpenter work

Wind NorthWest. Wrote letter to Dr Hagarthy Steuben to come and visit my wife who has been unwell for a long time. But was taken down very suddenly last night. on writing this 9 PM the Dr has not come
Wind Northerly Thermometer 2-0' below zero. did not work much but staid in the house with my wife who is sick and was visited by Dr Hagarthy of Steuben
Wind moderate North Thermometer 8 below 0 at sunrise but went up to 10 above 0' at noon. At night fell to zero.
Wind Southerly and rain. At 10 cleared of wind NorthWest. although there is not much snow it is good sleighing Not doing much work on account of my wife being sick

Wind NorthWest work in shop Dr. Hagarthy of Steuben called to see my wife who is troubled with a lame back. caused by the kidneys and liver being out of order. and the Dr says the spine is affected also
Wind South West In the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting
Wind North West Thermometer 22' above zero. Not doing much work on account of my wife being sick
Wind East North East blowing a gale. and a terrific snow storm. Thermometer 6' above 0 Worked in the blacksmith shop apart of the day for GW Tracy
Wind N.N. East thermometer 12' above zero. My wife is getting better she has been troubled with a kidney trouble also spine affected
Wind North East at home
Wind North East and snowy. At night S.E. and rainy. with a heavy blow. work about home
Wind W.N.W blowing heavy made a hell out of canvas for my circular saw
Wind W.N.W. in forenoon. In the afternoon hauled around South East In the evening Went to a masonic meeting at the Hall
Wind N. East in forenoon hauled around Southerly. with snow
Wind Westerly blowing a gale Work at home. run the circular saw. sawing out boat timbers
Wind Southerly and overcast work a little in the blacksmith shop
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. In the afternoon went to Prospect accompanied by my daughter to make a call on Dr.  Larrabee who has been sick. but now is slowly gaming
Wind Southerly and rainy all day. melting the snow very fast
Wind Northwest in morning and South West in the afternoon
Wind N.N.E. warm in morning but grew colder at night. In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting
Wind Northerly in morning Thermometer 0' below zero. Afternoon moderated helped E. Kingsley haul wood out of the pasture for Jermie Kingsley
Wind South West and in the afternoon little rainy
Wind Southerly fresh. with heavy rain all day
Calm all day overcast. and partialy foggy or a scoth mist
Wind North West. quite fresh Getting ready for a party. In the evening reed about twenty invited guests.
Wind Northerly with light snow. Work in shop building a boat for J.P. Gordon at Franklin
Wind North East Thermometer 6 degrees above zero. In the Evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting

Wind NorthEast and the thermometer at zero in the morning & snowing In the afternoon wind Southerly Thermometer 36' above 0 with a little fog and rain Registered and sent W.H. Card $14.45 for laths bought last fall

Wind NorthWest One dollar Sent ER Wingate Sec. Narraguagus Lodge at Cherryfield it being the amount of my dues to that Lodge. Sent petitions to Pleiades Lodge at Milbridge F R AM also to Lygonia Lodge and Estonic of Ellsworth for their action in regard to hacing a Lodge at Winter Harbor. the petitions had 20 signers each Turned caulking mallet for Capt H.E. Tracy and work in shop. on a boat I am building
moderate West N.W. wind, Thermometer 12' degrees above 0 work in the shop most of the day.
Wind North East. with a very little snow
Wind North East Thermometer 12' above zero. Work at home in shop on various kinds of work
Wind South East fresh. Snowed untill three oclock PM then turned to rain. Port garboard plack on a skiff
Calm in morning At 8 AM the wind breezed up fresh North West work in shop in boat In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting
Wind Northerly in forenoon. and Southerly in the afternoon. About home working in the shop on boat. Thermometer 33' above 0
Wind North East and snowing all day. Sent to Prospect to Dr Larrabee for medicine for my wife. who is very sick. and I stay in the house
Wind North West fresh. About home doing no work in particular on account of my wife being sick
Wind N. N. West. At 9 PM the thermometer at 0'

Went to Franklin with W.A. Millikwn to see about Selling my part of the Chromo. He wishes to but it he can put a man in her. On seeing the Franklin owners it is agreed to. and I sell my 3/32 and Capt. Fross 1/32 Came home at night
Wind S.S.W. and snowing in the forenoon. In the afternoon the wind South and rainy. about home
Calm in forenoon and warm. Wind South East in the afternoon. Work all day in shop on boat. In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting
Wind North West quite moderate. work about home in shop
Wind North East fresh and commenced snowing at 3 oclock P.M. finished planking a boat in shop. In the evening blowing a gale heavy storm
Wind South West moderate. Gave a bill of sail of my 3/32 and Capt Fross 1/32 of Sch "Chromo" to W.A Miliken of Bar Harbor. the 1/8 sold for $300. took two notes on demand for the amount
Wind West North West about home all day
Wind Northerly moderate. timbered out my skiff I am building
Wind E.S. East snowy in afternoon work about home

Wind NorthWest Thermometer 20' above 0 The skiff I have been building is done except the work on the inside which I leave untill warm weather so I can paint her before putting the ceiling in. In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting
Wind South in the morning and snowing untill noon when it hauled Easterly and rained hard At 3 PM the wind came of West heavy did no work in particular. having company
Wind North West. blowing a gale too cold and blustering to work in shop
Wind Northerly in morning and cold. In afternoon wind South East. In the evening Snow and rain
Wind South West. Got Geo; Childs horse and went to West Gouldsboro, accompanied by my sister. came back same day
Wind W.N.W. heavy run the wind untill sawed stove wood with circular saw
Wind North West Thermometer at zero to cold to work in the Shop
Wind Southerly fresh and overcast with a very little snow work about home In the evening went to a Masonic meeting at the Hall
Wind Northerly. At noon went to South Gouldsboro took the Str "Sebanora" and went to Bar Harbor and In the evening went to the Masonic Lodge. worked on the second degree

Wind Easterly At noon took the Str Sebenoa at Bar Harbor and went to South Gouldsboro and then home by land Reed letter from Sec. Lygonia Lodge I am Ellsworth. That they recommend that the most worshipped Grand Master of the Grand Lodge of Maine. grant a dispensation to the brethren of Winter Harbor to establish a Masonic Lodge at that place

Wind moderate N.W. Thermometer at zero in morning. It being to cold to work, and having a severe cold. did not attempt to work in the shop. Reed letter from Sec. Estonic Lodge FR AM that the petition for a Lodge at Winter Harbor was returned as the Lodge had voted they had no power to act in the premises
Wind Easterly and a cold snow storm

Wind Easterly and fine. The snow of yesterday drifted bad. Went to Town meeting with Charles Smith Elected Albert R. Joy myself and R R Joy for the board of select men. overseers of the pror. road commencies &e. PL Hill Town Clerk S L Tracy treasurer & D. W. Joy tax collector. In the afternoon Nathan A Bickford & myself went to Milbridge to get Pleiades Lodge to give consent to let us have a Lodge at Winter Harbor. And it was voted to lay it over untill the next Regular meeting. Staid at Milbridge all night
Wind North West and fine pleasant weather. Left Milbridge in the forenoon for home but having many places to call did not get home untill in the afternoon
Wind Southerly work in shop making moulds getting ready to build a boat In the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting
Wind Southerly with snow and rain all day. Work in shop building boats
Wind North Blowing heavy with a heavy snow storm work in shop
Wind N.N.E. and a little showery in the afternoon Work in shop all day
Wind North by East snow melts very fast
Wind Northerly and moderate Went to the Lower Harbor to inspect the bridge as to the necessary repairs. I assume the responsibility as one of the select men of the town
Wind Northerly and fresh work about home wrote letter to the Sec of the Grand Lodge F & A. M.
Wind Northerly and moderate work in shop In evening went to Lodge at Hall. Stella 14 to day
Wind Northerly work in shop
Wind North East work in shop building boats

Wind North East apart of the time rain squalls then snow squalls. put the garboards on a boat building in the shop. In the afternoon went to Edmund Grovers house with Wilber Vose & SL Kingsley to look after Mr Grovers Interest financially. that he is not defrauded by a bond he gives on his place to Vose & others
Wind N.N. East partially cloudy
Wind Southerly work in shop building boats
Wind South East In the afternoon snow and rain work in shop
Wind NorthWest heavy work in shop. building boats In the evening went to the hall to a masonic meeting
Wind from West in forenoon to South West in afternoon To cold to work in shop
Wind Southerly and heavy with rain. at noon the wind West blowing a gale

Wind West blowing a gale run the windmill in forenoon sawing In the afternoon wrote an agreement from Jennie Kingsley to Stephen L. Kingsley where by she agrees to bond Grindstone Point to the said Kingsley for $2100 as soon as she can get a Guardian appointed for her son S.L. Kingsley agrees to pay 300 for a bond
Wind Westerly. about home

Wind South East and heavy rain all day Made my first payment to R. Pendleton $26.02 for the building of a Steamer to run from Bar Harbor to Winter Harbor of which I shall represent 1/64 the Steamer will cost abt $6660
Wind Northerly and thick with snow. work in shop and put timber in boat
Wind Westerly run mill in forenoon turning for R. Pendleton And in the afternoon went to Prospect Harbor on town business

Wind Westerly Went to Bar Harbor in John Lynams yacht with Capt H.E. Tracy to get my charts that I left on board the Chromo last winter The Chromo was hauled up in N.Y last winter and had no arrived with coal for W A Milliken
Wind Easterly. and pleasant. work in shop on different jobs
Wind NorthEast, at 7 am commenced snowing. and the wind and snow kept increasing all day. and at night it was in my opinion the toughest N.E. gale and snow storm for the winter work in shop on boats
Wind North and fresh. About home
Wind Easterly. snow and rain in forenoon overcast all day painted boats in shop
Nearly calm with a very light air of wind Southerly. overcast and partially foggy. work in shop at home
Wind heavy W.N.W taking valuations as one of the board of select men In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting
Wind W.N.W fresh calling at the houses of Winter Harbor taking the valuations of property
Moderate North West in forenoon South West in afternoon Finished all the work of taking the valuations at this place, and went to the Lower Harbor and took the valuation there
Calm all forenoon and pleasant In the afternoon wind Southerly and overcast. painted two boats in shop am not to work for the town today
Nearly calm all day. very fine with a light air South West in the afternoon Took my wife out on a little ride. the first time out since Christmas been confined to the house nearly all the time since

Wind North North West and fine Took a team and went to West Gouldsboro taking the valuation of the town. going the old read and taking them all as far as Frank Bunkers there went to West Gouldsboro to stop all night and commence against nathan shaws the limits of my route and work home stoped at John Shaws
Wind NorthWest. cool commenced talking valuation at West Gouldsboro. and work toward home On arriving at Frank Bunkers I had finished all my work talking valuation and drove home arriving at 2 P.M.
Wind North fresh work in the black smith shop in the forenoon. And took most all the afternoon to write a letter to the Grand Master In the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting
Wind northerly fresh. about home working on boats for Pendleton & Stevens

Very light air of wind NorthWest in forenoon Southerly in the afternoon. Work in Shop on boats. Received letter from Secretary of Pleiades Lodge. in regard to our petition for a new Lodge here Sec writes It was Indefitinally postponed. R. Pendletons house burned cheen 8081 oclock in the evening
Wind South Easterly and drizzling rain work in the shop at home
Wind North West overcast in the forenoon. Fine weather in the afternoon
Light air N.W. in forenoon. then calm. afternoon wind Southerly. Evening North and snowy. but moderate. Work in shop.
Wind North. work in shop in forenoon. in the afternoon work for Chas Smith making gutters for the house and putting up Hhds to catch water
Wind Northerly work all day for Charles Smith. on the work I commenced yesterday noon and finished it at 6 oclock PM in the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting
Wind Westerly moderate. worked 3/4 day fror Pendleton & Stevens caulking and painting the sloop boat "Little Nell"
Wind Northerly work all day on the Little Nells caulking painting &c. for Pendleton & Stevens
Wind Southerly and fine. work all day for Pendleton & Stevens on the Little Nell and launched her at night
Wind Easterly. and rainy all day
Light air Northwest in morning. At 10 am wind Southerly fresh work on the yacht Little Nell for Pendleton & Stevens laying plot form In afternoon work in shop for my self
Wind Easterly and very heavy rain. Wind hauled Northerly in the afternoon Work at home in shop
Wind Southerly partially cloudy. but quite pleasant. work at home. In evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting
Wind South East overcast. Put center board in dova for Jordan Joy. Had piano tuned
Wind East South East very heavy with tremendous rain Went to Prospect Harbor. in the afternoon on town business
Wind Southerly and rainy worked apart of the day in boat shop Then ordered a crew to repair the highway as the heavy rain had washed out the road. worked a part of the day in the blacksmith shop
Wind Northerly Went to Prospect Harbor after Dr Larrabee for Edmund Groves

Calm in the morning walked to So Gouldsboro took the Str Rockland went to Bar Harbor then took the Str City of Richmond for Portland to attend the Grand Lodge of F& A.M. Arrived in Portland at 11 oclock P.M. will stop the remainder of the night on bound of the Str City of Richmond the object of the trip to Portland is to present a petition to the Grand Lodge for them to grant a dispensation to our Lodge of Instructions at Winter Harbor

Wind South West and fine The Grand lodge called to order by by the Grand Master Fressender I day at 9.20 AM. and at the proper time our petition. for for a dispensation was called up, and it is to go before the committee on dispensations tomorrow morning at 8 was present in the afternoon at the election of officers and Frank E. Sleeper elected Grand Master

Wind Southerly our petition for a dispensation. went before the comittee at 8 AM. and after hearing in regard to a new Lodge at Winter Harbor The Remonstrance was read from Pleiades Lodge signed by 50 or more masons. The Committees report will be handed in tomorrow morning In the afternoon witnessed the work of the third degree by the Grand Lodge

Very moderate Southerly wind. Grand Lodge opened at 9 oclock A.M. The committee on dispensations and Charters handed in their report and that was that the Masons at Winter Harbor had not complied with all the laws. They applying to the three nearest Lodges when they should apply to all of the Lodges affected by a new Lodge and it is left to the new Master to grant a dispensation if he thinks favorable after the fourth Lodge votes. finished all business and installed the Grand officers, and closed the Lodge at noon the annual business done
Wind Southerly and overcast Stoping in Portland the Grand Lodge closed yesterday noon. but as I have got a return ticket I cannot use it untill the Str City of Richmond goes East

Wind South and overcast Arrived in Rockland at 6 oclock AM. from Portland on Str. City of Richmond bound home. Left Rockland at 7.45 AM. on same Steamer Arrived at Bar Harbor at 2 oclock P.M. At 6 oclock P.M. took Str Rockland for South Goulsboro on arriving at South Gouldsboro found a team waiting for me and arrived home at dark raining
Wind Southerly and warm. about home.
Wind South Easterly and pleasant At Prospect Harbor assessing taxes home at night
Wind Southerly Went to Prospect assessing taxes came home at night
Wind Northerly Fresh Went to Prospect Harbor assessing taxes home at night. In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting
Wind Northerly in the morning and southerly in the afternoon Went to Prospect Harbor in the morning assessing taxes back at night

Wind North East in forenoon and Southerly in the afternoon Went over the Prospect Harbor in the morning assessing taxes. After getting through with the days work stoped the evening at the meeting house to hear Pulesson Luce speak on education came home at 10 PM
Wind Northerly in morning and Southerly in the afternoon went to Prospect Harbor in the morning assessing taxes back home at night

Wind Southerly about home. called to visit Edmund Grover in the forenoon who is very sick and can never get well. In the afternoon called to visit Amasiah Southard who is very sick & no probability of ever being any better

Wind Southerly Went to Prospect assessing taxes. Went to Dr. C. C. Larrabee to stop through the night On my way to Prospect in the morning the wagon broke down and I spell out not seriously hurt  got another inwl went along
Wind Southerly Went to A.R. Joys house. Prospect. from Dr Larrabees house assessing taxes came home at night
Wind South Easterly rain and fog all day went to Prospect Harbor on town business in the morning lack at night. This is our Lodge night but we voted at our last meeting to hang up a while
Wind Southerly and partially cloudy. Went to Prospect Harbor assessing taxes home at night
Wind Southerly Went to Prospect Harbor assessing taxes got through with the town tax and one District tax home at night
Wind North East Went to Prospect Harbor assessing the taxes of Dist No 3. South Gouldsboro Finished at 6 oclock and came home am now done with house and wagon I have been using
Wind South East overcast most all day Visited Edmund Grover, and Amaziah Southard who is very sick not able to leave the bed
Wind Southerly about home. cleaning up door yard
Wind Southerly Fresh. Work all day for R. Pendleton on row boats
Wind Southerly rainy all day work about home Reed check from J.R. Hammond for $250 on acct for a piece of land I have agreed to sell for $900
Wind Southerly about home. Got a quit claim deed from Lewis Fross of the back lot known as the Steven Rand back lot

Wind North East and showery Got quit claim deed from Wm Abbot and Loving Rand of the lack lot known as the Stephen Rand back lot. With Lewis Fross deed and the Rand deed the whole lot is owned. Wrote Quit claim deed of the above lot to J.R. Hammond
Wind Easterly work in shop at home. have $50 on acct of land sold to Capt J.R. Hammond
Wind North East Showery at night about home visited Mr. Edmund Grover who is sick
Wind all around the compass cloudy and misty hired A.G. Gervish $200 payable in one and two years at 7 percent
Wind Southerly workin shop in forenoon and put out a new boat for R Pendleton
Wind South Easterly and moderate. Work 1/2 forenoon for R. Pendleton and worked in Blackdmith shop in afternoon. In the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting
Wind Southerly and in the afternoon thick with fog Commenced for work for E. J. Hammond on his new horse
Wind Easterly Commenced work the second day on E J Hammonds House at  7 AM and at 2.30 PM quite work on account of rain
Wind North East. Work all day on E.J. Hammonds house at Winter Harbor. Settled with Capt J R Hammond for Labor on E. J. Hammonds for house 2 days and 6 1/2 hours the past week got 1/2 per day $5.30

Wind Easterly fine weather. Visited Edmund Grover who is very sick. Amasiah Southard and Loren Rand all of which their chances are quite doubtful of recovery More especially Mr. Grover and Mr. Southard
Wind South West fresh. Work in forenoon on E.J. Hammonds house and being short of lumber worked in my shop in the afternoon
Wind Southerly work in the shop apart of the day. and went to R. Rands after lumber for myself
Wind Southerly and thick with fog work at home in shop
Wind Easterly heavy rain in the morning then cleared up Worked in shop at home and finished a skiff complete that I have been building
Wind Southerly and moderate. Went to Bar Harbor in the Amazon with Wm Guptill my business was to see about investing money in the land Co. but there was no stock for sale

Wind Southerly work about home The lumber arrived for E.J. Hammonds house and I shall go to work monday on the house. Settled for labor on E.J. Hammonds horse at $2.00 per day only working 1/2 day the past week
Wind SouthWest. Took skiff out of the shop and put her in the water. carried her around to the Harbor.and put her on board of the Sch A.G. Brooks to send up to Franklin
Wind SouthWest Thermometer 80' work all day for E.J. Hammond on house
Wind North East fresh and fine work all day on E.J. Hammonds house
Wind Southerly Work all day for E.J. Hammond on house
Wind Southerly afternoon little rainy. Work all day for E.j. Hammond on his house
Wind SouthWest . quite warm Work all day for E.J. Hammond
Wind Westerly in forenoon and hauled out in the afternoon and blew fresh. Work for E. J. Hammond all day. on house shingling roof
Wind Southerly and hot. about home
Wind South Easterly and partialy foggy In the forenoon went to Mr. Wm. Dodger. and agreed to bond a piece of land. some time during the week. In the afternoon worked on house for E.J. Hammond
Wind Southerly thick with fog and wet, work all day on E.J. Hammonds house
Wind Southerly heavy rain all day. work on the inside of E.J. Hammonds house all day

Wind Southerly and thick with fog. in the morn Started for Bar Harbor at 7 A.M. in yacht little Nell At 8 the fog lifted arrived at noon my business was to get a bond for a deed written. In afternoon wind North West. Bought a horse power machine of W.A. Milliken & Brought it to South Gouldsboro in the Str Silver Star
Wind North West in morning. Southerly in the afternoon. and the Thermometer 80' In the evening went to the Hall to a religious meeting

Wind Westerly Went to the land of Mr Lodge with compass and run across one end of the lot. then went to the house and bonded a piece of land paid $100 on board and $650. due in two years from date In the afternoon went to So Gouldsboro and hauled home a horse power machine bought of W.A. Milliken
Wind Southerly work all day for E.J. Hammond. on house and stable
Moderate Southerly Thermometer $5 at noon in shade Work all day on EJ Hammonds Stable
Wind Southerly Thermometer 102' at noon in shade Work all day on Stable for EJ Hammond
Wind Southerly Wrote letter to Frank E. Sleeper Sebattis Me. Master of Ground Lodge Work all day on EJ Hammonds stable Thermometer 90'
Wind very moderate Southerly and Thermometer 7' work all day on E.J. Hammonds Stable
Wind moderate NorthWest untill 3 oclock PM. when it hauled out Southerly
Wind Southerly Partially foggy Celebration day but none of it here very moderate. Work about home most all day on a horse power machine. getting it ready for work

Wind SouthWest fresh and cool and apart of the time thick with fog. Work 3/4 day on E.J. Hammonds house. and run out land next to J.P. Joys land 1/4 day the piece of land run I intend to convey 1/2 undivided to R Pendleton
Wind out South thick with fog. and little showery Work all day on EJ Hammonds Stable.
Wind South West fog cleared up work all day on EJ Hammonds Stable
Moderate Westerly wind in morning. then hauled out Southerly Thermometer 78 degrees. Work in shop at home doing some turning for EJ Hammonds house
Wind Southerly work in forenoon repairing the bridge across the Millstream In the afternoon work on EJ Hammonds stable
Wind South East rain in the afternoon. and foggy
Wind Easterly and thick with fog Work all day on E J Hammonds Stable
Wind Northerly untill 3 P.M. then wind Southerly Work all day on E J Hammonds stable. Reed letter from Frank E. Sleeper Grand Master Sabbatis Me
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. Work all day shingling roof od E J Hammonds stable
Wind North West very heavy breeze all day. Work on E. J. Hammonds stable
Wind N.N.W. fresh breeze work all day clap boarding E J Hammonds stable In evening went to a religious meeting at the hall
Wind Southerly Work all day on E. J. Hammonds stable. laying clapboards
Wind NorthWest in morning and Southerly in the afternoon
Wind moderate Easterly and a little rainy in the forenoon. Work all day on E J Hammonds stable laying clapboards. In evening went to a religious meeting at the hall
Wind Southerly Work all day on E.J. Hammonds Stable
Wind Southerly and apart of the day thick with fog. Work all day on E.J. Hammonds house & stable
Wind Southerly and apart of the day thick with fog. Went to South Gouldsboro. and took Str. Silver Star. went to Bar Harbor. and collected $100. due from R Pendleton came home at night
Wind S S East. rainy work on stable of E.J. Hammond
Wind Southerly work on stable of EJ Hammond Heavy rain most all day and thick with fog
Wind Southerly rainy all day and thick with fog
Wind Southerly and rainy Commenced building Piazza around the house of E.J. Hammond
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. Work all day on Piazza of house of Edw. J. Hammond
Wind Southerly fog lifted up in the afternoon Work three fourth day on E J Hammonds house. and me fourth day turning posts for Prospect Harbor School house
Wind Southerly and thick with fog Work all day on E J Hammonds house. building piazza

Wind Southerly Wind Southerly and thick with fog Work all day on house of E.J. Hammond In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting The object of this special meeting to get a regular Lodge established here. and were visited by Herbert Harris D.D.G.M. of East Machias. At end of meeting things looked favorable. but offisnd known
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. Work all day on E J Hammonds house accts settled to date
In the morning heavy thunder & lightning accompanied by heavy rain. cleared up at 10 oclock in forenoon and people opened their hay In the afternoon fine weather
Wind Northerly and moderate in forenoon Thermometer 94. Afternoon wind Southerly & moderate. The first hay day for two weeks Work all day on E J Hammonds house
Wind very moderate Southerly fine weather. Work all day on E.J. Hammonds house
Wind Southerly work all day on E.J. Hammonds house
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. work all day on E J Hammonds house
Wind Southerly and thick with fog work all day on E J hammonds horse
Wind Southerly and foggy in forenoon and heavy rain in afternoon with thunder work all day on E J Hammonds house
Wind North fine fresh breeze and clear. about home
Wind Northerly and fine. Work all day on E J Hammonds house. shingling the walls above the piazza
Moderate Westerly wind Work all day on E J Hammonds house
Wind Southerly clear in forenoon but a little fog in afternoon. Work all day for E J Hammond on house
Wind S.S. East. overcast and in the afternoon rainy work all day on piazza of house of E.J. Hammonds
Wind Southerly heavy rain & thick with fog untill 5 oclock PM when it cleared up with the wind Northerly Work all day on the in side of E J Hammonds house on finish
Wind North fresh work all day on house of E.J. Hammond and finished. making 50 days work at $2.00 per day $100. Although the house is not done I have left. to see about building a house for my self
Wind North West and fine. In the evening went to the Hall to a religious meeting but the minister did not come therefore there was none
Light air of wind W. in morning and in the afternoon South West went to Bar Harbor in a skiff got some Rend rock to blast out the corner of the highway near the Hotel
Wind Southerly and foggy. Went to Birch Harbor chartered a vessel of Andrew Jackson Lindsey to go to Machias after lumber fa house for myself. The vessels name is the Billow
NorthWest wind and fine weather. commenced blasting on the corner of the Highway near the Hotel
Wind South East at noon commenced raining and rained heavy the remainder of the day hired $200 of Crabtree & Havey for 90 days
Wind Westerly and hauled S.W. Went to Bar Harbor to collect money due me. back at night Received of Dispensation from Grand Lodge. Empowering us to meet and make masons

Calm in the forennon At noon the wind breezed up SouthWest. Went to Birch Harbor and went on board of the Sch. Billow got underway and went out for Machias after lumber for myself. after getting out got beclamed and drifted into Prospect and anchored and I walked home

Moderate wind Northerly went to Prospect and got the Billow underway and went out for Machias after lumber. Passed Petitnoon at noon Jonesport at 3 PM wind hauled Westerly anchored at Machias Port at 9 oclock in the evening
Wind Southerly. got underway at Machias port at 8 oclock AM. fine rain got to East Machias at 11AM

Wind Easterly commenced loading my house frame at noon. and took in in as fast as they would saw it and haul it. house frame purchased of P. S. J. Tolbs & Co. In the evening went to the Town Hall at East Machias to a play entitled Dairy Maids
Wind North East. Loading lumber at East Machias as fast as we could get it In the afternoon very heavy rain
Wind Northerly and overcast. got all my dimention sheld on board the little Sch Billow. Andrew J. Lindsey Master
Wind North West fresh, and pleasant at East Machias. buying lumber and loading it on board of a vessel called the Billow

Calm in morning on the highwater. On the Ebb tide. wind came NorthWest. but to late to leave the wharf at East Machias When the vessel floated again in the afternoon Sailed out of East. Machias bound home to Winter Harbor with lumber for myself Sch Billow Capt A.J. Lindsey. passed Averys Rock at sunset Anchored at Starboards cove at 9 PM. N.W. from Libby Island

Moderate Westerly wind got underway at Starboard cove at sunrise. At noon up to Moose abeck. took the wind South West, at dark becalmed about half way between Petitnan Light and Nash Island Light Midnight abrest of Petitenam light air North
Wind Northerly at daylight up to Mark Island. bound into Winter Harbor. arriving at 8 AM. and went into my wharf and commenced discharging lumber In the afternoon wind Southerly
Wind Easterly discharging lumber at my wharf
Wind Easterly and clear. Vessel discharged Commenced hauling lumber from the wharf to the place where I intend to build
Wind Southerly hauling lumber all day from the wharf. and at night had it all hauled up

Wind South Easterly Visited Mrs. French by request. she complaining of the highway or of a certain rock which caused her to fall. In afternoon examined highway accompanied by Wm. Farrow. and found as follows viz From Rock to middle of the nearest wheel rut 4 ft. From Rock to middle of horse tracks as traveled 7 1/2 ft from Rock to opposite side of road to the first obstruction which is a rock 21 1/2 ft.

Wind Northerly showery and quite rough. Went to Bar Harbor in New Steamer "Winter Harbor" with my wife. Not having any business whatever only went as being an owner in the boat and am much please with her came home at night
Wind Northerly in forenoon. and calm in afternoon. Visited Edmund Grover who is very sick
Wind Southerly work about home.
Wind Southerly Went to Bar Harbor in the little Str Winter Harbor apart for pleasure and business

Wind Southerly work all day on highway blasting rocks In the evening went to the Hall to out first masonic meeting under dispensatino of the Grand Lodge organized with proper officers my self Master A.G. Gervish S.W. H C Gupill J W heavy squall with rain
Wind Westerly fresh. work all day on highway blasting rocks
Wind Southerly work around the ruins of my old house that I have had torn down
Wind Southerly and heavy rain in forenoon. Afternoon wind North. Work around my old cellar burning up the old Trash from the old house
Wind Northerly in forenoon & Southerly in the afternoon In the evening went to a religious meeting at the Hall
Wind Easterly Commenced in the afternoon to clear out the old cellar getting ready for a new wall
Wind Easterly work on cellar in forenoon and in the afternoon went to East Sullivan after Henry Workman to lay up wall in my cellar. he has not promised to come for sure.
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. Went to Bar Harbor in Str Winter Harbor and back home at night
Wind NorthWest and fine weather work all day on cellar with three other men
Wind N.N.W. Work all day on my cellar with six men
Wind NorthWest fine weather work on my cellar beside myself Falbot workmen melvin Torrey Charles Sargent Eugene Tracy & William Giles
Calm in morning Later in the day the wind breezed up SouthWest. Went to So. Gouldsboro after Geo. Sargent to work for me in cellar. he has agreed to come tomorrow
Wind SouthWest fresh. work all day on cellar with four men
Wind N.N.W. good breeze worked with four men on cellar
Wind SouthWest worked in cellar in forenoon. In afternoon went to West Bay after a man to finish laying my cellar wall. In evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting.
Wind Westerly work all day on my cellar
Wind Northerly and fine. Went to Bar Harbor in Str Winter Harbor to collect pay for the Sch. Chromo. that was sold to W A Milliken in February. Settled Came back at night.
Wind North East. had stone hauled for cellar. at night fresh breeze and heavy rain
Wind NorthWest fresh and chilly Went to a religious meeting at the Hall
Wind SouthWest work all day on cellar wall with the help of Talbot workman R.M. Torvey George Sargent and Chas. Sargent
Wind SouthWest very smoky work all cellar wall for myself
Wind Southerly work all day on cellar wall Went to a masonic meeting at the Hall

Wind Southerly and very smoky did no work in the forenoon. But in the afternoon went to the school house to a district meeting and at said meeting voted to sell the School house lot for $100. to E.J. Hammond and others for a Hotel voted to move the School house of the lot on to one owned by Theodore P.O. Riley voted to raise $600 myself one of the Committe

Wind Southerly and smoky and foggy. Being one of the Comittee to move the school hoouse and make out deeds from the District to those who have just purchased it and from the new prospered lot to the District I have cquin my whole attention to it
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. work while for my self around the cellar
Wind Southerly
Wind South and thick with fog. Blasted rocks for myself
Wind South Easterly and partially foggy. Work one half day on cellar with oxen hauling stone to grade up

Went to a masonic meeting at the Hall visited by Herbert Harris D.D.G.M. of East Machias Signed note of $100 payable to J.A. Merrell &Eco Portland for Collars Jewells IE and endorsed by R. Pendleton payable in 120 days dated oct 4

Wind Northerly Went to Bar Harbor in the Str Acadia took the ferry boat to Mt. Desert Ferry, and the team to Ellsworth to take Council on articles in the Sch District Warrant. whereby the District has noted to sell the lot for $100 but no one authorized to give deed. and was advised to have another meeting Came back to Bar Harbor at 7.15 PM went to the Masonic meeting. worked on the 3d degree a Mr Ladd being candidate. Stoped at Bar Harbor all night
Wind Westerly. Got Breakdast at the Rodick Bar Harbor. and came home in a boat in forenoon
Wind NorthWest. about home all day
Wind NorthWest Went to a religious meeting in the evening at the Hall
Wind Southerly blasting rocks in the field
Wind North Easterly and rainy in the forenoon in the afternoon better weather Wrote deed from Rodric Pendleton to E.A. Baker. Received plans for a horse I have I have been waiting for this two weeks

Wind NorthWest blowing heavy hired a team and went to West Sullivan to pay Crabtree & Havy $200. Then hired the $200 again of them for one year. business also with A. Martin abt work on my house. Went to a masonic meeting at the Hall and exemplified work
Wind SouthWest reed check of $4.69 dividend to 1/64 for Str. Winter Harbor. agreed upon the lines between my self and Capt J.H. Smallidges land
Wind NorthWest work about home

Wind Northerly hauled stone all day around my cellar In the evening went to a district meeting at School house to instruct the committee to give deed of School house lot. and to appoint a committe for that purpose
Wind West South West. very fresh but pleasant
Wind Southerly Did nothing but wait for the boss carpenter untill three oclock when I goat a letter from saying he would not be here very soon
Wind Southerly Accomplished nothing to day Trying to speculate a little in land, but failed in every attempt
Wind North Easterly and moderate at night the wind went down. In the evening went to the hall to a masonic meeting

Light air of wind Northerly Took Str Florence went to Bar Harbor and train for Ellsworth. to see about getting timber to move the school house at Winter Harbor. but could not get any large enough At Night took the train for Bar Harbor. arriving at 7.45 PM Then went to the Masonic meeting at Bar Harbor It being a business meeting no work done Stoped the night of the Rodick House and let Rodick have the job to move the school house

Wind North East and rainy. At noon wind hauled East and blew heavy At 3.45 PM took the Steamer Florence for Winter Harbor from Bar Harbor. The sea being very rough and wind blowing a gale. blew the top arriving of together with the nails breaking them in pieces
Wind South West blowing a gale Woek at home in shop
Wind Westerly fresh about home

Wind Southerly and very heavy rain in morning In afternoon wind SouthWest and still continued to blow. Wrote deed from Thomas Smallidge to Geneva Milliken and from Celestia A Milliken to Jesse E Smallidge

Wind Westerly and expecting the carpenters at work on any house did not do anything but wait. but they did not come. Mr. Rodick commenced getting ready to move the School house. In the evening went to a religious meeting at the Hall
Wind NorthWest and fine work about home covered a lounge & in the evening went to a masonic meeting at the Hall
Wind Northerly At noon commenced framing my house with three men
Wind Southerly very moderate and overcast Work all day on my house framing with eight men
Calm in morning heavy frost Work all day framing my house. and got it about ready to raise
Wind North North East very overcast looking like snow
Wind SouthWest. Laid underfloor in house in forenoon and in the afternoon commenced putting up the walls of house. and laying apart of the cellar wall over again
Wind N.N.E. Thermometer at 32' above Work all day with crew on house and cellar wall a disagreeable day

Wind North East and cold. Work all day on cellar while a crew of carpenters worked on hours In evening went to the hall to a masonic meeting the Hall moved to abreast of Hammonds store on its way to the new lot
About calm most all day very pleasant work with crew on house and cellar. put upper beams on house
Wind South heavy breeze. work all day on house and cellar with a crew in both places
Wind NorthWest. very heavy breeze work on house with a crew
Wind North East Thermometer at 30 very overcast In evening went to a religious meeting at the Hall. The Hall at this time is near Capt. P. L. Tracys house on its way to the new lot

Wind Southerly and pleasant At noon commenced putting up raftees on house. light men at work as follows Alganias Martin foreman Dick Martin James Wakefield Chas Smith, Jordan Joy, Chas Grover, Geo. Childs and my self

Wind South West in forenoon and north West fresh in afternoon Crew work all day on my house consisting of ten men while I worked about the grounds. So much wind in the afternoon to finish putting up rafters

Wind NorthWest heavy. Work on the inside of my house in forenoon building stairs and studding of the rooms In the afternoon a little more moderate finished putting up rafters. In evening went to a masonic meeting at the Hall
Wind moderate all day N.W. in forenoon and S.S.W. in afternoon. and overcast. roof of house nearly all boarded in. One of Albert Farrars twins burried in the afternoon
Wind South East. fresh and heavy rain in morning, then hauled out Southerly rain ceased at 9 AM No crew at work to day
Wind North finished boarding roof of house at noon which completes the whole of the boarding In the afternoon work around the house only one on pay
Wind North and fine. about home
very moderate NorthWest. and very fine weather two men at work on the house & one besides myself on the grounds
Wind East. Fresh. and heavy rain all day no crew at work on house Work in shop in afternoon fitting it up ready for work

Wind Southerly in morning In the afternoon wind came of N.W. work about the new house with two men at night discharged all. In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting The hall is now on the new lot
Wind South West Work about home fitting up the shop J.P. Joy has had a line rum on my land that he has claimed
Wind Westerly Sawing fancy Pattern for shingles for roof on my house
Wind South East and in the afternoon blew heavy with rain. Work about the shop, assorting shingles to saw fancy for my house roof
Wind Southerly and wet thick with fog. On account of so much mad and water in the road did not go to the religious meeting at the hall
Wind moderate North Westerly. J.P. Joy took away the line fence between his lot and mine. Work apart of the day on house inside
Wind Southerly assorting shingles for pattern shingles in the evening went to the Hall to a dance accompanied by my wife and daughter. music by Enos Tracy & Miss Woodward

Wind Southerly having company did not work in shop. In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting. work on the first degree And James W. Wescott was made an E.A. The first Mason ever made at Winter Harbor my self Master
Wind North Work all day assorting shingles for fancy shingling

Wind North East and snowing in the morning. The first snow for the season at 10 AM the wind hauled out South East and rained the rest of the day. Work with the circular saw sawing fancy shingles with wind power
Calm all day Work about home from one thing to another but nothing in particular
Wind Southerly and thick with fog all day
Wind Sourtherly and very fresh breeze. rain squalls work about home

Wind N.N.West. run my mill apart of the day making pattern shingles for the roof of my horse Hired two men from Steuben James Wakefield and Chas Smith to work for me a while on house gettinf the roof ready to shingle No one at work since Nov 16 untill now
Wind N.N.W. very fresh putting up finish In the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting
Wind Northerly Thermometer at zero Work on the outside of my house putting up finish
Wind Southerly work on my house putting on finish very fine day
Wind South East moderate overcast and a little rainy In evening the wind hauled out North East looking very much like a storm. Work on house putting on upside finish
North East wind very overcast In evening wind hauled out South East Went to a religious meeting in the evening
Wind Southerly and in the afternoon rainy. Work on house and in shop
Wind North West fresh. run wind mill most all day sawing Diamond pointed shingles for roof of my house. The Mill running well. sawed a large quantity of shingles

Moderate Northerly wind and fine weather. Work all day on the house shingling the roof with two men from Steuben Chas. Smith and James Wakefield In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting. It being our stated meeting had considerable business
Wind North East and as there had been a sleet storm during the night past. The men could not shingle on my house. and I took the day to assort shingles in shop
Wind Northerly moderate painted the turnings on my house as far as they have been put on. So much sleet on the roof to shingle
The wind Southerly work about home in shop. In the evening rainy

Wind Southerly Fresh. and heavy rain all day Called to see Mrs Dunton who is very sick and who needs a little help from the town as I have been notified being one of the municipal Officers and overseen up the poor Also called to see Amazia Southard who is very sick
Wind North East and rain in morning then hauled Northerly and cleared up built a bridge in forenoon near Samuel Sargents house. In the afternoon work in shop No snow what ever
Wind West fresh run circular saw most all day from 4.30 AM untill 8.30 PM sawing pattern shingles

Nearly calm but when there was an air of wind it was North West. Work all day shingling the roof of my house with the help of Jas Wakefield and Chas Smith both of Steuben In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting opened on E.H.D. and Oseau Hammond took his first degree being the second man ever took a degree at Winter Harbor
Wind Southerly Shingles on the roof of house untill 3 oclock P.M.where it began to rain and quit work

Wind North North West blowing very heavy with rain and a little snow, but the snow does not stop on the ground Mrs Timothy Dunton Died at 3 AM. & I being notified in the morning went over to the house and as he had made application to the town. I being one of the municipal office order casket made and grave dug

Wind North West fresh Had a grave dug for Mrs. Dunton neare where they lived. but could not get it deep enough and she was not burried to day a new grave must be dug somewhere else Went to Duntons house to sit up all night

Wind Easterly commenced to storm at day light sleet Ordered a new grave dug in R Pendletons yard and went home from Duntons In the afternoon Mrs Dunton was burried. A prayer at the house by A.J. Gervish. heavy rain.
Wind North West. Went to Mr Duntons to see how he was financially and what he intended to do with the Children Got no satisfaction In the evening sawed fancy shingles untill 11 P.M.
Wind NorthWest shingling on house, and sawing shingles two men at work

Wind North Easterly Shingling on the roof of my house untill noon when it snowed so hard we had to quit In the evening went to a masonic meeting at the Hall open on E.A.D. and Initiated Rev. James P. Nowlun he being the third one ever took the degree here at Winter Harbor. Then opened on the 2nd degree and passed Osea M. Hammond to the F. C Degree
Wind Northerly Went to Prospect and back in stage to fine up a little town business a little snow in the afternoon Not snow enough on the ground for sleighing
Wind N.N.W. and blustering paid all wages fue the men for work on my house Work in my black smith shop
Wind Northerly finished shingling my house in the afternoon fine weather, andwhat snow was on the ground has evaporated not much to be seen
Wind Northerly Christmas Went to a religious meeting at the Hall
Wind North East Thermometer at 0 in morning. This day is substituted for Christmas, and preparations are being made for a Christmas tree at the Hall
Wind Northerly & fine weather work about my house getting it ready to leave for the winter

Wind North East and hauled around South East and blew very heavy with snow and rain. In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting Passed James P. Nowlan to a F. C. D. and Osea Hammond being just ever raised here in Winter Harbor Lodge to the 3rd degree When Lodge was out the wind was blowing a terrific gale and the rain pored down like a flood
Wind W.S.West. heavy work about the new house. fastened up windows and doors and got it safe to leave. have finished work on the house for a while
Wind W. N. W. blowing very heavy Thermometer at 0' to cold to work away from the fire

Wind North West. Thermometer 4' above 0 The ground as bare of snow as in July and no sledding whar ever so far. living in one part of Jennice Kingsleys house I have stoped work on mine for a while. my house is up boarded roof shingled and studded of above and below also the cellar is completed

Wind North East In the morning the ground bare of snow. There has not been any snow for sledding so far. At 8 AM commenced snowing and in the afternoon turned to rain and at night no snow on the ground I am living in one part of Jennice Kingsleys house. I have stoped work on mine for the present that I began the last of Oct. the house is up boarded roof shingled and tudded of above and below
Wind came of N.W. in the morning work all day about home repairing my mill which goes by wind
Wind NorthWest fresh. run my mill apart of the day sawing out brackets for house stages

Wind NorthWest fresh Thermometer at 20' above 0. Run mill most all day on small jobs for different people. In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting it being our State meeting did no work but business
Wind NorthWest very heavy run mill all day sawing small posts to be turned for piazza
Wind Northerly work in shop. Turned organ Shoal for J R Hammond
Wind SouthEast and in the afternoon a sleet storm. Work in shop at home for my self
Cleared of with the wind Northerly No snow or ice on the ground. At 3 oclock PM Dora Joy daughter of Thomas Joy died In the evening went to the Hall to a religious meeting
Wind North West work at home in shop In the evening went to the Hall to the Hall meeting and I was elected one of the trustees
Wind Easterly snowing all day, and not withstanding the number of snow storms we have had. There has not been any sleighing yet. work all day in shop

Wind West a gale Work for Joseph Smallidge all day finishing a room in his house In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting. Alex Bickford and Rev. Otway C. Herbert took E.A.D. and Rev James P. Nowlan the M.M.D. he being the second to take this deree in Winter Harbor. There are as large number of Masons hire who have taken the M.M.D. but did not take it here as there was no lodge. and we have no Charter yet Although we are alowed to make masons

Thermometer at 0' Wind North West. Went to Bar Harbor in Str. Florence. accompanied by my wife and daughter Then took Str. Rockland and went to North East Harbor. Arrived at 11 AM. The object of this trip is that my wife might visit her folks making our head quarters at my wife's Fathers Mr. Josiah Smallidges
Wind Easterly in morning and commenced snowing. Wind hauled out Southerly commenced raining. and is raining at this time of going to bed at 10 P.M.
Wind Westerly. not much snow on the ground. but all glitter of ice. The sleighs run a little. but very dangerous. as they slure into the gutter Visiting my wife's folks at N.E. Harbor
Wind Southerly. and at noon it commenced raining and rained the remainder of the day
Wind Westerly Visiting my wifes folks at N.E. Harbor

Wind North West in morning, afternoon calm fine weather. At 5 oclock P.M. the weather looks treacherous At 7 P.M. commenced snowing hard and looks doubtful abour over getting home tomorrow as was our ploms where we left one week tomorrow
Wind Easterly and heavy snow storm all day To night will be the night for our Lodge meeting. but as no steam boat came I cannot get home. and doubt if the Lodge will be called to order
Wind North West very heavy and cold No boat came to day so we have to remain at North East Harbor Estimated more than one foot of snow the first sleighing fo the winter

Wind North West and cold. At one oclock took the Str Rockland accompanied by my wife and daughter At North East Harbor and came to Bar Harbor bound home. But as the Winter Harbor. Steam boat has not made her trip to day. we must stop over at Bar Harbor. then at zero
Wind NorthWest and very cold. Ice making very fast. At 4 P.M. took the Str Florence accompanied by my wife and daughter and went home. The sound of Winter Harbor is freezing

5' below zero. Wind NorthWest and at sunrise the Thermometer 5 degrees below zero. Commenced to grow sick. Taken vomiting with great pain. At 10 am senf to the doctor. He being unable to come on account of his lameness and I still growing sick. took physic soaked put took sweat and went to bed. At 2 PM stoped vomiting and quite comfortable
The wind said to be north west. and cold but I being in bed all day cannot tell of myself although I am no worse than yesterday. Can lay in bed and write and sit up a little in bed
Wind North West. They tell me. but being unable to leave my room cannot tell. Sit up one hour in the afternoon. quite comfortable

Moderate wind N.W. but said to be cold out of door. Feeling quite well went from the bed room to the kitchen in the afternoon. To night will be our Lodge night. but they will do without me. although we have plenty of work. I cannot attend

Wind Easterly and snowing in forenoon and turned to rain in the afternoon Being unable to get out on account being unwell I stay in the house and read a book on Romanism. Borrowed at N.E. Harbor Winter Harbor Sound frozen up
Wind Westerly and fresh The ice in Winter Harbor Sound is all gone. Finished reading the book on Romanism and able to walk about the house
Wind NorthWest Ice made across the Sand cove I have been able to walk about the house and have whitted most all day
Moderate N.W. wind. but the weather very cold The Thermometer being in the house cannot tell how cold it is out of door My health is improving although have not been out of doors
Wind North West cold. and Winter Harbor Sound. frozen solid. no Steam boat runs more ice than I have seen for many years. my health quite good

Wind very moderate not enough to tell which way it is. Went out of doors and to the Harbor the frist time since I was sick Put teams on to haul stone for the new Church as directed by D.B. Filmit of Boston

Wind NorthWest In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting. It being the first Wednesday in the mouth it is one Stated meeting or meeting of business Rev O.E. Herbert was raised to the M.M. Degree he being the third meet again Friday the 3rd

Wind N.W. In the afternoon went to Birch Harbor to the funeral of James Barrett. He was not buried under the Masonic Order. but the Masons clothed themselves and followed the remains to the grave as mourners. he belonged to Pleiades Lodge
Wind North West Had a special meeting of F. & AM. at the Hall in the evening, as it was deemed necessary on account of work Alex Bickford took the M.M.D. he being the fourth
Wind Easterly At 3 P.M. commenced to snow. Not work to day. Winter Harbor Sound frozen up solid to Lower Harbor. In the evening rainy
Wind Westerly Ice all broken up clear to the head of the cove
Very light air North North West and warm. Shoveled snow in forenoon on highway Ice all gone out non in sight

Wind very moderate Southerly Went to Birch Harbor with Chas Smith after men and teams to haul stone for a new Stone Chapel at Winter Harbor There went to Prospect to make Dr. Larrabee a social call back in afternoon

Wind South Easterly and drizzling rain all day. Work in the Black Smith Shop in the afternoon. In the evening went to the Masonic meeting at the Hall John O. Fross and Woodbury E Martin took their first degree

Wind Westerly work all day at the hauling bec hauling stone to build a stone church at Winter Harbor. Dinner & supper at A Bourgetts house Mr. D.B. Flint of Boston is the man who builds the church with a little assistance of labor form the residents of this place
Wind Northerly light and cold Thermometer 6' below in morning but at night it was at zero. to cold to work in shop
Wind North Easterly and snowy all day work in shop turning for my self
Nearly calm but what little wind there was Northerly about home
Nearly calm all day. but in the afternoon a very light air Southerly Thermometer 40' above Work in the shop in the forenoon for my self turning

The wind South South West In the afternoon went to Cherryfield with Capt. J.B. Fross & P.A. Summers team. Our object in going was to visit Narraguagus Lodge which we did. but they had us work. Went to the Cherryfield House to stop all night

Wind North East and snowing hard At 8 oclock A.M. left Cheeryfield for home with Capt. J.B. Fross. arriving at noon. The wind hauled North and at 3 pm cleared up. In the evening went to the Lodge opened on 2nd degree and John O. Fross  and woodbury E Martin was passed to the degree of F.C.
Wind North North West. Thermometer 5' below 0 at sunrise then went a little higher. Work most all day in shop
Very light air of wind Northerly and snowy untill 10 am when it cleared up. work about home
Very light wind Easterly. Sound clear of ice. plenty of snow and good sledding work in shop
Wind NorthWest very moderate and pleasant about home

Wind South East went to Ellsworth with Geo. Childs and Handy Bunkers horse left home at 5 AM. at 6 AM commenced snowing. Arrived at Ellsworth at 9 am. Hunted up record of deed took Council thereover. At 240 PM the snow turned  to rain and at that time started for home. drove across the ice at Crabtrees shore. and arrived home at dark
Wind very moderate North West Ther. 45' above In the forenoon getting lumber. and in the afternoon working in shop

Very light air of wind North West. In forenoon work in shop at home. In afternoon went to Prospect Harbor to help male out warrant for town meeting as one of the municipal officers of the town. back at night In the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting. have a large attendance from Prospect Harbor. John O Fross was raised to the M.M.D. he being the 5th to be raised here
Very moderate Westerly wind and warm. Snow melts fast work about home
Calm in morning At 10 AM wind breezed up moderate NorthWest. Work at home in shop with lathe
Wind South East. and in the afternoon fresh. Run the mill all the afternoon using circular saw. sawing rounds for the house and later work also some small posts. Settled with C.E. Smith & Cv
Wind Southerly and thick with fog, about home all day
Wind Westerly Run my mill all the forenoon. But in the afternoon looking after the land interest

Wind North North West and fresh. Thermometer 10 above. Work in the shop a little but my time given mostly to the land interest. Made out the anual report of the Local board of health myself being the sec.
Wind NorthWest. Work in shop. In evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting and Woodbury E Martin took his third degree. he being the sixth in this Lodge
Wind Northerly Work in shop in forenoon and in the afternoon went to West Gouldsboro to settle with the Town Treasurer as the year is about up and our town meeting will be next monday
Wind N.N.W. Looking after the land interest most all day
Wind North North West Commenced snowing in the morning. At 7 A.M. went to Prospect Harbor to settle the town business for the year back at night
WindNorth West Thermometer at 30 fine weather No Ice in Sound. and very good Sleighing

Wind North West very light & warm Went to Town meeting Read our reports of the past year when I was the 2nd on the board. This year I was elected Chairmen of the board. Geo. Capt I met & Freeman Joy 3d the Select men are overseeres of the poor and fence viewers J.S. Summivan was moderator Arthur Kingsley Clerk. SL Kingsley auditor and S.L. Tracy Treasurer Voted to open the Old Now oldy discontinued over the big Hill so called and voted to raise $300 to do it with
Went to Prospect & got the Town books being Chairman of the board of the Select men chosen yesterday. In the afternoon tended out on the hauling "bee" getting stone to build a Church

Wind moderate N.W. work in shop in forenoon. And in the afternoon went to South Gouldsboro took the Str Sappho went to Bar Harbor thence to Ellsworth by train. after lumber for inside finish for my house. On arriving can find nothing I want. and will stop over night in Ellsworth. It is the night for our Stated Masonic meeting at home. it being the first Wednesday in the month

Wind Northerly & snowy all day. took them in forenoon for Bangor. transacted my business in regard to lumber and at night took the train back for Ellsworth. After arriving in Ellsworth went to a sociable got up by Estonic Lodge F. & A.M. then to the Hancock House for the rem. of the night
Moderate Northerly wind. Took train in Ellworth for Bar Harbor in forenoon. The So. Gouldsboro Steam Boat being broken down. Took a passage home with Capt. H.E. Tracy in yacht rain arriving at 4 P.M.
Wind North East work about home overhauling the town books
Wind Easterly and clear
Wind Easterly and fresh. at night stormy work at home in shop
Wind Easterly and heavy snow storm all the forenoon. In the afternoon very damp fine mist fresh breeze all day work in shop.
Wind North East Fresh and stormy the roads blocked full work in shop In evening went to the hall to a masonic meeting and James W. Wescott took the F.C.D.

Wind Northerly. work at home in the carpenters shop in forenoon turning stair post and in the afternoon work in any house getting it ready to lath. In the evening went to the Hall to listen to the music of the West Sullivan band consisting of eleven pieces
Wind North West Work all day in shop for Lorenzo Dodge making a modle to be patented as a fire extinguisher. Commenced the lathing of my house by Albert Freerar
Wind North West. fresh. Run mill all day turning stair ballisters, and had a man at work on the modle for Mr Dodge
Wind NorthWest fresh and clear about home all day
Wind moderate N.W. turned stair balisters for my house with the mill at night wind Southerly Chas Smith of Steuben at work for me all day on Lorenzo Dodges patent a proposed patent fore Engine tender
Wind Southerly work in shop in forenoon with Chas Smith for L. Dodge and in the afternoon we both worked on my house getting it ready to lath Albert Farrar is now lathing At night rainy

Wind South South East and rainy. In forenoon went to Mr. Dodge's house with F.P. Sargent a justice of the Peace. and got Mr & Mrs Doge to acknowledge there signature to a Bond of land Dated Jime 27-87 In afternoon went to a dickens meeting metting R Rand School Agt. Storms to hard for a masonic meeting although it is over meeting night

Wind Westerly in morning then hauled out Southerly very warm. snow & ice melting very fast. no more sledding Undertook to work on my house but was called of so many times both for private business and for the town did but little. In the evening went to the Lodge Inadeed Wallace Summer
Wind Westerly. Cold. and thick with snow all day to cold to work on house. and donde some sawing in shop
Wind West North West Work in my house in forenoon. and in the afternoon work drafting the windows
Wind Northerly in morning. But in the afternoon hauled arond Westerly. In the evenin went to the Hall to a religious meeting
Wind Northerly in morning and southerly in afternoon. Went to West Gouldsboro on town business back at noon.
Wind South East. Sleet storm work all day on the inside of my house

Wind South East. rain storm all day Work in my house in forenoon and in the afternoon went to West Gouldsboro to draw jouryman and drew John H. Tracy, then came home at dark This is our Lodge meeting but my wife being sick I shall not be present
Wind Southerly and rainy all the forenoon. In the afternoon wind Northerly and cleared up work in new house.
Wind Westerly work in my house
Wind Easterly and snowy all forenoon but in the afternoon it all melted. We the select men met at my house and assigned Territory for valuation
Wind Westerly and very pleasant
Wind Easterly and big snow storm and by noon there is at least 6 in snow fill good sleighing again work in shop in the afternoon for E J Hammond tuning for his Cottage
Moderate Westerly work alone on the inside of my house

Wind NorthWest, work in my house lathing in forenoon In the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting it being our regular meeting. myself being chosen to atten the Grand Lodge in may. After doing our business called of to the first degree and Initiated Capt Thomas H. Smallidge

Wind Southerly and fine. Went to So Gouldsboro took the Str Blue Hill went to Bar Harbor deposited $900. to be drawn out by checks in the Bar Harbor Banking and trust Co. The $900 was realized by the sale of land to R. Pendleton. I missed the Steamer on her return to South Gouldsboro. and took John Lynams gunning skiff and rowed home. and took for a passenger Mr Herbert Harris D.D.G.M of East Machias who was board to Winter Harbor to visit our Lodge. and was to late to take the Steamer

Wind Southerly and heavy rain all forenoon In the afternoon wind NorthWest clear and fresh. Commenced building the chimneys in my house by the Workmans and their tenders In the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting. we were called to gather by the D.D.G.M and worked the third degree. James W. Wescott was the man raised. he being the first to make application after our dispensation was granted and being the seventh to be raised here
Wind Westerly howling At the assessors office receiving valuations as advertised
Wind North West. fresh
Wind Northerly fresh. The Masons are building my chimneys. and the plumbers have commenced putting in the pipes previous to its being lathed
Moderate Westerly Taking valuation all day through Winter Harbor

Fresh Easterly and wet snow. The plumbers and brick layers are at work on my house and I with them all day In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting and W.W. Summer was raised he being the eight in our Lodge

Very moderate Northerly wind Sleighing in the morning but act melted before night. Went through Birch Harbor and Bunkers Harbor taking valuations and back home. All three of my chimneys one to the garret beams and the workmen quit
Wind Northerly and snowy all the forenoon and the sleighs were out in morning but the snow mostly vanished before night when it cleared up finished taking the valuations of the town
Wind Southerly The valuations being all taken and am now ready to assess taxes if the other on the board are ready
Wind North East and fine weather
Wind Southerly Commenced assessing taxes using Frank Summers house for an office. The plumbers at work on my house
Wind Northerly and fine weather. assessing taxes I have a crew digging near my house for seven pipe which the plumbers will put in
Wind Southerly assessing taxes during the day. and in the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting and Capt. Thomas H. Smallidge was passed to the degree of a F.C.
Wind Westerly work assessing taxes snow squalls
Wind South Easterly Work all day on taxes
Wind all around the compass but as a rule Westerly. work all day on taxes
