Wind Westerly and in the forenoon snow squalls. but no snow to lay on the ground
Wind South West and fine weather myself assessing taxes but have a crew digging a ditch. and blasting for sewer pipe
Wind NorthWest fresh. and cold work all day assessing taxes
Moderate Westerly wind. work all day assessing taxes. In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting and Capt. Thomas H. Smallidge was raised to a M.M. he being the ninth made in this place
Wind Southerly and fine weather work on taxes
Wind Southerly and very fine weather. work assessing taxes. shall not meet again untill week from next monday as I shall attend the Grand Lodge first Tuesday in May
Wind Southerly work about my house looking after every thing in general preparatory to going to Portland
Wind Easterly C J Guptill was burried in the afternoon and Emma Joney died about noon

Wind North East Took Str Silver Stas from home for Bar Harbor bound to Portland to attend the Grand Lodge F. & A.M at 10.10 left Bar Harbor for Portland via of the Maine Central. At 2 P.M. got of the train at Pittsfield to visist Charley Kingsley and others from home attending the Maine Central Institute At 9.13 took the train again for Portland

Arrive in Portland about 2 oclock AM. At 9 AM the Grand Lodge called to order and out petition was presented for a charter At 5 PM our petition went before the committee on dispensations and charters. and the committee voted to recommend our having a charter. and think my work was all done with the Grand Lodge went to the depot at 11 P.M. and took the train for home wind Easterly

Wind Easterly Arrived in Bangor from Portland at about 5.30. got breakfast. took train for Bar Harbor and staid in Bar Harbor untill 3 PM took Str Mt. Desert for South Gouldsboro and walked home In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting It being our stated meeting it was a meeting of business voted on the name of William Fernald and reflected him voted on the name of Peleg tracy and elected him. he took the E.A. degree about 20 years ago at Cheevyfield they have named jurisdiction
Wind Westerly got lumber and made arrangements for a crew to work on my house next week
Wind Southerly work around the house lathing
Wind South Easterly and afternoon rainy work in house lathing
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. In the evening went to the Hall to a religious meeting
Wind North West. Fresh. Work all day assessing taxes we adjourned one week ago last friday to meet to day we adjourned on account of my attenfing the Grand Lodge
Wind NorthWest in forenoon & Southerly in the afternoon. Work all day assessing town taxes and finished shall meet tomorrow to assess district taxes in several districts

Wind Southerly assessed Dis tax No 7 Prospect Harbor and partially assessed Dis tax No. 5. Winter Harbor and adjourned for the time being In the evening went to the Hall Masonic meeting and Capt P L Tracy took the 2nd degree. His first or E.A.D was taken 20 yrs ago at Cherryfield
Wind Easterly drizzly rain & fog. work on the inside of my house
Wind Easterly. and very heavy rain all day work on the inside of my house
Wind Easterly and very heavy rain work all day on the inside of my house
Wind Easterly and rainy all day
Wind Easterly and raining all day. The Masons came to plaster but the house was not ready they mixed the morter and left
Still raining and been raining since thursday all the time. A crew of six carpenters are now at work on my house

Cleared of at last wind Westerly in the morning and southerly in afternoon. Work all day on house with crew in inside. In the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting and a delegation of 42 being present from Bar Harbor Lodge. others from Prospect Harbor and South Gouldsboro Refreshments was served and a grand good time was had. Capt. P. L. Tracy was made a M.M. We were assited by the Brithere of Bar Harbor Lodge The enjoyments of this evening will long be remembered by all

Wind North West. fine weather. In the afternoon went to Bar Harbor to consult a lawyer or rather to retain him in case of a suit brought by J. P. Joy. about a disputed pieces of land. but I find the lawyer already retained by J P Joy

Wind North West. fresh. so mucho so I run the mill and finished sawing the grounds for the house. while I had a crew on the house finishing the lathing and getting it ready to plaster. It is now all ready for the masons

Wind South Easterly and partialy overcast A crew of 6 men at work on my house. besides the plumbers and masons. The Workmen Bros. commenced plastering this afternoon with the Exception of the kitchen and bathroom which was plastered some time ago for the benefit of the plumbers
Very moderate fine weather with a very light air of wind North West
Wind North West Fresh. Assessed District No 5 tax also district No 8. tax
Wind Westerly Masons at work on my house. and an account of the Masons being there no carpenters will be there this week as it jars the plastering

Moderate N. West in morning and Southerly in afternoon Moved stone from where I live to the new house. for the plumbers use. In the afternoon went to Bar Harbor to see  L L Kingsley abt buying Chas Guptill place. home at night In the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting No candidate
Wind Southerly and at night partially foggy Masons at work on my house. finished plastering all but the skin coat

Wind Southerly work about the house in forenoon. In afternoon went to Bar Harbor from So. Gouldsboro to deposit money reed on note by J. R Hammond and Roderak Pendleton Came to Winter Harbor from Bar Harbor on Str Silver Star
Wind SouthEast and fine weather work about home covering the Sewer pipe leading to the shore
Wind Easterly overcast

Wind Easterly and overcast. Masons finished skimming the plastering. Got lawyer Tracy to write a night of way across J.P. Joys land near the sand beach from R. Pendleton land to J. F. Kingsleys Estate to give one a chance to pass at will
Wind Easterly and rainy no men at on house
Wind Easterly and partialy foggy. Went to Bar Harbor in Str. Silver Star to see S.L. Kingsley abt buying Real Estate. came home at night. went to the hall to a masonic meeting did no work
Wind South East pleasant. Agreed to bond the Serene Cottage if the title is clear and pay $1.000 on bond for 6 months. At the end of 6 months pay $2500. and $2500 in one year after

Wind South East. thick with fog. Went with Surveyors and run line between Est. of J F Kingsley and lot formally of E. Grover on Grindstone Point. Also on Harbor point between land of Mrs. A J. Baker and myself

Wind Southerly work about the house J.P. Joy and wife signed deed of right of way across their land that was written monday by Bedford Tracy and left it with him to exchange with me for one where I release a clam to their land
Wind Southerly and very fine weather J.P. Joy went to the boarding house of Lawyer Tracy and got the deed he and his wife signed last night refusing to exchange as agreed
Wind Southerly commenced to do a little farming
Wind Southerly work about home. Agreed to sell R. Pendleton an acre of land below the wharf on Harbor Point for $1.000

Wind Southerly and fresh. Went to Bar Harbor with R Pendleton on silver star for fam back at noon In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting being a business meeting voted no to meet again untill Sept unless called to gather by the W.M.
Wind all kinds always with showers. Met at the Hotel beacon to see abt having a wharf built to tide waters the notice given by the select men of which I am chairman

Wind South East and fine weather Two carpenters at work on my house. planted potatoes and peas. Staked of a road leading to Harbor Point. Have bargained to sell one acre of land to R Pendleton for $1000 on eastern side of point up to where it is staked of
Wind Southerly and thick with fog plumbers finished their work to my satisfaction Workman Bros commenced to top out chimneys from the attic beams
Wind Southerly very fresh. built fire in my new house for the first time. to see if the plumbers work was equal to the guarantee find every thing satisfactory
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. three men at work on my house. at night wind came of North West clear and fine
Wind Westerly. work on house during the day After tea sewed but seed
Wind Southerly work on my house on piazza. No Lodge to night first night of vacation
Wind Southerly and at 4 P.M. commenced raining work on the out side of my house on piazza with a crew
Wind S.S. East and thick with fog In afternoon went to Bar Harbor on Str. Winter Harbor & came and came back on Str Silver Star
Wind Southerly work on my house. paid all the crew of
Wind Southerly and fresh.
Wind Southerly and the thermometer 80 degrees in the shade work on my house Sent Rev J P Nowlan $5 in letter

Wind of the land in forenoon afternoon Southerly Went t Gouldsboro point to see about Johnathan Nutter whom his boys says is insane. Went to Steuben to see his boys. they say they will help support him in the Insane Hospital. home at night
Wind South West Went to Bar Harbor to see Lawyer Peter Jr. about Johnathan Nutter. how to provend notice having been given that he was insane. home at noon.
Wind South East. fresh. Work on the outside of my house
Wind overcast Easterly Borrowed $87.39 of J.B. Fross payable in one week Paid P.A. Summer $60. on acct for lumber wrote town orders and transacted other business

Very moderate wind a very light air Westerly and very hot. At 6.30 a.m. Thermometer 98 in sun. Went to Bar Harbor in morning to deposit money back at 2 P.M. and went to a metting of the stock holders of the Str Winter Harbor and formed a corporation to be called the Bar Harbor & Winter Harbor Steam boat Co. capital stock 9.000 Wm. Rodgers Pres. Bedford & Tracy Sec. also chose board of directions
Wind Easterly and from 4 P.M. to 5 P.M. rainy
Wind Easterly and heavy rain most all day. no men at work on house on account of the rain. The Maine Central R.R.  Co runs a boat here for the first time
Wind Southerly and thick with fog tore down the old wood shed and cleared up the rubbish
Wind NorthWest fresh work on my house. had some painting sone on outside
Wind Southerly Went to Bangor by rail to buy lumber for my house. arriving in afternoon also left orders to have my doors made
Moderate Southerly bought some lumber in Bangor. Took the train for home arriving at 2 P.M. Four men at work on house
Wind Southerly The Painters on my house could not work after 9 AM on account of the rain reed. lumber from Bangor bought yesterday
Wind North East and in the afternoon rainy
Wind South East & fine weather work on house clap boarding & getting out finish
Wind Southerly work on house in forenoon. In the afternoon went to Bar Harbor on business. back at night
Celebration day generaly but not much of a celebration here. No men at work on my house today
Wind Southerly work on my house with a crew
Wind Southerly commenced putting the Scullery or back kecting on house afternoon rain squalls
Wind Southerly work on outside of my house
Wind North West fresh Went to Bar Harbor and back in the afternoon
Wind South West Went to Gouldsboro point to investigate the case of Jonathan Nutter as to his insanity. and decided it was necessary to have physicians to examine him. home in afternoon
Wind Southerly work on my house Two guests arrived at the Hotel Beacon Winter Harbor
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. In the afternoon went to Bar Harbor after paint window nights &ice

Wind Westerly and heavy thunder and lightning with powerful rain early in the morning at sunrise cleared up Went to Gouldsboro point to see Mr Nutter. he was examined by two physicians and pronounced Inocene
Wind Westerly and showery on house finishing kitchen
Wind Southerly work on house
Calm in forenoon and Southerly in afternoon
Wind Southerly work on house in forenoon and in the afternoon to Bar Harbor and back
Wind Southerly work on house finishing the cook room
Wind South East and thick with fog. Work on the inside of house finishing the bath room
Wind South Easterly and thick with fog. Finishing the inside of house working in bath room. had the Eastern end of house on gable, pebled, dashed
Wind Southerly and thick with fog work on house

Wind South East and thick with fog Crew at work on house all day but at night they are all discharged No more work going to be done on the house at present more than what I do alone. have not got the house ready to move in yet
Wind South South East. and thick with fog. at night rainy
Cleared up fine Wind North West in forenoon. Went to Bar Harbor and hired $50 at the Bank for 60 days Came home in afternoon. wind South West
Wind South West and showery very poor hay weather getting ready to repair my wharf. ready for a cargo of coal
Wind Westerly Went to W. Gouldsboro after men to work on my wharf. but got none. had timber hauled over in the afternoon to rebuild the wharf
Wind Southerly work on my wharf apart of the day. In the forenoon it rained. and could not work
Wind Northerly and very fine weather a Baptism takes place to day at Winter Harbor

Wind Westerly and fine weather work on my wharf with two men, all day. building a run about 14 ft high above the wharf to discharge coal on at 6 pm while I work on top of it. It gave way and I fill the whole distance beaking the ladder and buising myself some
Wind North West untill 4 PM where the wind came S.W. Worked but little to day on account of my fall last inght
Wind Westerly worked a little on my wharf and coal shed. feeling quite sore by the fall of last monday
Wind South West work a little abt the wharf and premises
weather threatening and people rushing to get their hay in on account of the weather work abt the wharf
Wind Southerly and rainy. Went to Bar Harbor in morning on Str Winter Harbor and back
Wind Easterly and partialy foggy.
Wind Easterly run line between A.J. Bakers land and my own by a surveyor
Wind Easterly work in forenoon clearing out the old barn in the forenoon. but in the afternoon it rained to hard to put the wood out of door that was intended to be kept for dry wood

Wind Southerly work all day clearing the wood out of the barn and getting it down cellar. before taking the old barn down The object of taking the barn down now is to have something to build a wood shed of
Wind South East and showery Tore the barn down and piled it up Two men been at work on the house all the week

Wind Westerly in the morning & Southerly in the afternoon. Good hay weather for all who have not got their hay. Capt. W. W. Summer comes to work on the coal shed. he will beg my partner in the coal business

Wind Southerly work on shed in forenoon and in the afternoon went to West Gouldsboro to caucus to send delegates to the County Convention to be holden at Elsworth Aug 15 I was chosen one of the delegates
Wind Southerly
Wind Easterly and rainy all day Went to Bar Harbor and telegraphed to Portsmouth about a load of coal also telegraphed to New York abt coal
Wind South West and fine weather work all day on coal shed with my partner W.W. Summer

Wind South West Went to Bar Harbor in Str Silver Star to take the 7.10 train for Ellsworth. but on arriving at Bar Harbor I find the 7.10 train does not stop in Ellsworth & I hire a horse go to Ellsworth to the Comty Convention back to Bar Harbor with team and from there to Winter Harbor by Str. Silver Star
Wind Southerly overcast Work on stage for coal shed. While two men are at work on inside of my house
Wind Southerly and rainy work apart of the day on coal shed
Cleared of fine. the wind North West and hot. work abt. the coal shed in forenoon and in the afternoon went to Bar Harbor to see about a note due at the First National Bank of Ellsworth home at night
Wind Southerly and fine abt home. all day
Wind Southerly work about our coal stage all day

Wind South East Went to Sullivan after coal barrows. Coal tubs &c. In the evening went to the Hanover to pass resolves to be read at the dedication of the New Church tomorrow thanking Mr Flint for his public spirit & generosity in building the church
Wind North East and a gale of wind with torrents of rain. The Dedication of the New Church postponed on account of the weather

Wind North North West fresh. Went to the Dedication of the Stone Church called Charming Chapel built by Mr. D. B. Flint and given to the public by him a very large Crowed present, and the day passed away pleasantly going to the Church in the evening
Wind South West work on wharf with my partner W. W. Summer fitting up for the coal trade
Wind Southerly fine weather. worked forenoon on wharf. In afternoon moved dishes and cooking utencils into new house and took tea for the first time. going back to the old place to stop over night
Wind South West and pleasant Went to a religious meeting in the forenoon at the Charming Chapel also to one in the evening at the same place
Wind Southerly Work all day making out voters lists with the help of one of the other men on the board
Wind Southerly work in forenoon on voters lists. and in the afternoon went to West Gouldsboro to get the second select man to sign warrant for Notice for State Election
Wind Southerly work about the coal stage at the shore
Wind Southerly work about the shore on the wharf
Wind South East- early and overcast work about the house and shore
Wind North East and a big rain storm
Wind Southerly work about the shore removing rocks that might be in the way of vessels laying at the wharf with coal
Wind Westerly masons working on my chimney tops pebledash &ce. In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting the first meeting for three months having a vacation through June July and august
Wind North West fine breeze
Wind Southerly work about home
Wind South East and heavy rain Sold A. Martin a buggy on acct. for $20
Wind South West Went to the Charming Chapel to a religious meeting

Wind Southerly State Election Went to the Town house in the morning and staid untill 8 P.M. being on the board of select men staid to count votes. The town went as follows Rep 194 Dem. 154 Pro. 7 No of votes 355
Wind Southerly work on house all day with Carpenters
Wind Easterly and hevay rain all day. Went to Bar Harbor on Str Winter Harbor and return In the evening went to a Masonic meeting no work to do
Wind South West Our coal vessel Yreka arrived in the afternoon to late to go to the wharf
Wind North Wesy good breeze. W. A. Milliken of Bar Harbor. came over with his crew to discharge Yreka and commenced at noon. worked all day
Wind South West Got the vessel discharged Settled up freight and the vessel took the seam boat & towed out the Harbor and went on his way

Wind Southerly received a telegram from the Insane Hospital that Jonathan had died, and requesting me to notify his folks how and when to ship remains. Went to Gouldsboro Point and notified them as requested
Wind Easterly and rainy went to Bar Harbor to telegraph to Maine Insane Hospital to send the remains of Jonathan Nutter at once by M.C.R.R. to Winter Harbor via Bar Harbor
Wind Easterly & rainy. the remains of Jonathan Nutter came. from Augusta and sent to his folks at Gouldsboro Point
Wind South West work about the house in the evening went to the hall to a masonic meeting
Wind Southerly work about home
Wind South East work about home with the carpenters on my house
Wind Easterly & rainy all day. went to Bar Harbor and returned
Wind Easterly and fine drizzling rain Went to religious meeting in the forenoon. and to sunday school in afternoon at the Charming Chapel
Wind South West and fair weather. Delivered coal to Str Silver Star and to individuals
Wind South West Went to Bar Harbor and back in forenoon. on Str Winter Harbor In afternoon painted on my house
Wind Easterly and a gale of wind with a power of rain in the afternoon. Delivered coal to the Str Silver Star in the Evening No Lodge meets to night the storm is to great

Wind Southerly and fair weather ground full of water Delivered 1 1/2 tons coal to P.A. Summer and the same to jabez myneck In the evening went to a Masonic meeting. yesterday was the day but on account of the storm it was put of
Wind Southerly and rainy delivered coal in forenoon
Wind Westerly Went to Bar Harbor in forenoon and back In the afternoon went to West Gouldsboro. to draw Jurymen back at night
Wind South West and pleasant. went to a religious meeting in forenoon and in the afternoon went to a sunday school at the Stone Church
Wind South West and overcast, Delivering coal and working around the house
Wind Southerly and rainy all the forenoon. Delivered 2 1/2 tons coal and work around the house

Wind North East and rainy all day. It is the day appointed by the Grand Lodge to constitute the Lodge at Winter Harbor. At 2.30 P.M. the Most worshipped Grand Master Grand Tyler and Grand Chaplain came met at the hall with the between Solemny Dedicated the Hall and Installed the Officers of Winter Harbor Lodge No 192 myself the first Master In the evening met at the Hall it being our regular meeting the first Wed. in the month And by request of the Grand Master Exemplified the work. The whole affair has been a grand success and enjoyed by all

Wind Westerly. Talked with Mr. E.J. Hammond abt selling land in the forenoon. But in the afternoon went to Bar Harbor and took as the Constitution requires before acting as Master of a Constituted Lodge. home at night
Wind Southerly delivering coal all day from early morn until dark
Wind North East. and damp. moved bedding over from where we have been stopping nights, and stop in our new house for the first time In the evening heavy rain
Wind South East and rainy
Wind Southerly and very heavy rain work in house
Wind Westerly and overcast Delivering coal
Wind Westerly and more pleasant delivering coal This evening is our Lodge meeting but being tired and feeling well shall not go
Wind North West and fine weather work all day around the coal yard
Wind Northerly and fine weatherly went to Bar Harbor In Str. Silver Star to collect money for coal furnished the Str. Silver Star. But found the Agt. very busy and got no chance to settle with him
Wind Easterly and rainy. hauled one ton coal to the Str Silver Star
Wind North East & pleasant. Went to a religious meeting and sunday school
Wind Westerly Delivering coal
Wind North East in morning. Went to Schoodic Island gunning with Jordan Joy we got 15 birds afternoon wind Southerly came home
Wind Southerly and at night thick with fog In the evening went to Hall to a Masonic meeting
Wind Westerly Went to Bar Harbor and got $200 on acct of coal for Str Silver Star
Wind NorthWest Work in forenoon building our road from the coal yawl doing some blasting In the afternoon hauling coal
Wind Easterly and rainy hauled coal to the Str Silver Star
Wind North West and pleasant Went to meeting and sunday school in forenoon
Wind North West and pleasant. Delivered 10 loads of coal to different people
Wind Northerly and fine delivered 12 loads of coal
Wind South East rain in forenoon and in the latter part of the afternoon it was thick with snow. No masonic Lodge to night
Wind Westerly but ovecast. The roads very bad about delivering coal. but delivered what was compelled to
Wind baffling with no clear of at all hauled coal for the Str Silver Star
Wind Southerly and overcast Went to Prospect on Town business
Wind South East and heavy rain. Went to Meeting & Sunday School

Wind Westerly and a gale. heavy rain in the morning there cleared up my birth day 43 yrs Went to Bar Harbor on Town business to get Warrents made to Notify the inhabitants of the Presidential Election Back in afternoon
Wind North West a gale. Work about home fixing up for winter
Wind South West and overcast work about the coal yard. In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting
Wind Southerly work on coal shed righting up the walls
Wind Southerly work about the coal shed Our coal vessel the Angola arrived just after dark
Wind Southerly and afternoon rainy. work all day covering the wharf with plank
Wind Westerly fresh
Wind Southerly Schr Angola came into our wharf at noon with a load of coal at to our consignment Bunker & Summer commenced work in afternoon

Wind Southerly Went to the Presidential Election at Town house. I being the chairman of Select men. had to go early and stay untill the Polls closed Republican vote 179 Democrat vote 122 Prohibition 2
Wind North West fresh. Work all day discharging coal from Schr Angola. In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting It being our regular business meeting
Wind moderate Easterly. Finished discharging cargo coal at 9.30 A.M. and hauled coal to the Steam boat
Wind Southerly and rainy untill noon when the wind came of N.W. and cleared up Went to Bar Harbor to settle business with the bank also Ellsworth Bank home at night
Wind Easterly and rainy work in house putting up pictures Ice
Wind South West In the afternoon wind came of N.W. heavy
Wind Westerly work about home all day getting ready for Winter In the evening Illuminated my house fired send rock and made bonfire in honor of President Elect Harrison the Republican candidate
Wind North West the ground frozed work about home all day
Wind South West work abt home delivered some coal In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting and Robt R. Joy took the E.A. degree
Wind South East At 3 oclock began to rain. Work about and delivering coal In evening snow storm
Wind Southerly work on piazza setting flatform on Iron rods. no men hired. Ground covered with snow
Wind Westerly work about home hauled 4 tons coal to Steam Boat wharf
Wind Northerly went to a religious meeting and sunday school at Charming Chapel
Wind South East and in the afternoon heavy rain
Wind Westerly hauled rocks around the home getting ready for wed weather
Wind from N. E. to N. and cold work about home In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting Robt. R. Joy took the F. C. degree
Wind Northerly and cold covered up the well. sold my Interest of 20 shores in the Str Winter Harbor and took reas estate for pay. Delivered coal to several families
Wind Northerly Thermometer at 0 working around the house getting ready for winter. The pump had given out around the packing or the pipes are frozen up think it is the pumps
Wind Easterly but pleasant. delivered coal for parties at Bar Harbor. Sullivan and Prospect Harbor. besides the steam boat and Natives

Wind East North East and a snow storm have to lug water from the well as can get none by the pump which is supposed to take water from the well and put it in the attic and draw from the faucet in the kitchen. but now plond out
Wind East a gale and heavy rain work in the house
Wind East fresh and heavy rain Got the pump to work all night in cellar, can pump water instead of luging it. snow going fast
Wind nearly calm very moderate Southerly at night more westerly work with a team. hauling gravel around my house. In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting. no work to be done
Thanksgiving Calm all day work around my house in forenoon hoveling gravel Afternoon hauling coal
Wind Southerly commenced putting roof on coal shed
Wind Westerly afternoon snow squalls. Work with crew putting roof on coal shed
Wind North West Went to meeting and sunday school at Charming Chapel
Wind Westerly work boarding the roof of our coal shead
Wind Easterly and snowy finished putting roof on coal shed, with the help of two men but no shingles used
Wind from East to Southerly with damp snow work abt home. In evening went to a Masonic Meeting at the Hall. It being a business meeting done no work
Wind moderate Westerly hauled coal in forenoon. afternoon hauled gravel to cover over my water pipes
Wind North West. work in black smith shop making Irons to set under back scullery on
Wind North West moderate The ground frozen abt two niches work around the house making it comfortable for winter
Light air North East ovecast and looks like snow. Went to a religious meeting and sunday school at Charming Chapel
Moderate Wind Westerly Went to the Lower Harbor claming for myself Delivered coal at night
Wind South East and rainy at night snowing with the wind North East
Wind Northerly some snow on the ground. Went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting in the evening
Wind Westerly a gale run turning lathe apart of the day
Wind North West Thermometer below zero great demand for coal hauling most all day

Wind Westerly settled with Summer & Owners and gave note payable in 4 months In afternoon went to West Goudsboro to auction sale of non resident property sold for taxes. & I bid it all in for the town being Charming of the board of select men
Wind West South West. fresh. went to meeting and sunday school at Charming Chapel
Wind Southerly and rainy all day at night wind hauled around North East. hauled coal for steam boat
Wind North East. very heavy rain & blow all day. At night sleet storm
Wind moderate Westerly. work about home In the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting
Wind North West and fine weather Went to Bar Harbor to settle with S.L. Kingsay the Str. Silver Stars coal bill back at night. nothing accomplished
Wind North West and fine weather delivering coal
Wind Northerly and cold work abt home

Wind South West At 9.30 AM the English Wood boat Alice S. of St. John ran ashore on the sand beach having previous lost both anchors near Long Island Mt. Desert I went on board help get her of took her around into the inner harbor to my coal wharf where she can stay safe without anchors vessel has in 50 tons pig Iron and other freight

Wind South West Went to Bar Harbor on Str Way field to Settle with Mr S. L. Kingsley for coal finished his Steam boat. got a settlement and came home at night. Took his note for $300 and deposited it in the Bank at Bar Harbor
Christmas wind SouthWest. delivered coal & worked abt home
Wind Southerly work about the house during the day In the evening went to the hall to a Masonic meeting and Robert R. Joy was raised to the sublime degree of a M. M.
Wind South East and afternoon rainy
Wind Westerly fresh. working on the house getting ready for cold weather
Wind Northerly and fine weather hauled brush to put over my pipes from the well to the house to keep them from freezing
Wind Moderate Westerly Went to meeting and sunday school at the Stone Church

Wind South West fresh no snow on the ground and no ice. Live in my new house and have gone into the coal business and have been delivering coal most all day W. W. Summer is any partner. Our first cargo of coal arrived Sept 13 with 180 tons since then we have had another cargo of 164 1/4 tons

New Year's day Wind Westerly and looking some what snowy Living in my new house Also am into the coal business with W. W. Summer as my partner. and we settle out business this day We have had two cargoes of coal amounting to 344 tons since the 13th day of Sept. and have nearly 200 on hand

Wind Northerly and looks like unsettled weather delivered coal for the steam boat. In the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting. It being the first Wed in Jan. it is anual meeting of officers my self was elected W. M. N. A. Bickford S. W. Chas. Grover J. W. J. R. Hammond Sec B E Tracy Yn. G W Tracy S.D. W. W. Summer J.D. P A Summer C.h. P L Tracy Yy.
Calm and very warm like a september day. work about the coal shed making doors
Wind Northerly delivered coal most all day
Wind Easterly and clear work all day getting brush to put over my sewer pipes to keep them from freezing
Wind Easterly and the weather looks stormy. Went to Birch Harbor to the poor farm. back home then to the Charming Chapel to a religious meeting and sunday school
Wind Easterly fresh and heavy rain. Work on the inside of my house
Wind Northerly with snow squalls but at noon no snow on the ground Work about home wrote some town orders
Wind South East. delivered coal apart of the day. At 4 P.M. commenced raining In the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting
Wind South West a gale run my wind mill all day turning
Wind Westerly Went to Bar Harbor on Str Maryfield to make a deposit. having been notified I had over drawn $95.07
Wind Westerly work about home on various kinds of work No snow on the ground whatever
Wind North North West went to a religious meeting and Sunday school at Charming Chapel
Wind North West coald and clear work at home In the evening went to the Hall. to a Hall meeting. and I was elected Clerk

Wind North West very fine weather Went to Bar Harbor with a large crowed to the Installation of the officers of Bar Harbor Lodge F & AM home at night & In the evening met at the Hall to Exemplify the work by the request of Leve Lurney D. D. G. M.

Wind South West very moderate and overcast. hauled coal all afternoon. In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting. and Installation of Officers the Installation was public. and the Installation officer was Levi Lurvey D. D. G. M. I was installed Master N. A. Bickford S.W. C. E. Grover Sec. G. W. Tracy S.D. W. W. Sommer J D. P. A. Summer Chap B F Summer Marshal Jabey Merick Sum S T H Smallidge Jun S P L Tracy Tyler
Wind South South East heavy blow and tremendious rain work in house
Wind Southerly and moderate warm work about home In evening went to Charming Chapel to a Sociable
Wind N. N. West. hauled coal all day
Wind Northerly and Thermometer at zero Went to a religious meeting and sunday school in afternoon at Charming Chapel
Wind Easterly and thick with snow all forenoon. but in the afternoon hauled out Southerly and rained. at night wind N.W. Cold snow most all gone. no sledding
Wind North West a heavy gale and cold. hauled coal on cart no sledding this year so far

Wind NorthWest and cold in morning but at night the air moderate In evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting on going home from Lodge find it is clouding up. light air Southerly and looks stormy 10 P.M.
Wind Westerly repairing horse sled for the coal Camperry in hopes to have sledding yet
Wind South West and warm. Work all day on sled to haul coal on if there comes any snow. but so far all the coal we have had this winter has been on wheels we have had some snow but no sledding
Wind Southerly and warm. built steps for out side door. to get from ground to Piazza
Wind Easterly hail and snow staid at home all day at 8 P.M. the snow storm turning to rain

Wind very moderate South Westerly and warm. Hauled coal on sled the first time this winter. but it is poor sledding. a cart is as good as a sled. there is more ice than snow in the road and the Steam boat wharf is entirely free from either
Wind Northerly and moderate in forenoon. then hauled around more Westerly in afternoon. work on the inside of my house casing out window
Wind Northerly hauled coal apart of the day In the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting

Wind South South East very fresh. and snow. In afternoon went to West Gouldsboro to take the Steamer for Bar Harbor. but on account of the storm the Str. did not make a landing came home at dark the snow turning to rain
Wind Southerly in morning with a little rain and snow. Went to Bar Harbor to settle with the Agt. of Str. Silver Star for coal. got no settlement and came home wind North West and growing cold
Wind North West work in shop turning for myself
Wind Northerly in forenoon, afternoon Easterly, and at night thick with snow
Wind Northerly and fine weather the first good sleighing or sledding we have had for the winter Went to Bar Harbor to see S. L Kingsley on town business back at night

Wind South East snow in forenoon. afternoon turned to rain the sled has run well to day. yesterday and to day the only days there has been snow wnough to haul a load of coal although the sled has been draged some on mostly bare ground

Wind Southerly and heavy rain all forenoon afternoon wind North West. at night went to the Hall to a masonic meeting It being the first Wed. in the month it is our business meeting. Elected Wilson H. Sargent. and Jesse Smallidge for the degrees and C. C. Lanchor to menched hip
Wind Westerly fresh and cold work in shop all day turning for myself using the Wind for the motine power
Wind Westerly with snow squalls. hauled coal most all day
Wind North East and a little snow work about home
Wind North East. fine weather about home
Wind North East and little snow. No sleighs out all wheels. work on town books At night wind hauled out S. East
Wind North East and snowy all day work in shop Jig-sawing lattice work for piazza supposed when I was sawing last winter I had enough, but now find I have not
Wind North West work about home. In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting and Wilson H. Sargent took first degree
Work in coal shed in forenoon and in the afternoon run my mill Wind West North West
Wind North North West fresh work in the coal shead most all day
Wind Southerly and weather growing soft. delivering coal all day
Wind Southerly and a rain storm
Wind Southerly preparing stuff for turning on the lathe when the wind comes Westerly
Wind Westerly and very fresh run mill most all day using the lathe turning posts for my piazza

Wind West North West went to Bar Harbor for Counsil on town warrant and other town business came home at night In the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting and Wilson H. Sargent took the Fellow crapt degree
Wind NorthWest. Wrote warrant for anual Town meeting
Wind Southerly and fresh. Went to Sullivan to see about a pauper belong to this town Naomi Robinson by name home at night
Wind North. fresh. Thermometer below zero all day. work in the house keeping the pipes in house from freezing
Wind North West in forenoon Thermometer 10 degrees below zero. In afternoon wind westerly Thermometer 10 degrees above zero
Wind North East. cold and snowy busy all day on coal
Wind moderate North work about home on various kinds of jobs
Wind Southerly work on town business. In the evening Went to the Lodge of F & A.M.

Wind Easterly and moderate We the selectmen laid out a Town way from Chas. Pendletons hill to my house and has it recorded in the Town Clerks office. In the evening had a social gathering of select friends at my house and think a good time was enjoyed
Wind North East forenoon Moderate Southerly afternoon. At the Town Treasures office. Settling with Treasurer and collector preparatory to making a Town report

Very moderate and fine weather Work all day making town report. with the help of F. P. Joy one of the Selection to be read was 4th At night the Silver Star arrived after being ashore on sunk there repaired guns fire in honor. No wind or same as none
A very light air North Easterly. Went to a religious meeting and Sunday school in afternoon at the Unitarian church

Calm all day and hot. Went to Town meeting on wheels I was not a candidate dor re-electino as Chairman of the board of Selectmen W. F. Vose Elected moderator Geo. F. Capt Freeman P. Joy and C. Y Bunker select men. S. L. Tracy Treasurer. Arthur B Kingsley Town Clerk, D. W. Joy Tax collector. Voted to accept the road as laid out by the select men from my house to the Town road
Wind Easterly fresh and a rain storm picked up the Town books ready for the new board of select men when they call for them

Wind Easterly and very heavy rain all day In the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting. It being the first Wed. in the month it is our stated meeting We also Initiated Wm. H Parker who was elected some time ago
Wind Easterly and rainy all day. hauled just enough coal to keep the Str running the hauling is very bad. Gave up the Town book the the new board of Select men

Wind Southerly and rainy. went to Bar Harbor on Str. Silver Star to see S. L. Kingsley about finance matters also to borrow a coal screen for an experiment before buying one to know of the right size. ice.
Wind Westerly and a little snowy Thermometer 34' above 0. no snow on the ground whatever melt as it comes hauled 6 tons coal to steam boat Silver Star
Wind North West and fine
Wind North West splendid weather work on my house alone
Wind Westerly work on my house getting out rails for my Piazza

Wind Southerly Work on my house on Piazza. assisted by B. F. Summer. In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting. Initiated there candidates. viz. Jesse Smallidge. Nabum Stevens and Talbot Workman

Wind Westerly work abt. home. Passed Wm. H. Parker. and Jesse Smallidge to the degree of a F. C. at the Hall in the evening. In the afternoon went to the School house to a district meeting adjourned for two weeks
Wind Southerly Delivering coal to the boat also to Natives
Wind Easterly and overcast. Bonded Mrs. Harringtons field for $1000 on 40 days by paying $15 on board
Wind Easterly and rainy

Wind North East and wet. Work about home. In the evening went to to the Hall to a Masonic meeting and Jesse Smallidge took the M. M. degree A special meeting was called for this purpose. there being a rush of candidates
Wind North East Hauled coal all day

Wind East North East work all day about home. In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting The D. D. G. M. and W. M. of Tremont Lodge were present. Capt. Nahum Stevens to the F. C. & M. M. Degrees
Wind North East Went to Bar Harbor on busines with S. L. Kingsley back in afternoon
Wind North East in forenoon. South West in afternoon Painted the Sign "COAL" to be placed on Eastern end of coal shed
Wind South West. work about home on the house

Wind South West. Went to the Charming Chappel to a religious meeting. The sermons are read by a layman after meeting resolves were read on the death of Mrs. D. B. Felint. After which we had a sunday school
Wind moderate and baffling from North to S.W. hauled coal to Str. Silver Star
Wind Northerly. Done some turning for Str Silver Star
Wind South South West fresh and cold not doing anything in particular. In the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting Wilson H. Sargent took the M.M.D. At 11 PM rain
Wind Southerly. Went to Bar Harbor and back on Str. Silver Star

Wind West North West in forenoon. South West in afternoon. Went to West Bay with stable team to carry Capt. Ramsdal to buy the Schooner New Boxer. Late in afternoon put water line on Str Mins harbor for Capt. Enusin at King's Cove
Wind North and cold. work about the house
Wind South West and snow squalls. Went to a religious meeting and sunday school in afternoon at Charming Chapel
Wind North East and thick with snow Settled with my partner W.W. Summer. the first time for three months
Wind North East hauled coal on snow. the best sledding for the winter

Wind South West and the sledding all gone. In the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting W. H. Parker took the M.M.D. It being the first Wed it was our business meeting and Elected 7 for membership. and two Proxes to the Grand Lodge
Wind South West with wet snow falling, work around the house
Fine day with a very light wind from North to S.E. Looking over old accts. for Settlement
Wind South Easterly Went to Bar Harbor to see S.L. Kingsley after money on Steam boat acct. got $150 home at 5 P.M.
Wind Southerly In afternoon went on board of the Str. Silver Star to work repairing where she had recently took fire. Although it is sunday & consider it a necesity therefore work
Wind North East commenced repairing John Cross boat in Jennice Kingsleys shop raising her one streak
Wind North East work on John Cross boat
Wind North work on John Cross boat. all day and in the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting and Talbot workman took the F. C. D
Wind Southerly working on boat commenced monday
Wind Southerly hauled coal in forenoon and in the afternoon working on boat
Wind N.N.E. in morning and hauled Northerly work on boat in shop
Wind N.N.W. Went to meeting and sunday school at Charming Chapel
Wind NorthWest in forenoon and South West in the afternoon. Work for John Cross on boat most of the forenoon but in the afternoon hauled coal for Str Silver Star

Wind Northerly and fine weather. Shingled on the roof of the coal shed apart of the day In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting although Lodge nights are Wednesdays it met to night to accommodate people who could not come wed. night. work 3 d on J. S. Workman no Lodge tomorrow night

Wind North East Went to Bar Harbor on business connected with the sale of land Including Grind Stone point. came home with H. E. Tracy in the yacht rain No Lodge of F. &. A. M. meets in this place tonight as it met last night instead
Wind North East Went to Bar Harbor on business connected witth the sale of land. Got out at South Gouldsboro and came home by land. looking out for the land interest.

Wind Southerly went to Bar Harbor on business connected with the great land scheme. was set ashore at South Gouldsboro as I had business there connected with it. A piano put in the house by S. J. Clement. subject to his under and and agreement wider to that respect
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. hauled coal and work shingling the coal shed
Wind Southerly and thick with fog Went to a religious meeting at the Charming Chapel

Wind West North West fresh. cleared the bush away from the house. hired Capt. W. W. Summer. my partner in the coal business to do my part of the work at the coal shed. so I can go on other business. but am still interested on the business. the sum paid is $800 per month to do my part of the work for three months

Wind W. N. W. very fresh. Went to Bar Harbor, and telegraphed to New York to H.B. Rawson & Co. if they had Chartered a vessel for coal for us. Got answer (not yet) came home in the afternoon. wind hauled out to South
Wind Southerly work abt. home In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting did no work
Wind Southerly Work about home doing a little work out of doors as the warm weather approaches. such as cleaning up the door yard Ice
Wind S. S. East. Went to Bar Harbor on business with S. L. Kingsley concurring land In evening heavy rain
Wind South East and rainy. and between showers work on coal shed building stages for shingling
Wind South East and thick with fog. Did not go to Church. staid at home and entertained company most all day
Wind North East and rainy. Work about the coal shed. and shingled between showers
Wind Northerly work on coal shed and finished shingling the roof all we shall do this spring at night wind South West

Wind Westerly Went to Bar Harbor. on business with the banks also with S.L. Kingsley home in the afternoon. In the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting. Elected 4 candidates for membership and rejected one
Wind Westerly work about the coal shed
Wind Southerly and looking like rain. built a place out of Door to put hard coal to make room for a cargo of Cumberland coal

Wind South West and fine weather put about 20 tons stove coal out of coal shed. to make room for soft coal At 4 P.M. got B.L. of coal and at the same time the vessel arrived with 180 tons Cumb. The Sch Rosie & Adria of Machias

Wind South very fresh. In the afternoon went to the funeral of Stillman Guptill buried from Charming Chapel. Servises by Rev. A. F. Palmer a baptist minister Stillman Guptill was 92 yrs. old lacking one month
Wind Southerly Commenced to discharge Schr Rose & Adra of Machias of Cumberland Coal for ourselves

Wind Southerly Went to Bar Harbor hired $100 for 30 days and $100 for one week of the Bar Harbor Banking and Trust Co On my arrival home at 4.30 P.M. The Schr Rosie & Adra had been discharged of 180 tons coal on hour before my arrival
Wind Southerly and partialy foggy. Went on board of Str Silver Star hired for this one day only No Lodge to night as our S. D is at the Grand Lodge and no work to do
Wind South Easterly Commenced furnishing Soft coal for Str Minnil ha ha
Wind Southerly hauled coal in forenoon and in afternoon Commenced farming for myself with the help of Sineon Sargent and oxen. at 5 oclock PM heavy thunder shower
Wind North East in forenoon and Southerly in the afternoon. Work all day farming for myself
Wind Southerly Went to meeting in the afternoon myself reading the Unitarian Sermon
Wind South and thick with fog. made garden
Wind Southerly and partially foggy planting potatoes
Wind NorthWest and Thermometer at 80' above. Work all day farming and finished unless I conclude to plow up another piece. At night wind Southerly. In evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting
Wind Southerly hauling coal and working about the coal shed all day
Wind Southerly and thick with fog Went to Bar Harbor on business with S L Kingsley back at night
Wind very moderate Southerly work about home
Wind Southerly and moderate Thermometer 80'

Wind S.S. East and thick with fog Went to South Gouldsboro to sell coal to parties building Bar Harbor break water and think have made a trade. hauled Cumberland Coal to the Str Silver Star for the first time
Wind Southerly fresh. Went to Bar Harbor
Wind Southerly and thick with fog
Wind Westerly in forenoon. Southerly in the afternoon
Wind Southerly went to Bar Harbor after money S L Kingsley being gone did no business
Wind North West Went to Bar Harbor In dora to see S L Kingsley on business not attended to yesterday. Got home at noon with $200. on acct of coal for Str Silver Star
Wind Southerly and fine weather
Wind South East. and at 6 PM it commenced to rain. wotk about home
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. work on my piazza
Wind Southerly work about home
Wind South South East. Went to Bar Harbor with my wife on board Str Winter Harbor. free excurtion Came back on Str Silver Star

Wind South South East moderate and thick with fog. Delivered to S L Andrews Contractor of Bar Harbor Breakwater 13 tons of Cumberland coal delivered on board of a scow at my wharf also coaled the Str Winter Harbor
Wind Southerly and a little shoewry work about home on various kinds of work
Wind Southerly and thick with fog Went to meeting at Charming Chapel
Wind South South East little rainy Geo Billings and Chas Smith of Bar Harbor came at noon to finish my house out side what is not done
Wind Southerly and very heavy rain all day work on house with two men hauled coal &ic
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. Went to Bar Harbor and back. In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting Elected two for membership
Wind Southerly work on my house finishing the out side with three other men
Wind Westerly in forenoon and South West in afternoon. hauled coal for Str. Minniehaha and Str Silver Star In afternoon went to Bar Harbor to see S.L. Kingsley he being out of town could not see him
Wind South East and rain all day Went to Bar Harbor. and raised money on paper at the Bank back at night
Wind South Easterly and rainy
Wind Southerly rainy and foggy work about home
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. went to South Gouldsboro with Dr Larrabee. to make the arrangements about rebondry a lot of land
Wind Southerly In afternoon went to South Gouldsboro and rebonded a piece of land by giving $40 on board It being nealy two years since the bond was given
Wind Southerly work all day on my Piazza painting
Wind Southerly work painting on my piazza
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. Established line between my land on the Hill and Capt J. H. Smallidge field
Wind Southerly about home all day

Wind Southerly and thick with fog. Took Steamer Silver Star and went to Bar Harbor then took Str Mt. Desert to Rockland. Then took Str Penobscot at 7 oclock P.M. for Boston. bound to New York to look after the coal interest and pilot a yacht down. from N.Y. to Bar Harbor with Capt As good Richardson

Wind Easterly and fine weather. Arrived in Boston at 7 oclock am. on Str Penobscot from Rockland Staid in Boston all day. Took the train at the Old Colony Depot at 6 P.M. for Fall River there took the Str Pilgrim for New Port & N York leaving New Port at 9.50 P.M.

Wind Easterly. On board the Str. Pilgrim. Arrived in M.Y. at 7 A.M. at Pier 28 North River. have seen the yacht that came after but she is not ready. loafed about New York all day and lodged at Colonial Hotel 726 Broad way
Wind Southerly Went to Harlem where the yacht is building and got a boarding place where to stay untill the yacht is ready Stoping at Mrs. Palmers at the Morris Dock Station
Wind Westerly Went to the City from Harlmen and settled with H.B. Rawson & Co. Acct. of Coal purchased in 1888
Wind Northerly Still boarding above high bridge at Monis Dock waiting for the little yacht to be done

Wind Westerly and a very fine cool day. Found a friend where we are boarding at Morris Dock. and waked across high bridge took the cable road cars. and went to the Yomb of the late President and General U.S. Grant
Wind Southerly and fine. Went to Town and back in afternoon
Wind South Westerly fine weather Stopping at Morris Dock in the Northern part of Harlem N.Y.
Wind Southerly and overcast. showery. and foggy. Still waiting for the builders to get the little yacht ready
Wind Southerly Doing nothing but sit down and wait for the boat to be completed
Wind Southerly am in hopes to get the boat tomorrow but it is uncertain
Wind Southerly Thermometer on South St. 86 degrees Thick with fog morning and night. The little Naphtra Lainch was fired up to day to try her machinery It works all night but she is not quite ready
Calm and hot during the day but thick with fog morning and night. Staid at my boarding house at Morris Dock N.Y.
Wind Easterly and a little rainy thick with fog We have received word by Mr. Garneeb agent in New York not leave New York when the boat is done as he is coming to New York and wants to sec her
Wind South East, rainy thick and nasty weather The boat is already to leave New York when we get word from the owner Mr. Gurnie

Wind South East and heavy rain most all day Mr. Gurnie came to see his yacht and has accepted her at 6 o'clock P.M. and have us orders to sail for Bar Harbor soon as we was a mind to no better orders could have been given although it is awful weather to move a small boat

Wind South South West Celebration day Left Morris Dock N.Y. in the little Naphtra Launch Myrabel at 8.30 AM for Bar Harbor. Myself Capt. As good Richard core and Engineer for a crew Passed Throggs Point at 9.50 AM Execution Rocks at 10.30 AM Eatons Neck at 12.45 P.M. At 2 P.M. Wind North with heavy rain at 3 P.M. Passed Middle Ground Wind N.N.E. fresh heavy rain and thick. Went into New Haven laid one home Wind hauled Westerly came out again passed Falkners Island at 8 P.M. Passed Race Rock at 11.30 P.M. At midnight about 4 miles East of Rack Rock Light. weather overcast. So ends these 24 hours

Wind hauling from West to North and breezing up Passed Block Island abt 3 AM heavy sea ruming The boats propeller out of water so much she made slow headway in the sea. Went into Woods Hall about 11 AM after more Naphthere. After getting that in Went to Edgartown for a harbor the wind N.N.E. and to rough for a small boat

Wind North North East fresh breeze but fine weather. To much Chop to get around Cape Cod. At noon in the wind began to moderate at three oclock left Edgartown. Passed Cross Rip at 4.30 P.M. Pollock Rip at 7.00 PM Nausets three lights at 10 P.M. wind gradualy hauling from N.N.E. to S.E. thince South West Passed Cape Cod Light at 11.45 good breeze and same chop. at midnight Wind West. So ends these 24 hours

Wind Westerly and moderate. Passed Thatchers Island at 8 A.M. The Naphthree is very pon and the boat is moving very slow. We want to get to Portland if we can but it is doubtfull At 11 AM when nearly abreast of the Isles of Shoals finding we are not liable to reach Portland on acct. of the boat moving so slow change the course for Portsmouth. The boat running slower all the time. At noon the boat stoped just inside the Isle of Shoals Took the machinery upfornt cleaned it fired up and got into Portsmotuh out 4 oclock P.M.
Wind all around the Compass and overcast. Lying at Portmouth Ordered 4 Bbls of Naphtha Oil Company Boston but shall not get it untill tomorrow

Wind North East Instead of 4 Bbls of Naphtha cam as ordered we only got two. And left Portsmouth at 9.15 A.M. and went into Portland at 3.30 P.M. after more Naphtha. the wind hauling Southerly Got 3 Bbls Naphtha and came out of Portland. at 7.15 P.M. Passed Seguin at 9.45 P.M. at midnight between Seguin & Monhegan A calm night and water. but very overcast. So ends these 24 hours

Dead calm run broard off on account of the weather Passed Monhegan at 1245 AM run to White Head and waited for it to begin to grow day light there went in the Mussel Ridges Wind North East. arrived in Bar Harbor at 9.30 AM and waited untill six P.M. for the Silver Star to Winter Harbor arriving home at 7 P.M. Then went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting Ezra W. Tupt. took the E. A Degree. he was accepted at our last stated meeting while I was gone and Mr. James Coumbs was accepted
Wind North West. and very fine weather In the afternoon went to So. Gouldsboro to see Mr. Andres at the Breakwater quarry
Wind Southerly hauled coal for Str Silver Star & Str Winter Harbor

Wind Southerly went to Ellsworth via Bar Harbor on Maine Central RR to be examined for Colon blindness Previous to an examination for a Pilot Licence Passed examination all right came home at night. thick with fog

Wind NorthWest fresh and fine weather Went to Bar Harbor to see the Steam Boat Inspector to be examined for a Pilot Licences and thick I Passed all right. athough no Licence was given me as it will have to be made out in Paullord home at night
Wind W.N.W. and very fine weather Work about home hauling coal

Wind NorthWest in forenoon Southerly in afternoon Let my hay out to Joseph E. Bickford to be cut onshore Capt. W.W. Summer finishes his work to day for the summer on coal. as he takes charge of a yacht
Wind North West in morning. Southerly in afternoon Work all day in my cellar. In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting and James F. Coombs took the E.A. Degree
Wind Southerly and good hayweather hauled in one load of hay for myself. I have the whole coal business for the next 2 months as my partner is out for that time
Wind Southerly with some fog At home and Entertained company all day
Wind South South East and thick and rainy all day. Went to Bar Harbor and back on Str. Winter Harbor
Wind North West fresh clear and fine. Went to a religious meeting at Charming Chapel in afternoon
Wind Southerly my hay all in the barn. fine weather

Wind South South East and thick with fog work on the cart in forenoon and hauled coal in afternoon at night rainy Put the horse in Jennie Kingsleys barn as it would be better abt taking care of him where I am going to have that at W.W. Summers
Wind North West Good Breeze work about home hauling coal which keeps me buusy most of the time In the evening went to the Hall to a Mason meeting and Ezra W. Tupt took the F. C. D.
Wind West North West fresh hauled coal all day to the several Steam boats
Wind Westerly in the forenoon and South in the afternoon. Commenced to build a bath house at the shore. but have to leave off officer to haul coal

Wind Easterly & thick with fog in morning afternoon cleared up. Went to Bar Harbor in forenoon & Back. hauled coal in the afternoon. at 4 P.M. raining hard and wind increasing. at 10 P.M. a gale from N.E.

Wind North East in morning and hauled Northerly and pleasant. Went to a religious meeting in afternoon at Charming Chapel and afternoon meeting went to Bar Harbor in Str. Winter Harbor as she was going to race with the Str.  Silver Star was about ten seconds behind in the race from Bar Harbor to Harbor Point
Wind Easterly and forenoon rainy hauled coal all day for Steam boats and Hotel

Wind South East and thick with fog. went to Bar Harbor after money on acct of coal. back at 11 A.M. and in the afternoon went to South Gouldsboro to see Mrs. Lodge about land. and made arrangements for an extension of 10 days on land
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. hauled coal. In evening went to hall to a masonic meeting and James F. Coambs load the F.C.D. Reed Bill of Laden of Sch Mariel with coal for Bunker & Summer
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. Work apart of the day on bath house at the shore
Wind Southerly and thick with fog delivering coal all day

Wind South West. and thick with fog in forenoon. Clearing out the coal shed getting ready for another cargo In the afternoon went to Bar Harbor to see S.L. Kingsley I being sent for his business was to get another piece of land on Grind Stone neck. came back at night
Wind South West and clear. the Thermometer 80 degrees Went to a religious meeting at the Unitarion Church in the afternoon
Calm and overcast in forenoon and in the afternoon rainy hauling coal to the various Steam boats
Wind South West and very fine weather. work about home
Wind S. S. East Went to Bar Harbor and back in forenoon. In the evening went to the to a masonic meeting It being our stated communication no work
Wind Southerly work on bath house for myself and E. J. Hammond at the sand back Sent our horse to West Gouldsboro to be shoed

Wind Southerly went to Bar Harbor and Borrowed $320 at the First National Bank to pay for the Dodge jill lot with Dr C. C. Larrabee came back at noon and found a coal vessel at my wharf the Sch. Manuel with coal for Bunker and Sullivan. did not commence on her to discharge as could not get any men to work

Wind Southerly and in the forenoon thick with fog at noon cleared up Commenced discharging the coal in morning Sch Mariel 12 tons In afternoon I went to South Gouldsboro obtained a deed of land from Sarah Dodge to C. C. Larrabee and myself buying about 30 acres more or less and paying them $650 besides $100 paid on the bond two years ago
Wind North West went to So. Gouldsboro to look for a horse to hoist coal but could hire none
Wind North West and fine weather bought a hose in the morning of C. L. Bunker Discharged Sch. Mariel coaled two Steam boats. Got Schr Parlese in the wharf at night ready to discharge coal
Wind South West. Commenced discahrging Schr. Peesless in morning and finished at night Cargo of 80 tons
Wind Easterly and heavy rain all day. hauled coal for three steam boats. Did not meet at the Hall for a masonic Lodge as it was a big storm and not many to attend
Wind Southerly and very moderate. work about home in the forenoon and in the afternoon went to Bar Harbor to take up a note of the Bank
Wind South West hauled coal all day with two horses
Wind Southerly thick with fog in morning but soon cleared up. Work in the Black smith shop making hooks &c to more succesfully hitch up two horses
Wind South West and pleasant
Wind S. S. West. and looking like a storm hauled coal all day
very light air Westerly and fine weather not much like the weather looked for yesterday did not haul much coal
Wind Southerly Lodge did not meet could not get officers enough to work the 3d degree hauled coal
Wind Southerly and showery in morning and at 9 AM cleared up wind North West work about home in the house
Calm in morning afternoon wind abt. South and warm Work about the coal shed
Wind Southerly and hot. work about the coal shed
very light air South Easterly Went to the Marsh visiting with my wife. at Uncle Clement Bunkers and Calvin Tracys home in the evening
Wind Northerly and went around Easterly dry & hot work at the coal shed all day
Wind Southerly work apart of the day on roof of bath house and hauled some coal also cleaned out the well
Wind Southerly work about home in forenoon and in the afternoon went to Bar Harbor and back on Str. Winter Harbor
Thick of fog in the morning. but it cleared up at 9 A.M. with the wind South. work about home
Wind Southerly work about the coal shed all day
Wind N.N.E. hauled coal for Several boats
Nearly calm In afternoon light air of wind Southerly Went to Somesville with my wife on Str. Silver Star and back as invited guests by Capt. Parker of Str. Silver Star
Very moderate all day Thermometer 80' hauling coal
Wind Southerly Went to Bar Harbor in morning after money on acct of coal got $300 in notes and checks and deposited them in the Banks. came home in afternoon Str Silver Star

Very moderate Southerly and hot. Send $300 to N.Y. to H.B. Rawson to Co on acct. of coal In afternoon haul coal for the Steam boats. In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting It bein the first Wed. it is our stated
Wind Southerly and thick with fog most all day work about the cellar and house
Wind Southerly and thick with fog hauling coal for Steam boats
Calm all day Thermometer 80' above put my coal in for winter
Wind Southerly and Thermometer 80 degrees Went to a religious meeting at the Stone Church in afternoon
Wind Southerly foggy in morning hauled out 6 1/2 tons coal for boats

Wind Southerly and thick in the morning. got a team and went to West Sullivan to see the Mijsrs Andrews, who bought coal of us in way for a settlement. not getting any money but plenty of promises. came home in afternoon
Wind Easterly. went to Bar Harbor in morning on Str Silver Star to get money from the McJsrs Andrews building breakwater but could not find my mum and came home at noon on Str Winter Harbor
Wind Easterly and very smoky Collecting money from the summer resident people for coal. previous to their going away
Wind Easterly with Thermometer 80' work about the coal shed
Wind Easterly Thermometer 80' above hauling coal
The wind Easterly and thick with fog. showery
Wind South Easterly thick with fog and Showery. Went to West Sullivan to collect money for coal sold to Mr Andrews the Contractor of Bar Harbor breakwater Got $35 00 on acct. home at night
Wind Easterly and thick with fog with some rain. hauled coal to the Steam boats
Wind South East. Went to Prospect Harbor to see a horse weighed with some intention of buying. but did not trade. heavy rain in the afternoon

Wind Southerly with tremendious rain in morning after it cleared up We (Bunker & Summer) traded horses with James H. Means. we left the horse go we had of C. L. Bunker Our year is up to day since Bunker & Summers sold their first coal which has amounted to about 600 tons and we settle satisfactory to both and my it another year
Wind Southerly and blowing very fresh. dug my potatoes and work about home
Wind South Easterly heavy rain in the morning afternoon cleared up Went to Bar Harbor. on business with S.L. Kingsley back at night
Wind West North West blowing fresh. Not feeling well did not go out of door

Wind West North West very fresh. The Piano was taken away that was put in the house by S. J. Clement. Apr 19 subject to his order In afternoon went to Bar Harbor on business connected with the coal business came back at night
Wind South West. work about home getting ready for col weather

Wind Southerly went to Bar Harbor in the morning to settle with S.L. Kingsley the year being up the 19th he being very busy like the two last times I went to see him I got no chance to settle. and came home without
Wind South South East fresh and afternoon rainy
Wind Westerly got a sloop boat ready belonging Saint J. Clement to go fishing got bain in Evening all ready

Wind West North West. Went out fishing in Saml J. Clements boat out on what is called Marting ground Sam. Sargent. and Jordan Joy with me we got three tubs and in before night wind hauling now Northerly and blowing fresh
Wind West North West fresh. Took care of the fish caught yesterday and in the evening tried to drive bait for tomorrow fishing but was unsuccesful none to be had

Wind South South East. and overcast looking like a storm not having any bait to go fishing with. Went up to Stave Island wier got bait. Got back to Neds Island and gave it up. blowing heavy. Settled with C E Pendleton for Bunker & Summer
Wind South Easterly fresh and a big rain storm. Work in house on back stairs
Wind Westerly work about home In evening went to the Lodge stated meeting
Wind SouthWest delivered some coal. In evening went in a boat driving herring for bait to fish with
Wind Southerly and fresh. went out fishing on Turtle Isle shoal used hand lines. got about 100 weight
Wind Northerly in forenoon. Went out fishing in a sloop boat with Saml Sargent an Jordan Joy on Sivins ground got between two and three tubs. afternoon wind Southerly got home in the evening
Wind Easterly and quite fresh but clear. put fish on flake to dry
Wind Southerly and heavy rain all day work about home. In evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting
Wind South West. heavy and rough finished my back stairs. Washed out some fish &ec
Wind heavy Westerly run mill had Piano tuned In evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting Ezra W. Tuft took his third degree
Wind Southerly and in the morning a little rainy but soon cleared up hauled coal for Str Silver Star
Wind West North West in forenoon. went out fishing in big boat on Marting Ground and out there untill 715 PM on an hour after dark. getting home at 9.30 PM with the wind S.W. got one tub of fish
Wind South West. dressed fish and saltem them in forenoon. In afternoon work for E.J. Hammond shingling roof of Bowling Alley
Wind Easterly and overcast. Staid about home
Wind North East. fresh and overcast Work on E.J. Hammonds Bowling alley shingling
Wind North East fresh but fine Work all day for E J Hammond laying shingles

Wind North East clear and fine work for E. J. Hammond shingling In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting James Coombs took the 3d degree after which the Ladie furnished Supper at the Hall. A good time enjoyed
Wind Northerly in the morning and gradualy went Easterly thence South finished shinglin the Bowling Alley at noon making 4 days work
Wind Westerly hauled 4 tons of coal to Str Silver Star and three tons to B. Frank Summer which used up the day
Wind South West. fresh and fine weather Hauled coal in forenoon. afternoon went to Prospect Harbor to settle for coal sold there
Wind South West and overcast and a little wet
Wind North East fresh and overcast Collecting money and sent to New York $400
Wind South East. Went to Bar Harbor and back. the weather looking like a storm

Wind Easterly and overcast. cleared up at 10 A.M. hauled some coal. In evening went to Hall to a Masonic meeting. Exemplified the work in 3d degree in presence of D.D.G.M. E. R. Wingate of Cherryfield the third masonic District

Wind North East and hauled around S.E. Work about home untill night then went to Bar Harbor on Silver Star with 7 or 8 Masons to witness the work on the 3d degree The evening was enjoyed very much. Came home after Lodge

Wind Easterly went to Ellsworth with Saml J. Clement as a Witness in a law suit about a boat taken form the Davis at Otter Creek The case not being called up untill night it will be necessary for me to remain untill tomorrow

Wind South East went to the Court house at 9 AM and the case against S.J. Clement was continued. at 10 am I was called to the witness stand, as the one who had the case of the boat in controversy and testified. as to the value of the boat &ce staid at the Cout house untill the testimony was all in and the lawyers made their pleas Then a recess was taken got dinner and came home in the afternoon with Wm. Framer without hearing the verdict of the jury
Moderate Easterly staid about home all day
Wind South East. moderate and thick with fog got ready & Went to Turtle Isle gunning and back at noon without any game
Wind East and rain all day. My birth day 44 years old traded horses with Colon Bunker paying $5.00 to boot
Wind North East and overcast hauling coal. In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting. Opened on the third degree. did no work
Wind Northerly went to Turtle Island gunning got 8 birds back at noon
Wind very moderate or no wind at all went gunning at Schoodic Island with two others got 25 birds most of them ducks and drakes In afternoon wind Southerly came home
Very moderate S.S.E. wind and fine weather. Went to Bar Harbor in small boat and back
Wind South South West. Heavy blow and heavy rain all day
Wind W.N.W. went to Bar Harbor and back in sail boat. Then hauled wock weed and put around the house
Wind W.N. West heavy hauled coal all day

Wind Westerly work all day at the coal shed hauling out coal and dumping it to make room for for another cargo that is expected any day In the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting It being the first one in the month it is our stated one
Wind Westerly work about the coal shed getting ready to receive another cargo of coal
Wind Northerly in forenoon and South West in the afternoon Work all day on wharf and coal shed and am now ready to receive a Cargo that we have been expecting
Wind Southerly overcast and looking like foul weather. The Sch. Walter M Young arrived with coal and got into the wharf at noon with 126 tons 82 tons Egg and 44 tons stone 126 total
Wind North East afternoon rainy
Wind Northerly Commenced to discharge Sch. Walter M. Young. Then went to Bar Harbor and back
Calm or nearly so about all day at night a very light air Southerly. The Sch. Walter M. Young finished discharging coal for us to day noon and got out the harbor

Wind Easterly Went on board of the Str. Silver Star and went all day over the bay for the express purpose of weighing all the coal she burned during the day. At night it stormed to haul to have a Lodge of F & AM and did not meet
Wind Easterly and rainy most all day work about home
Wind North West. very heavy blow and cold. ground freezing Not feeling very well did no work
Wind North West went all day on the Str Silver Star weighing all the coal was used
Wind Westerly fresh Went to Aunt Martha Bunkers with my wife visiting home in the afternoon
Wind Southerly took up a note of Bunker & Summers at the First National Bank of Bar Harbor of $100. hauled coal most all day
Wind Easterly Went on board Sch. A. B. Crabtree. made out a memorandom of timber and Iron to repair her this coming winter. put out side windows on house for Jennice Kingsley
Wind Easterly fresh and tremendious rain untill 3 P.M. when it cleared up and wind died out work in the house
Wind South West and rough. Took Saml Clements boat as here to haul up for the winter hauled rock weed to put around the cellar wall
Wind Southerly and a little rainy Covered ground over sewer pipes with rock weed to keep it from freezing no frost in the ground yet
Wind very moderate Northerly. but the weather does not look settled. took Saml Clements boat out of water to keep clear of the ice during the winter
Wind South West about home

Calm untill dark when the wind breezed up Northerly Fixed the mouth of the Sewer pipe at the Shore to keep it from freezing although there has not been cold enough to freeze any thing yet. as I have been at work this day in my shirt sleeves
Wind N.N. West. fresh. Thermometer at freezing point working out of door getting ready for cold weather

North West. very moderate. at night none at all. The weather thickening up and looking very bad weather Commenced changing the coal cart from single to a two horse cart In evening went to hall to a Masonic meeting
Wind Easterly with heavy blow and a tremendious snow storm turning to rain. At night the snow all gone by the heavy rain storm. Made pole for our horse cart
Wind South West Work most all day on cart
Wind North West. ground freezing. work all day on cart. doing the black smith work

Wind Westerly quite moderate. On hearing the Chromo was wrecked at Yorks Narrows. The Str Silver Star was going to tow her home. and we haul two tons of coal for that purpose. it being a case of cmauguey

Wind South West Finished the carpenter work. and Iron work on cart at noon. afternoon commenced work on Sch. Chromo She has been towed here from Yorks Narrows. came here to repair. Step of foremast gone the flying jobform gone also the Bon side of bowsprint where the jib stays goes
Wind Northerly work on Sch Chromo repairing
Wind N.N. East. Thermometer at zero Commenced the making of flying jobboom for Sch Chromo with the help of Wm. Tracy In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting Stated one
Wind N.N. East looking like a storm. work on Sch. Chromo all day. at 8 PM wind Southerly and heavy rain
Wind West North West. heavy work on Sch. Chromo
Wind Westerly held survey on Sch. Chromo. and finished all labors on said vessel at noon. In afternoon went to Bar Harbor to make affidavit regarding lots on Grind stone point
Wind Easterly and partialy Cloudy Thermometer 34'
Wind South East and rain storm
Wind moderate North West. hauling coal all day
Wind South South East heavy with a power of rain. work in house fixing the attick windows No lodge to night on account of the rainstorm
Wind North West and blowing a perfect gale. picking the water right up work about home
Wind baffling all around the compass. At night the wind North work all day on road leading to coal shed carting in beach rocks
Wind N. N. East Thermometer 10 above hauling coal
Wind Northerly Thermometer at 0' in morning
Wind N.N.W. hauled some coal and worked in the house

Wind Northerly hauled 4 tons coal to Str Silver Star and leased wood lot of Jennice Kingsley Also received check from J. P. Gordon for $113.00 to pay the bills on Sch. Chromo, caused by the carrying way her head gear
Wind South East and wet. Went to South Gouldsboro to see Calon Bunker back at noon. Afternoon worked on table for Capt. W. H. Parker In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting
Wind South South East and heavy rain Painted decoys for myself
Nearly calm with a very light air of wind Southerly Work on horse sled changing from a one horse sled to a two horse sled. Not one particle of snow on the ground yet

Wind West North West very heavy. In forenoon went in the woods up the Stream looking out a chance for a man to cut some wood and piling. In afternoon finished the sled from a one horse to a two horse one
Wind Easterly The A.B. Crabtree came into my wharf to lay for the winter and to be repaired. afternoon and evening heavy rain and blow
Wind North West very heavy work about home
Moderate Westerly wind Ther abt 30' made handle for broad anx and adze, getting ready to work on Sch. A. B. Crabtree
Christmas Day Rainy in forenoon with the wind Easterly. Afternoon cleared up and at night wind Westerly. no Lodge to night as there will be a concert at the Stone Church
Wind South East. afternoon heavy rain. Used up most of the afternoon with S.L. Kingsley on business connected with proposed great land scheme
Wind North West a perfect gale to blowy for any kind of out of door work
Wind North West fresh breeze went to Bar Harbor to obtain a Lisence for Jennie S. Kingsley to seel land she being Guardian for he son Chas. F. Kingsley back at night
Wind South East Thermometer 8' above 0 in morning later in the day getting overcast. in evening a little rainy
In morning the wind South West and hauled North West. work with the blacksmith forge and hauled coal

Wind North Ther 14' above. Not any snow on the ground. noe has there been any. and but a very little cold weather. My principal business is that of a coal dealer though I do various kinds of work and expect to fo a job of work on Sch A.B. Crabtree

Wind Southerly Not any snow on the ground whatever neither has there been any My principal business is that of a coal dealer. But my partner W. W. Summer looks out for that while I do other work. In the evening went to the Hall to the anual meeting of the Lodge of F. & A.M. and elected officers as follows My self W. M. H. C. Guptill S. W. W W. Summer J. W. IR Hammond Treas. B E Tracy Sec. then the master appointed W H Parker S.D. J W Wescott J D Ezra Trept S S. Jabez Myrick J. S. P. A. Summer Chap. B. F. Summer Marshal Tyler not appointed to night No snow so far this winter
Wind Southerly and warm. Commenced work on Schr A. B. Crabtree and worked all day
Wind North West. Work on Sch. A. B. Crabtree
Wind North West Went to Bar Harbor on Silver Star back at night
Wind Easterly and a very little snow. The first that has been on the ground so far this winter to last two hours
