Wind Southerly. some sleighs were out in forenoon. the first time for the year but is is no sleighing In evening went to the Hall to a Hall meeting
Wind Northerly work all day on Schr. A. B. Crabtree

Wind Easterly in morning then hauled out. work half day on Sch. A.B. Crabtree In evening went to the Hall to a Public Installation of officers of Winter Harbor Lodge F. & A.M. my self Installed Master Horner C. Guptill S.W. Wallace W. Summer J.W. Thomas R Hammond Treas. Bedford E. Tracy Sec. Way H. Parkers S.D. James W. Wescott J.D. Ezra W. Tuft & Jabez Myrick Stewards. No Tyler been appointed. Officers Installed by E. R. Wingate of Cherryfield D.D.G.M. 3d Masonic dist. assisted by B Frank Summer. as Grand Masters of Winter Harbor. After which we went to the Hannover to supper got up Swing Circle and others

Wind West North West and blowing a perfect gale. with the Thermometer at zero Work one half day on sch A. B. Crabtree doing some blacksmith work but the weather being so tough knocked off at noon. Afternoon keeping pipes from freezing in my house and have succeded so far. at this wintering whech is 9.30 P.M.
Wind North East Thermometer 12' below zero in morning and 6' below at noon and 8 below zero at night Kept the house and looked out for the water pipes not frozen yet

Wind North East and thermometer 10 degrees below zero in morning work drafting a boat for Jordan M. Joy In afternoon Then 6' above 0 and commenced snowing at 10 P.M. Wind S.E. and Thermometer 30' above as I go to bed no pipes frozen yet
Wind Northerly Thermometer 30 above some snow on the ground. but had the appearance of heavy rain during the night past
Wind South East fresh and a little rainy. Snow going very fast. Worked 3/4 day on Sch A. B. Crabtree at night snow all gone
Wind West North West very fresh but the thermometer stood at 31 degrees Work all day on Sch A.B. Crabtree
Wind Southerly and snowy in forenoon In the afternoon rainy and snow abt gone Work all day on Sch. A B Crabtree In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting and exemplified the work on B.A.D
Wind Southerly and rainy taking a way what little snow there is left work on board Sch. A.B. Crabtree in her hold doing blacksmith work having my forge there
Wind West North West Thermometer 8' above work all day on the Sch. A B Crabtree during blacksmith work in her hold to blustering to work on deck doing Carpenters work
Wind NorthWest and moderate Work all day on Sch. A.B. Crabtree
Calm in morning Southerly in afternoon. Went to So. Gouldsboro on a ride
Wind South Easterly and rainy all day worked 3/4 day on Sch. A. B. Crabtree doing blacksmith work in hold with my forge
Wind NorthWest. work all day on Sch A. B. Crabtree

Wind North West fresh. Did not work to day on vessel not feeling well Got life Insured in Mechanic Falls Ins Co. Masonic In evening went to the hall to a Masonic Meeting James W. Bunker took the E. A. D.
Wind North North West went to Bar Harbor to see S.L. Kingsley but where I got there found he had gone to New York Came back in the afternoon
Wind North East and snowing in forenoon. Afternoon stoped snowing and used sled to haul coal
Wind South West blowing a perfect gale. Work all day at the coal shed snow snow but very light
Wind Westerly very moderate and fine weather In evening went to the Baptist Church to a prayer meeting. It being the second time I ever saw the inside of it
Wind East North East Went on Str Silver Star all day in place of Fired Sargent
Wind N.N.W. Hauling out coal all day
Wind South West Went to Bar Harbor in the yacht rain back in afternoon Evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting. Opened on M M Installed Tyler
Wind North East work all day on Sch A. B. Crabtree
Wind Northerly work all day on Sch A. B. Crabtree
Wind North East work all day on Sch A. B. Crabtree

Wind Easterly in morning then hauled out South Went to So. Gouldsboro after dinner there hauled 2 1/2 tons coal to the Steamer Silver Star to go to Bar Harbor. We did not receive the order untill late last night and tomorrow is the boats last trip this winter therefore work today
Wind Southerly thick with fog and a little rainy worked 3/4 day on Sch. A. B. Crabtree Str. Silver Star has made her las trip for the present. and now hauls up
Wind North West. work all day on Sch A b Crabtree

Wind South in morning and thick with fog at noon cleared up wind Westerly Thermometer 50' above work on deck on shirt sleaves Evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting the first Wed. in the month therefore a stated one
Wind North West Thermometer 16' above work all day on Sch A. B. Crabtree
Wind Northerly Thermometer at zero in morning afternoon wind out Southerly looking very much like a storm. work all day on Sch A. b. Crabtree
Wind South South East heavy blow and rain Mabel Smallidge died at 5 oclock A.M. work 1/4 day on Sch A.b. Crabtree
Wind North and cold. Went to Capt. Smaallidges house with my wife to stop a little while on account of the death of Mabel
Wind Northerly and fine weather. Work on Sch. A.B. Crabtree in forenoon. In afternoon went to Thomas H. Smallidge house to the funeral of Mabel which took place at 2 P.M. by S.H. Altkins
Wind Northerly and fine weather work all day on Sch. A.B. Crabtree
Wind Southerly and in the afternoon Wind westerly with rain squalls Work all day on Sch. A.B. Crabtree In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting and Henry J. Hovey took the E.A.D.
Wind South West and very fine weather Work all day on Sch A.B. Crabtree
Wind Southerly work all day in my shirt sleaves on deck on board of Sch. A B Crabtree
Wind Southerly in forenoon at night West very heavy work all day on Sch. A.B. Crabtree
Wind North West very fresh Thermometer from 12' to 20' above zero
The wind very moderate Northerly work all day on Sch. A B Crabtree
Wind East North East and thick with snow. No sledding thus far this winter Work all day on Sch A B Crabtree

North East Wind snowy in forenoon Started to go to Bar Harbor with Capt. W. H. Parker Took team went to Sullivan Took Sebenoa for Bar Harbor. Capt. Parker found the Parties on board the boat he wished to see. therefore did not go any further than Mt. Desert Ferry the first landing then came back to Sullivan and home. In evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting. Henry & Howey the F. C. Degree
Wind East and thick with snow and snowing heavy untill 3 P.M. when the wind hauled North and cleared up This is the first snow for the winter that could make any use of. and now there is a plenty
Wind North West and blowing a gale Thermometer at zero No work out of door
Wind North West Thermometer at 0' with a very heavy breeze To cold to work out

Thermometer 10' below in morning and at night 32 above wind Southerly hauled one ton of coal for the Str Silver Star. She had been hauled up since the first of the month. but is going to do some towing for the Ice Companies
Wind Southerly and the snow going very fast It is hard sledding now. in fact there has not been any sledding so far this winter hauled coal most all day
Very light air of wind South East and thick with fog. Work all day on Sch A.B. Crabtree
Wind Easterly and a rain storm. hauled coal on a cart. In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting exemplified the work in the M.M.D.
Wind Southerly Thermometer 42' in Shade Work all day on Sch. A.B. Crabtree
Wind South East and overcast. at night rainy work all day on Sch. Silver Star
Wind Easterly and rainy. Got Capt. H. E. Tracy yacht rain to take me to Bar Harbor to bid on the Sloup boat Elta. M. I bid on her $60 and got her Came home in Str. Silver Star Wind North & Clear
Wind N.N.E. overcast. In afternoon went to the stone Church to a religious meeting. In evening a a snow storm

Wind Northerly and a tough snow storm Went to Town meeting Elected Jack Dumper Moderator Arthur Kingsley Clerk B E Tracy Esq Capt S C Moore Jack Dumper all select men At night fine weather Every thing to day went to my satisfaction
Calm in morning later very moderate Easterly Work all day on Schooner A.B. Crabtree
Wind Southerly afternoon cloudy Work all day on the Sch. A. b. Crabtree. In evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting Henry J. Hovey took the M.M.D.
Wind North East. and thick with snow. Work all day on Sch. A. B. Crabtree
Wind North West good sledding Work all day on Sch. A. B. Crabtree
Wind North West work all day on Sch a b crabtree
Wind North hauled coal to Str Silver Star
Wind Northerly and fine weather work all day on Sch. A.B. Crabtree
Calm in forenoon with Thermometer at zero. In afternoon the Thermometer 40 above wind Southerly. Work all day on Sch. A B Crabtree
Light wind South and very fine weather. Work all day on Sch A.B. Crabtree. In evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting No Candidate appeared In afternoon Mrs Reliance Bickford died
About calm Went to Bar Harbor and back on Str Silver Star Mrs Reliance Bickford burried in afternoon
Calm all day Left the Sch. A. B. Crabtree for the present to work on Sch. Angola In afternoon rainy and quit work at 4 P.M.
Calm large flakes of wet snow falling Work apart of the forenoon on Sch Angola when it became to wet and knocked of Mrs. Annie Pendleton Died at about 11 Oclock AM
Calm and overcast most all day snow melting
Wind Westerly work for Charles Davis in forenoon on Sch. Angola In afternoon painted the boat Elta M. Mrs Annie Pendleton burried from the Charming Chapel
Wind North West fresh. Work all day on Schr A. B. Crabtree
Wind Easterly and moderate Launched the boat Elta M. and Rigged her. In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic Meeting Capt Charles J. Hamilton took the E.A.D.
Wind South West went to Bar Harbor in sloop boat Elta M that I bought man 1 back in afternoon
Wind Southerly and rainy work apart of the day on Sch A b Crabtree

Calm in forenoon At noon the wind breezed up Southerly Went to Bar Harbor in sloop for a settlement with S.L. Kingsley with the determination not to come back untill I get a settlement In evening rainy stop at the Bremer Hotel
Wind North East. snow on rain most all day. Stoping at Bar Harbor
Wind N.W. by North fresh. Got a settlement with S L Kingsley in afternoon. and got home at sunset. after depositing $390 as collateral security with the Bar Harbor Banking & Trust Co
Wind Southerly Sent check to Mcjrs H B Rawson & Co for $200 on acct of coal
Wind Easterly and rainy No Lodge to night unless calles to order by the S.W. as I am unable to attend
Wind Westerly quite fresh Run my windmill turning belaying pins for Sch. A. B. Crabtree
Wind Easterly and thick with snow. Work for Loun Rand repairing a skiff at his barn
Wind North East. and a little snowy Work all day for Loren Rand repairing his skiff
An air of wind North with fine snow
Wind South West work in forenoon for Loren Rand and in the afternoon Went to South Gouldsboro to work on Sch. Mattic putting on Shoe forefoot &ic
Wind NorthWest Work all day at South Gouldsboro for Burt Bunker on Sch. Mattie Caulking and doing Carpenter work finished at night and came home leaving my tool box up there

Wind Westerly Took on sloop boat Elta M. into the wharf and commenced raising her top by wash boarding higher In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic Meeting First Meeting in Apr. Therefor a tated one I was elected Historian to write the History of lodge from Organization to Jam 11890
Very moderate South West and a very fine day work on sloop boat
Wind South South East and rainy. work in house
Wind North Snow in forenoon. Cleared up in the afternoon. In forenoon wrote on the history of Winter Harbor Lodge to which I have been appointed
Wind North West. Staid about home. At night wind Southerly and looked rainy
Calm untill abt 10 AM where the wind breezed up Southerly. at noon little rainy Work on sloop boat Elta M.
Wind N.N.W. very fresh in forenoon afternoon moderate at night Southerly work on boat Elta M.
Wind Easterly and rainy. Went to Bar Harbor in Sail boat to take care of a note at the First National Bank. In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting D Winslow Joy took the E. A. Degree
Wind South West work about home
Wind North. work on stoop boat
Wind Northerly in forenoon and South West in afternoon. Went to Bar Harbor in sloop boat after freight and passengers as there is no steam boat on the Route Got back at sunset
Calm in forenoon wind Southerly in afternoon Went to So. Gouldsboro after my toolbox that was left there when I was done work on a vessel Apr. 1st
Wind Easterly quite fresh. Took a row boat from the coal shed that I had bought and hauled her to Jennie Kingsleys shop to repair and work the day on her
Wind North West very fresh Work all day on my row boat
Wind Westerly fresh Work all day on my row boat. In evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting and D. Winslow Joy took the F.C.D.
Wind West North West fresh finished work on my row boat at noon
Wind North West Not well unable to work
Wind North staid in the house with a cold
Wind North East in forenoon and Southerly in afternoon staid at home
Wind Northerly and very fine weather did not work not well enough
Wind hauled out Southerly work a very little about home
Wind Southerly work about home getting ready to go out fishing In evening went to the hall to a masonic meeting and D Winslow Joy took the M.M.D. after lodge, rainy
Wind came of N.W. In afternoon went to Bar Harbor in sloop boat after bait to go a fishing with stoping on board of the boat
Wind E.S. East Got 4 bushels of herring form the weir and came home. arriving at 2 P.M.
Wind Easterly and went around Southerly Went Fishing with Jordan Joy got about two tubs
Wind Easterly and fresh with heavy rain and and some snow
Wind North West and fine weather commenced plowing but finding there is so much frost gave up farming for a while
Wind Southerly work all day on the inside of J.L. Smallidges house finishing the closet
Wind South West work all day on J. L. Smallidge's house. In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting. but so few met. the Lodge was not called to order
Wind Southerly work in forenoon on Joseph Smallidge house and in the afternoon getting ready for farming
Wind Southerly work all day farming
Wind Southerly and fresh. Worked most all day farming R Pendletons boats attached by William Fennely Depty Sheriff and put in my care
Wind Southerly thick with fog and rainy
Wind South East and tremendiously heavy rain all day work about the house

Wind South East thick with fog and showery Work all day for Joseph L. Smallidge on his house A Company of Capitalists has been formed. bought Grindstone Point and other lands. and have commenced this day to build a house to be used (as they say) for a Look out station. a map on Chart room Coat room. Office &C The Co. was formed a long time ago butCommenced building to day

Wind Southerly and very fine weather. Work all day on Grindstone Neck for the Gouldsboro land and Improvemente Co putting up the first building. In the evening went to the Hall to the Stated meeting of Masons Elected James A Stavens for the degrees
Wind North East and rainy As I could not work on Grindstone Point. on acct rain Went to Bar Harbor and back in the Sail boat Elta m.

Wind South West and fine weather Work all day on Grindstone Point building a house for the Gouldsboro land and Improvement Co. the house to be used for an office Lookout Chart toom Coat room bathroom &ce
Wind Southerly and rainy worked 3/4 day on Grindstone Point
Wind N.N.W. Went to Bar Harbor in sloop boat and back
Wind Southerly Work all day on Point
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. In forenoon worked setting out Goose berries of the Downing kind In afternoon worked on Grind Stone point
Wind South East and rainy Went to Bar Harbor and back
Wind very moderate South Easterly work 3/4 day on the point when it began to rain came home
Wind Southerly and thick with fog work all day on Grindstone Point on house getting out finish
Wind South West and fine weather work all day on Grindstone Point for the Gouldsboro Land Improvement Co. shingling the roof their building
Wind South West and a very fine day
Wind Southerly work all day for the Gouldsboro Land Improvement Co.
Wind South Easterly and rainy. work all day for the Gouldsboro Land Imp. Co. on the inside of the house
Wind North North West and fine weather Work all day for the Gouldsboro Land Imp Co.
Wind Southerly work all day for the Gouldsboro land Imp Co

Wind North Easterly work all day for the Gouldsboro Land Improvement Co. on Grindstone Point workind on their new building whis is intending to be for a Look out. Office. Coat room. Chart room &c R. Pendletons boats released from attachment and I give them up
Wind South Easterly and chilly work all day on the new house on Grindstone Point
Wind South Easterly and fine weather In afternoon went to West Gouldsboro to see C. E. Kingsley who is quite sick Came home at night and find I have a very bad cold comming on and hoarsing up

Wind Southerly Being sick with cold do not go on Grind Stone Point to work as usual Reed Notice from the Masons Relief association of Mechanic Falls Me. that my assessment is 160 there being three deaths since last assessment
Wind South East and rainy stoped in the house and done a little work
Wind Easterly with rain. Staid in house

Wind North East Went to Bar Harbor on Str Silver Star. Took Str Sebenoa Went to Mt Dessert Ferry. Took M C. R R went to Ellsworth Came back to Franklin Road hired team went to Franklin came back to Franklin road. took cars to Mt. Desert Ferry and Steam boat to Bar Harbor
Wind Northerly and fine weather Came home from Bar Harbor in forenoon. In afternoon went on Grind stone point to work for the Gouldsboro land Imp Co. on house
Wind South West work all day for the Gouldsboro Land Improvement Co
Wind Northerly in forenoon, and Southerly in the afternoon Went to meeting in the Unitarian Church
Wind Southerly work all day for the Gouldsboro Land Imp. Co
Wind Southerly work all day for the Gouldsboro Land Imp Co

Wind South South East Not having lumber to work with for the Gouldsboro Land Imp Co. do not work for them to day Sec go gunning down to the Turtle Isle Lodges all alone got three birds and back home in the forenoon In afternoon rainy
Wind North East and wet. work about home Not having any lumber to work with for the Gouldsboro Land Imp Co

Wind South South East went to Bar Harbor & back in forenoon on Str Silver Star and took up note at the First National Bank Given by F. S. Whitney &co and Endorsed by S L Kingsley and Bunker & Summer the note being protested is paid this day by Bunker & Summer
Wind Easterly and rainy. Run jigsaw sawing out lattice work for house Gouldsboro Land Imp. Co. office
Wind North West a gale. Went to West Gouldsboro to see Edward C. Kingsley who is very sick and will probably never be any better
Wind Southerly in morning then came N.W. thence North and blew fresh. Work for the Gouldsboro Land Imp Co. Jigsawing using Wind mill power
Wind North North West Work for the Gouldsboro Land Imp. Co. sawing with jig saw in the shop. using windmill for motive powers
Calm in morning and fine weather In afternoon wind Easterly and at 6 oclock PM rainy work all day on the house on Grindstone point
Wind Easterly work all day for the Gouldsboro Land Imp Co on house on Grindstone Point
Wind Easterly and a rain storm. Work all day on house on Grindstone Point finishing the inside of the house C. E. Kingsley died in morning
Wind North East. and wet fine rain. Work all day on Grind Stone Point
Wind N.W. in forenoon and S.W. in afternoon A large party of the Gouldsboro Land Imp Co arrived with their friends. and are delighted with the point
Wind Southerly fresh. got wharf logs in the water form R Rands shore and rafted them. In the evening took boat and towed them to my shore to repair my wharf arriving home at midnight
Wind South South West work all day on Grindstone Point ceiling the rooms in house for the G L & Co

All kinds of weather this morning the wind Southerly and good fine weather. This afternoon Thunder Lightning & rain with heavy squalls North East. North & North West also S.E. then calm. Work all day on house on point
Wind Southerly and thick with fog Noon rainy At night wind North East. Work all day on Grindstone Point on house for G.L.I.Co
Wind South West work all day on Grindstone Point same as yesterday
Wind South West very fresh work all day on Grindstone Point for G.L.I.C.
Wind South East and fine weather staid about home
Wind Easterly work all day for Gouldsboro Land Imp. Co.
Wind Easterly and thick with fog. Work all day for G.L. I. Co.
Wind Easterly and rain all day Work all day for G.L.I. Co.
Wind North East. and showery laying floors in house on grindstone point for G.L. I. Co.
Wind North East and showey. Finished work on Grindstone Point at night on the house I have been working on. The Carpenter work being all done
Wind Northerly and good weather getting ready to paint my house or rather I have let it to a man to pain. In afternoon worked a whole in the Cemetary
Wind Southerly Went to a religious meeting at the Charming Chapel The preaching was by a colored man Wm. E. Froy
Wind Southerly Commenced having my house painted by W. F. Vose & others
Wind South East with a little fog having my house painted mowed a little around the door
Wind South Easterly and fine weather Running lines between the Estate of J.F. Kingsley and the Fover lot so called. Road laid out from my house to Jamie Kingsleys house by the Select men
Wind South Easterly Foggy and little rainy. built stall in Coal shed to keep our house
Wind Southerly Foggy and wet apart of the day. No Celebration here to day. But a dance in the evening Finished building stall in the coal shed to keep our house
Wind South Easterly and thick with fog with some rain hauled some coal
Wind North West and pleasant. Staid at home
Wind Southerly but very moderate Commenced hauling coal to the Str. Silver Star again. have not finished her any coal since march
Wind South Easterly and thick with fog jobbing with the coal cart. Thunder shower in the evening
Wind North West very fresh Went to Bar Harbor to see Lawyer Peters about the collection of a note given for coal
Wind Westerly and very fine weather Work about the coal shed
Calm in morning afternoon wind Southerly work about the coal shed
Very light air of wind Northerly in forenoon, and SouthWest in afternoon. Sold my hay in the field to E.W. Tuft had potatoes hoed my house finished being painted. work about the coal shed &ce
Wind Southerly went to Church in the afternoon at the Charming Chapel which is unitarian

Wind South West. Hauled coal all day getting ready to work on the Club house on Grindstone Point. It is my intention to haul coal mondays and Thursdays and work on the Club House the other four days in the week if I can make it work
Light wind Southerly Commenced work on a Club house built by John Clark of Bar Harbor for the Gouldsboro Land Imp Co. This is my first day but the building was begun last week

Very light air of wind Southerly untill about 3 oclock P.M. when the wind struck North in a squall which soon died out and a light air of wind Southerly again. Work all day on Grindstone Point on the Club House owned by the land Co
Wind very light Southerly and a hot day. hauled 4 tons coal to Str Silver Star
Wind North and more coal Work on Club house on Grindstone Point
Wind South South East fresh. Jig sawing all day for John Clarck the Contractor making rafter ends for the Club house on Grindstone Point
Wind Northerly and a little showery Went on a little ride with my wife
Wind Northwest in forenoon and Southerly in afternoon Hauled coal all day for Str Silver Star and others
Wind Southerly Run jib saw for John Clark making rafter ends for Club house on Grindstone Point
Wind Southerly work all day shingling on Club House
Wind South South East. thick with fog morning and night. but clear in middle of the day. Work all day hauling coal to Steam boat and Hotel
Wind Southerly and thick with fog Went to Bar Harbor to settle at the Banks some notes. afternoon heavy shower came home about sick
Wind South Easterly Thick with fog in forenoon and heavy rain in afternoon Staying in house Sick in bed and had the Doctor says I am Billious
Am told the wind is South West and pleasant. am unable to get out of bed. am suffering great pain Dr. came in the afternoon
Wind Southerly am able to to Cork out of the sindow and know it is fine weather pain much relieved by the Drs. medicine left last night. hired coal hauled
Wind Southerly and fine weather have not left my room yet. but am much better
Light air Southerly Thick with fog over the water but it burned up over the land. Have been able to get to the door. and am improving fast
Wind Southerly and hot. hired the coal hauled for the Str Silver Star Sent H B Rawson & Co $200. on acct for Bunker & Summer
Wind Southerly am able to go most any where on account of my health
Wind Southerly work around home some. and hauled little coal
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. Went to a religious meeting in afternoon at the Charming Chapel
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. hauled coal
Wind South South West and some fog. and very fresh wind work at home
Wind South South East Went to Bar Harbor on business connected with the Bank
Wind very moderate Southerly and hot plowed amongst Jennie Kingsleys potatoes. and worked around the coal shed
Light Easterly wind in forenoon afternoon wind South hauled coal
Wind Southerly and foggy. work abt home but not well
Wind Southerly and partialy foggy Did not go to the meeting not being well

Wind very moderate Easterly. Although not being well necessity compells me to go to Bar Harbor to collect money for Bunker & Summer Not getting much Satisfaction the business remains unsettled and I will have to go back tomorrow if possible

Wind Easterly and good weather. Went back to Bar Harbor on business connected with coal and while there not able to sit up and took a room in the Rodick House where I remained in bed. untill about time for the Str. to go home got some satisfaction abt money
Wind Easterly and hauled out more Southerly. Sent check to Messrs H.B. Rawson & Co for $200 on acct on Bunker & Summer but am unable to be out of my room
Wind Southerly and fine weather Went out of door not able to work hired coal hauled to the Steam boat
Wind Southerly not able to work much hired the coal hauled
Wind Westerly in the forenoon. but in the afternoon it hauled out SouthWest Work about the coal shed in the forenoon. and in the afternoon went to Bar Harbor with my sister by her request
Wind very fresh Southerly with some fog. In the evening heavy shower with thunder and lightning

Wind North East with heavy rain in morning. when the wind hauled North Westerly and fine weather. Reed bill of Laden on load coal on my own acct. Mr. Summer out of the Business. Sent check to the Bar Harbor Banking & Trust Co. for $200 to take up a note there of Bunker & Summers
Wind Southerly Finished hauling all the coal out of the shed that is owned by Bunker & Summer except a little Cumb. coal
Wind Southerly and heavy rain in morning. then it cleared up fine work about home
Wind Southerly coaled up the little Steamer Gouldsboro for the first time she belonging to the Gouldsboro Land Improvement Co
Wind Southerly and very heavy rain in morning cleared up at 8 AM and then the wind Westerly. and fine
Wind North East and a little wet. repaired the wheel burrows ready to discharge the coal vessel when she arrives
Wind Southerly with a little fog but a very fine day
Wind moderate Southerly and fine weather work about home waiting for the coal vessel to arrive
Calm in morning afternoon wind South My coal vessel arrived at 3 P.M. consigned to me Individualy not Bunker & Summer as has been the case for the past two years
Wind South South East fresh breeze and heavy rain. so much so could not discharge the vessel of coal lying along side of the coal wharf
Wind North West Work all day discharging coal from the Sch. Ruth S. Hodgdon but the vessels hatch being to small slow work is made of it. only a little over 60 tons out in all day
Wind North West in morning. Got the Sch Ruth S Kodgon out at 10.30 AM. Afternoon the wind Southerly and hauled some coal
Wind Easterly and thick with fog Evening rainy did but little work
Wind Southerly about home
Wind North West fresh for the time of year and pleasant hauled coal in forenoon
Wind South West Sold five tons coal to A.R. Joy at Prospect Harbor to be hauled by himself
Wind Southerly delivering coal all day In evening went to the Hall to a Stated meeting of Masons. the first meeting since may

Wind Southerly and at night. thick with fog. Went to Bar Harbor with my sister. her business is to settle with S L Kingsley or his alby. She holding a mortgage on Grindstone necks for $1800. her claim was satisfied and she gets a check for $1811.33 came home at night
Wind Southerly received an order from Cale Bros. for 16 tons coal work about the coal shed
Wind Southerly and hot. The summer Cottages are getting ready to Cave. I have taken this day for the settlement with them
Wind South Easterly and very fine weather
Wind Southerly To day is State Election. and I have been to the polls and cast a vote for Edwin C. Burleigh voting the straight Republican ticket In the afternoon hauled coal
Wind North East hauled coal in forenoon but in the afternoon rainy
Wind North East and over cast. work on cart making whiffle trees and fixing up the hauling gear in general. Went to the Hall to a masonic meeting
Wind Easterly & overcast most all day. delivered coal and hauled rocks to grade around the horse
Wind Easterly and rain all day without ceasing
Wind South and overcast. blowing a gale Went to Bar Harbor and back on Str. Silver Star bought hanes and stoughters for heavy work
Wind North West in forenoon and Southerly in afternoon Went on Grindstone neck to look at the roads wharf Club house &ce
Wind Southerly and very heavy rain early in the morning at noon went to Bar Harbor in sloop boat and bought some grain for my horse
Wind South Easterly and a big rain storm. Made a seat for my horse cart
Wind East. and heavy rain all day without ceasing. hauled one ton coal to Boat. Storms to hard for me to go to the Lodge to night and dont know whether there will be or not
Wind Easterly and rainy. In afternoon the wind came of Northerly but it kept on raining
Calm in morning then the wind breezed Southerly and fine weather work all day around the coal shed. tending to business
Wind Southerly Fresh and somewhat overcast. Worked hard all day at coal shed
Wind North West fresh breeze and fine weather
Wind moderate Southerly hauled coal and worked grading around the house
Wind South Easterly and overcast. hauled coal Reed Check from S.L. Kingsley and collected money from other Sources
Wind Northerly and Westerly work about home In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting and James W. Bunker took the F C Degree he took the E.A.D. several months ago
Wind South West very heavy worked on over Sloop boat the Elta M. putting her in order
Wind South west and rough hauled coal and getting ready ready to go over to North East Harbor
Wind North East & In afternoon. took sloop boat and went to N.E. Harbor to see Capt. Frank Sperlings who is in a yacht at N.E. Harbor
Wind North East. Stopping at N.E. Harbor untill 3 P.M. where the wind began to moderate and I was ready to go home and got as far as Otter Creek. and went back to N.E. Harbor and stop
Wind E.N. East. Left N.E. Harbor at 8.30 A.M. and beat home. arriving at one twenty wind hauled out Southerly in afternoon
Wind North West very fresh. hauled coal and made up my accts to the end of the month
Calm in forenoon. afternoon Southerly work about home at night getting ready to go gunning Evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting. It is our Stated meeting. being the first Wednesday
Wind South West Went gunning on Turtle Isle. Lodges found birds very scarce
Wind Southerly and very fine weather. hauled two tons coal to J.W. Wescott Reed. desk from R Pendleton on acct. of note
Wind moderate Southerly and thick with fog work about the coal shed
Wind North West heavy but fine
Wind North fresh goo weather hauled coal all the forenoon. In afternoon got shoes under a shed bought of W.W. Summer to be used for a stable by me at my coal shed
Wind North East Under took to more a building bought of W.W. Summer but did not have team enough and will have to wait a while

Wind Easterly with showers work on my cart most of the day In the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting and Mr. John Straw and Capt Chas Hamilton to the F.C.D after which we had a lunch finished by the Ladies
Wind Northerly and very fine weather. jobbing with cart

Calm in morning Thermometer 32' above vapor thick. At 9.30 AM She breezed up Southerly At 11.30 AM took the Sail boat & went to Bar Harbor business connected with the Bank. home again at 4.30 P.M. Evening rainy
Wind Northerly and overcast. hauled coal all day. Reed bill of Laden of a load of coal 157 tons schr. Stephen J. Watts
Wind North East. fresh and clear Sch. S. J Watts. arrived with a load of coal at 7 A.M.
Wind Northerly & Easterly Work all day around the coal shed getting ready to receive the load of coal. In the evening the vessel hauled into the wharf ready to discharge
Light air Southerly Commenced to discharge the Sch. S. J. Watts with her load of coal to my Consignment Got out about 90 tons

Wind North West fresh. Finished discharging Sch S.J. Watts with coal at 3 oclocks P.M. In evening went to the hall to a masonic meeting officially visited by Bro Benj F. Hadly D.D.G.M. for the 2 masonic District and John A Shaw took the M.M.D.
Wind Westerly hauled coal all day with two horses and a man hired by the month Reed pay from the Str Silver Star the amount of $183.13 for Bunker & Summer and the sum of $194 for myself individualy
Wind Easterly and heavy rain storm all day Went to Bar Harbor on Str Silver Sar and deposited $420. back before noon
Wind North Easterly and fine. Had stable hauled from W.W. Summers to my coal shed that I had bought my team kept out hauling coal
Wind South East. and overcast. and looking very much like a storm

Wind East North East. very heavy with a power of rain in forenoon. Did not take the horses out to haul coal untill afternoon then it was showery Fixed the shed bought of W.W. Summer & put the horses in it at night. Sent check to Capt Frank & Spurling for $50
Wind North East and fine weather. hauled coal all day
Wind North East and pleasant. grading around the house & hauling coal In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting and Chas J. Hamilton took the M.M.D.
Wind very moderate N.E. and very pleasant hauled coal all day
Wind Easterly very fresh. Went gunning but the wind blew so hard came back home and worked around the coal shed
Wind Easterly fresh. but good weather. hauled coal to Customers and gravel to grate around the house
Wind North East moderate In afternoon went to Bar Harbor in sloop boat to see S.L. Kingsley back at dark
Wind Easterly and rain in the afternoon. Helped Capt. R.C. Jovey to haul up the yacht Iowa in forenoon. In afternoon fixing around the outside of the house getting ready for winter
Wind West. Fresh This is the first change of wind from Easterly since the 16th of this month work around the shed and house

Wind South South East rainy in afternoon My birth day 45 years. Sending coal to West Gouldsboro. Evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting but it stormed so hard did not call to order no candidate appearing
Wind a gale S.W. and very rough Sold coal to West Gouldsboro and hauled rockweed to put around the house to keep the cellar from freezing
Wind South East and overcast work about the coal shed all day
Moderate North West and partialy overcast hauled brush to put over the veil and around the house
Win Southerly and rain in forenoon
Wind Westerly and fresh. hauled coal
Wind Westery and chilly Worked most of the day getting ready to go on a cruise gunning
Wind South West and blowing a perfect gale. In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic Meeting Stated one Reed. applications and balloted on others

Wind Southerly and very rough In afternoon John Stover and myself went to Rollon Island to stop in the boat a few days. to go gunning anchored just after dark and a dead calm At 11 pm wind began to breeze up Easterly At 11.50 pm commenced to reef the boats sail preparing to leave 12 oclock midnight piping on in good shape

Wind Easterly. 12.30 a.m. Filled a way from Rollin Island in the sloop boat under two reef mainsail & jib. Parted one haven in trying to get the anchor before filled away. Anchored in Winter Harbor at 2.15 A.M. Then went to hauling coal. Put 3 tons on board tub boat Wm. Hinds bound to Calais. and took a sight draft on owners James Munchie & Sons
Wind SouthWest and hauled around NorthWest. work at the coal Business
Wind Easterly in morning and hauled out South and at night stormy
Wind North West a gale. Went to Bar Harbor on Silver Star and back
Moderate Northerly Thermometer 20' hauled coal to tug boat Wm Hinds and took a sight draft on owners James Murchie & Son
Very moderate wind baffling Early in morning the wind light N.E. In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting James W. Bunker took the M.M.D.
Calm nearly all day. At night very light air of wind Southerly. Went to Bar Harbor in row boat and came back in Str. Silver Star. Bought Our boat
Wind Westerly Fresh. work apart of the day on pile driver
Wind South Easterly hauled the boat Elta M. ashore and took her part way out the water. hauled coal to several parties. In Evening rainy
Wind North West
Wind Westerly Work about the Stable

Wind Southerly with snow and rain in forenoon. Held a survey on the Sch. Wm. Gallum at Winter Harbor loaded with staves and full of Water. In afternoon went to Sullivan after tug boat to to her into the wharf but could not get her. came back at dark

Wind South South West. Agreed to take the load of staves out of the Sch. Wm Gillum and put them on my landing. agreed with the Insurance agent sent from N.Y. I chartered the Sch Billow to take a load of the Gallum deck. In evening went to the Lodge of F. & AM
Wind North West very fresh. The Sch Billow took her load of Staves of the Sch. Wm Gallums deck. but did not reach my whard as the wind blew so heavy

Wind NorthWest good breeze untill night, when the wind went down. Chartered the Sch A B Crabtree to take the remainder of the staves of the Wm Gillums deck. and went along side of the Gillum at Suan set. Then hired a crew and went at work taking of the deckload At midnight still at work on the Wm Gillums deck load. and the wind blowing fresh South West

Wind South West. When this day begins (midnight) I am taking stones of the Wm Gillums deck and putting them on board Sch. A.B. Crabtree. Got the deck load of at 3 AM having worked since dark last night to the present time. At 3 A.M. went home. wind blowing fresh South West At 5.30 A.M. was out again. took breakfast went over to Henrys Cove on board Sch. A.B. Crabtree beat out and went into Winter Harbor the staves going to my wharf After this hauled stoves going to my wharf After this haules staves from my wharf by the Sch Billow
Wind Northerly. Took the wrecked Schr. from the head of Henrys cove. and anchored at the mouth of the little harbor. Afternoon snow squalls
Wind North North West. Thermometer at 20' Commenced work on my pile driver getting ready to work on my wharf
Wind South West very heavy Got the Sch. Wm Gillum into the wharf. and in the afternoon commenced taking the hold full out and hauling them up on the bank
Wind Westerly in the morning and then hauled NorthWest Work all day on the Sch Wm Gillum. taking her hold full of staves out. and hauling them a way. 10 men at work

Thanksgiving day Wind Northerly. Although it be a National Holly day. we finisdhed on loading the Sch Wm Gillum of her cargo of staves. And at the same time I have reed letter from the Ins. Co. that they have another vessel to take them in a few days
Wind North North West Thermometer at 20' above work on pile driver and wade out my bill on the cargo of Staves of Sch Wm Gillum and sent it to N.Y. to the Atlantic mutual Ins. Co.
Wind Westerly moderate but looks like snow Delivered coal all day
Wind South West. fresh and overcast The Sch. F. J. Diusco of Jonesport arrived to take the Cargo of staves landed by the Sch. William Gillum and left in my charge

Wind NorthWest very fresh. and at night growing cold work all day wheeling staves from the landing to wharf with a crew of men. To be taken on board of Sch. F. J. Dusco the staves being the cargo of Sch Wm Gillum
Wind North West. blowing very heavy Thermometer 4' below 0 work all day getting cement staves to the Sch F. J Drises

Wind North West Thermometer 12' below zero in morning to cold to work on staves. In evening went to the Hall to a Stated meeting F & A M At 9 PM Ther. 33' above with the wind South East and a heavy gale. A 11.30 P.M. the gale was tremendous with a power of rain
Wind Southerly in morning very heavy with rain. At noon Wind Westerly with snow squalls. commenced putting the deck load of Staves on F. J Dives at noon
Very moderate Westerly but looks like snow Finished loading the F. J Drisco at noon and have him bill of Laden Thermometer 22 above
Wind North East Thermometer 4' above Went to the auction Sale of Sch Wm Gillum. she was sold for $740
Wind North West. staid at home to entertain company
Wind Northerly Thermometer 12' above hauled coal all day
Wind Easterly and hauled out Southerly hauled coal in forenoon. afternoon hauled the sloop boat up for the winter
Wind Southerly and looking like rain. hauled coal. In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting and Lewis Bickford took the E.A.D. In the evening after Lodge it was snowing
Wind North West heavy Went to Bar Harbor on Str Silver Star to take care of a note and some other minor business back at noon
Wind Northerly had a hired man at work all day hauling coal
Wind heavy Westerly with the Thermometer at 0 some sledding and some wheeling
Wind North East with snow in the forenoon afternoon quite clear
Wind Easterly and fine weather Went to Bar Harbor in forenoon to telegraph to N.Y. about coal. Came home at noon
Wind Easterly and fine weather Bought some board of P.H. Stratton a Contractor on Grindstone Point. to Sheath the Scuttery on my house. hauled coal
Wind Easterly with a little snow. Work apart of the day sheathing my back Scullery or summer kitchen
Wind Easterly in morning then hauled North West. with snow squalls work about home
Wind North West a perfect gale Thermometer 8' above had horse sharpened and hauled coal
Wind West North West Thermometer from 8 to 10' above. work in house
Wind Southerly
Wind Westerly Hauling coal in quite large quantities
Wind Southerly looking like a storm been trying to trade for a horse with C.G. Brown but made a failure
Wind North West good breeze. Thermometer 12' abreast Took a horse on trial. to keep if he suits. and worked abt. the coal shed
Wind North West blowing heavy Trying the horse I took yesterday on trial to make up my mind whether to buy or not. but am not decided yet
Wind North East. Thermometer at zero At dark commenced blowing and snowing Work about the coal shed
Wind South East heavy rain in forenoon Afternoon Wind N.W. and colder. Plenty of snow now for sledding. as it first snowed then turned to rain Worked a little while at the shed
Wind North West blowing and cold
Wind Northerly with a little snow all day hauling out coal
Wind N.N. West. Bought a horse of Casper Brown for $175 paid 25 down and a note for 150 on 4 months 6 per Thermometer 4' below Bought hardwood of Froster J Bunker to sell

Wind North West and cold It is now good sledding. The month just ended has been a very hard month. and I think on the whole The Thermometer has been below zero as much as it has above. I am in the coal and wood business alone now having bought out my partner Capt. W. W. Summer and am now expecting daily the Sch Lucy M. Collins with coal of 2.21 tons all stone coal as she was loaded in N.Y. Dec 24th

Happy New Year. Wind North West and moderate. I am in the coal business alone my partner and my self having disolved partnerships in August. I have been selling coal now just 4 months alone during that time I have sold 225 tons of coal
Wind Southerly and a rain storm worked about the shed and house but haul no coal
Wind North. warm in morning Thermometer 33' but at night colder 4 afternoon hauled a load of coal to Mr. G A Dodge. Prospect Harbor
Very moderate Wind North and North East Thermometer about 10' above zero Took a ride down on Grindstone Point
Wind North East snow in afternoon Bought several lots of Hardwodd for sale
Wind North East and thick with snow sold some wood and coal Afternoon wind North In evening went to the Hall to a Hall meeting

Wind N.N.E. and little snow. In the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting. It being the first wednesday in Jan. It is on Annual meeting for the Election of Officers &cE Voted in G.W Tracy W.m " " W H Parker S W " " B E Tracy J W " " A J Gerrish Treas " " Frank Summer Sec. The other officers will be appointed by the new M. This is the first clause  there has been in Master since me first began to meet, for I have always been master now five years and feel glad to be relieved
Wind Northerly work about the coal shed
Wind North and clear Thermometer 20 degrees above zero. Commenced building a shed on my small stable to make more room
Wind very light Northerly Thermometer about from 10' to 20' above work on my shed commenced yesterday Sent team to Prospect Harbor with coal in afternoon

Nearly calm all day but at night the wind breezed up South East. but it has been a fine day. Afternoon harnessed up a horse and went to South Gouldsboro to See Burney Fross Mary Bourgett Burried at 2 P.M.

wind Southerly and a gale Tremendious high tide Over Harbor Point. Over Henry's bridge. I had some wood piled on the lower side of the novel now called California cove that drifted to Henry Sargents barn There was two feet of water in my coal shed. John Cross house washed down and great damage was done around the Shores
Wind Westerly Quite fresh Delivering wood and coal all day

Wind Easterly in the morning with the Thermometer 4' below zero Later in the day the wind hauled out South with snow then grew warmer. My coal vessel the Lowey M. Collins arrived at noon at my wharf with 221 tons of Stone coal consigned to my self And worked a little while in the afternoon discharging In the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting. No work
Wind South West and fine. Worked all day discharging Sch. Lucy M. Collins of her Cargo of coal. at my wharf

Wind Northerly and moderate. worked all day discharging Schr. Lucy M. Collins and finished at 6 P.M. In evening went to the to a Public Installation of Officers of F. & A M. I step down and out from the Masters seat where I have presided for more than 5 years Including while working under Dispensation and Installation
Wind Easterly In afternoon snow In evening rain & sleet settled with the Stevedores for labor discharging Sch. Lucy M. Collins of coal at my coal shed
Wind North East with a sleet storm
Wind North East with a little snow It is now good sledding the snow not drifted hauled 10 loads of wood and coal
Wind Northerly and fine Very busy hauling wood and coal
Very light air of Wind North East and very pleasant Hauled $35 worth of wood & coal today In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting G W Tracy Masters Exemplified the work in E.A.D.
Wind Southerly and rainy hauled coal in forenoon Afternoon work in the house

Wind Westerly and very pleasant Work at the Shed Commenced again to coal the Str Silver Star. I have not been coaling her since Nov. Except a little Cumberland coal to keep the boat warmed while repairing
Wind Southerly and very fine work about the coal shed
Wind Easterly Began to snow at day light and snowed all day At night wind Northerly and cleared up
Wind SouthWest and very fine warm Buisy at the coal shed
Wind Easterly and snowing all day. There is a plenty of snow now for anything Bought a sleigh from milbridge price $14
Wind South West and very pleasant Work at my Business In Evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting Exemplified the 2d G W Tracy W. Master
Calm and warm snow melting. at night wet Hauled coal to Prospect Harbor

Wind Southerly Rain in morning. Then the sun came out hot melting the snow very fast Sold 5 1/2 Cords wood to G.W. Tracy at 5 per cord. Went to B.E. Tracys Office in afternoon to a Caucus Prior to our March meeting to see about the Nominating Town officers. Hauling wood & coal the rem. of the day
Wind Southerly hauled wood and coal all day
Very moderate South wind a little rain in the morning cleared at noon. In afternoon went to Birch Harbor for a Sleigh ride

Wind very moderate North Easterly. In afternoon went to Milbridge to a Masonic meeting 15 of us went. They worked the 3d degree. After Lodge at about 10.30 PM we started for home arriving soon as possible
Wind South very fresh and in the afternoon rained Coaled up the Str Silver star in the forenoon
Wind NorthWest Bought large quantities of hardwood. In evening went to the hall to a masonic meeting. Stated Elected three and received application of four more
Wind North West and fine weather Delivering wood
Wind Northerly Work at my Business
Wind very moderate Northerly. Went to Bar Harbor and back on Str Silver Star in forenoon
Wind North East and a snow storm
Wind North West and fine weather Delivered wood and coal all day
Wind South East and heavy rain storm in forenoon and a warm South West wind in the afternoon. melting snow very fast. But a plenty is left for all purposes
Wind NorthWest Thermometer at 0 in morning. then went up Work at my business In evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting and Joseph M. Rice and Nathan Sargent took the first degrees
Wind Easterly in the morning Thence hauled Southerly looking like a storm Work at my business that of wood & Coal
Very moderate North West wind much finer than was expected yesterday Collecting money on accts. Iu
Wind North and the Thermometer at 0 all day. A big rush of business to day
Wind Northerly in fore noon and South West in the afternoon
Wind South West with rain showers work abt. the coal shed
Wind North East Hauled wood & Coal all day

Wind Southerly in forenoon with heavy rain. Afternoon Cleared of wind Westerly Helped Andrew Pendleton most all day on a boat he is building In evening went to the Hall Northern Sargent took the F.C.D.
Wind Westerly Work about home
Wind NorthWest Work all day at my Business. having all the orders I can fill at present
Wind South East and fine rain all day. Went to Birch Harbor with sleigh after milk
Wind South West with a little rain and snow in morning At 10 A.M. cleared up Went to C.Y. Bunkers on a sleigh ride
Wind Westerly and moderate In afternoon went to Prospect Harbor with a load of coal for G.A. Dodge. went on wheels
Wind Southerly and fine weather. hauled coal and wood all day
Wind Southerly and looking like spring. Town meeting is about all people talk about In the evening went to the Hall to a Masonic Meeting No Candidate appeared

Wind Southerly and thick with fog I am a Candidate for first man. The Election takes place monday next. The Comming election will be the hardest ever fought in Gouldsboro. I am looking out for voters. It is not the prejudice people have against me. But prejudice people have in other parts of the town against any one who lives in Winter Harbor as this village is growing faster than any other village in Town
Wind North Easterly in morning with snow. Later hauled around North West and Cleared up All spare time Given to the Town meeting which takes place next monday
Wind Westerly and fine weather no sledding except in the woods
Wind Northerly and dark like a snow storm. Late in the evening snowing

Wind Northerly Went to Town meeting on runners. The largest vote polled ever in this Town 399 votes some not voting myself a Candidate for First Select man and Robert R Joy also a candidate for the same office. I got left and Robert R Joy was Elected
Wind Easterly and overcast. hauling wood & Coal all day with two horses
Wind Easterly Thermometer 10' above very overcast and looking very much like snow. hauled wood and coal with 2 horses all day. In evening went to the Hall to the Lodge F & AM. Stated meeting
Wind North East in morning and snowing. It is now as good sledding as it has been any time during the winter
Wind Northerly and good weather Having about all the business I can do without more help at the Coal shed
Wind NorthWest. No Carts out. Everything goes on runners. Went to Birch Harbor Pond to look out the Route to put in a bid to haul the water pipe
Wind North West in forenoon and Southerly in the afternoon. Very fine weather
Wind South South East and overcast. Put in my bid for hauling water pipe to Birch Harbor Pond Hauled coal most all day
Wind Westerly Hauling coal and work about my business

Wind Southerly Hauled coal with two horses all day with a man hired. In the evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting. Lodge opened up the E.A.D. and Lewis Perry. Elisha Bickford and Frank Norris all took then first degree
Wind Southerly and overcast. Work all day making Windlass for Sch. A.B. Crabtree
Wind South South East Commenced raining about 9 oclock AM and rained and blowed the rest of the day
Wind South West. Blowing a gale with a heavy sea hauling wood and coal also collecting bills or money for the Coal bills
Wind North West fresh. but fine weather
Wind South West Fresh. Work all day making windlass for Sch A.B. Crabtree At 6 oclock P.M. the wind North West with a heavy snow squall
Wind North West a perfect gale Thermometer 10 degrees above in the morning very disagreeable to work out of doors in forenoon. But in the afternoon more moderate hauled Coal
Wind Southerly and looking like a storm. Work all day turning windlass for Sch A.B. Crabtree In evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting & Nathan S. Sargent took M.M.D.
Wind N.N. East Snowy in morning later cleared up Work all day on Windlass for Sch A.B. Crabtree. And got it set in its place on board. and is Comparatively done
Wind Easterly But fine. Hauled wood & coal all day with two horses and an extra man to help
Wind Easterly and wet. hauled wood & coal apart of the day
Wind Easterly and heavy rain Fresh breeze & rough
Wind Easterly and damp. Work at the wood and coal business
Wind Easterly very moderate and thick with fog. Work all day at my business
Wind North West and very good weather. But very muddy under foot. In evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting Elisha S Bickford took the Master masons degree
Wind North West fresh and quite cold. Hauled coal to Steam boat &ce
Wind North West fresh and fine weather Repairing coal and woodcarts &ce
Wind Northerly in morning and hauled Easterly very fine weather Work at the Coal shed
Wind Easterly and very nice weather. Took my wife out on a short ride
Wind Easterly and fine. Was summonsed by R.R. Joy Depty. Sherriff and Contable to appear at Ellsworth and act as one of the Traverse Jurrors Apr term
Wind North East in forenoon and Southerly in the afternoon hauling wood and trucking
Wind Southerly and beautiful weather. Work around the Coal shed and hauled coal to the Str Silver Star
Wind South Easterly and looking like a storm. Work at my business
Wind South East and heavy rain Did not take the horses out to work
Cleared of fine lots of work to day on acct of keeping the horses in the barn yesterday
Wind North West and very fine. Went on a little ride to South Gouldsboro
Wind North West Hauled Coal in forenoon. In afternoon went to W. Gouldsboro and bought 29 5/16 Cords of wood of Epps H Sargent at $350 per cord and paid $30 down
Wind Northerly working at my business
Wind North West in morning and Southerly in the afternoon. Delivering wood all day. In the Evening went to the Hall to a Masonic Meeting and James M Rice took the F. C Degree
Wind Moderate N.W. Went to Bar Harbor and took up a note Calon Bunker Commenced work for me in the morning
Wind Westerly and very pleasant hauling out Southerly in afternoon Having all the work I can do at present. Groning 2 horses. and having a man hired
Wind Southerly Hauling wood and coal
Wind South East and rainy all day
Wind South West and fine. A Brick loaded vessel came in to my wharf to discharge Hauling wood all day
Calm and hot work on wood delivering
Wind South East and rain. no work In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting and Frank G. Norris took the M.M.D.
Wind Northerly and chilly. Went to Ellsworth to attend Court being drawn on the Traverse Gurroy It being Frast day no Court untill tomorrow Board at the Jail

Wind North West Called into Court at 10.30 AM. was swoon. Went into the Jury Room. Elected foreman. Went back into the Court room and set upon the frist Case. which was. Timothy Frinr VS. Dr. Frink for a malicious Prosecution It takes the plantiff the remeainder of the day to get in all his witness. So no further business comes before this Court to day. and the Court adjournes to meet tomorrow at 9 oclock A.M. Standard

Wind South East. A continuation of yesterdays trial. Timothy Finn V.S Dr Frink. The witness for the define all in. The Court Change after the Lawyers given all made their plea of one have not fifteen minutes each. The Jurry retired at 5.45 and returned at 7.40 with a verdict of $408 against Dr Frink Plaintiffs Council A.P. Wiswell and the Def. Council J.J. Higgins and Mr. Frolger of Rockland
Wind SouthWest somewhat overcast. made a few calls amongst friends I could not get home yesterday as the journal of yesterday will show. being one of the Jurry on a case

Wind Southerly and somewhat overcast. Went into Court at 10.30 and rendered the verdict of saturday. The first Jurry then listened to the hearing of another case. Hiran Norton V.S. the Manor Inn. Froster for Plaintiff. Wiswell & King for Dependent Verdict for Plaintiff sums $444.85 with Int. I belong on the first Juror But the first case tried I was drafter on. Therefore set on the two first cases tried. The thord case I have nothing to do with

A very light air South Easterly Mrs. Clarissa Billington VS. Edwin N. Osgood Parties reside at Surry The plaintiff sees the dependent for her Gran Childs Co and for 119 weeks. Verdict for Plaintif in the sum 2 per week for 117 weeks and 6.40 Int. whole amount according to the verdict $240.40

In Ellsworth Wind Northerly and fine weather The first Jurry to which I belong has nothing to do A case is being tried before the second Jurry So all the first Jurry has their pittines taken in a group. In evening went to a Masonic meeting (Lygonia) and the worked the 2 degree

Wind South Easterly First case, this day Franklin Land Mill & Water Co V.S Henry Cord and Henry Cand V.S. Franklin land Mill & Water Co are to be tried to gather. My name being the same as some other interested parties on the case and Lawyer Wiswell supposing I might be some relation my place among the Jurry was challenged and I take back seat having nothing to do with the case

Wind North West. and very fine. Being in Ellsworth on Jurry. Got permit of Judge Emery. to go home and stay untill monday morning. and left Ellsworth on train for home via Bar Harbor arrived home at noon
Wind Easterly and a little snow in the forenoon and rain in the afternoon Doing nothing in particular except to look after my acct books and business in General
Staid at home with my family. Wind Northerly Fresh.

Wind light Northerly Went to Ellsworth on train via Bar Harbor. arriving at Ellsworth at 10.10 went to the Court house at 10.30 The Commenced the Case of C.H. Sawyer V.S. Cushman This was a trespass case in the Town of Tremont
Wind Southerly in the morning. Afternoon NorthWest and fine. The Case on trial to day is a continuation of yesterday. And when the Court closed at 5.30 The evidence for the defence not not all in

Wind North West. fresh but pleasant. Went to Court at 9 oclock. It was a continuation of yesterday and the day before. Evidence all in at at 11 am. Plea of both sides in at 2.30 Went to the Jurry room at 3.40 At 6 P.M. the vote stood $75 the lowest and $240 the highest. At 6.40 Jurry agreed the whole damage should be $178.17 and sealed the verdict as required by law. But as Court has adjourned. the verdict will brought into Court tomorrow. In evening went to general Lodge Worked the 3d degree

Wind North NorthWest and very fine weather Brought in the verdict of yesterday. The damage for trespass $178.17. and the Jurry discharged but not in time to get home. so I will have to stay untill tomorrow
Wind very light Northerly Took the train in Ellsworth at 8.25 for home. Via Bar Harbor. Thence Str Silver Star for home arriving at noon. Wind Southerly
Wind North North West and very fine. Took a horse on trial to buy if he suits
Wind Southerly and overcast. Went to South Gouldsboro on a ride and stoped to Leonard Bunkers house to dinner. at night very light rain
Wind NorthWest in morning and South West in afternoon Hauled Brick for Contractors on Grindstone Point, and removed some wood beside the town road by order of the road Commissioner
West Wind Cloudy but fine. Clifting wood to season. bought horse of Arthur W Webb for $157.50 paid $32.50 down. and gave 5 notes of 25 Each to be paid monthly
Wind Easterly in morning. Then Southerly. In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting and the minister Mr. Geo. W F. Hill took the M.M.D.
Wind Easterly in forenoon. and Westerly at night My Double team is working on the Point while I am using the Old horse to deliver wood
Wind South West fresh. Hauling wood and coal. Arbor day. Reed Currant and Rose bushes but to late to set out to day
Very light air of wind Southerly. Coaled the Steam boat Set out one day. Currant bushes & 2 Rose bushes
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. Staid at home
Nearly calm all day. but when there was my wind it was southerly hauled wood and coal all day
Wind North East. overcast and looking like rain Piling clifted wood in my wood yard
Wind North East. and moderate rain all day, did not take the horses out of the stable untill night. In evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting.but no candidate appeared

Wind Westerly Went to Mt Desert Ferry In Sch Yilowa Temple after a Car load of hay shiped from Holden on the M.C.R.R. Took the hay in at 3 P.M. got home at 6 PM This is the first hawy I ever had to sell except what I have raised and befor I went into the wood & Coal business
Wind Easterly Hauled the Schr. Felora Temple into the wharf discharged the hay 8 tons. and hauled the hay to Chas Pendletons barn and stored it
Wind South East and overcast. At 5 oclock P.M. began to rain hard Worked for Jennie Kingsley
Wind Southerly in the morning and heavy rain untill 10 AM when the wind hauled. around west thence more northerly and cleared up
Wind South West. Cold and disagreeable At 4 P.M. heavy shower wind came of with a squall. Westerly. Worked apart of the day for Jennie Kingsley Also sold Coal and hay
Wind South West Sent my double team on Grindstone Neck to work
Wind South West. and smokey Work apart of the day for Jennie Kingsley and after my business in general
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. hauled some wood and had Cart repaired. also hauled some brick from my wharf to Grindstone Neck. In the evening Showery
Wind Southerly Plowed harrowed and furrowed all the land that I intend to pland and dressed it in the forenoon In afternoon hauled wood and coal coald Engine for water Co.
Wind North fresh and very fine. Work with my team both for myself and others
very moderate Southerly but fine weather
Wind Southerly fresh and cold. planted potatoes and peas
Wind Southerly with fog. Team hauling Cement on Grindstone Point. Went to Prospect in afternoon to see the Select men with business abt Billiard and pool
Wind Southerly and light delivering wood and coal
Wind South West and moderate. Hauled brick sand for the Contractors on Grindstone Point. using a double team
Wind Southerly Team at work on Grindstone Point
Wind Southerly with fog and in the afternoon little rainy. Plowed apart of the day for Saml Sargent. planted squash seed for myself
Wind Southerly and light fog but the sun shined and was pleasant
Wind South East and thick with fog. hauled water on Grindstone Point also Coaled the Steam Boat
Wind Southerly and thick, hauled water to mix water morter on Grindstone Point
Wind Northerly with rain in forenoon afternoon wind Southerly and fine. Hauled wood and coal In evening went to Prospect to have horses weighed. weight 1160 lbs & 1245
Wind North East and rain all the forenoon. But in the afternoon. Cleared up fine wind hauled out. Trying to collect bills In evening went to the Hall to Luciers Exhibition
Wind Southerly hauled coal in forenoon. Afternoon work on Grindstone Point hauling water for the Masons
Wind South West hauled some wood and coal in forenoon In afternoon painted the Cart

Wind North West in forenoon. In the afternoon took a buck board with my horses and went to the sand for a ride. taking a select party. At 2 P.M. wind Southerly Called to see Nahum Stevens at Birch Harbor
Wind Westerly in forenoon. Southerly in afternoon Coaling Steam boat. and doing various kinds of work
Wind South Easterly Went to Bar Harbor and took up a note due at the First National Bank
Wind Southerly Work about home with the horses and a hired man
Wind Southerly Reed letter from Chas. S. Whelen The President of Winter Harbor Str Boat Co. Phila. that he would give $5.50 per ton for coal for one year which offer I refused to accept
Wind Southerly Thermometer 63' work about home
Wind South West moderate Thermometer 77' work about home

Very moderate N.W. At 2.30 the Hotel Beacon was discovered to be on fire. At day light the fire set the Steam boat wharf on fire but was Extinguished At 5 AM. the last stick of timber that once stoof on end of the Hotel Beacon fell amongst fire ashes and smoke and the once large handsome building which was the pride of the place is no more. At 9 AM wind So.
Wind very light Southerly Thermometer at noon 82' which we call hot Did but little work
Wind Southerly Thermometer 76' hauled Coal and the teamed worked on the road
Wind Easterly Collected some bills and getting ready to go to NY

Wind South Easterly and overcast Started for New York Went to Bar Harbor in morning. Took M. C. Boat at 9.30 went to Ferry took train for Boston arriving in Boston at 10 P.M. Tickets reduced to $5.00 At this time of evening it is rainy
Wind Easterly in Boston. Went to various parts of the City calling on friends. At 6 oclock P.M. took train for N.Y. via Fall River. Thence by Str Puritan midnight somewhere in Long Island Sound

Wind South Easterly and cool enough for Comfort Arrived in N.Y. ay 7 AM Str Puritan. Bought load of coal. Chartered a vessel at H.B. Rawsons 45 So Str which is all the business I have here and am ready to leave at 230 P.M. but stayed untill 6 P.M. took Str Puritan For Fall River bound home. At midnight somewhere Long Island and thick with fog. so ends these 24 hours
Wind Southerly weather just comfortable warm. Arrived in Boston at 7 A.M. bound home from N.Y. where I have been to buy a load of coal
Wind Easterly and heavy rain. At 5 P.M. took Str Lewiston for Rockland bound home from Boston & N.Y. midnight somewhere between Thatchers Island and Monhegan with the wind N.E. and thick with fog
Wind North East and thick with fog. Arrived in Rockland at 7.30 A.M. from Boston on Str Lewiston. Took Str Mt. Desert for Bar arrived at 2.15 P.M. and at 3.45 took Str. Silver Star and went home
Wind South Easterly and thick with fog
Wind North East and fine weather Work about home

Wind North East and fine weather The County Commissioner met at my place to view the proposed Route from my home to Jennie Kingsleys & down to G.L.I. Co sland then met at the Hall and heard all parties interested Decesing reserved untill Oct Term
Wind North East and showery Work most of the day hauling wood & coal. Painted Cookroom floor. at home
Wind North East and showery Staid at home
Wind Easterly and half the time rainy Work apart of the time with the team
Wind East North East and very fine weather hauled coal to Star 5 tons. Afternoon book cart and sent it to West Gouldsboro to be repaired

Wind Southerly and fine weather Work about the Coal shed getting ready for a Cargo of Coal In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting. To see about getting another Hall But few met and did not call to order
Wind Southerly and thick with fog Work with team at my business
Wind Southerly and thick. Filling wood and coal orders as they are given from Rusticators and am kept very busy with one man hired and two horses
Celebration day Wind South South East and heavy showers all day. To day was intended to be a lively on here but the heavy rain put the damper on all the sports
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. Abt. home all day at Night went to Birch Harbor to see Capt Nahum Stevens
Wind South West and fair weather Work all day getting ready to receive another Cargo of Coal
Wind Southerly & Sch Lizzie Brewster Capt. J.E. Farrisworth Jonesport. Arrived at my wharf at noon with 143 tons Coal from N. York. Commenced discharging in afternoon
Wind Southerly with very heavy rain in morning. at 930 cleared up. Commenced discharging vessel again and worked the rem. of the day. Afternoon wind N.W. and fine

Wind Easterly but moderate Finished discharging Sch Lizzie Brewster of coal at 10 AM and she hauled from wharf Time of discharging vessel of 143 tons Coal 14 1/2 house or about 10 tons per hour or 100 tons per day
Wind very moderate North West in morn Went to Bar Harbor on business with the Bank. home at noon Wind South West
Wind Southerly and hot. Worked at my business, selling wood and coal
Wind Southerly and a little fog. At night went to Birch Harbor to see Capt Nahum Stevens who is very sick
Wind Southerly and hot. hauling wood and coal
Wind Southerly Hauling wood and Coal
Wind Southerly and very thick with fog. quite a large number of orders for wood & coal from Summer visitors on Grindstone Neck
Wind South West and thick in forenoon Clear in afternon plowed among my potatoes
Wind North West. and very fine weather. Afternoon wind S.W. fresh. Had piano tuned and done work around the shed
Wind South South East. hot in forenoon. but in the afternoon Cloudy overcast. and cooler. Hauled coal to Steam boat and pumping station
Very heavy rain in morning. Wind Southerly At 6 P.M. went to West Gouldsboro to see abt some Charcoal for Grindstone Inn Foggy at night
Wind Southerly and thick with fog in morning. At 9 am. fog sealed. Sun came out hot. hauled coal for Str Silver Star
Very moderate Southerly Work at the Coal shed
Wind Southerly not much of a hay day Buisy with my team working at my business. Calon Bunker my hired man is done I am doing the work alone
Wind Southerly and damp. poor weather for those who are trying to get their hay Went to West Gouldsboro with my team after a load of charcoal
Wind Southerly in forenoon and thick with fog. Afternoon fog lifted and commenced raining but I hauled wood and coal all day just the same
Wind Southerly hot on land but thick with fog out side. Could not fill all the wood & Coal orders to day being alone
Wind Moderate N.W. in forenoon and South West in afternoon At night went to Birch Harbor to see Capt Nahum Stevens who is very sick
Wind Southerly Many Coal & Wood orders in and working hard to fill them being alone
Wind Southerly Delivering wood & Coal on Grindstone Point
Wind Southerly afternoon rainy Sold 6 1/2 tons coal to Alfred Hamilton
Wind Easterly with some fog Working alone all day. and cannot fill all the orders for wood & coal
Wind Southerly This day ends the month. and the sales of wood & coal for the month of July is a little more than $500 The best months work I ever had in the business
Wind South West very fresh. This being the first day of the month I make out lots of bills to send out for wood coal &ce and still keep my team going
Wind Southerly and very fine weather. Went to Birch Harbor to see Nahum Stevens
Wind North West in forenoon and South in afternoon and hot. Very buisy hauling wood to the Cottagers
Wind Southerly Hauling wood & coal
Wind Southerly Went to Bar Harbor on "Silver Star" to take up note at the Bank back at noon Have a man hired to work whether I am at home or not
Wind Southerly Buisy filling orders
Wind Southerly and somewhat overcast. In evening thunder & lightning. but no rain. Coaled Steam yacht now then
Wind North West. and very warm. Working at my business. Coaled one yacht Str Silver Star & Str Gouldsboro and delivered several lots of wood and coal
Wind Southerly and fine. Coaled two Steam yachts. and after supper went to Birch Harbor to see Capt Nahum Stevens who is sick a bed
Wind Southerly and warm. very busy with wood & coal
Wind Southerly Thermometer 82' Coaled yachts &ce Sent Check to H.B. Rawson & Co N.Y. $350 ACCT Coal

Light North West wind in forenoon and a light Southerly in the afternoon. At 9 AM went on board Steam yacht Northern and went to Pulpit lodge to get a yacht of said lodge We took out the sail yachts ballast then pumped and bailed and with the help of the Steam yacht Now then we got her of towed her up here to the Steam boat wharf at 3.30 P.M. I get for my parts one dollar per hour
Wind NorthWest and warm weather having about all I can do with one man to hekp me to deliver wood & coal
Wind Southerly and just warm enough to be comfortable Had my cart at the blacksmith shop most all day having her repaired. also had horses shood

Wind Easterly afternoon rainy hauled 3 tons Egg Coal to Steam yacht Now then. 2 tons Egg Str Silver Star 1/2 ton to Str Gouldsboro 6 1/2 tons to Alfred Hamilton for his sardine factory. One ton stone Grindstone Inn. 2 Bbls stone to Alice Crane and 1/2 Cd Hd Wood to G.W. Pendleton making 13 1/4 tons Coal and 1/2 Cord wood. The sales to day amount to more than $80
Wind South Easterly and pleasant. At night went to Birch Harbor to see Nahum Stevens
Wind Southerly and warm very buisy with wood & coal
Wind Southerly and very fresh. In afternoon heavy thunder shower But kept at work filling orders

Wind Easterly in the morning  afternoon wind moderate Westerly. At 10.30 AM attended the Court of County Commissioners. held at B E Tracy's office to assess land damage by the running water Pipe across peoples land
Wind Southerly and very good weather and am receiving orders all the time to be filled
Wind South East weather looks bad and the water is rough. But I keep the horses moving
Wind Easterly and rainy all day. did not take the horses out as there were no orders very urgent
Wind Easterly and but very little fog in here. At noon went to Church in the Charming Chapel but the meeting was Episcopal Evening went to Birch Harbor to see Capt Nahum Stevens
Wind South Easterly and thick with fog Went to Bar Harbor with my wife to see the parade
Wind Southerly and thick with fog Discharged my hired man as he did not suit me. And rushed business to day to make up loss time for yesterday
Wind very light Southerly in the afternoon but as a general rule it might be considered calm am very anxious about my coal vessel as I have no Egg coal and am substituting stone for yachts &ce
Calm an rainy afternoon little wind Southerly. but kept my team moving all day
Wind Southerly and thick with fog no chance for my coal vessel to arrive untill the fog clears up
Wind North West and very fine weather At 3 P.M. my coal vessel home in sight. Very buisy all day with orders
Wind Easterly My Coal vessel the Sarah P. of Jonesport hauled into the wharf In afternoon went to Birch Harbor to see Capt Nahum Stevens. who I think is failing all the time
Wind Easterly and some overcast Commenced in morn to discharge cargo of Coal from Schr. Sarah P. And at night had her all out. 100 tons and vessel hauled from the wharf before dark
Wind North East all day. plenty of work yet. but my business will soon drop of now Sept had come in have sold 109 tons coal during the month of August
Wind Westerly hauling wood and coal
Calm in morning Southerly wind in afternoon, at night thick with fog Coaled the Steam Yacht now then for the last time this year having sold her 34 tons since Aug 7
Wind South West with a little fog At 2 AM Isaac P. Joys house burned understand fully insured. cause unknown
Cloudy wind South work at my business
Wind Easterly and thick with rain. Went to meeting at the Charming Chapel. In evening went to Birch Harbor to see Capt Nahum Stevens
Wind Easterly and heavy rain all day. Team out all the forenoon
Clear of wind N.W. and pleasant

Wind NorthWest and very fine Went to Bar Harbor with my wife whoe went to have a tooth extracted as was administered and the tooth wxtracted with out trouble Came home in afternoon. Evening went to the hall to a Masonic meeting. Voted to sent B E Tracys new Hall for 5 years A collection of $50 was taken up toward the furnishing
Wind NorthWest in the morning. Southerly in afternoon. Went to So. Gouldsboro in afternoon after drag plank but got none
Wind Southerly and very fine weather. Went to Bar Harbor to see J.A. Peters Jr. for Jennie Kingsley about prosecuting G.L. I. Co. for land damage on road from her house to the neck

Wind Southerly and very fine weather B.F. Summer P A Summer and myself met in Tracys new Hall to consider what we need for the furnishing it for a Masonic Hall as the Lodge voted las wed we being appointed the Committee

Wind Southerly & overcast. with some fog. Went to the Marsh to Uncle C.Y. Bunkers accompanied by my wife. where we stoped to dinner & tea after which we started for home. Calling to see Capt. Nahum Stevens on the way
Wind South Easterly and thick with fog. Afternoon Thunder shower. and cleared of Wind Northerly work about home
Wind Northerly Went gunning with Mr. Knoblauch the Proprietor of Grindstone Inn. no birds ftew and did not stop
Wind very moderate Northerly in morning. and Southerly in afternoon. My team hauling Coal over to Prospect Calon Bunker teamster

Wind Southerly and a little inclined to be foggy. Went to Bar Harbor to deposit $253.53 also to see about getting settees for our Masonic Hall my teamster run into a buggy hearing a woman out and smashing the buggy My team was hauling a Coal Cart
Wind Southerly my team hauling coal to Prospect. At night dreadful heavy thunder shower. Wind came of North West
Wind North West very pleasant. In afternoon went to South Gouldsboro with a ton of Coal. and hauled back 11 bushels of potatoes

Wind Southerly & fine weather. In afternoon drove to Prospect to investigate a matter of Collision between my double team and cart and a light wagon driven by Mrs. Chas Crabtree of this place. Called at Birch Harbor to see Capt Nahum Stevens
Calm in morning wind later breezed up Southerly plenty of orders to fill to day
Wind Southerly and thick with fog Buisy at my business
Wind Easterly and fine weather My team hauling Coal to Prospect I am getting ready to go to Cherry field to the Train
Wind Easterly and little Chilly in forenoon. Left home with my two horses and a Buchboard with 5 passengers besides the driver. Went to Cherryfield to the Fair. back at 4 P.M.
Wind Southerly hauling coal to Prospect Harbor
Wind NorthWest Thermometer 74' Work at my business
Wind Southerly Afternoon went to Birch Harbor to See Capt Nahum Stevens Who I hope is getting better
Wind Southerly but hot. I have contract to haul coal to Prospect Harbor to run the Sardine Factory and finish the Coal
