WInd Southerly and thick with fog Receiving orders and filling them
Fresh North Western attending to Business In evening went to our new Masonic Hall & hekd our first meeting in said Hall. We now call it the Masonic Hall
Wind Easterly in morning then hauled out Southerly Hauled wood to the Friedly Cottage and Coal to Prospect
Wind Southerly and fine weather
Wind Southerly Thick in morning Went to Bar Harbor on Str. Silver Star to Telegraph to N.Y. back at noon. thick in afternoon
Wind South and Thick with fog morning & night In afternoon went to Birch Harbor to see Capt Nahum Stevens and thick he is better
Wind South Easterly and rain I have a note fall due to day. the last one given for a horse bought of Arthur Webb
Wind North West Fresh
Wind Westerly at night Calm In evening went to the Masonic Hall to a Stated Communication
Wind Easterly and very heavy rain untill noon. When the wind came from the N.W. and cleared up

Wind North Easterly Took Str Silver Star in morning. Went to Bar Harbor Took Str Mt Desert and went to Rockland Then the wind was southerly. At 10 P.M. took Str Katahdin from Rockland for Boston At midnight I bring in my berth I dont know where we are the the end ot the 24 hours
Wind Northerly in the forenoon. On board of Str Katahdin bound to Boston and arrived at 1030 AM Soon as arrived I telegraphed to New York got no answer

Wind East overcast in Boston At 6 PM took train at Old Colony Depot for Fall River. Thence Steam boat Providence for N.Y. a little rainy At midnight some where in Long Island Sound on board Providence
Wind North East blowing a gale. Arrived in New York at 7 oclock AM. And went to 45 South Str. to find a vessel to load coal for me But in all day could find none

Wind North East with rain all day Worked all day long in New York trying to get a small vessel to get a load of Coal. but could get none At 5 oclock P.M. took Str. Pilgrim for Fall River bound home Wind blowing a gale

Wind North Easterly Arrived at Fall River about 4 oclock A.M. Made no landing at Newport At 5.30 took the train for Boston and arrived at 7 am At 5 oclock P.M. took Str Penobscot for Rockland an old sea hearing in midnight some where between Thatches Island and Monhegan I being in my berth dont know the position

Wind South West Arrived in Rockland from Boston on Steamer Penobscot at 6 A.M. At 7 AM took steamer Mt. Desert for Bar Harbor arriving about noon At 2.30 took Steamer Codmore and went home to Winter Harbor
Wind NortWest and fine weather. Went to Bar Harbor on Str. Creedmoore from home to settle Bank acct. back at 10.30
Wind Northerly and fine day About sick with cold
Wind Southerly and during the day it became cloudy but a fine day. did not go to see Capt. Nahum Stevens to day as I have a bad cold
Wind Easterly and in the afternoon rainy
Wind Easterly and in the afternoon rainy Team kept buisy most of the day
Wind Southerly and forenoon overcast. afternoon bitter weather In evening went to our new masonic Hall to the Lodge no work
Wind West South West and fine weather. a good chance for my coal vessel to come from N.Y. with coal
Wind North East Cold rain storm Thermometer 38' Work apart of the day in making Coal barrow
Wind North West blowing a gale Done a big days work hauling out wood and coal
Wind West & North West and quite cold Afternoon went to Prospect Harbor to see Alfred Hamilton and Ezra Over Also called at Birch Harbor to see Capt. Nahum Stevens
Wind Easterly in morning and hauled out Southerly and at noon heavy rain
Wind Northerly and overcast Team jogging at my business
WInd North quite cold. hauling wood and coal to the natives here In evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting no work
My birth day 46 yrs Wind North West team hauling coal to Prospect & Wood to Birch Harbor

Wind Southerly Schr. Lucy M Jenkins arrived at my wharf with 131 tons Cumberland Took Schr Felora Temple along side and took out 18 tons to take to Prospect. And at noon comenced discharging rest of Cargo in my Coal shed. Worked untill dark
Wind very moderate Southerly. Sch Lucy M Jenkins at my wharf was finished being discharged of 131 tons of Cumberland Coal at 3 P.M.
Wind West South West very fresh. Schr Lucy M. Jenkins hauled from my wharf at 9 am where she has been to discharge coal
Wind North West blowing a gale Commenced in the afternoon to repair my pile driver getting ready to extend my wharf
Wind North West a gale work on my wharf or getting ready to work to chip pile

Wind Easterly in morning. there hauled out Southerly Work on my wharf In evening went to Lodge at Masonic Hall States meeting Voted that the dedication of the New Hall Should be private Except Each Bro. Might invite one lady friend
Wind Easterly and fine weather Work on my wharf and keeping my team at work
Wind North East Work on my wharf with the help of John Lacount & Chas Sargent and apart of the time my teamster Calon Bunker
Wind North East overcast. Work on my wharf repairing
Wind North East. Sun shining very pleasant. Afternoon went to West Gouldsboro with W.A. Milliken
Wind North East and good weather Working on my wharf trying to get it ready befor a Cargo of wood or Coal arrives
Wind Southerly and wet. work on my wharf. In evening our Masonic hall was Dedicated by the Grand Lodge R.W. Henry R. Taylor G.M.
Wind South East thick and showery Finished work on my wharf for the season at noon. At night a load of wood arrived for me. In evening went to Masonic Meeting no work done
Wind Southerly warm and thick with fog. Commenced discharging a load of wood from Sch. Lucy Elizabeth of 29 1/4 Cords and finished at night
Wind North West and pleasant. Having got the Cargo of wood taken care of yesterday. to day is devoted to filling orders for wood
Wind SouthWest hauling wood and Coal. Although my coal vessel sailed from New York two weeks ago last thursday she has not yet arrived
Moderate wind Northerly. ground freezing. Went to Uncle C. Y. Bunkers to look at some wood and think I have bought it back at night In evening noticed the Eclipse of the moon
Wind Southerly blowing very heavy hauled wood and worked around the Coal shed
Wind Southerly heavy blow and rain. Work about the stable and house. No team out. The Str Silver Star could not make her trip to Bar Harbor on account of wind and sea
Wind West North West Commenced to build a small wagon shead for myself

Wind West South West Arrived in outer Harbor Schr Udrica R. Smith of Milbridge with 202 tons Coal Consisting of 109 tons Egg 93 of stone consigned to me Shiped from Haboken N.J. three weeks ago to day

Wind SouthWest. Commenced to discharge a load of wood from A Schooner Capt W.H. Fenneald 23 3/4 Cds Hardwood 4 3/4 Sgt and finished her at 6 oclock P.M. Schr. U R Smith came up in the Harbor but no berth at the wharf
Wind Southerly Schr U.R. Smith hauled into the wharf on the high water in the afternoon, and we riged up our gear ready to discharge monday morning
Wind Southerly
Wind South East Commenced discharging Sch U R Smith of Coal
Wind South West fresh. Finished discahrging Sch Ubrica R. Smith at 4 oclock PM of 202 tons coal. Commenced yesterday
Wind South West. Delivering wood and coal all day In evening went to a Masonic Hall to Lodge
Wind very light moderate and warm Northerly. In afternoon Wind Southerly and chilly overcast. looking stormy. Work at my business
Wind North East and heavy rain. At 9 AM wind hauled NorthWest and cleared up
Wind South West. In afternoon an auction sale of horses belonging to Geo. Matthews sold Henry Sargents barn my self auctioner At dark wind N.E. with little snow
Wind N.N. East Thermometer from 10' to 14' above zero. About home No snow on the ground to amount to anything
Thermometer 8' above zero Wind NorthWest Team out all day with wood & coal
Wind Northerly Meeting of the Select men to lay out a road from near Chas Pendletons Barn to Geo. W. Pendletons
Wind Southerly and very warm Put outside windows on Jennie Kingsays House. Banked up my house &ce In evening went to a meeting of Stated F & AM Elected 4 for degrees and I for member ship
Wind Southerly Went to West Gouldsboro In afternoon and sold some staves to F. P. Noyes for $20 for which I agree to take my pay in Millwood

Wind South West Took on a load of staves that I have sold to F.P. Noyes. and hauled them to West Gouldsboro. Then took on a load of lath edgings for home from the Mill and broke card wheel and left the cart with O K Stevens to repair Then took a Gig and came home at dark. In first part of the night a terrific gale form the W.S.W
Wind South West very heavy. Having my cart repaired at W.G.
Wind West South West and fresh in the forenoon. but in the afternoon the wind went down and dark. Calm
Wind West South West Went to West Gouldsboro after my cart that was left there friday with a wheel broken took on a load of Edgings and came home

Wind North West and fine. hauled coal all day. In evening a special meeting of Masons was called. and Capt. Chas. Miller and Wm. F. Davis took the E.A. Degree so much work now on it is deemed necessary. to call this special meeting. As out master is absent. I am called to the East. being a past master. Expect to meet again tomorrow night
Wind South West very fresh. Went to West Gouldsboro with a load of staves and brought back a load of Stave Edgings In evening went to the masonic Hall
Wind South West Work about the coal shed
Wind Westerly Started to go to Bar Harbor in a sail boat to a masonic meeting broke mast and came back
Wind North & Fine weather Went to Bar Harbor on Stmr. Silver Star back in afternoon
Wind Southerly staid at home
Wind North West and afternoon fresh. Team out delivering wood and coal

Wind Northerly and overcast. Took the forenoon to pile over and measure a pile of wood that was hauled to B E Tracys office Nov. 13th Afternoon hauling coal. Sch. A B Crabtree hauled into my wharf for the winter At 4 P.M. began to snow. There has been no sledding yet
Wind South East in morning with rain. Snow fast melting. Afternoon wind Westerly and at night growing cold. Sledding spoiled In evening went to a Masonic meeting and Mr. Fitzgerald took the E.A.S.
Wind North West very fresh, with the thermometer 8' above all day

Wind North West My team hauling coal all day. At noon Chartered the Sch. Felora Temple Went to Bar Harbor to Consult J.A. Peters on law questions and order a writ against the Gouldsboro Land Imp Co. in behalf of my sister Jennie Kingsley back in the evening
Wind Westerly and fine. Thermometer stood at abt. from 15 to 35' hauled coal to Prospect and about Winter Harbor
Calm all day and clear with the Thermometer at 30'
Wind Southerly and very warm hauling wood & coal. In evening went to Pacific Hall to the Baptist Sociable accompanied by my wife
Wind Southerly Put bottom in cart and work around the shed

Wind Southerly and overcast. Went in the woods up the stream looking for a chance to get logs back at noon. Afternoon rainy. In evening went to Masonic Hall. Fillean Davis took the F. C. D and near Dolan took the E A D and F C D. heavy storm when Lodge was out
Light air Northerly but overcast and wet Work around the Coal shed

Christmas day Wind Easterly and overcast and damp No more snow on Ice than in July and no more frost in the ground. Commenced this day to use up all my spare time in Building a boat for Charles Kingsley Have not had the team out to day

Wind South and afternoon and evening raining For more than a week the ground has not been frozen anymore than in July. But the weather about the same as we expect in April, showery overcast with a little fog
Wind North West and commenced to freeze in afternoon My Daughter Stella taken sick with Lagrippe and sent for the Doctor

Wind N.N.East with fine weather Thermometer in the morning 22' above The team out all day filling orders. Not a sled on sleigh has been through Winter Harbor yet. for there had not been any snow or ice for anything
Calm in forenoon at noon wind South blowing a gale and looking like a big storm team out all day

Wind South by East blowing a gale and a tremendious power of rain. No team out to day delivering coal or wood. No sleds or sleighs has been used so far this winter in this place Wheels alltogather and my sled has not been put to gather. Also it has not been cold enough to make any ice safe to bear up a man. In evening snow squalls

year ended. Ther. 10' above blowing a gale. N.W. I am in the wood and coal business alone. And all done with a cart Neither snow or ice to be of any practical good. My team has been a prospect to day with a ton of coal and went with a cart
Wind North Thur 20 above My business is that of a wood & Coal dealer There has not been more than 2 in of ice this year so far and not any snow for business
Wind Southerly and looking very much like a storm Worked a little while on boat for Chas Kingsley that I commenced on the other day
Wind Southerly and heavy rain in forenoon Afternoon cleared up but the wind was still Southerly Called to see Capt. W H Parker who is sick
Wind South West and moderate. Working about home

Wind Westerly Very fine weather Set ringbolts in Lodges each side of my wharf to make vessels fast to. In evening went to the Hall to a Hall meeting. and I was elected Hall Clerk Chairman of the Trustees. also Treasurer for the ensuring year

Wind Southerly My hired man is hauling wood & coal In evening raining Went to Masonic hall to our Annual meeting Elected G.W. Tracy Wm " HC Guptill SW " T H Smallidge J.W. " W H Parker S D " Jabez Myrick J D " My self Sec. After Lodge I begin to get ready to go to Machias to join the Lodge of Perfection which meets tomorrow eve

Wind South West. Started with a pair of horses from the Stable with B Frank Summer for Machias to join the Lodge of Perfection and arrived at 4 PM Standard. Lodge opened at 5 P.M. and we took the following degrees Viz Select Master Perfect Master. Intimate Secretary Provost & Judge Intendent of the building. Elected Knight of the nine Illustions Elect of the fifteen. Sublime Knight Elect of the 12. Grand Master Architect. Knight of the Ninth Arch. or Royal anch of Solomon. Gran Elect Perfect and Sublime Mason

Wind South West. Left Machias at 8 oclock A.M. and owing a sick horse we had. did not get back to Columbia Falls at 1 PM to dinner When it began to snow at 2.30 P.M. left Columbia Falls and arrived at Milbridge at dark and drove through to Stamben at 6.30 P.M. where we stoped to supper leaving Steuben at 8 P.M. we arrived home at 10.30 P.M. Did not snow after 8 oclock P.M.
Wind Southerly About home No sledding yet although there is a little snow
Wind Northerly and fine weather
Wind North East and looking like snow Work at my business
Wind Easterly and fine. Went to Bar Harbor to see J.A. Peters Esy on law business for my sister. Came back in the afternoon
Wind Easterly and rainy most all day In evening went to a masonic meeting C.H. Bickford & N.A. Fitzgerald Took the F.C.D. I worked the East Both Wardens absent
Wind Easterly and rainy all day What little snow there was on the ground is all gone Worked on a boat for Charlie Kingsley I do not average more than one day in a week on her

Wind North North East and moderate with rain most all the forenoon and snow in the afternoon There has not been any sledding yet. although we have had a little snow several times To day the ground is not frozen
Wind Northerly Thermometer 10' above 0 worked apart of the day on boat for Charles F. Kingsley
Calm in morning with Thermometer down to zero Afternoon wind South West, and at 10 PM Ther. 30' above. Afternoon went to Prospect Harbor to see Alfred Handleton but I was gone

Wind Southerly Went up the stream after small spars for W.A. Millikins vessel but did not have them out here being no snow on Ice. In the evening went to Masonic Hall and I being Past Master Installed the officers and the Master Installed me as secretary
Wind South East and very heavy rain all day. At dark the wind hauled North and commenced snowing but cleared up at 9 P.M.

Wind Northerly Thermometer 2' above 0 in morning. a very little snow on the ground. no sledding or sleighing and no ice so far this winter In evening went to a masonic meeting and N A Fitzgerald took the 3d degree
Wind North West, team buisy hauling wood and Coal. Thermometer 4' above
Wind Westerly in forenoon and S.W. in afternoon Went to Prospect Harbor to see Alfred Hamilton but on getting there I found he had gone to Ellsworth
Wind Westerly and moderate but quite overcast. Tried to get into the woods with my team but finding the swamps all open came back home without getting in the woods
Wind North North East Thermometer a little below zero in the morning. at dark 10' above. Went to Prospect to see Alfred Hamilton

Very light air Easily and sometimes Northerly Started for Bar Harbor at 8 oclock AM on board of Schr Felora Temple Arrived at Bar Harbor at 12.30 P.M. deposited some money at Bank and left Bar Harbor at 2.30 P.M. for home arriving at midnight snowing a little most all day The Sch Felora Temple has taken the place of Str Silver Star, while is hauled up for repairs

About Calm Except at night when there was a little wind North East with a little snow. Went to Prospect to see Alfred Hamilton about his getting someone to endorse his note which I hold for $122.49 got Fred C Bickford
Wind Northerly quite fresh, with the Thermometer at 15' above. In evening went to a Masonic meeting and James Dolan took the 3d degree
Calm in morning Went to West Sullivan to settle Interest on two notes given to Crabtree & Havey Int amounting to $102.10 Came home in afternoon Wind Westerly
Wind North East Went up the Stream in the afternoon after boat timbers for Charleys boat
Wind North East Thermometer 15' above with spits of snow. Work all day on Charleys boat

Wind North East very fresh. The pipe under ground that runs from the mill into the Cellar is frozen up. There has not been any sledding yet in the highway but teams can do a little in the woods. pipe clear in evening

Wind North West and moderate. No sledding yet. Although there has been some sleighs out. yet it is half bare ground and there has not been a load of wood hauled on runners this winter through the place
Very moderate NW in forenoon But in the afternoon light air of wind Southerly. Work all day on boat I commenced to build
Wind North East. Work on C. F. Kingsleys boat. In evening went to the Masonic Hall and worked the 3d degree on NA Fitzgerald
Wind Northerly and fine weather Went to Bar Harbor in Schr Felora Temple to do business with the banks
Wind North Ther 10' Work all day on boat Fir C F. Kingsley but my team hauling wood and coal
Wind Northerly Thermometer 0 in the morning but went up during the day. Work all day on boat

Light air North in morning with Ther. at zero. At 9 AM Ther 30' above. Went to the Marsh and carried my wife & sister to see Aunt Eliza who is very sick also to make a call to Uncle Clement Bunker & home in the afternoon
Wind Easterly with Thermometer at 30' above and a smart snow storm all day. This will make good sledding if it does no turn to rain
Wind North East. It may now be said this is the first sledding through this place this winter although there has been a little snow in the woods. Work at my business

Wind Easterly and moderate fine weather Worked on boat for Charles Kingsley In the evening went to the masonic meeting although I am Sec. I am called to the East, being past master and the W.M and Senior Warden absent Wm Over took the E.A.D.
Wind Easterly and in the afternoon a very heavy snow storm drifting my hired mand workin in the woods while I repair sleds &ce
Wind Westerly Work on C F. Kingsleys boat. The Highways are drifted full of snow. to much snow now for anything. the mail cannot get through on time by 12 hours
Wind North West. Thermometer from 12' to 17' above. work apart of the day for C.F. Kingsley yesterdays mail got along at 5 oclock this morning

Wind North West Went up the Marsh to Carry my mother who is is going to her sisters funeral. Arrived at Calvin Tracys house at noon At 2 P.M. Aunt Eliza's remains were carried to Prospect for interment also where the Funeral was held. arrived home at 5 P.M. And on the way home at 4.30 met the stage with yesterdays mail which should been here at 3 yesterday
Wind Southerly in forenoon with the Thermometer 40 degrees above. Afternoon wind N.W. and fine work apart of the day for C F. Kingsley on his boat
Wind North West. Thermometer abt. 12' above Work on Charles Kingsleys boat
Wind NorthWest a gale. Thermometer from zero to 10' above to cold to work with tools In evening went to the Lodge F. & AM Wm Over took the F.C.Degree

Wind North North East. and snowing. Started for Machias to visit the Lodge of Perfection with Capt. W.H. Parker and Dr Larrabee who went to take the degrees. In going through Steuben. Sleigh upset and hurt us all three a little and infuring the Stigh got another sleigh and went on. arriving at Machias at 4 P.M. visited the Lodge of Perfection. went to the Banquet. listened to speaches. bought lantern and started for home at 12 oclock midnight. overcsat but not snowing

Wind Northerly and very warm. arrived at Columbia Falls at 3.15 A.M. from Machias. laid down untill 7 A.M. left Columbia Falls at 8 AM for home. Arrived at Steuben at 11 A.M. got our own Sleigh which had been repaired. got dinner and left for home. One of the horses got out in Birch Harbor. Arrived home before night
Wind North East Thermometer 32' above being a little sore where I was thrown out in Steuben I do not work
Very light air East. Thermometer 34' above went to West Gouldsboro mostly for a Sleigh ride and see some people that I can not see conveniently any other day
Wind Easterly and very moderate Thermometer 36' above have done but little work to day being sore where I got hurt in the upsetting of the Pung in Steuben the 18th
Wind Easterly work all day on boat for C F. Kingsley

Wind Easterly Was Examined by Dr Overlook of Steuben as to my being hurt in the town of Steuben the 18th by the Sleigh up setting In evening went to Masonic Hall and Frank P. Noyes took the E A Degree
Wind Southerly and very warm The snow melting very fast. Work all day on C.F. Kingsleys boat
Wind Southerly and very warm. The highways are getting bare of snow and my cart was used to day to haul wood & coal. Work all day on Charley Kingsleys boat Eva Hammond burried
Wind Southerly and very fine weather. Finished planking boat for C.F. Kingsley
Wind North East Thermometer 2' below zero in the morn at night 6' above

Calm left Winter Harbor at 8 A.M. for Bar Harbor and at 3 oclock P.M. had not got by Grindstone point When the wind breezed up South. and arrived in Bar Harbor at 5 P.M. Then Got L.B. Deacy Esq. to write for me a Legal notice on the Town of Steuben making a demand for settlement on accident which happened Feb 18 got home at 10.30 P.M.
Wind North East fresh breeze. Done no work to day only trying to look out for a little business

Wind North East Went to Steuben with Capt W. H. Parker to give Legal Notice in writing that we was hurt by the upsetting of the Ring Feb 18th in the Town of Steuben and that one should claim damages. Came home in the afternoon. In evening went to the Masonic Hall and Wm H Over was raised to the sublime degree of a M.M. and I as Past Master acted as Master
Wind North East and heavy snow storm did not try to work
Wind North North East and fine weather The snow drifted some but not very badly blocked. Made up my accts as Local Collector for Kennebee Martial Life Ins. Co.
Wind North West and fresh. Went to Bar Harbor on Sch. Felora Temple and ordered L.B. Deacy to sue the Town of Steuben for damages. Injuries received Feb 18 back in the afternoon
Wind West North West and very fine. very good sleighing Went to Steuben to carry Capt W.H. Parker who went to sue his Father. back in the afternoon
Wind Westerly and very warm Went to West Gouldsboro to our anual Town meeting. and re elected the same old board of officers
Wind Southerly Went on board of Sch Abbie Bersley to see what work I was going to do
Wind South Easterly thick with fog and showery. In evening went to Masonic Meeting did no work owing to the traveling
Wind Southerly and very warm. Commenced to line a stick for a beam for Sch. Abbie Berlsey Discharged my hired man at noon. Orders for wood & coal very limited
Wind South West a perfect howler and rough
Wind Westerly a perfect gale disagreeable working out of doors. Painted Charleys boat out side
Wind North West Thermometer 12' above stayed in house done some writing
Wind Westerly and a rough day
Wind Westerly very fresh In afternoon went on board of Schr Abbie Bursley putting in a beam

Wind North West and cold. Work in forenoon on board Sch Abbie Bursley putting in a beam In afternoon worked on Sch Lucy Elizabet making a flying jibbin In evening went to Masonic Hall myself acting as Master W H Simpson took the degree of a F. C.
Wind North North West wind more moderate Work all day making small spars for Sch Lucy Elizabeth
Wind South East and snowy. Worked apart of the forenoon on W A Millikens vessel when it snowed so hard had to quit In afternoon puttied Charley Kingsleys boat. In evening heavy rain and blow
Wind South West and blowing a perfect judgement. Hauled wood and coal
Wind Westerly fresh. Staid at home
Wind North North West Clear weather Around my customer collecting money
Wind North West and very fine weather. Work all day on Sch. Abbie Bursley
Wind South East with snow in forenoon and rain in afternoon In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting on account of the Storm no candidate appeared
Wind North West Went to Bar Harbor on Sch Lone Star Came back on Sch. Felora Temple Went to consult Lawyer in regard to the Steuben accident which happened Feb 18th
Wind Westerly. In forenoon trying to sell out my business to the Mesers Brownies of Milbridge In afternoon hauled wood and coal
Wind North West. Work all day on Main boom for Sch Lucy
Wind Southerly Went to South Gouldsboro for Calon Bunker to drive my team tomorrow
Wind North West Went in the woods with my horse & hauled out a stick to make a foremast for Sch Felora Temple the stick is 60 ft long & 30 in at the Butt. 8 in at top
Wind North North West and fine weather Work all day on Sch Lucy Elizabeth rigging her up with new Main boom flying jib boom and fore top mast
Wind Northerly and fine. Work all day on Sch Lucy Elizabeth In evening went to a Masonic meeting and Frank P. Noyes took the F.C.D.
Wind Westerly work all day on Sch Lucy Elizabeth
Wind South West work all day on Sch Lucy Elizabeth
Wind Southerly worked 3/4 day on Sch Lucy. then went to West Gouldsboro after my sister
Wind SouthWest in forenoon and North West in the afternoon. The thermometer at 5 PM stood at 60' in the shade
Wind Westerly in morning South West in afternoon and very fine weather Work all day on Sch Lucy Elizabeth
Wind Easterly our cast and looking like rain. Work 1/2 day on Sch Lucy Elizabeth In evening thick with fog
Wind North West in forenoon South West in afternoon work all day on Sch Lucy Elizabeth In evening went to a stated meeting of F. & A.M. Wm R Hanny was Elected to take the degrees
Wind Southerly Work all day on Sch Lucy Elizabeth
Wind Southerly Work all day on Sch Lucy Elizabeth and finished work

Nearly Calm with a very light air of wind either N.W. or S.W. Went to Bar Harbor in Company with my sister to consult Lawyer Peters. My sister has sued the Gouldsboro Land and improvement Co. Got back home at 9 P.M.
Wind Westerly but overcast and some showery
Wind North West very fresh Measured land on Grindstone Neck as I expect to be called to Court as a Witness regarding land taken by the Gouldsboro Land Imp Co.
Wind North West quite moderate hauled some wood and Coal and getting ready to attend Court tomorrow

Wind North West at 7 AM left home with my team to attend Court. arrived at 11 A.M. The first Case on trial. Fred P. Sargent V S Chas. C. Hutchings At night the evidence not all in. Court adjournes untill tomorrow
Wind South West. attended Court in Ellsworth

Wind Southerly Went to the Court at 9 AM And at 11 AM left the Court house for home Got home middle of the afternoon. Notified my sister Mr Kingsley that I was after her. Got supper at home and started for Ellsworth with my sister at 7 P.M. to attend Court tomorrow arrived at West Sullivan at 9 P.M. and put up for the night at Sidney Bunkers

Wind Westerly. Left West Sullivan at 6 AM. arrived at Ellsworth 7.30 A.M. Went to Court House at 9 AM and my sisters case was called up. Mrs Jennie Kingsley V.S. Gouldsboro Land Imp. Co The case was withdrawn form the Jurry and sent up to the law Court. Left Ellsworth with my team at 2 P.M. and arrived home at 6 P.M.
Wind Westerly in forenoon and Southerly in afternoon staid at home all day
Wind North West in forenoon and South West in afternoon hauled wood and coal
Wind Northerly and fine. Went to West Sullivan to buy an interest in Sch W H Card but on getting to Sullivan I find that the W H Card has not arrived from Boston came home in afternoon
Wind Southerly Worked 1/2 day on sail boat. Then hauled Coal In evening went to the Masonic meeting and Bro. W H Simpson took the M.M.D. Myself acting as Wm
Wind Southerly work all day on sail boat
Wind Southerly and rainy in the forenoon and thick with fog in afternoon Work apart of the day on my Cart. In evening went to Pacific Hall to an Exhibition Got up by P O S by A.
Wind Southerly with some rain in forenoon. afternoon clear. Work in Jennie S. Kingsleys shop on boat
Wind Southerly in morning. Westerly in afternoon
Wind North West in forenoon and South West in afternoon Went to West Sullivan to buy the W.H. Card but the Capt. had gone home and I did not see him
Wind Westerly in forenoon South West in afternoon hauled wood and coal in forenoon and worked on boat in afternoon
Wind Southerly work on boat for C. F. Kingsley In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting. Visited By Benj L. Hadley D.D.G.M. Frank P Noyes took the M M D.
Wind Southerly work on boat in forenoon. Afternoon hauled wood and coal but rainy all the afternoon
Wind North West Work all day on boat for Charley Kingsley
Wind North West Went to Bar Harbor on Str. Creedmore to settle with Mr W A Milliken for work on Schr Lucy Elizabeth Came back in the afternoon
Wind Southerly blowing very heavy Harnessed both my horses to go on a ride. Went to Birch Harbor and back in forenoon and in the afternoon went to the Marsh

Wind South East some overcast cleared away the brush around the house. hauled coal and work on boat a little while in afternoon Hired Saml Leighton to work for me one week from this morning untill St. night for $500 to do my farming
Wind South East and overcast. work all day on boat. my hired man getting ready to farm a little
Wind Southerly and drizzly all day to wet to farm work on boat. In evening went to Masonic Hall to our States meeting Elected Frank Taft for membership and Rejected wood burry Farrar for degrees
Wind North West and fine. Helped my hired man do plowing in forenoon then I left it for my man to plant. and in afternoon work on boat
Wind North North West good weather Work all day on boat for C. F. Kingsley
Wind Northerly and fair weather Work all day on boat for Charley Kingsley The boats Hall is now done. except the painting of the last Coat. But her spars and sail is not made
Wind North East very fresh. Rainy in morn fair weather in the afternoon
Wind North East and fine weather Work on boat
Wind Northerly in forenoon and Southerly in the afternoon. Work on boat for Charley Kingsley

Wind Southerly and overcast Hauled Charley Kingsleys boat from the Mrs Kingsleys shop to the shore and painted her. At dark raining hard In evening went to our Masonic meeting The Master being gone. I as Past master take the East and Wm R Hanna took the E A D also the F. C D. when Lodge was out. raining hard
Wind North East and a little rainy Launched the boat I have built for Charley Kingsley and took her from Mr Kingsleys shore in the Harbor to my wharf
Wind North East made mast for Charleys Kingsleys boat
Wind South West Work about home
WInd Southerly and overcast. In evening heavy rain
Wind Southerly Thick with fog Work about home
Wind North West fresh. Cut boat sail for Charley Kingsley
Wind Northerly and fine. Sent horses to Sullivan after brick. back at 6 P.M. In evening went to the Lodge F. & A.M. and Wm R. Hanna was raised to the Sublime degree of a M Mason
Wind North East and cloudy Work about home hauling some wood &ce
Wind Easterly and wet & cold Made boom for C.F Kingsley boat
Wind Easterly overcast and cold looking very much a rainstorm Finished planting peas. hauled coal &ce
Wind Easterly and heavy rain all day
Wind Easterly and rainy went to Bar Harbor and back on Str. Creedman to deposit money &ce
Wind Southerly and rough. Work about home In evening went to Pacific Hall to an Exhibition got up by home talent. The name of the Play Bettr than Gold
Wind Southerly Finished rigging Charley Kingsleys boat and she is now completed
Wind Southerly and apart of the day thick with fog. Went out sailing in Charley Kingsleys boat on her trial trip. and thick she will be a good sailor
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. In afternoon went to So. Gouldsboro after a Cart or wheels for a dump Cart. heavy thunder shower

Wind Southerly and showery although sometimes the sun would shine. Went to Prospect in the forenoon after a pair of wheels and bought them and in the afternoon went over with both the horses after them
Wind Southerly and very fine weather went out and sailed Charleys new boat
Wind Southerly and rain half the day. Commenced to rig up a dump Cart having bought the wheels saturday
Wind Southerly and very moderate finished work on the Cart. and hauled wood & coal
Wind Southerly and thick with fog Went to Bar Harbor and back on Str Creedmore The Str Silver Star is also running Business with the Bank called me over In evening went to a Masonic Stated meeting
Wind Southerly & very hot. The County Comissioners met here to assess damages on my sisters land My team commenced work grading anormal house for John Moore of N.Y.
Wind Northerly and very fine weather Made a flower basket seven feet across
Wind Southerly Painted flower basket. and worked about the place while my double team is at work on Grindstone Neck
Wind South Easterly and rainy
Wind Southerly and showery hauling wood and Coal
Wind Northerly fresh and very fine Work about home. my team working on Grindstone Neck
Wind South West and in the forenoon hot. work hoeing peas
Wind Southerly fresh. Had water come in the house from the Winter Harbor water Co.
Wind Southerly Work at the Coal shed
Wind Southerly went to Bar Harbor on Str. Silver Star to take up a note at the bank Came back at noon
Wind Southerly and hot
Wind Southerly and a tremendious heavy thunder shower in morning then cleared of fine My team at work on the neck but I working about home
Wind Southerly and is called hot Thermometer 85' shade been all day collecting money. At night thunder showers
Wind North West fresh. work all day among my peas
Moderate Southerly work about home and at the coal shed

Wind moderate N.W. started for Bar Harbor in the boat that I built for Charley Kingsley arriving at noon done business at the Bank started for home Wind N.N. East. When I got to Iron Bound head received hard. at night clear again
Wind Southerly Mr H B Rawson of N.Y. dined with me. In afternoon Went to Prospect Harbor to a Caucus to nominate delegates to the 3d district Convention to be held in waterville july 6
Wind South Easterly and a very moderate rain
Wind South East and a very heavy rain all day The horses not taken out of the stable for the day
Wind Southerly and thick with fog Left home at noon for West Sullivan to buy into the Schr W. H. Card. but am not successful as yet. Stop overnight at S S Bunkers & Son
Wind Southerly and a little showery came home from West Sullivan at noon
Wind Southerly in morning and night thick with fog Clear at noon Commenced making spar for yacht Iowa of Philada
Wind Southerly Fog in morning clear at noon Worked apart of the day on spar

Wind South East rain all day but had to keep the team hauling  coal most all day Drs. Overlock and Walling from Steuben and Milbridge Respectively came to Examine me as to how bad I was hurt by been on violently hone out of a purng
Wind Easterly thick with fog with some rain
Wind South. Fog and rain. but keep the team out all the time
Wind Southerly very fresh and a power of rum all day. No team out
Wind Southerly clear and warm hoed my peas
Wind Southerly & thick with fog wet day Carted Soft Coal out of the shed getting ready to receive a cargo of Egg & Stove Coal Sold my black horse to E. K. Merrett $167.50
Wind Southerly and rainy hauled wood & Coal down to Grindstone Neck Leased my Coal privilege
Wind Southerly cleared up fine Finished making mast for yacht Iowa. all that can be done with the old mast is out
Wind South, thick and very heavy rain all day
Celebration day very quite here Worked all day at the Coal shed

Light air North West in forenoon. Went to Bar Harbor on Str Silver Star to take care of a note given by W A Milliken at the First National Bank and endorsed by me Came home at noon My Coal Cart Moving all day
Wind North West in forenoon there hauled out mowed around the door
Wind Westerly in morning. South West in afternoon. Work about the Coal shed with a hired man
Wind Southerly and looking like a storm. Work about home
Wind Southerly Went to Bar Harbor on Str Silver Star back at noon My team filling orders
Wind South East with a little fog
Calm in forenoon Thermometer up to 78' Hauled wood & Coal in forenoon. In afternoon wind SW sent my team on the Point to work at night Mowed a little around the house
Wind Southerly Thermometer 75 lined a stick of timber to make main boom for Sch Grace E Stevens
Wind Southerly Mowed apart of the forenoon. then hauled coal
Wind Southerly thick in forenoon then the sun came out hot work all day on my hay
Wind Southerly Thick with fog in morning then it cleared up. And at night thick again. Work about home

Wind South West forenoon thick afternoon Clear and fresh breeze At 2 P.M. went to Pacific Hall to a Camrs to elect Delegates to attend the County Convention Myself chosen Clerk The delegates elected were W.F.Vose P.A. Simmer J.A. Hill and E G Guptill
Wind South West very fresh and clear
Wind Southerly worked some haying. but dare not. get down to much because I am expecting a coal vessel
Wind South West Expecting a Coal vessel to arrive every hour. hauled some wood and Coal

Wind South West. Sch. Albion of Milbridge arrived with a load of Coal 197 tons It being Ebb tide when she arrived hauled into the Steamboat wharf untill night when she came up to my whar. At midnight Mrs W.H. Parker broke into my house supposed to be insane
Wind North West and South West. Commenced discharging Sch Albion at my wharf
Wind Southerly Work all day on Sch Albion discharging Coal
Wind Southerly Finished discharging Sch Albion at noon of 197 tons. then hauled coal
Wind Southerly Went to Church at the Charming Chapel in afternoon
Calm in forenoon Thermometer 85 in shade most to hot to work much. Wind Southerly in afternoon
Wind Southerly Thermometer 86' in shade hauled coal
Wind North West Thermometer 80' very fine weather Hauled wood and coal. At dark C C Brown Brought a man to work for him in the coal business
Wind Southerly hauled coal in forenoon and in the afternoon the Team went on the Neck hauling gravel Thermometer 87'
Wind Southerly Thermometer 82' working at my business
Wind South East and Cooler Hauling wood & coal
Very moderate South wind Staid at home
Wind Easterly moderate dry and comfortable Working hard all day at my business
Wind South East and overcast. but good weather to work a rush of business just now
Wind Southerly Went to Bar Harbor to the Bank and took up a note
Wind Southerly Mowed a little and work about home
Wind all around the Compass. Thunder shower and sunshine. Commenced repairing boat that had been runto by Steam yacht. Now then
Wind South thick with fog. Bought Int in Coal business with C G Brown who had cased my Coal priviledge Afternoon Went to Franklin to a Caucus to nominate Candidate for Representation & Legislator
Wind Southerly Mrs Saml Sargent did in afternoon
Wind South West very fresh. Went to Bar Harbor to visit the Bank Eugene Tracy was drowned at 5 P.M. coming from Schoodic Island to his wifes mothers funeral
Wind Westerly Then South. Men went to swich for the body of Eugene Tracy who was drowned last night
Wind Southerly and not very good hay weather done some mowing
Wind Easterly mowed some but to wet to rake it up
Wind South East and rainy team out apart of the day
Wind Southerly and thick with fog with rain in forenoon. Commenced to build another Coal shed on my land having C G Brown in Company in the Coal business
Moderate Southerly and thick with fog on the water but the sun burned the fog up a little over the land so I opened some hay
Wind Southerly and overcast. Building Coal shed
Wind North West finished haying and working on coal shed. At sunset the Sch. Georfie D Loud arrived down the Harbor with 252 tons Egg Coal on board
Wind Southerly very fine Working with all my night with a crew of men getting Coal shed ready. The coal vessel into the wharf waiting
Wind Southerly moderate and very warm. Commenced to discahrge Sch Georgie D. Loud and working on the Coal shed to get it ready
Wind Southerly and in the forenoon thick with fog Work all day taking Cargo out of Sch Georgie D Loud
Wind North East very moderate. Finished discharging Sch. Georgie D. Loud at 3.30 P.M. of 252 tons
Wind Northerly Helped the Capt of Sch. Georgie D Loud get the vessel away from the Coal wharf down the Harbor and out to sea
Wind South West and fine. a large quantity of orders for coal a head now. they have accumulating while the vessel was discharging
Wind very moderate Southerly have all the orders two of us can handle
Wind Southerly fine weather working at my business
Wind South East. afternoon rainy hauling wood and coal
Wind Easterly and overcast. Hauling coal
Wind Easterly Went to Bar Harbor. Back at noon. Afternoon heavy rain coaled up several small steam yachts
Wind North East Over cast
Very light air of wind North East hauling Coal & wood
Wind South and at night thick with fog. Trying to collect money all day on Grindstone Neck as the Company is about to go away
Wind Southerly with some fog & rain at night. Have sold just 100 tons of Coal this month besides the wood
Wind North West Fine weather. Collecting mooney as many of the summer visitors are about to leave
Wind Southerly The body of Eugene Tracy was found on Schoodic. he was drowned Mon aug 8 while comming from Schoodic Island to his wifes Mothers Funeral

Wind Southerly hauled wood in forenoon. In afternoon went to West Gouldsboro. to Nathan Shaws Funeral At the same time the Funeral of Eugene Tracy was held at this place. His body was found yesterday very much decomposed
Wind Southerly Went to Uncle Clement Bunkers to spend the day with my wife back home at dark
Wind North East and rainy. Hauled Coal and received $100 from the Grindstone Neck Water Co for damage to land in laying the water pipe across
Wind Southerly and rainy in forenoon. In the afternoon cleared up. Went to Prospect Harbor with a load of coal for Chas Surry
Wind Westerly and very fine Winter Harbor Lodge F & A.M. meets for the first time since June 1st Elected Grant Scutt to membership
Wind moderate Southerly and the best of weather In the evening went to West Gouldsboro at Town house to hear a Republican Lectures speak on the topics of the day

Wind Southerly gave the largest Check I ever gave it Covering $1110.70 The Went to Bar Harbor and deposited the amount. The above Check was given to Mejsrs H B Rawson & Co for a Cargo of Coal Consisting of 252 tons
Wind Southerly In afternoon went to West Gouldsboro to the town house to examine the voting booths as I am one of the Election Clerks for monday the 12 whint state Election
Wind Southerly and very fine weather staid at home
Wind Southerly Went to West Gouldsboro to State Election I being one of the Election Clerks have to stay there all day. This town went for Governor 191 Republican and 150 Democratic
Wind Southerly work about home the great rush of business is over for a while
Wind South a gale Mr C G Browns hired man whoo has been helping me left on stage for home at night heavy rain
Wind Westerly with a genuine clear of. In evening went to the Hall to a traveling show. Louise Hamilton
Wind Southerly delivering wood
Wind South West Fresh but fine weather Work alone about the Coal shed only work enough for once Hauled coal to Grindstone Neck
Wind Southerly and fresh Went down on Grindstone Neck for a ride
Wind Southerly and fine Went to Bar Harbor on business with the First National Bank
Wind South hauling Coal all day
Wind Southerly Work about home and getting ready to go a gunning
Wind South West. Went gunning down to Schoodic Island with Andrew Pendleton. We got six birds
Wind South and a little thick hauling Coal all day
Wind South and thick with fog. Went to Steuben with Lawyer C N. Higgins to be there at the taking of a Deposition of Mrs Dutton. In the case of Capt Parker and myself v.s. Steuben
Wind Southerly and thick with fog Went to Steuben to look up a witness that we could not find yesterday came back at dark
Wind South South East and rainy
Wind West South West blowing very heavy and rough. Sending Coal to Prospect Harbor and delivering around Winter Harbor
Wind Westerly work about home
Wind Westerly Went to Bar Harbor to see about one law suit
Wind South West. Went to Bar Harbor at 10.20. back at 2 P.M. and went to Steuben arriving at dark
Wind North West a heavy gale Left Steuben in the morning arrived home at 10 AM. took the boat at 10.30 went to Bar Harbor and give up the lawsuit and go home
Wind N.W. a gale. Went to Steuben With Capt Parker back in the afternoon
Calm and heavy frost. Commenced to discharge Schr White Froam of a cargo of wood. Afternoon wind Southerly
Wind Southerly and rainy Finshed discharging Schr. White Froam in morning
Wind N.N. East hauled wood and coal In evening went to Masonic Hall to Stated meeting
Wind West South West very fresh hauling wood
Wind South West. business slack to day
Wind Southerly fresh & rough. very buisy to day In evening it commenced raining
Wind North East and rain all the forenoon but cleared up in the afternoon with the wind Northerly

Stephen Gerrish begins work Wind Westerly and very fine weather Took the Str Silver Star in the morning with my wife and went to Bar Harbor. Then took the Str Mt. Desert and went to N.E. Harbor arriving at noon This trip is for a visit to my wifes folks and stop the night at her fathers
Wind North West and fine. Visiting at N.E. Harbor with my wife at her folks
Wind Southerly Visiting at N.E. Harbor with my wife
Wind South. At N.E. Harbor. Visiting Left N.E. Harbor at 11 AM. on Str Mt Desert came to Bar Harbor took Str Silver Star for home at 3.15
Wind Westerly moderate and very warm like a summer day Work at business
Calm in forenoon At 10 am went down turtle Isle ledges gunning afternoon the wind Southerly got 10 birds. home before night
Very moderate Southerly In afternoon a little rainy
Wind moderate North and in the afternoon went to Turtle Isle gunning got two
Wind Southerly Went to Bar Harbor in a little packet
Wind South West Went to Bangor to see about out side windows having business in Ellsworth on my way back
Wind North West fresh. left Bangor at 7 AM. arriving in Ellsworth Went to Burril National Bank drew out $500 for my sister belonging to her. took the train at 11 am for Bar Harbor and the packet home
Wind West North West very heavy. Put my Coal in for Winter 2 tons for dining room
Wind NorthWest hauling logs from So Gouldsboro home that was left there winter on acct. of being little snow
Wind South westerly fine morning and night. a little showery at noon
Wind North West heavy hauled coal in forenoon. and in the afternoon hauled a log down from So. Gouldsboro
Wind Westerly and moderate Finished hauling my logs down from South Gouldsboro
Wind mdoerate Easterly and overcast. Went gunning on Egg Rock with Andrew Pendleton got 34 birds. Rainy in Evening Lodge did not meet

Wind Westerly and overcast. Went to Bar Harbor on the little packet to see about hiring a steam boat for the Route. made no trade to day Came home at night. and a vessel with hay and wood hauled into my wharf
Moderate Southerly and warm. took the deckload of hay of Sch White foam. and stored it. The hay and wood belongs to Mr C G Brown and myself
Wind South Easterly Commenced to take hold fall wood out Sch White Foam and had it all out before night. In evening raining hard my birth day 47 yrs
Wind northerly fresh and clear
Wind North West and fresh in the forenoon. Went to Bar Harbor in Packet to get cases drawn up to Charter the Str. Electa. afternoon very moderate came home
Wind North in forenoon with rain afternoon cleared up
Wind East in forming with snow squalls. Afternoon wind S.S.E. fresh. at night rainy. In evening went to the Hall to a masonic Started meeting and done some business
Wind North East and rainy Made axle tree for my Cart
Wind North East and showery done blacksmith work on my cart with my forge
Wind North North East rainy in morning cleared up in the afternoon Put outside windows on my house
Wind North fresh. Went to Cromwells Harbor in the rain with H E Tracy to carry W H Parker who is going to Boston from Bar Harbor tomorrow
Wind South Partialy banked up the house getting ready for Winter In evening rainy
Wind South and heavy rain untill 8 A.M. then cleared up. Went to Presidential Election and was one of the Election Clerks. Town went 162 Rep 147 Dem and 1 Pro total vote 310
Wind North West Work about home In evening went to the Masonic Hall but only three members came so the Lodge was not called to order
Wind Easterly and heavy snow storm untill about noon and 5 or 6 inches of snow fall. When it began to rain and it rained untill late in the evening so there is no sleighing
Wind North. team out all day on wheels

Wind Northerly Sch Julia Ann. Capt Sargent hauled into my wharf and discharge 400 but of Corn for Mr Brown and my self. Bought a Top buggy of C.C. Brown for $82 gane note for $42 in one year without Int. It will go to pay lease of Coal Privilege
Wind Northerly but warm. Went to W. Gouldsboro for a ride in my new buggy
Wind South and fresh. hauled some wood and coal. also took the little Sch. Sea Nymph to my wharf to look after during the winter for $10.00 unbent her sails and stored them
Calm in forenoon moderate Southerly in afternoon hauled coal to Prospect Harbor
Wind South. Fresh. Heavy rain in the afternoon No Lodge meets to night
What wind there has been to day has been Southerly and very fine weather Our only daughter Stella is sick taken yesterday had the Dr. to day
Wind South East And in the afternoon plenty of rain. team out in the forenoon. Dr. Larrabee makes another visit to see our Daughter. Hired girl came
Wind South South East. and rain all day no team out. In afternoon. The Dr makes another call and thinks and thinks our Daughter is no worse
Clear off fine with the wind Northerly Another Professional visit from the Dr. and says our Daughter is getting better
Wind Northerly Working on wagon house all day
Wind Westerly and fine Sent team to West Gouldsboro with coal
Wind North West. Thermometer 30' Work about the coal shed In evening went to the Masonic Lodge
Wind N.N. West buisy at the coal shed
Wind North Thermometer 32' above. Sent coal team to Prospect twice with coal
Wind N.N. East hauling coal all day
Wind North East and fine. Went to South Gouldsboro for a ride
Wind N. East. Worked at the coal shed in forenoon Afternoon went to West Gouldsboro to see if I could find a stick to splice Mast for W A Millikens vessel and think I have found it
Wind North East and overcast. Went to West Gouldsboro with my team and got a stick to splice a mast for W A Milliken vessel got back home at noon
Wind North East. snow in forenoon. but rained in afternoon At night no snow left on the ground. In evening went to Masonic Meeting. Exemplified the work
Wind North East. and rainy no work The ground entirely free from any ice on snow. No frost whatever in the ground
Wind North. Work apart of the day splicing mast for Schr Lucy Elizabeth
Wind North North West for W A Millikens vessel. The Sch Lucy Elizabeth
Wind Northerly and chilly There is neither snow snow or ice on the ground
Wind N.N.W and cold. Work on Mast for Sch. Lucy Elizabeth very disagreeable
Wind N. East and more moderate Got the mast spliced the Iron did not come to hoop in
Wind Northerly and fine. The Blacksmith work on Sch Lucy Elizabeth Mast is done and the mast set. In evening went to Stated Meeting of Winter Harbor Lodge F & A.M. Elected James B Higgins
Wind South East and rain storm do not pretend to do any work
Wind Northerly finished all work on Sch. Lucy Elizabeth the mast set and rigging sails &ce all on
Light air North East. Went to Bar Harbor in sail packet. left for home at 1 P.M. with a very light air East got home at 8 P.M.
Wind North West Capt Homer C. Guptill died at 8 oclock A.M.
Wind North West. Work about the coal shed
Wind Westerly Capt. H. C. Guptill was burried here at 2 P.M. with Masonic Honors. He was our Junior Warden and a noble Officer. Mrs. Roderic Pendleton died here at 5.30 P.M.
Wind North East and moderate snow all day. but no snow on the ground this morning untill this commenced In evening went to Masonic Hall James B Higgins took the E A D
Very little snow on the Ground. Afternoon rainy Mrs Roderic Pendletin burried in afternoon Wind Southerly No sledding
Wind West North West and fine no snow in the road but there is from 1/4 to 1/2 inch out side of the road all the books and streams are open
Wind Westerly and fine. Collecting what money I can but the team hauling coal
Wind North West Thermometer 10' above Went to Prospect Harbor. to see Fred C Bickford

Wind very moderate Northerly Thermometer went from 15' above to 35 above a little spit of snow. hauling coal on wheels In evening went to Pacific Hall to a Sociable with my wife The Proceeds are to buy a hearse
Wind North and disagreeable Collecting money
Wind Northerly work about the shed In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting James B. Higgins took his F.C. Degree
Wind West North West Turned hitching post to set near the house. The weather is growing colder very fast but there is no snow whatever to be seen from my house except on Mt Desert
Wind West. a gale Thermometer at zero team kept buisy hauling coal
Wind North West and blowing a gale with the Thermometer 5 degrees below zero
Wind Westerly The Thermometer 20' above To day being Christmas my whole family accepted an invitation and went to Jennie Kingsleys to dinner at night snowy wind Northerly
Wind North West Thermometer 3' below in the morning and 4 above at night There was a Christmas tree at the Hall and although I did not go I had some presents that did come from the tree
Wind Westerly Thermometer 20' above Collecting
Wind very light Northerly Ther 30 In evening went to Masonic meeting James B Higgins took the M.M.D.
Very moderate North Easterly and fine Ther. 30' above
Moderate Northerly Employed at my business
Calm. so much so the sail packet could not get to Bar Harbor and back in all day I am still in the wood & coal business having taken C G Brown in Company with me in July

Calm untill in the evening when the wind began to breeze up Easterly and later in the evening it began to rain. Ice is now 12 inches thick and I hear they are cutting Ice at West Gouldsboro but there is no more snow on the ground here then in the summer
Wind South East a gale. Tide flowed into the Coal shed At night the wind South West. Thermometer 46 above. Work about the coal shed
Wind North West and at night began to grow cold. In evening went to the Hall to a Hall meeting and I was elected Clerk. Chairman of the Trustees & Treasurer

Wind West North West Thermometer at zero In evening went to the Hall to our Annual meeting Elected W H Parker W.M. T H Smallidge S.W. JB Myrick J.W. H E Tracy Treas. F. R Bunker Sec. W W Summer SD W H Sargent JD.
Wind East North East Thermometer 12' above Work about home
Wind Easterly fresh and a very little snow Thermometer 18' above
Wind North West Thermometer 12' above. Team cannot fill the orders to day owing to such a rush of business
Wind N.N.W. Thermometer 16 above

Wind Easterly Thermometer in morning a zero Went to Bar Harbor in the sail pocket at noon commenced snowing. At 1.30 started for home arriving at 4.30 P.M. tough snow storm. In evening went to a Masonic meeting and Amasa  W Young took the E A D. also the F.C.D. At 11 P.M. after getting home from the Lodge the Thermometer 30' above with the wind E.S.E. blowing and looking like rain

In morning Wind South and heavy rain and blow. At 9.30 AM started for Sullivan & arrived at noon. Took Str. Sebenou and went to Bar Harbor to visit the Lodge of F. & AM In the evening the Lodge was called to order and the 3d degree was worked The R W D D G M A O Gross was present. When the Lodge was out the Wind Northerly

Wind North West. Thermometer at zero At 8 oclock started for home via of Sullivan and took my team for home arriving at noon. In the afternoon went to Masonic Hall where we were visited by the R.W.D.D.G.M. and worked the 3d degree on Amgrasa W. Young In evening went to the Church where the Officers of Winter Harbor Lodge were publicly Installed by DDGha A O Gross A supper was served at Pacific Hall but I did not stop
Wind Northerly Thermometer at 0 in morning Afternoon Calm and over cast
Wind Northerly steady cold it seems as though the mercury was almost frozen at zero. If it gets a little above in the day It gets as much below in the night. Working about the coal shed
Wind Northerly Thermometer at zero must of the time. To cold for most any kind of work
Wind North East and a little snow. I think this will make sleighing
Wind Northerly Thermometer 10' above zero. This now is a little sleighing and a little wheeling and not very good for either
Calm in the morning with the Thermometer 10' below zero but to 10' above before noon
Wind North East with spit of snow Thermometer 12' above In evening went to Masonic Hall Chas. Miller took his F C Degree
About calm all day Thermometer at zero in the morning then went up to 12' above Repairing sled
Wind North West Thermometer at zero in morning and went up to 16 above in the afternoon. Repaired my sled did not get her done yesterday
Wind North West. Thermometer 10' above. Went to Lower Harbor with team to see about building boat for Elisha Crane
Very moderate Light air NW. Thermometer in the warmest part of the day 15' above a very little snow
Calm all day Thermometer up to 30' some sleighs are used also some sled but wagons goes best through the place good sleighing after getting out the place
Dead calm all day Thermometer 30 good sleighing not much snow but a good deal of ice
Wind Southerly wet snow in forenoon and rain in afternoon the Ther. 34 degrees In evening went to the Masonic Hall Chas H. Miller took the M.M.D
Wind North West Thermometer 28' work abt home
Wind North West and growing cold work about home
Wind North West and moderate. Thermometer 0 in morning but went up a little during the day. It is now good sleighing. not much snow but the roads are a glitter of ice
WInd South East and rainy
Wind North West Ther 26 above
Wind North West snow in forenoon good weather in the afternoon very good sleighing on ice not much snow. Ther 18' above

Wind moderate Southerly. Thermometer 20 Work about the coal shed. In evening went to a Stated meeting at Masonic Hall after Lodge went Capt. J. H. Smallidges House where my wife was. This was a gathering of Mrs Smallidges folks in honor of his 30th birthday
Wind Northerly Thermometer 14' above work about home
Wind North East Thermometer 4' below zero all day and snowing hard
Wind North West Thermometer at zero and blowing a gale notwithstanding the team was kept out delivering coal
In the morning the wind N.W. blowing a gale with the thermometer 10' below zero At night calm with Thermometer 12' above zero
Wind Southerly The Thermometer rising with a mixture of rain and snow untill night when the rain poured down in torrents
Wind Southerly Thermometer 42' above zero At sunset the wind came of N.W. sledding spoiled
Wind North West Thermometer at zero at night Ther 10' above. In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting and A. Jed. Guptill & Edwin H. Norris took the E.A.D.
Wind Westerly at night Southerly In evening had a surprise party at our house consisting of more than 25 people
Wind South a gale and a power of rain
Wind Southerly snow all gone and all sleighing except some Ice in the road
Very light wind Northerly & Easterly and very fine Went to East Sullivan to see W.H. Simpson who has been very sick for two months he belongs to our Lodge F. & A.M.
Light air of wind Easterly but fine. Work for M. Perlinsky. In evening commenced snowing and at bed time snowing hard and blowing a gale

Wind East North East thick with snow in morning. there it cleared up fine. Work for M. Perlinsky In evening went to Masonic Hall A. Judson Guptill and Edwin H. Norris was passed to the degree of a F.C.
Wind South West Thermometer 44' above. Went up the Stream with team My hired man choped and I hauled fire wood
Wind Northerly Worked hauling wood same as yesterday
Wind North West and windy hauling coal. Ther. 12' above
Wind Easterly Hauled coal in the forenoon. Afternoon went in the woods with horse and hauled out a wharf log. Ther 10' above spit of snow
Wind South West Thermometer 30' above
Wind Easterly and blowing a gale with a heavy snow At noon wind South West and kept on snowing about 10 inches fell to day. Thermometer 30' above
Wind North West a gale. hauling wood home for my self in afternoon from Squire Rands meadow

Wind Easterly heavy At 8 oclock A.M. commenced snowing Went to Gouldsboro to see Robt R Joy. Afternoon came home snowing and blowing fearfully. get no wail to day In evening went to Masonic Hall and A J Guptill took the M M Degree
Wind heavy westerly cut wood at the door. My team delivering coal
Wind North West work about home Thermometer 18' above zero
Wind South West and fine. hauling wood home from stream lot. Thermometer 26' above
Wind North West Thermometer 20' very fine
Wind North West very heavy. yet not cold Thermometer 20' I sawed wood at the door but my team hauled coal all day
Wind South West. Thermometer 30' Cut wood at the door in forenoon and went in the woods and hauled out a load at the noon

Calm in forenoon Thermometer 38' and the damp snow fell dast. At noon cleared up with a light wind N.W. and very fine working at my business. In evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting E H Norris took the M.M. Degree although it is a stated meeting The Ladies served a lunch after lodge in the Lodge noon
Wind North West In afternoon fresh Thermometer 25' Went up the stream after a load of wood
Wind North West moderate Went in the woods in forenoon and got a load of wood. back again in the afternoon and got a wharf log
Wind North East. Thermometer 25' hauling coal
Wind North. Thermometer 15' above
Wind North West Thermometer 10' above in morning. Went to Town meeting and for Select men Elected Geo. Taft J R Hammond & Raymond Guptill. back home at 4.30 P.M.
Wind Southerly hauled coal in forenoon. Afternoon went in the woods got a log
Wind South West and fine. hauling firewood all day. In evening went to to a masonic meeting, opened on the 3d degree no work
Wind Southerly Thermometer 40 degrees hauled wood for Llewellyn Pendleton At dark wind North East
Wind Easterly and sunshine snow melting very fast. Hauling wood home. from up the stream
Wind South East and overcast. Finished hauling my fire wood at noon. have also got some wharf logs. hauled coal in afternoon
Wind South East and rainy snow and ice melting with the Thermometer at 42'
Wind Northerly and moderate Thermometer 50' which causes the snow to melt very fast. Cut wood at the door
Wind Southerly Thermometer 40' above. Cut wood at the door
Wind Southerly and rainy in forenoon. South Westerly in afternoon. And at night N.W. and growing cold. In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting. no work
Wind North West Went to Bar Harbor on the Packet to buy lumber to finish rooms in my house cannot get it time enough to get back to day therefore shall have to stay all night
Wind West South West got lumber down to the Packet at Bar Harbor and came home at 1 P.M.
Wind Easterly. commenced to finish chambers in house to let. working to day alone
Wind Easterly in forenoon. South West in afternoon. staid at home
Wind South West very fine. working with all my might to get rooms finished expect they will be occupied by tomorrow afternoon
Wind South West and afternoon rain. finishing rooms in my house
Wind North and fine March weather. Lawyer Mc Tier and family moved into my house. In evening went to the Lodge. No work
Wind South East Thermometer 12' above. Work in the home
Wind South East drizzling rain in forenoon & thick with fog in afternoon Work in the house
NorthWest. and very fine. work about home
Wind North East in morning and Southerly in the afternoon
Wind North West Went to Bar Harbor in packet after more lumber for my house. but as the packet does not stop at Bar Harbor I leave my order and go home Wind South West
Wind Easterly and clear. Went to Bar Harbor In Sch Filora Temple and got the lumber that I left the order for yesterday back home at noon the packet did not go over
Wind North West in forenoon & South West in afternoon. Work at home finishing my parlor. In evening went to Masonic Lodge
Wind Southerly fresh and overcast At night rainy Work all day on the inside of my house
Wind North West work all day on the inside of my house
Wind South Finished laying floor in my parlor. Having one carpenter at work with me all the time
Wind NorthWest fresh staid at home
Wind South East at noon commenced snowing and snowed at dark Finished work on my house for the present. have laid out in the last two weeks about $100
Wind South and rainy hauled coal. at 10 PM thunder storm

Wind North West a perfect gale. with the Ther 37' Work about home In evening went to the Stated meeting of Winter Harbor Lodge F. &. A.M. Elected Elmer Hawnd for the degrees. Took out an accident Policy A. E. Commers Agt
Wind North hauled coal
Wind South East and overcast. at night thick with snow
Wind South & wet the snow that came yesterday all melted. and the old snow all gone
Wind North West and fine. Geul Banks hauled from my wharf where she has been laying all winter
Calm in morning In forenoon the wind breezed up Southerly Although it is fine weather and warm during the day time. It froze so hard this morning as to bear up a loaded coal cart
Calm untill 10 AM where breezed up Southerly Went to the Lower Harbor floundering and claming Little Schr Sea Nymph hauled from my wharf where she has been hauled up for the winter
Wind Southerly Getting ready to work on Grindstone Point. Took outside windows of house In evening went to the Lodge Elmer A Hama Took the E.A.D.

Wind Southerly and afternoon rainy Worked on Grindstone Neck untill 5 P.M. When went home to supper. and went on board Str Creedmoor. Went to Bar Harbor with 19 others to visit the Lodge F & AM. they worked the 3d degree after which the banquet was served At 10.30 P.M. went on board the boat for home. but it was to much of a storm to come and it was decided to wait untill day light. apart of the passengers remained on board
Wind South West and some fog. Left Bar Harbor for Winter Harbor in Str Creedmoore at 5 A.M. arriving at 4 AM. Got my breakfast at home. and went on Grindstone Neck to work. worked all day on Hotel
location: Bar Harbor, Winter Harbor, Grindstone Neck

journal_entry: Wind Easterly My hired man tending out on the coal business. And I am working on Grindstone Neck for Chas. Grever on Hotel. At 3 PM it began to snow and at 6 PM when we went home it was a tough snow storm
Wind North West and pleasant. but the ground covered with snow
Calm in morning and fine. at noon the wind breezed up South East Work all day on Hotel Grindstone Neck for C E Grover

Wind North East and snowed all day. and may be called a tough snow storm. although it melts as fast as it comes Work all day on Grindstone Neck on Hotel. but it is very disagreeable meltings on most all day
Wind North West. very heavy. Work all day for C.E. Grover on Hotel. In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic Meeting Elmer A. Hamma Passed to the degree of a F.C.
Wind North West in forenoon and South West in the afternoon. pleasant Work all day on Hotel Grindstone Inn
Wind South East. heavy. and a rain storm. Work all day on the inside of Hotel Grindstone Inn
Wind Easterly and wet. Work all day on Hotel Repairing
Wind Southerly and fine. In afternoon took a ride over to Prospect Harbor to see Alfred Hamilton
Wind North West good breeze and very fine weather Shingling on the roof of the Hotel on Grindstone Neck

Wind Southerly and rainy. Work all day on Grindstone Inn. at Grindstone Neck In evening went to Masonic Hall getting ready for a beg time for tomorrow night we expect from 30 to 40 here from Bar Harbor

Wind North Good Breeze. and fine weather Work all day on Grindstone Inn. In evening went to Masonic Hall. about 30 masons were over from Bar Harbor. Elmer A. Hanma took the M.M.D. After Lodge more than 70 Masons went to Sirene Cottage to lunch. Then the Creedmore went back to Bar Harbor. Calm evening
Calm in morning then the wind breezed up Southerly at night showers Work all day on Grindstone Inn
Wind South South West and partially foggy. Work all day for C E Grover repairing Grindstone Inn
Wind Westerly worked on half day on Grindstone Neck. In afternoon bought suit of clothes getting ready to go to Portland monday to attend the Gd. Lodge being chosen proxy at the last stated meeting
Wind NorthWest and fine weather

Wind Easterly & moderate. Took Str. Creedmoor at 7 AM went to Bar Harbor and at 8 A.M. Took Ferry boat and went to Mt. Desert Ferry then took the train for Portland to visit the Gd. Lodge F. &. A.M. got dinner in Bangor. pulled out of Bangor at 1.40 P.M. when we got to Pittsfield it was raining moderately Also when we arrived in Portland at 6 oclock P.M. On arriving in Portland took the house car and went to the Chase House to stop. but being over crowded. Lodged at the Chadwick house. they being near to gather
Wind Easterly and drizzling rain in Portland. At 9 A.M. attended the Grand Lodge being a delegate from Winter Harbor Lodge as Proxy
Wind Easterly and rainy. Attended the G. d. Lodge and witnessed the work in the First degree This degree was worked by Deering Lodge

Wind Easterly heavy And the rain fall like a young flood. Attended the Gd. Lodge in forenoon Left Portland for home at 1.30 P.M. rain pouring down in torrents. 15 miles East of Portland the train stoped one hour to have the road repaired. the heavy rain caused washouts. Arrived at Bar Harbor 10.45 standard time. and went to Hotel Brewer. no rain at that time
Wind Southerly Arrived home from Portland via Bar Harbor at noon on Str. Creedmoor. Afternoon put up window shaed. also getting ready to work on Grindstone Neck

Wind Northerly and fine weather in the forenoon. but in the afternoon the wind Southerly and a little showery. Work all day on Grindstone Neck on Casino. near the clubhouse for C E Grover the contractor
Wind North North East but fine weather
Wind Northerly in the morning. then Southerly. Work all day on Grindstone Neck
Wind Northerly untill noon. Afternoon Southerly Work all day on Grindstone Neck
Wind Southerly Work all day on Casino on Grindstone Neck In evening went to Hall to a Masonic Meeting. and Charles P. Robertson took the E.A.D.
Wind Southerly and fine weather Work all day Casino Grindstone Neck
Wind Southerly and fine weather work all day on Casino near the Club house
Wind Easterly worked on half day on Casino At noon it rained hard and could not work in the afternoon
Wind Easterly thick with fog and showery
Wind Easterly little wet & overcast and moderate. Work all day on Casino
Wind Easterly overcast. with some fog but very moderate Work all day on Casino shingling

Wind South East. fresh. and heavy rain all day. Could not workout of door. therefore did not go to work on the Casino. This is our Lodge night. but on account of the Storm. no Candidate. therefore no Lodge
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. In the afternoon fine rain Work all day on Casino
Wind Northerly a little while in the morning. then Southerly Work all day on Casino on Grindstone Neck
Wind North West in forenoon South West in afternoon. Work all day on Casino. beautiful weather It is now been a week since we have had clean weather. the ground to wet to farm
Wind Southerly and very fine
Wind North West in forenoon South West in afternoon. Work in forenoon on Casino In afternoon farming for myself and planted two rows peas
Wind Southerly and at night thick with fog Work all day on Casino
Wind Southerly in morning and at 10 AM the wind North West and very fine. Work all day for C.E. Grover on Casino In evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting and Chas P Robertson took the F.C.D.
Wind Southerly fresh and rough Work all day on Grindstone Neck
Wind North North West very fresh. Work the day on Grindstone Point And after supper planted one peck of potatoes

Wind Southerly Work all day for M. C. E. Grover on Grindstone Neck doing Carpenter Work In evening went to B.E. Tracys Law office as a spectator to the trial of Offord Denton V.S. Daniel Mc Kay & Elmer Torvy for assault and battery. B E Tracy for complain out & K.S. Mactur for the Respondents & J.R. Hammond Trial Justice. The verdict of Hammond in me Kays case withheld for the present and Torvy fined $4 and costs
Wind Southerly but good weather
Wind Northerly in the morning and at 10 am the wind Southerly Work all day for C.E. Grover
Wind Southerly work all day for C E Grover on Casino at the Club house
Wind Southerly work all day are Grindstone Neck for C.E. Grover doing carpenter work on Casino In Evening went to the hall and Charles P. Hanma took the M.M.D.
Wind Southerly Work all day for C E Drover on Casino
Wind Southerly Work all day on Casino
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. Went to Bar Harbor on Str Creedmoore hired 50 at the Bank for 30 days. home at noon. In afternoon collecting money from some that I have sold coal to
Wind South and thick with fog and rain with thunder & lightning
weather_condition_am: thick with fog, rain, thunder, lightning

journal_entry: Wind Southerly and thick with fog. Finshed planting peas. and my farming is done At night showery the lumber all used up at the Casino therefore no more work there untill some arrives
Wind Southerly and thick. Waiting for C.E. Grovers lumber to come so I can go to work again on the Casino
About calm all day. sometimes a little wind one way then another Took the top of my wharf of to repair it
Wind Southerly The lumber came to day for the Casino on Grindstone Neck but to late for me to go to work to day
Wind South Work alll day for C E Grover in Casino
Wind South and thick with fog Work all day for C E Grover on Casino. near Club House on Grindstone Neck
Wind Southerly Went to Prospect with my wife for a ride
Wind Easterly and thick with fog. Work all day on Casino. At 1 P.M. a very heavy thunder shower
Wind Easterly and thick with fog work all day on Casino
Wind Southerly and thick with fog Work on my wharf rebuilding one part of it by making it higher and wider
Wind South in the morning and thick with fog during the day the wind hauled around Easterly and clear Work all day on my wharf Reed bill of Laded Sch L. Halmay 175 tons coal Water turned on by Co.
Wind Southerly moderate & very pleasant. Work all day on my wharf
Wind Easterly and in the afternoon a little rainy Work all day on my wharf and finished the rebuilding of it
Wind Southerly Went on Grindstone Neck for a ride
Wind W.N.W. work at the coal shed screeming coal to fill orders
Wind N.N.W. Went to Bar Harbor & back on Str Silver Star to get some coal shovels J.D. Harrington's remains were bought home on the boat. He died of Paralasis on the road away from home
Very moderate Southerly wind Went to J D Harringtons funeral in the afternoon from Capt J B Fross's house

Wind Southerly and very moderate Hauled some gravel around the house to make a driveway At night the Sch L Halway arrived into the Harbor with 175 tons coal for me. but on account of the tide the vessel did not get into the wharf
Wind Easterly and a little rainy all day. Worked most of the day discharging Sch. L. Holway with coal. she got into the wharf in the morning
Wind Easterly and rain all the forenoon. did not work discharging the vessel with coal untill in the afternoon after the rain held up
Wind South Easterly and rain all the forenoon No rain in afternoon
Very moderate Easterly and overcast Finished Discharging Sch L. Holway of 175 tons coal at 4 oclock P.M. Settled freight and the vessel ready for Sea.
Wind Easterly and fine. hocing potatoes and hauling coal
Wind Southerly have all the business can attend to hauling coal with two horses and a hired man
Wind Southerly and in the morning thick with fog very buisy all day hauling wood and coal
Wind Southerly and thick with fog Went to West Bay with team and bought a cargo of wood
Wind Southerly and bad weather being thick business is now good having a good sale for wood and coal
Wind Southerly and thick with fog except over the land it was partly burned up
Wind South and thick. looked after the wood and coal business in the forenoon. In the afternoon went to Bar Harbor to do a little business back at night
Celebration day Tremendious heavy rain all the forenoon with the wind S.E. No amusements going on here at Winter Harbor. Prospect Harbor has it all this year
Wind Southerly Went to West Bay to see about a vessel to get me a load of wood and dont think I can get one this week
Wind South and thick with fog and heavy rain in morning but in the afternoon cleared of fine. hauling wood all day
Wind Westerly in forenoon and Southerly in afternoon hoed my potatoes but my team at work at my coal & wood business
Calm in the morning at 9 AM the wind breezed up Southerly fresh. Went to Bar Harbor on Str Silver Star back at noon Mowed a little around the house
Wind Westerly all day fresh
Wind South West. Went to Bar Harbor and hired at the First National Bank $350 back at noon
Wind Westerly and very fine. hauling wood and coal also painted the dining room floor
Wind SouthWest Thermometer 75' Sent Check to N.Y. for a cargo of coal for $729.20 mowed some hay and done some painting on the house and painted the dining room floor the second coat
Wind Easterly and rainy
Wind Easterly and fine weather Schr Seth Ny man Capt Fred Rice Arrived at my wharf at noon with 40 1/4 cords hard wood for me. In the afternoon commenced to discharge. at night wind Southerly
Wind SouthWest work all day hauling wood from my wharf. as it came out of the Sch. Seith Nyman
Wind SouthWest and fine
Wind Southerly. Finished discharging Cargo of wood at noon and filling orders
Wind Southerly team hauling wood and coal all day My hired man done to night
Wind North West. Thermometer 84' at noon Hoed peas untill 9 AM. then hauled wood and coal
Wind North West in forenoon South West in afternoon Hauling coal
