Wind South West thermometer 84' In afternoon heavy shower Working at my business
Wind Southerly and hot. Afternoon a little showery Coaled up the steamboats. Hotel &c
South West Wind afternoon heavy thunder shower after supper. went to Prospect Harbor to see A Hamilton
Wind Northerly and would be very fine hay weather if it were not for the little showers in the afternoon. Lafayette commenced work in the morning
Wind Southerly and good weather hauled wood & coal. and done some haying Picked our first green peas for the season
Wind South Easterly and thick with fog In afternoon heavy thunder showers
Wind West North West very fresh and fine Mowed some hay
Wind North West and very fine hay weather Worked haying most all day Hauled but little hay
Wind South East and overcast. and in the afternoon a rain storm Hauled coal untill it rained hard
Wind North West In forenoon and fine. Afternoon wind Southerly
Wind Southerly hauled in some hay. also hauled away some wood and coal Rud had my fireplace tiled
Wind South East and thick fog having all the orders I can fill
Wind North West and fine hay weather but do not mow any as I have to many other things to attend to in my business
Wind Southerly Finished mowing hay and painted Cookroom & parlor floors
Wind Southerly and fresh. Finished my haying and hauled coal
Wind South Easterly afternoon rainy. Painted parlor floor and worked about the coal shed
Wind Southerly Thermometer 80' about home
Wind South and most of the day thick with fog. In the evening thunder & rain Went to Bar Harbor to have a set of double reins made
Wind S.S. East Thermometer 76' having all the orders I can fill
Wind Southerly Thermometer 80' Work around the coal shed
Wind Southerly and very moderate Thermometer 90 building driveway around the door
Wind Southerly and hot untill 6 PM when the fog began to come in
Wind South East and a heavy rain from three oclock in the morning untill 11 am. with continuous thunder & lightning
Wind Easterly and heavy rain untill 8 am when the wind came North and cleared up. In afternoon went to Prospect to see A Hamilton. at night calm
Wind Northerly Fresh & Fine About home
Wind Northerly Went to the Unitarian conference both in the fore and afternoon
Wind Northerly and fine. Then showery with the wind Easterly and at night calm. Went to Bar Harbor to take care of a note at the Bank of $150 back at night
Wind all around the compass but on the whole, a very fair day Work at the coal shed
Wind Easterly moderate and some overcast. Work at the coal shed
Wind South East. and moderate. Went to Bar Harbor and back on star
Wind Southerly and somewhat overcast. Staid at home
Wind Easterly and rainstorm but the team kept buisy
Wind Westerly in forenoon and looks like a clear of In afternoon the wind Southerly very buisy all of with coal
Wind Southerly and rough. about home
Wind South East very fresh. rough with fog & rain
Wind West South West fresh in forenoon In afternoon went to bar Harbor on Str Silver Star
Wind moderate North West Thermometer 85' hauling wood and coal
Wind Southerly staid about home
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. Not feeling well do not go out of door
Wind South a gale afternoon heavy rain. Painted floor up stairs. am feeling better than yesterday
Wind Westerly and fair weather work at my business

Wind North West good breeze. Went to Bar Harbor on Str Silver Star. took Str Golden Rod went to N E Harbor. after a sloop yacht for C.F. Kingsley arriving at noon. Afternoon bent sails and at 6 PM. am all ready for home Stoped at Reuben Laurveys House
Wind Northerly in the morning at N.E. Harbor started for home in sloop yacht boat at 8.30 AM. wind went Easterly thence Southerly Arrived home at 12.30 P.M.
Wind South Easterly very moderate and fine rain. done a little work on the boat I came from N.E. Harbor in yesterday. but my team at work hauling wood and coal
Wind South West very fresh. Sch zelia arrived in the Lower Harbor at day light with coal. In the afternoon got vessel part way up the Harbor. but to much wind to get to the wharf
Wind North West. Got Sch zeila into the wharf in the morning and commenced to discharge cargo of coal
Wind Southerly and moderate work most all day discharging coal. but one acct of showers in the afternoon did not work all day

Wind North West and very fine Finished discharging cargo of coal at 11 AM. and the vessel sailed at 4 PM for Calais. In evening went went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting the first time we have meet sine June
Wind South South East over cast and in the afternoon rainy filling orders
Wind North West and fresh. working at my business
Wind Westerly in forenoon and South West in afternoon work about the coal shed
Very moderate wind all around the compass and looking like rain. Went to the Marsh to Uncle C.Y. Bunkers House. in forenoon and stoped untill after supper. then came home my wife accompanied me
Wind North and very fine collecting debts
Wind Southerly Collecting some bills. In evening went to Prospect Harbor to transact some business with Dr Ch C Larrabee
Wind South West. Went to Bar Harbor on Str Silver Star to take up a note $200 at the Bank came home in the afternoon
Wind Southerly and very fine weather collecting bills most of the day, as the people are going away
Wind South South West Some people mostly home to Pa from Grindstone Neck and I put in the day looking after the finances
Wind South a Gale afternoon Showery. Work about the coal shed
Wind S.S.W. most of the day overcast
Wind South West and fine. had some gravel hauled to the house to build a drive way Collecting money for wood & coal as they came Grindstone Neck
Wind Southerly and fine weather Work in attic on tank to keep it from freezing during the winter
Wind North West. fresh and fine work at the coal shed. In evening went to a Masonic meeting No work
Wind North West fresh building a drive way to the house
Calm in morning at noon wind breezed up Southerly Went to Bar Harbor to the Bank to make a deposit back at noon. At 3 PM rainy
Wind Southerly Work at the coal shed. In evening went to the boarding house kept by Mrs. Rhod a Crane to the reception of James Broderic after the wedding
Wind North West and very fine. Went to West Gouldsboro for a ride
Wind Easterly shiped 20 tons coal to Bar Harbor to W.A. Milliken a Coal dealer

Wind North West Went to Bar Harbor to make a deposit and hired $250. to pay for cargo of coal shiped one month ago. In afternoon went to a Municipal Coat. Roscoe Conman VS S L Gerrish for disterbance in the night. Verdict for Plantiff. fine 2.00 & costs
Nearly calm all day. but a very light air part of the time Easterly In evening went to the Masonic Hall Fired V Joy took the E.A.D. fine weather
Wind Easterly and rainy. doing nothing
Wind Easterly and rain all day. Painted backstairs
Wind North East. fresh. hauling coal and wood
Wind Easterly a gale and a power of rain
Wind North East very fresh. getting ready to fo gunning
Wind Easterly and fresh. Went gunning with Llewellyn & Andrew Pendleton at the ledges got 27 coots
Wind N.N. East. moderate. Team buisy all day delivering coal In evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting Stated. devoted to business
Wind Northerly in forenoon Went to Bar Harbor in Sloop boat afternoon calm and the Silver Star towed the sloop boat home
Wind Northerly and fine Went to Egg Rock gunning. no birds at all. home at noon. Water turned of by the Grindstone Neck Water Co. Afternoon wind Southerly
Wind South East and at night rainy
Wind Southerly In afternoon went to Birch Harbor
Wind Southerly and very fresh. At night a heavy thunder shower. and the wind came of North West
Wind North West. blowing a gale all day. Work around the house
Wind North West moderate. In evening went to the Masonic Hall Fired V Joy took the F C Degree
Wind Southerly and very fine weather Went to Turtle Island Ledges gunning but it being so rough did not stop. My daughter taken sick, and in the afternoon sent for the Doctor
Wind Southerly Not much doing in the wood and coal business. commence to repair a dora for my sllf
Wind South East blowing a gale with heavy rain
Wind South West blowing a gale
Wind North West. my daughter being sick do not go away to work
Wind South West and fine weather Working on my dora at my sisters shop
Wind Westerly work about home having a man hired to drive my coal coat In evening went to the Masonic Hall. and Fired V. Joy took the M.M.D.
Wind South Easterly but good weather work about home
Wind Southerly working on my dora putting near plank on
Wind South East with a little fog painted my dora and bought fish Cranberries and other things for the winter
Wind Easterly and fine weather My daughter is getting better
Wind South East with fog. Went to Bar Harbor on Str Golden Rod and back
Wind South East fresh breeze and heavy rain. Painted my dora
Thick with fog and calm in morning At noon the wind Northerly and cleared up In evening went to the Masonic Hall no work
Wind North East. but fine Work about home

Wind moderate South Easterly Went to Bar Harbor via Sullivan to join the Chapter and took the first degree in the Chapter which is the Mark Master for the fourth degree in the York Rite Masonry staid at Bar Harbor
Wind South East and a heavy storm Came home from Bar Harbor in Str Golden Rod. where I have been to take a degree in the Chapter
Wind South West. My Birth day 48 yrs
Wind North West Finished work on my dora. and all ready to begin on another
Wind Northerly and Westerly. work on boats repairing
Wind South South West and fine after 10 A.M. but from day light to 8 AM it was calm with the Thermometer 22' above In evening went to Masonic Hall to a stated meeting
Wind South South West Put my dora in the water that I have been repairing
Wind Southerly working on the beach to make a place to haul up the Str Madora
A very light air of wind Easterly At dark rainy My team working for Spencer Ervin W.W. Summer Agt
Light air North East and fine. Went to So. Gouldsboro

At 3 AM Calm. At 3.30 AM Started gunning. light wind South West. At day light on the Southern head of Egg rock. the wind blowing so hard we could not row a boat against it and came home at 8 AM to much wind and sea to shoot birds
Wind Northerly and fine. Hauling coal most of the day
Wind South West work at the coal shed. In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting
Wind North East fresh. hauled C F Kingsleys boat up for the winter
Wind North East. The Thermometer down to freezing point in shade built a coop for ducks
Wind Southerly and Westerly. Bought 10 ducks of Jared Crane at Birch Harbor
Wind Southerly Went to Birch Harbor and got 10 ducks I bought. Took steam Lighter Medora up to my dock for the winter
Wind South West. Went to Bar Harbor and back on Str Golden Rod
Wind Southerly Put out side windows on house and banked the house on two sides So far this year it has only been cold enough two nights to make ice
Wind Southerly and a rain storm At night Wind N.W with snow squalls In evening went to the Masonic Hall to a Lodge meeting
Wind West North West blowing a gale hauling coal

Wind West South West Went to Bar Harbor on Str Silver Star at noon to take more degrees in the Chapter of Masonry and in the evening took the Past Masters and Most Excelent Masters degree will have to go once more to take the Royal Arch Degree
Wind West South West. Came home from Bar Harbor at noon where I have been to take degree in the Chapter
Wind Westerly. Staid at home
Wind North East Discharged 20 tons coal from a vessel at the Back wharf coal for C C Hutchings
Wind South West work about home
Wind South East a gale and heavy rain all day. On acct of the heavy rain no Lodge meets to night
Wind South West. Went to West Gouldsboro to pay the taxes on the Burrill Property for the year 1892
Wind North West and breezy. In evening went to the new Hall owned by P H Joy called Globe Hall to a pie sociable accompanied by my wife
Wind Westerly and fresh. Team hauling coal In evening went to Masonic Hall to rehearse the 3d
Wind West North West very fresh. Thermometer 22' in morning above
Calm in morning Thermometer 10' above Went to Sullivan to carry my Daughter to A L Chase the Dentist where she had 5 teeth extracted using gas. Came home arriving at dark. Wind South
Wind South East a gale and rain

Wind West South West fresh. Put outside windows on Jennie Kingsleys house. In afternoon went to Birch Harbor and hired Fred Rice to go to Milbridge after a load of Wood & hay in his vessel In evening went to the Hall to a Lodge meeting
Wind Westerly and fine weather This being Thanksgiving and by a special invitation myself wife & daughter went to Capt T H Smallidges to dinner
Wind Southerly and in the afternoon wet. hauled wood and coal. In evening it rained and later it snowed the first for the season
Wind North West. Thermometer at 20 and the ground covered with snow. some sleighs are out to day. Dr. Larrabee from Prospect Harbor. a distance of over four miles came with a sleigh
Wind North East Thermometer 8' above and snowing. In afternoon Thermometer went up. and at 8 P.M. Thermometer 48' above and raining hard Wind hauled out south
Wind North sleet stoorm untill 9 AM then clear weather
Wind North East Thermometer 8' above At 3 P.M. Thermometer 15 above and commenced snowing and snowed hard untill after bed time Hauled coal in forenoon
Wind Westerly and fine weather. good sledding or sleighing Went to South Gouldsboro In afternoon for a Sleigh ride. In evening went to the Masonic Hall to a stated meeting
Wind South West. hauled coal all day fine weather

Wind Southerly and very fine. Went to Went to Sullivan with my team. and taking the Str Sebona to Bar Harbor. In the evening while at Bar Harbor. took the Royal Arch degree in the Chapter of Masons after which we went to Frank Shermans to a Banquet. then listened to speeches from various people midnight found us just ready to leave the dining room four over Hotels and our stoping places
Wind Southerly and pleasant. Left Bar Harbor at 8 oclock went to Sullivan. Traded horses with Joseph Cleaves of Steuben and went home. In evening raining
Wind Southerly and snow melting all day. At night Wind Westerly. Went to West Bay for a ride
Wind West North West blowing a hurry cane Thermometer 10' above hauled some coal
Wind East North East Thermometer from 3' to 8' above and snowing
Wind Northerly Thermometer about zero all day. In evening went to Masonic Hall Hod H. Hanson passed to a F.C.
Wind North Thermometer 6' below zero and at noon at zero and at night some below. Hauling coal all day. And reed check from J A Peters for $100 being the amt drove me from F.P Sargent
North East. wind Thermometer 16' above at noon and snowing. work about the coal shed
Wind Easterly and wet. At 10 A.M. the wind South and raining hard At night killed a horse I got of Joseph Cleaves a week ago
Calm in morning Thermometer at 40 At night wind Westerly and began to freeze a little
Wind Northerly The Thermometer 10' above Went to Bar Harbor on Str Golden Rod with business at the Bank came home at night
Calm or nearly so all day with rain and snow Thermometer 32' It is now neither wheeling or sleighing although both may be seen

Wind North West Thermometer 20' above Select men met to lay out a road leading from Mrs. J.S.Kingsleys to land of G.L.I. Co land on Grindstone Neck. In evening went to Masonic Hall and Chas. F. Kingsley took the E.A.D.
Wind South West very fresh. Str. M. & M. hauled into my wharf for the Winter
Wind North North East hauled some wood Thermometer 10' above
Wind Southerly snow in the morning then turned to rain Went to Bar Harbor on Str. Silver Star and back at noon at night cleared up wind North West and moderate
Wind South East Thermometer 40 degrees This being so near Christmas, myself wife & daughter were Invited to my sisters to a Turkey diner It is good sleighing but not much snow mostly Ice

Wind South Easterly Thermometer 38' above overcast and in the afternoon a little rainy. Christmas. Through Winter Harbor it is better with wheels than runners. but after getting out runners goes best. The Mail goes on runners
Wind North and the Thermometer from 20 above down to 10'
Wind Northerly Thermometer 22' above In forenoon setting with C G Brown In Evening went to Masonic Hall and C F Kingsley took the F.C.D.
Wind Southerly and in the afternoon rain. In evening had a party at our house of 16 people who staid untill midnight
Nearly calm all day When there was any wind it was out and showery
Wind Northerly Went to Bar Harbor on Str Golden Rod in regard to leasing on buying the Str M & M back at night In evening snowing
Wind North East and moderate snow storm all day
Wind South West and fine. New Year. In the afternoon went to Prospect for a sleigh ride
Wind Southerly and warm. hauled wood and coal

Wind South West. Thermometer 38' and the snow melts fast. In the evening went to the Masonic Hall to the anual meeting and Elected Officers W H Parker Wm C C Larrabee S.W. J B Myrick J.W B E Tracy Treasurer F.R Bunker Sec. A J Guptill S D Ira N Workman JD
Wind South West The Thermometer 40' above Went to Sullivan with my team and took the Ferry boat to Bar Harbor. Came back to Sullivan in the afternoon and took my team home. arriving about dark
Calm in morning Ther 40 at noon wind N. East and snow. In evening went to Masonic Hall and Charles F. Kingsley was raised to a M.M.
Wind North East in the forenoon with some snow. In the afternoon wind North moderate and fine. In evening went to Masonic Hall and Hall H. Hanson took the M.M.D.
Wind Easterly in the morning with light snow At noon the wind North and clear. Thermometer 20' above
Wind North West and fresh. Thermometer 15' above good sleighing hauling wood and coal all day
Wind West North West. quite fresh Thermometer 12' above

Wind North East and Thermometer 10' below zero in the morning and at zero at noon In evening I publicly Installed the Officers of Winter Harbor Lodge F. & AM at the Church And being a past master I was qualified
Wind Easterly and snow in morning Ther. zero At 10 AM wind S.E. Thermometer 36' above

Wind North West and blowing a perfect gale all day The Thermometer went from 30' above in the morning to 4' below at night In the forenoon took my wife in Sleigh down on Grindstone Neck visiting where we staid to dinner to Capt Summers going home in afternoon if it was dreadful bitter
Wind North West gale Thermometer from zero in morning to 10' above at night
Wind North West and moderate. Thermometer 20' above
Wind Southerly and very fine. Team all day out delivering wood and coal. In evening went to Globe Hall to a rehearsal for an exhibition which is going to be place on the stage. by Local talent
Wind North East and a little rainy. Went to Steam boat wharf at Sullivan after Mr. S L Kingsley and brought him to South Gouldsboro. At night cleared up
Wind North East & clean Ther 10' above zero. Went to West Gouldsboro to carry S L Kingsley In evening went to the Lodge F. & AM

Calm in morning. Thermometer 10' above At 9 am Ther. 18' above Went to John Smalls with my wife visiting At noon wind Southerly Got home at dark. In evening went to Globe Hall to Rehearsal for an exhibition

Rain in the morning At 8 AM cleared up wind North North West At 10.30 A.M. went to Mt Desert Ferry with Capt W.H. Sargent in the Pinky Sch. Julia Ann and got a car load of hay Shiped from Bangor to me. Got home at 7 PM
Wind Easterly and fine Thermometer 20 above zero Work all day on hay that arrived yesterday taking care of it and delivering it
Wind Easterly and very pleasant. at night calm and overcast

Wind West North West moderate and pleasant Went to Bar Harbor on Sail packter the pink stern Schr Julia Ann and back in the afternoon accompanied by my wifes Brother his wife & daughter In the evening went to a rehearsal for an Exhibition
Wind Easterly and very moderate and pleasant. Going around making calls with my Borther in law Proctor Smallidge. In the evening went into the Dancing School with Maud Smallidge
Wind South Easterly and overcast and in the afternoon rain. Adam Pendleton burried. In evening to much storm for the Lodge to meet
Wind North West. fresh Thermometer 20 degrees Hauled coal In evening went to the rehearsal
Wind Easterly and in the morning Thermometer at zero At night overcast
Wind Easterly and snowing Thermometer 20' above
Wind Northerly coal fine. Took a ride over to Birch Harbor and Bunker's Harbor
Wind Easterly, went to Bar Harbor on sail packet and back by land. In evening went to Globe Hall to a rehearsal of Exhibition
Wind North East a perfect gale and snow and rain all day At night the wind hauled northerly but kept on snowing At 4 oclock AM one of the squares of glass in my house blew in size 24 x 39 in
Wind Westerly and fine. Work most all day shoveling snow In the evening went to Masonic Hall to the Lodge

Wind very moderate Easterly. Left home at 8 oclock AM for Machias drove my horse to West Gouldsboro and left him. Got in sleigh with J.E. Bunker jr & S.L. Kingsley got dinner at Cherryfield at 2 P.M. arriving at Machias at 9.30 P.M. The object of this trip is to Charter or buy the Str. M. & M if it  can be done at a reasonable price After getting out supper at Machias it is too late to do any business Although the owners are here from Penbroke we stop at Chanes Hotel

Wind Northerly and fine weather. in Machias We leave Machias at 2 P.M. without accomplishing the object for which we came. We think his offer 4000 for the sale of the Str M & M to much. and we offer him 500 for the use of the boat 10 months on charter. which he M. E. H. Spraguce refuses to do untill he consults the other owners and agrees to telegraph to Bar Harbor tomorrow At dark we stop at the Crandon House at Columbia Falls

Calm in morning with the Thermometer 4' below zero when we leave Columbia Falls at 4 oclock A.M. for home. arriving at Cherryfield at 6 AM when the air grew warmer and the wind came Southerly. arrived at West Gouldsboro at 9.30 AM and left the double team we went with and took my own for home arrived at 11 oclock. and receiving message do not wish to charter
Wind Easterly and overcast. with a little snow

Wind North East Thermometer 3' below in the morning Went to Bar Harbor and back on the sail packet. afternoon warmer In evening went to the Masonic Hall and was Officialy visited by the DDGM A.O.Cross Exemplified the work 3d

Calm all the forenoon and at sunrise the Thermometer 13' below the lowest for the winter so far. At noon Wind S.W. and thermometer 30 degrees above. In evening went to Globe Hall to a rehearsal for an Exhibition called "atonement"
Wind South West very fresh. Work about home In evening went to Masonic Hall a stated meeting of the Lodge
Wind SouthWest and very fine. sold boat to H.E. Tracy for $700 In evening went Globe Hall to a rehearsal
Wind Easterly and overcast. Went to Prospect to look at some wood then went to Washington Stevens house to see the owner of it. In evening Rehearsed the play Atonement
Wind Easterly fresh Went to Bar Harbor via Sullivan. snowing a little. came back in the afternoon snowing hard. In evening went to a rehearsal
Wind Westerly a fine day with the Thermometer ranging from 28 degrees to 32' Wind freshening at night Staid about home
Wind Northerly clear and fine untill night when the wind hauled Easterly and began to grow cold. Getting ready to play Atonement In evening went to another rehearsal

Wind Easterly and the Thermometer 4' below zero. blowing fresh and snowing. Fixing wig and false whiskers and costumes for the play. This play Atonement we put on the stage here 170 yrs. ago this month. myself taking the same parts as them now
Wind very moderate South West. the wind chilly. In evening went to a rehearsal and is supposed to be the last one befor the play
Wind Easterly and blocking snow all day. Do not play to night as expected on acct. of the snow storm
Wind North West Thermometer 10' above In evening played Atonement although we have had several rehearsals this is the first time for 17 years we have played it
Wind North West in the morning Thermometer 3' below zero. At noon wind Southerly. Ther 25 above. In evening Played Atonement Plenty of snow every where now
Wind South South West and rain untill the middle of the afternoon when the wind hauled Westerly. Thermometer 40' above. snow settles fast
Wind Southerly pleasant Thermometer 42' above Baled out Str. M. & M. lying to my wharf In evening went to Globe Hall and played Atonement At midnight where we came home. raining
Wind Westerly and fine weather Played Atonement at Globe Hall which finished our playing here
Wind North West Thermometer 28' above Went to Globe Hall & got my costumes & such things as I had to use at the Exhibition

Wind Southerly and fine weather. Except Early in the morning it was calm and then the thermometer was at zero. Worked in forenoon on board Str M & M getting the ice out of the Engine room. In afternoon went to Prospect and bought tickets for the Exhibition to be used next Saturday

Wind North West and moderate but the wind increased and so did the cold Left home in the morning for Bar Harbor via Sullivan Worked three degrees on one candidate in the afternoon. and the Royaal Arch in the Evening at Bar Harbor

Wind North West Thermometer 16' below zero. Left Bar Harbor for home at 8 AM on Str "Sebenou" before reaching Sullivan ice had made so thick the boat could hardly get through it. We arrived home at noon At night Ther. 6' below This has been the coldest & most blustering day for the winter
Wind North West in the morning & the Thermometer 10' below zero. In afternoon Wind West South West. Ther. at night 18' above

Wind Easterly and Ther. from 22' down to 15' above. Went to Sullivan with my horse and went to Bar Harbor and back to Sullivan on Str Sebanoa then home. gave not for $1000 pay able in 4 months to raise money toward buying Str M & M
Light air North East in forenoon and Southerly in the afternoon. Thermometer 20' above. Work around Str M & M

Wind Southerly Thermometer 35' above zero Went to West Bay Via West Gouldsboro and back Via Prospect Harbor looking after the interests of the comming town meeting Reed news from the law court in regard to the road from Mrs. Kingsleys to Grindstone Neck It is in favor Mrs. Kingsay the Co. has no right to the road
location: West Bay, West Gouldsboro, Prospect Harbor

journal_entry: Wind very light Southerly with more or less fog the Sleighing now is fast breaking up Went to Prospect Harbor. Most all of this day is used for Electioning purposes to defeat Art. 18 in town warrant to see if the town will vote to layout a road from Mrs. Kingsleys house to land of Co on Grindstone Point

Calm and thick with fog all day. Thermometer 40' above Went to West Gouldsboro & back Electioneering acct. of Town meeting monday And went back to West Gouldsboro in afternoon to see J.E. Bunker & S.L. Kingsley as they return from Machias where they have been to see about purchasing the Str. M & M

Wind North North East with the thermometer 38' above zero. Work all day Electioneering for the Town meeting next monday Trying to get article 18 in town warrant Indefenitely postponed relating to the road by Mrs. Kingsleys to Gouldsboro land Imp. Co. land
Calm in the morning Thermometer 36' above Middle forenoon wind South West. In afternoon went to the Lower Harbor to see some people

Fine moderate Southerly wind. Went to Town meeting on wheels some went on runners. but I don't which is the best. Elected the same old board of Selectman but I got left on the road question and the Town voted to accept the road from Mrs. Kingsleys to Cos line
Started to go over to Bar Harbor in the Packet but on acct of it being calm came back. At 10 AM wind breezed up Southerly. Thermometer 48' at noon In afternoon went to Prospect Harbor very mudy
Wind South West overcast in the morning. later cleared up Ther. 44' above Went to West Gouldsboro to get a certified copy of our last town warrant. In evening went to Masonic Hall to a stated meeting
Wind Southerly hauled wood in forenoon. got a Bbl floor home. and did work around the house
Wind North East in forenoon & South West in afternoon Commenced to work a little on Sr. M & M although I have not got any claim on her I am working for Mr S L Kingsley by his request Thermometer 40

Calm untill night when a little wind Southerly came up. Overcast day. The Thermometer 38 work some on Str. M & M. At noon  G.W. Tracy comes with a telephone message from Mr Sprague. putting him in change of the boat but I recognize no ship keeper. Sent by M. Sprague I keep on at my work on board holding my authority from S.L. Kingsley keeping the keys & papers
Wind Southerly and overcast with the thermometer 32' a ship keeper still on board Str M & M

Wind South in the morn and North West in the afternoon Ther. 42' Doing some work on Str M & M. although the ship keeper G W Tracy forbids any work being done no attention is paid to him as I do not recognize him as a shipkeeper
Wind North East and out around Southerly fine weather Thermometer 48' above The dificulty abt. the Str. M & M has been settled and the bogues ship keeper gone ashore
Wind Easterly and overcast. Went to Bar Harbor on yacht after an Enginner. afternoon snow and later cleared up. Not getting and Engineer to go on Str M & M. stop over at Bar Harbor

Wind North West and very fine weather Telephoned to Ellsworth for an Engineer. but not successful Get a temporary one at Bar Harbor to come to Winter Harbor and connect the machinery and work a little while in the afternoon
Wind Southerly and rain in forenoon. Afternoon cleared up and wind North West. Hauled water for Str M & M and the Engineer working on her pipes
Wind North North West and very fine. Worked on Str M & M all the forenoon In the afternoon got the boat ready and most to the halibut hole to try the machinery and it works well
Wind Southerly and overcast. Went to South Goulsboro and back in forenoon In the afternoon a little rainy

Wind South West and thick with fog. Went to Bar Harbor in Str. M & M and coaled up. Afternoon clear. Made a landing at South Gouldsboro & West Gouldsboro back to Bar Harbor and home at night. blowing fresh
location: Bar Harbor, South Gouldsboro, West Gouldsboro

journal_entry: Wind N.N.W. and very fine. Started the Str. M & M on her first regular trips between Winter Harbor, Bar Harbor and West Gouldsboro making two trips around as follows Winter Harbor Bar Harbor West Gouldsboro Bar Harbor Winter Harbor Bar Harbor West Gouldsboro Bar Harbor and Winter Harbor crossing the bay 8 times and making 8 landings
location: Winter Harbor, Bar Harbor, West Gouldsboro

journal_entry: Calm in morning. afternoon Wind South Went the rounds as yesterday with the Str. M & M
Wind North North West and very fresh breeze run Str. boat M & M as I did yesterday the first day she run

Wind South East and thick with snow Having charge of Str M & M run her to Bar Harbor West Gouldsboro Bar Harbor and back to Winter Harbor at noon blowing fresh making one round trip in forenoon do not run this afternoon
location: Bar Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: Wind North West and fine. run all day on our usual time of Str. M & M
Wind Southerly and afternoon a little rainy boat lying at the Steam boat wharf At Winter Harbor

Wind North fresh and fine but coal Went to Bar Harbor West Gouldsboro Bar Harbor Winter Harbor Bar Harbor West Gouldsboro Bar Harbor and back to Winter Harbor in Str M & M which is my work for every day
location: Bar Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: Wind North West very heavy gale. but I made my two round trips from Winter Harbor to Bar Harbor and West Gouldsboro
location: Winter Harbor, Bar Harbor, West Gouldsboro

journal_entry: Wind westerly fresh and cold. running Str. M & M on her route
Wind South West very fresh. making my landings
Wind West North West a gale In making my afternoon trip at West Gouldsboro It was so rough I could not make my landing to put off freight
Wind Easterly in forenoon and Southerly in afternoon have done the best to day of any day since I started Str M & M
Wind North West and clear after 9 oclock AM. In afternoon went to Prospect with my horse and after getting back at dark got J J Roberts to take care of my horse
Wind North North West very fresh. but made my regular round trips to Bar Harbor and West Gouldsboro on Str M. & M.
Wind North West. good breeze but made my regular trips around. The painters begins to paint the cabbin while the boat is running
Wind South fresh and at noon commenced rainy and afternoon quite a big storm went my trips in Str M. & M. In evening went to the Lodge started meeting. B F Summer Praxy
Light air of wind South West and thick with fog. Got Str. Golden Rod to run the Str. M & M. trips while we have cabin painted wheel fixed &ce  I go to the round trips with Capt H.E. Tracy
About calm all day Str. M & M on her regular trips afternoon rainy
Wind moderate N.E. and very fine continue the Route
Wind Easterly afternoon fresh & thick with snow boat at wharf Winter Harbor
Wind North East and a tough snow storm and gale of wind
Wind East North East fresh and clear running Str M & M over the Bay. In evening went to Globe Hall to a traveling Exhibition consisting of sleight of hand and lecture
Wind East heavy on Str M & M
Wind Easterly and disagreable weather but do manage to get around on our trips
Wind still continues to hold Easterly and does not stem to be inclined to let up. it is very rough at the steam boat wharf at Bar Harbor and hard to make a landing

Wind Easterly and very fresh. We do not make all our regular trips to day as we are taking in an extra lot of coal and water to take the Str. M. & M. to Bangor. where she is going for a new shaft and a general overhauling at the machine shop
Wind East North East. Started for Bangor on Str. M & M via Bar Harbor at 6 A.M. after calling at Bar Harbor left there at 7.30 AM arriving in Bangor at 6 P.M.
Wind North East. Went from Bangor to Brewer in Str M. & M. and took her wheel off. preparatory to an over hauling with here machinery. also took her shaft out
Wind Easterly in Brewer Took the Engine apart and took it to the Machine shop in Bangor
Wind Southerly. Work in machine shop in Bangor
Wind South East Work in machine shop
Wind Easterly and at night thick with fog. Work on board Str M. & M. in Bangor
Wind South East and looks as though it was thick with fog out side, but it is fine weather here in Bangor. At 7 P.M. take the train for Bar Harbor bound home and arrived at Bar Harbor at 9.40 PM
Wind Easterly thick with fog and showery. Finding the Golden Rod at Bar Harbor. I take passage on board and come home arriving at noon
Moderate Southerly wind. Went to Bangor on 8 oclock train from from Bar Harbor. arriving at 11.30 AM and went on board of Str. M. & M.
Wind Southerly and thick with fog put. Shaft in Str. M & M and towed from Brewer to Bangor Went to the Lodge of F. & AM in evening
Wind Northerly and fine Work on machinery at the shop in Bangor
Wind Up River Still at Bangor. Babbitted the bearings of shaft in Bangor. and commenced putting machinery back in to Boat. Myself being only a helper
Wind Up River. helping put the machinery back into Str M. & M. from the shop in Bangor
Wind Southerly and fine weather The work completed on Str. M. & M. at 7 P.M. in Bangor. And we leave at that time for Winter Harbor and run down the River to Hampden and haul up for the night
Wind North Easterly in the morning. Left Hampden in the morning for home on Str. M. & M. at 4 oclock at $11.30 am passed Bass Harbor Head and took the wind South West arrived home at 2 P.M.

Moderate Southerly wind. Went to Bar Harbor on Str M. & M. Bought a ticket for Portland and left Bar Harbor at 8 got dinner at Bangor and supper in Portland at the Chase House My business is to attend the Grand Lodge of Masons and also to get a larger steam boat license
local_place: Chase House, Grand Lodge of Masons

journal_entry: Wind very moderate South Westerly and fine Visited the Grand Lodge during the day and the Grand Chapter in the evening at Portland, Me
Wind Southerly in Portland and in the afternoon more westerly Attended the session of the Grand Lodge In evening went to A. Gospel meeting

Wind South West In forenoon went to the Custom House in Portland and was examined for a raise of License. Then went to the Gd. Lodge was appointed & Installed D.D.G.M for the 21 Dic In the afternoon took the train for home arriving at Bar Harbor at 9.30 P.M. where I shall stop over night
Wind Southerly went on board Str M & M at 8 AM in Bar Harbor went to West Gouldsboro and home
Wind Southerly. Went our regulat trips and landings with Str M. & M. at night thick with fog Str. Golden Rod broke her propeller and we take her passengers home on our last trip
Wind Southerly rainy and thick with fog
Wind South and thick with fog Run the Str Lur to So. Gouldsboro as the Golden Rod is broke down we also run over regular trips

Wind South West and rainy in forenoon. fine in afternoon. The Str M & M run to day as follows Winter Harbor to So. Gouldsboro So. Gouldsboro to Bar Harbor Bar Harbor to W Gouldsboro W. Gouldsboro to Bar Harbor Bar Harbor to Lamoine Lamoine to Bar Harbor Bar Harbor to Winter Harbor Winter Harbor to Bar Harbor Bar Harbor to W Gouldsboro West Gouldsboro to Bar Harbor Bar Harbor to Winter Harbor
location: Winter Harbor, South Gouldsboro, Bar Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Lamoine

journal_entry: Calm in morning Later wind breezed up Westerly. run boat on our trips also to S. Gouldsboro. At night bought propeller over for Str. Golden Rod which will probably place her on the Route tomorrow In evening went to Al Martz show at Winter Harbor
Wind North and a very fine day. The Str Golden Rod is again on her Route. and we drop out So. Gouldsboro and run on our old Route
Wind South and rough overcast with a little rain run steamer
Wind Southerly and fine. Run on regular trips in Frenchmans Bay
Wind North West fresh and very fine day
Wind North West fresh. This has been a good day for me although it has been rough. have had a lot of passengers Lafayette Bickford goes on wages
Wind North North West. very fine and a very dull day. Got my horse home that has been let to J.J. Roberts. since Apr 1st
Wind North West in forenoon. Southerly in afternoon. Got Chas. Davis to run Str. M & M. and I staid at home to day farming also took off Out side windows
WInd Southerly and fine all day not having a man to run the Str. M. & M. I leave my farming and go on regular trips
Wind South East moderate and fine in forenoon. but rainy in afternoon a very dull day for business on a Steam boat in Frenchmans Bay
Wind Easterly and rainy. business very dull running Steam boat. Went to Lamoine on the noon trip after coal and got 3 tons
Wind Easterly and fine. Went to South Gouldsboro for a ride
Wind Easterly in the forenoon and southerly in the afternoon. but fine all day. This is a very good day for business
Wind North West and very fine in forenoon South West in the afternoon On Str M & M
Wind Southerly fresh and fine. Making regular trips
Wind Easterly and overcast. In making trips took on board at West Gouldsboro. and Execurtion party of abt. 50 people. brought them to Winter Harbor and returned them to West Gouldsboro via Bar Harbor
Wind Easterly rainy and some fog. No business to day. What I call an off day
Wind East North East and heavy rain. Got Chas Davis to run the boat in the afternoon and I Staid at home
Nearly calm all day. Except in the afternoon when there was a little wind Southerly In afternoon went to So. Gouldsboro with my horse for a ride
Wind Southerly and a little fog out side. but clear up the bay. A little business to day as it is monday
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. Running Str M & M
Wind Easterly and a power of rain in forenoon But in the afternoon cleared up and I got Chas Davis to run the boat and I staid at home and finished planting peas. At night went to Prospect & Back
Wind Southerly good weather but rough outside. but very smooth between Bar Harbor and West Gouldsboro which is apart of my Route
Wind South Easterly and fog in forenoon and overcast all day. See no trouble in getting around with boat when it is thick
Wind Southerly. After running the steam boat I planted beans squash and cucumbers. ground very wet
Wind Southerly Hauled Str M & M on beach to clear the lobster pot warps from the wheel. hauled of at night
Wind Southerly This being monday it is one of the best days in the week for business
Wind South West and overcast Doing a little business with Str

Wind Westerly in forenoon and Southerly in afternoon Run all day on my Route Towed two vessels at Bar Harbor Str. Golden Rod gone home to Bangor. In evening went to Masonic Hall to a regular meeting. reed petition from the buten at Sullivan asking our lodge for permit to have a lodge at Sullivan Lodge called of

Wind moderate South Easterly and a little rain. The new Steamer "Ruth" makes her first regular trip to day between Winter Harbor & Bar Harbor I now have her to contend with instead of Str. Golden Rod as in the past. Golden Rod went home yesterday to Bangor
Wind Southerly Running Str M. & M.
Wind Southerly and quite a fine day In running from West Gouldsboro to Bar Harbor found Rodicks dump scow with mast broken two men on her. took her in tow to Bar Harbor
Wind Southerly In afternoon went to Prospect Harbor for a ride

Wind variable and very unsteady. Thunder & lightning in forenoon also showery which continued at internals during the day and evening Such days as these are injurious to most all business and especially running a steam boat in the bay
Wind Easterly wet and cold. so much so it is necessary to have the heat turned into the Pilot house of Str. M & M for comfort. Sewed cucumber seed in morning and finished all my farming for this year
Wind Southerly and a very fine day Run Str M & M In evening went to So. Gouldsboro for a ride an to exersise my horse

Calm in morning and the remainder of the day South West. Wind After making regular trips and running all day Left home for Bar Harbor at 6.30 P.M. took onboard on execution party and left Bar Harbor at 8 P.M. for Sullivan arriving at 9.10 This party goes to the ball at West Sullivan At midnight Str. M & M at wharf in Sullivan

Calm. Left Sullivan for Bar Harbor at 1.40 A.M. with the party we brought up last evening and which I am paid $15 for doing the work Arrived at Bar Harbor at 3 AM After the party got ashore left for Winter Harbor arriving at 4 A.M. Left Winter Harbor for our regular trips at 6.15 AM with the wind Southerly

Wind moderate Southerly Str. Ruth being gone away for repairs the Str. Creedmore takes her place and as she is a very poor substitute it gives us pretty good business. At night heavy thunder & lightning with rain

Calm with a little fog in the morning. Went to Bar Harbor to tow a big stone scow from Ball porcupine to Bar Harbor then had the fires hauled out. after cooling the furnace had the tubes cleaned out in the boiler Heavy thunder & lightning with rain in afternoon arrived home at 5.30 P.M.

Moderate South Easterly wind with some fog a very good day for business. The Str. Ruth came from Rockland this afternoon Expect she will go on the route tomorrow One of our valves spring breaks near So. Gouldsboro but we get home with of

WInd South and thick with fog. Chartered Str. Creedmore to run for Str. M. & M. sent Engineer to Bangor with a valve to have it done and I go to Bar Harbor and back in forenoon on Creedmoor. Afternoon had my horse shoed. got lumber home for a hen hoarses

Wind Southerly and thick with fog Str Creedmore running in place of Str M & M In afternoon our Engineer came back from Bangor and without the valve for which he went to have repaired myself building her pen in forenoon and went on Creedmoor in afternoon
Wind Southerly and thick with fog all day. run Str. M. & M. all day with one engine and also towed scor form Bar Harbor to the Ball porcupine. at night the valve came by express from Bangor
Wind Southerly and thick with fog The valve of Str. M & M being put in place she is on the route with the broken valve repaired
Winds variable. all around the compass Thermometer at 85 in Shade This being a fine day I had an Execution party from West Gouldsboro to Bar Harbor
Wind Easterly and fine. Staid about home
WInd Southerly doing a good business to day with freight

Wind Southerly and thick in the morning and clear inmiddle of the day. While making a landing at Bar Harbor at abt 5 PM Saw the little Sch. Sea Fran run ashore. and went to her assistance. hauled her of from the rocke. and towed her into Bar Harbor with out any rudder thick with fog at night

Wind Southerly and thick with fog at Winter Harbor but clear between Bar Harbor and West Gouldsboro. Brought the remains of Ned Perry from Bar Harbor to Winter Harbor on the noon trip. He died in Boston and is brought home for burial. Towed Sch. Sea Fan from anchorage Bar Harbor to Hanons Wharf
location: Winter Harbor, Bar Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Boston

journal_entry: Southerly and thick except the middle of the day
Wind South South West and thick with fog Brought the first Rusticators to West Gouldsboro for the season
Wind Southerly fog very dence in the morning and at night but clear in the middle of the day
Wind South West. made a trip to bar Harbor A little fog in the morn later all clear Thermometer 85 at Bar Harbor
Wind Southerly and at night the fog came in. Running the Str. M. & M.

Wind South South East. thick with fog and a part of the day toward noon. heavy rain. This has been a very good day for us as people are going home to stop untill after the 4th Also some Tourists came for West Gouldsboro

Wind South West. thick with fog in the morning then cleared up. This is celebration day. particularly at Winter Harbor I see but little of it as I run the Str. M. & M. between Winter Harbor Bar Harbor & West Gouldsboro two round trips as usual
location: Winter Harbor, Bar Harbor, West Gouldsboro

journal_entry: Wind North West clear and fine a very beautiful day and a lot of business as people are going back to there work after spending the 4th at home
WInd North West up the Bay where I go and South West out side. but clear and fine some travel but no so much as yesterday
Wind Southerly and fine weather except a little fog abt. 10 oclock. This has been one of my best day so far for the Str. M. & M. thirty people came on board at West Gouldsboro on an excurtion
Wind North West in forenoon and S.W. in afternoon a very fine day had the Str M & M partialy painted outside as there is no chance to paint while the boat is running
Wind Southerly and very fine. Running Str M & M
Wind South and thick with fog. Our intention is to to make a trip to Sullivan touching at Mt. Desert Ferry but owing to the fog and not having any courses. dare not run
Wind Southerly and thick with fog We have argued to run to Sullivan. but like yesterday dare not go
Wind South West & clear. run to Bar Harbor Mt. Desert Ferry & also on the old route. Between Bar Harbor West Gouldsboro & Winter Harbor
location: Bar Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: Wind Southerly and a little showery in forenoon. but very fine in afternoon. Am now making trips to Mt Desert Ferry and Sullivan

Wind South and fine. my landings to day have been from Winter Harbor to Bar Harbor. Mt Desert Ferry Sullivan Mt Desert Ferry Bar Harbor West Gouldsboro Bar Harbor. Winter Harbor Bar Harbor West Gouldsboro Bar Harbor So Gouldsboro and back to Winter Harbor
location: Winter Harbor, Bar Harbor, Sullivan, West Gouldsboro, South Gouldsboro

journal_entry: Wind Southerly and fine Went to Bar Harbor Mt Desert Ferry Sullivan Mt Desert Fery & Bar Harbor hauled out the fine and commenced to put some new tubes in the boiler and to expand others. at midnight ready to set smoke stack
Wind South West and fine Went the roands to sullivan as per agreement
Wind Southerly and thick with fog as could be untill 9 AM. the rest of the day very fine running on Route
Wind Southerly and fine untill night when the fog came in Took the mail from Mt Desert Ferry to Sullivan. then run on the old Route
Wind South East. moderate and thick with fog. untill night
Calm and hot Thermometer at Bar Harbor where I make landings stand at 96' at night very light air of wind Southerly

Nearly Calm and quite hot. our trips now are as follows From Winter Harbor to Bar Harbor then to Mt. Desert Ferry and Sullivan back to the Ferry and Bar Harbor. thence over to West Gouldsboro and back to Bar Harbor then over to Winter Harbor in the forenoon. Afternoon from Winter Harbor to Bar Harbor Thence to West Gouldsboro. Bar Harbor and back to Winter Harbor
location: Winter Harbor, Bar Harbor, Sullivan, West Gouldsboro

journal_entry: Wind North East in morning with a little rain. there cleared up very fine afternoon wind South Went to Bar Harbor West Gouldsboro. Bar Harbor & Lamoine. waited for the Sunday papers to arrive. Went back to Bar Harbor West Gouldsboro back to Bar Harbor and home I commenced this day for a regular expedition and hired to bring papers from Lamoine to Bar Harbor
Wind Southerly and very fine day. Run our regular week day trips
Wind Easterly and in forenoon fine but in the afternoon fresh breeze and heavy rain. but nothing to hinder our making regular trips over the bay
Calm in morning Then a light air of wind Southerly but a very fine day This day I took the Express matter from Mt. Desert Ferry to Sullivan. after a full description of my person had been made
Southerly wind Took the mail and Express & passengers &c. from Mt. Desert Ferry to Sullivan after which made regular trips across the bay
Wind Southerly and very fine Steam boating
Wind South West fresh breeze. And at Bar Harbor Ther 94'
Very moderate N.W. wind. but hot. Ther. at Bar Harbor 100 in shade Run Str to day according to Schedule time. of Sunday To Lamoine after Boston journals and various points across the Bay

Wind Southerly and fine weather Run Boat as did all last week as follows Winter Harbor to Bar Harbor Thence to Mt. Desert Ferry to Sullivan and back to Mt. Desert Ferry and Bar Harbor. Thence to West Gouldsboro back to Bar Harbor and over to Winter Harbor. From Winter Harbor to Bar Harbor then to West Gouldsboro and back to Bar Harbor then home The first trip from from Bar Harbor to Sullivan is for the Maine Central R.R. Co
location: Winter Harbor, Bar Harbor, Sullivan, West Gouldsboro, Sullivan

journal_entry: Light air Northerly in forenoon and Southerly in afternoon
Wind light N.W. in forenoon and South East in afternoon and very fine weather continue to run as per schedule time
Northerly wind first part of the day. then Southerly running the Str. M. & M. and getting her ready for Inspection

Wind Southerly made trip for M. C R R in morning then went to Bar Harbor and layed the rem of the day waiting for the Inspectors to come to Inspect the boat. her license Expires to day but he did not come Afternoon heavy rain. went home at night
Wind Southerly and the forenoon thick with fog. Made regular trips
Fine Westerly winds. Run the regular excurtion as have done the two Sundries before

Wind Westerly made regular trips during the day and in the evening went from Bar Harbor to Mt. Desert Ferry to wait for a special train to take people to Bar Harbor train arrived at 11.15 P.M. took the passengers and landed them at Bar Harbor at midnight We shall stop here the rem of the night
Calm in the morning started from Bar Harbor at 5.45 AM for Mt Desert Ferry arriving at the usual time for the train The made the West Gouldsboro and Winter Harbor trip
location: Bar Harbor, West Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: Calm and somewhat overcast in the morning In afternoon clear Wind Southerly. In evening the fog came in thick
Wind South Easterly thick with fog and showery in forenoon Afternoon wind North Run Str. M & M on her regular trips as I did yesterday rain in afternoon with the wind N.
Calm in morning and very fine. Running boat as usual. The inspectors are expected tomorrow and we go to Bar Harbor to lay to night to be ready

Light air of wind west. Fixed up in the morning at Bar Harbor. and went to Mt. Desert Ferry after the Custom House papers then back to Bar Harbor hauled the fires out. and let the furnace cool donen At 8 AM the Inspectors came on board. found the boilder leaking and could not get what Pressure we wanted. and Inspectors went East on Str. Frank Jones . We sent to Bangor for a Boiler makes who got here in the evening ready to go to work tomorrow. I went home from Bar Harbor on Steam Launch Gouldsboro

Wind Southerly. Went to Bar Harbor in sail boat in morning. The boiles maker was at work expanding the tubes in the Str M & Ms Boiler getting it ready for Inspection when the Inspectors get here on the Str. Frank Jones tomorrow At night the tubes are all expanded and think we can get all the pressure on the Boiler we want

Wind South Easterly & a little rain. The Inspectors arrived on the Str. Frank Jones Tested the boiler and found it to be light and all right and alow us as much steam as she has had in the past 100 lbs to the squall inch. and now the Str M & M is Inspected for another year. It takes the rest of the day to get things to gather and we do not get ready to go home in Steamer untill dark arriving in evening
Wind Southerly and thick with fog apart of the day. and some times the sun would shine Commence on the route again this morning with Str. M & M
Wind Moderate South West and partialy foggy. Run boat as usual
Calm and thick with fog in morning at 7 am cleared up wind breezed up fresh North North West
weather_condition_am: thick with fog, cleared up, fresh

journal_entry: Wind North West all day and very fine weather. After running the Str M & M all day Went to Bar Harbor in evening took an Excurtion party out in the evening and went to Sorrento Mt Desert Ferry and over the bay. at midnight between Bar Harbor & Lamoine

Wind Southerly and somewhat overcast but no storm untill late in the evening This day like all others begins at midnight. but the beginning of this one finds me cruising overt the Bay with an Excurtion party on board which we landed at Bar Harbor at 2 am. and began our daily trips as usual

Very moderate Southerly wind and fine weather Made the Sunday Excurtion as usual by going to Bar Harbor from Winter Harbor. then to West Gouldsboro then back to Bar Harbor The leave Bar Harbor for Lamoine at 12.30 PM. Then return to Bar Harbor and go to West Gouldsboro and back to Bar Harbor then to Winter Harbor
location: Bar Harbor, Winter Harbor, Gouldsboro, Lamoine, West Gouldsboro

journal_entry: Wind Southerly and at 10 oclock am thick with fog
Wind North North West. a very heavy blow so much so it is difficult to make a landing at West Gouldsboro

Wind North West fresh and fine. Got A. J. Gerrish to run Str. M & M. to day as there is to be a meeting of the County Commissioners to assess damage by the taking of land for a road by the Town across lot of C.F. Kingsley After the hearing no decision made known
Wind Southerly and very smoky. but we consider it very good weather. I have charge of the Str. M & M again to day
Calm untill 10 am when wind breezed up moderate Southerly After running our trips over the Bay we went to Lamoine to carry a party and came back to Bar Harbor to stop over the night
Calm in morning and smoky Started from Bar Harbor for the Ferry at the usual time. As I do all the other trips
Wind North West and very fine weather Made our sunday Excurtion trips to West Gouldsboro and Lamoine
Calm in forenoon Afternoon wind breezed up. Southerly

Wind South South East and thick with fog all the forenoon. after making all the trips during the day that we have been in the habit of making. went to Lamoine and back to Bar Harbor and hauled up for the night
Wind Northerly and fine. made a trip to South Gouldsboro to carry a boy by the name of Rich who got his leg broken by the fall of the stone derick on the Bald Porcupine
Wind Southerly and fine weather. Tomorrow we shall leave out West Gouldsboro and take in Lamoine running to Lamoine on the West Gouldsboro time
Wind South West after making the Sullivan trip instead of going to West Gouldsboro as usual. I went to Lamoine intending to run to Lamoine Tuesdays & Fridays instead of West Gouldsboro on those days

Wind Southerly Went to Mt Desert Ferry as usual. stoped off and A. G. Gerrish run the boat for me while I stoped to make my monthly report for august. came back to Bar Harbor from the Ferry at noon and took charge of Str M & M in afternoon Lafayette done work
Wind North West and very fine made our regular sunday Excurtion to West Gouldsboro and Lamoine from Winter Harbor
Wind North West in morning and a little frosty. afternoon warmer with the wind southerly Tomorrow will be our day to go to Lamoine
Wind Southerly and fine weather. After running our mail trip we went to Lamoine. Instead of West Gouldsboro as that will be our days for Lamoine
Wind Westerly and very smoky Run boat all day. In evening went to the Masonic Hall to a stated meeting Very heavy thunder and lightning with rain
Calm in morning later the wind breezed up Westerly Run boat as usual
Wind Southerly after making the mail trip run to Lamoine leaving out West Gouldsboro Horace Joy came on pay
Wind Southerly and very good weather
Wind Southerly and fine. Run our usual sunday trips to Lamoine West Gouldsboro &ce

Wind South South East and very thick with fog Went to Mt Desert Ferry and mail trip as usual. then got the Pilot of Str. Sebenou to take any place and went to the State Election. Came on board again at West Gouldsboro and went to Bar Harbor and hauled up for night being heavy rain
Wind North West. rough out side but very fine Run to Lamoine
Wind Westerly and very fine. this has been a very good day for our business. Run to West Gouldsboro
Wind Westerly and very fine. After running the day stoped to Bar Harbor for the night in order to to get a stove and other fixings
Wind South East and overcast. run to Lamoine Lewis Dix came on pay
Wind South West and good weather run boat all day
Wind Southerly with some fog. we do not make the Sunday Excurtion to day. At night discovered a leak in boiler and go to Bar Harbor to have it repaired
Wind very moderate South got the Creedmore to run for us while we do some work on Str M & M Boiler rain in forenoon with fog all day
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. Got Str Creedmore to run for us while the men is at work on our Steamers boilder trying to put a patch on she lying at the wharf in Bar Harbor
Wind South East quite thick with fog and rain Creedmoor running for Str M & M
Wind South East. heavy breeze and a power of rain. Creedmoor made our Sullivan trip then went to her mooring

Wind Southerly and moderate Creedmoor made the Sullivan trip. then got a Naphtra boat to run to Lamoine The patch was finished at 3.30 P.M. Steam got patch leaked & condemned. and a new one must be made
Wind moderate Southerly and fine. Str Creedmoor made the Sullivan trip. Another man from the machine shop came from Bangor and commenced to put patch on boiler

Wind Westerly fine Two men working all day on boiler Str. M & M lying at wharf in Bar Harbor at dark think the boiler all right. built fire. and things look quite favorable which is good for the blues

Wind North West. Left Bar Harbor in morning for Mt. Desert Ferry. Five minutes later the boiler leaking again Got to Mt Desert Ferry 20 minutes late took the mail Express and passengers. went to Sullivan took on board Passengers for the out. going train and arrived at the Ferry 30 minutes late. The boiler makes having gone to the Ferry bound to Bangor. Was at the Ferry when we got there. we stoped then from going home. and layed the boat up at the Ferry and the boiler maker worked all day and think she is tight

Wind North West. Started from Mt Desert Ferry When the train arrived at 6.40 AM Went to Sullivan and back to Ferry to connect with the 7.40 out going train then went to Bar Harbor Lamoine & Bar Harbor and find the boiler still leaks but still she runs. We go to Winter Harbor and back to Bar Harbor Then to Lamoine and Winter Harbor for the night
location: Sullivan, Bar Harbor, Lamoine, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: Wind North West in forenoon and South West in afternoon. After going the mail trip to Sullivan made two trips to West Gouldsboro and Winter Harbor
Wind Southerly and looking very much like a storm Running the boat as usual
Wind Southerly and the fog very thick Left Bar Harbor for Mt Desert Ferry at the usual time. but on acct. of the lateness of the train we omited on of the lamoine trips

Wind Westerly and a very fine day. Took quite a large Sunday School Excurtion party to West Gouldsboro from Bar Harbor and brought them back in the afternoon. Finished our contracts with the M.C.R.R. and make our last trip for them

Wind Easterly good breeze but overcast. Str M & M lying at Winter Harbor all day. In afternoon I went to West Gouldsboro by land and got my horse which has been in the pasture on Tafts point since July

Wind North East and overcast. Went to Mt. Desert Ferry to render an account of business done for the M.C.R.R. by Str. M. & M. for the month ending Scpt. 30 The went on the other trips as usual I stoped at Bar Harbor at night. the M. & M. &ch goes to Winter Harbor

Wind North and rough At 6 oclock AM went on board of Str. Sebenou at Bar Harbor and went to Rockland with Capt Dickenson. The Sebenou has gone for repairs. we arrived in Rockland at 11. 30 AM. and I staid in Rockland during the afternoon. Going on board Str Frank Jonse to stop the night

Wind very moderate South Easterly. Left Rockland at 6 AM in Str Frank Jones. arrived in Bar Harbor at 1 P.M. and went home on Str M. & M. In evening went to Masonic Hall to a Stated meeting. and Daniel G. Libby was Elected to take the degrees
Wind Southerly and rain & fog in morning Left home at 7 AM. for Bar Harbor in Str. M & M to go on her regular Route
Wind Southerly and some fog and rain. run boat
Wind South West. rough out side on Str M & M
Wind North West and very fine. Staid at home

Calm in morning but in afternoon the wind fresh Southerly This day we have no opposition in the Steamboat business the Str Ruth went to Boston yesterday for repairs. Therefore this has been a paying day for us
Wind South very fresh and heavy rain in forenoon Wind North West in afternoon. Run Str M & M two trips to Lamoine

Wind Easterly and in the afternoon it increased to a gale with a power of rain From West Gouldsboro we did not call to Bar Harbor on our way home as usual but got to Winter Harbor with all waste after leaving West Gouldsboro Str Mascot commences to day to run opposition to us
location: West Gouldsboro, Bar Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: Very fresh South West wind with a tremendious sea running. But the Str M & M run her trips so did the Str Mascot in direct opposition to us
Wind North West smooth and fine Andrew Pendleton run the boat in the afternoon and I staid at home
Wind Southerly fresh and rainy
Wind South Easterly Fresh in forenoon with rain. afternoon good weather. Went to Prospect Harbor for a ride
Calm in morning Later wind breezed up Southerly Run Str M & M
Wind North West. Fine. Run to Lamoine instead of W.G.
Wind Westerly and pleasant. After running all day we stoped at Bar Harbor to fix Engine. not to leave there for home untill midnight or after
Wind North West and in the forenoon heavy rain. run to West Gouldsboro the same as yesterday
Wind South West Run to Lamoine
Wind Southerly Run to West Gouldsboro
Moderate Southerly took Str M & M along side the wharf at Winter Harbor and cleaned her bottom
Moderate Southerly Run boat from Winter Harbor to Bar Harbor and West Gouldsboro two round trips
location: Winter Harbor, Bar Harbor, West Gouldsboro

journal_entry: Very light air of wind Easterly and overcast. Run boat from Winter Harbor to Bar Harbor and Lamoine two Round trips

Wind Easterly Run the boat as usual with the exception of calling to Egg Rock both comming and going to Bar Harbor The calling at the Rock was to take a doctor on and to take him back to Bar Harbor. Typhoid fever is on the Rock
Wind East South East and overcast. At night a little rainy. on my way from Bar Harbor to Winter Harbor called to Egg Rock to set a mand ashore supposed to be a Government official
location: Bar Harbor, Winter Harbor, Egg Rock

journal_entry: Wind Easterly and Rough. Run to Lamoine
Wind Northerly and pleasant. In running from Winter Harbor to Bar Harbor called to Egg Rock and got a Government official
location: Winter Harbor, Bar Harbor, Egg Rock

journal_entry: Wind Northerly and very fine. Staid at home
Wind Easterly fine My birthday 49 yrs. Run to West Gouldsboro two trips
Wind Easterly Run to Lamoine two trips
Wind South Easterly overcast. Afternoon rain. No lodge meets to night
Wind Westerly and fine weather. business dull on steam boat
Wind Westerly. At noon called to Egg Rock and took the doctor to Bar Harbor and made our trips as usual

Wind South and very fresh in forenoon And in the aftenoon it blew a gale and heavy rain. We left out the West Gouldsboro trip in the afternoon and on arriving at Winter Harbor There was no chance to lay at the wharf on account of vessel & Str boats and anchored me the Harbor alongside of Sch. Flora Temple
Wind Westerly and fine weather
Wind North East and very overcast looking very much like snow. Run to Bar Harbor and West Gouldsboro two round trips In evening began to snow. At 10 PM snowing hard

Wind North East and snowing hard all the forenoon do not run the steam boat to day In afternoon wind hauled northerly and cleared up I harnessed my horse to the sleigh and went to So Gouldsboro and Estimate 12 min of snow
Wind North West fresh. Run steam boat. My coal vessel arrived at mouth of Harbor at noon In evening went to Masonic meeting stated

Wind North West in morning. towed coal vessel into the Harbor. There went to Bar Harbor and staid all day to a Masonic convention. in evening worked the 3d degree Andrew Pendleton run the steam boat and came back to Bar Harbor in evening after me worth the wind Easterly & Spet of snow left Bar Harbor for home at 10 oclock PM
Wind North East and looking like snow Not water enough to get into the wharf this morning with coal vessel At night she came all right. Andrew Pendleton run the boat
Wind Easterly and a little rainy commenced discharging Sch Henry of coal. worked untill noon where it rained so hard quit work for the day
Wind South West and fine. Coaled up Str. M & M from my cargo just arrived
Wind North West. work all day discharging cargo of coal. Andrew Pendleton running the boat
Wind moderate Easterly Finished discharge of coal at noon and hauled vessel from the wharf at night rainy Str M & M cooked on of her piston nods at Lamoine

Wind Southerly Took Piston Rod of Str. M & M and went to Bangor to have straightened got it done at night but not ready to come home as I was sent by the Agt. J. E. Bunker who wants me to get on Engineer if possible

Wind South West. Took train in Bangor at 7 oclock AM got dinner at home and brought with me the Piston rod but the Engineer does not get her together at night. therefore will not run for tomorrow forenoon
Wind South West and very fresh Str. M. & M. not ready to go on her Route to day

Wind Westerly. Went to Bangor after an Engineer as I failed to find one when I was up Wednesday Walter Decker agreed to go in Str M & M as soon as the Golden Rod is done next week. At 7 oclock PM took the train to Ellsworth and stoped with Skiff Hooper
Wind Westerly and very light and fine weather Stopping at Ellsworth as I cannot get home to day Nor could not if I had kept on the train yesterday could not have got only to Bar Harbor
Wind Southerly and rain in forenoon Left Ellsworth at 8.20 AM for home via Bar Harbor At night Wind NW heavy

Wind North West very heavy and cold weather. The Thermometer at 10 degrees above zero boat made her regular Trip to Lamoine not withstanding the elements. She made two round trips. at night the wind moderated

Wind Southerly and heavy in forenoon with rain in the afternoon The Str M & M does not run to day as it is rough and the Engineer is sick In evening went to a masonic meeting and Horace H Sargent took the F.C. Degree
Wind North West and good weather Made regular trips over the Bay
Wind South South West very fresh. And in the afternoon hired the mascot to run for the Str. M & M as she is out of repair
Wind North and good weather Run regular trips all day and in the evening went back to Bar Harbor to carry carpenters working on Grindstone neck Calm in the evening while going over
Wind North East. fresh with snow squalls. Laid in Bar Harbor untill nearly 4 P.M. waiting for the carpenters to come over that are working on Grindstone Point arriving home at dark
Wind North East. fine day but freezing weather Run Str. M. & M.

Wind South fresh with rain in forenoon Started for Bangor via Sullivan with team to have some work done on the Engine of Str M & M the horses run and upset wagon. have myself and driver out. got another team and started again. Arrived at Sullivan at 11 AM finding the Ferry boat did not come to Sullivan on this trip Telephoned to Hancock for a team to meet me at the Ferry on Hancock side and drove to the Ferry and after crossing was met by the team telephoned for and made connection at Hancock arrived in Bangor at 1 PM and went to the Machias Stop
Wind North West. Got my Machias work done at 6 PM and at 7 PM Started for home. came as far as Hancock and stop over as I cannot get home
Thanksgiving Wind North West came home from Hancock in forenoon by land and in the afternoon commenced to put the machinery to gather or rather helped the Engineer
Wind North & cold made the trips in the M & M. but she does not run well

Wind all around the compass with snow and rain. Made the trip over the bay in forenoon. but in the afternoon only got to Bar Harbor & back to Winter Harbor. Sent check to New York to H B Rawson & Ce for $767.83 it being the amt of Invoice of cargo of coal of Sch Henry
Calm most all day at night Wind Westerly Hauled water & coal for Str M & M getting ready to go on the route

Wind North West quite fresh. Started for Bar Harbor via S. Gouldsboro after getting inside of yellow Island. a key came out of the connecting rod and boat drifted ashore on Jordans Island. Partialy repaired the damages. worked the Engine back and hauled the Str. afloat and went to So. Gouldsboro wharf. One hour later she was boarded by the U S. Martial towed to Winter Harbor and Libiled for debt. I was put in ship keeper towed by Str Mascot
location: Bar Harbor, South Gouldsboro, Winter Harbor, Jordans Island

journal_entry: Wind Westerly and fine work all day on board Str. M. & M. as ship keeper and putting things in order

Wind South West and very fine weather. Work all day on board Str M & M alongside of the wharf clearing up and putting things in order. In evening went to a stated masonic meeting Erivet Rice was elected

Wind West South West. quite fresh. Went to Bar Harbor on Schr Flora Temple. soon after we arrived I got a message from J. A. Peters Esq. Ellsworth to go there on business I went at ones by M. C. and came home in afternoon by land arriving about 8 oclock
Wind Northerly and fine day. making up accts of Str M. & M.
Wind North Easterly put out side windows on my house and out bush around
Wind Easterly overcast and looking like a storm Staid at home

Wind North East. Thermometer 10' above Went to Bar Harbor in sloop boat to see J.A. Peters Esq Preparatory to the meeting of the U S Count in Portland the 20 at which time the Creditors against the Str M & M will be heard

Very moderate Easterly also very fine but overcast. Done some painting on Str M & M as she is in my charge The remains of George Smallidge. brought home from Bar Harbor in first of the evening. he died this morning at 4 oclock in Bar Harbor as word came by telephone

Wind South East and a rain storm In afternoon went to the House of Capt Smallidge to a funeral of his Grandson. Geo. Smallidge or the son of Joseph & Annie Smallidge. In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic meeting Ernest S Rice took the E. A. Desser
Wind Westerly fresh Work most all day getting a remons trans signed against the dividing the town which is to set Winter Harbor and Grindstone neck of by a Tower of itself

Wind North West quite fresh. Started with my team to go to S.W. Harbor by request of Tremont Lodge No 77 to Install the officers drove to Sullivan went to Bar Harbor on Ferry boat with my team after arriving Put the team up and visited the Chapter at Bar Harbor of which I am a member
location: Sullivan, Bar Harbor, South West Harbor

journal_entry: Moderate Southerly and warm. Took my team from the Stable in Bar Harbor and drove to South West Harbor. and in the afternoon publicly Installed the Officers of Tremont Lodge. F. & A.M. At 6.30 PM the Banquet was sowed. Shall remain here over night

Southerly wind & warm. drove my horse from South West Harbor to Bar Harbor bare handed. a distance of 15 miles I shall be obliged to remain here untill tomorrow as the Ferry boat does not run to day and I cannot get home
Wind West South West. very warm. Put my horse on the Ferry boat at Bar Harbor and went to Sullivan and drove home. Mr. E. H. Sprague who holds a mortgage on Str M. & M. came from Bar Harbor with me
Wind North West very fresh and the Thermometer 12' above
Wind Southerly and very fine weather. hauling coal. In evening went to the Lodge F & AM and Ernest Rice took the F. C. Degree
Calm all day Working a little on a remonstrance to divide the town
Wind Southerly and stormy work about home all day on my accts

Wind South West in the morning. Started for Bar Harbor with Wilson Sargent in Sloop boat. Wind hauled N.W. Came home in the afternoon with the wind blowing fresh Stoped on board of Str. M & M at put up notices of the sale of Str. M & M at auction on Mt the 28 by order of master

Wind North West Thermometer at zero in the morning. Stoping most of the time on Str M & M as she is in my care being placed on board as ship keeper by the U.S. Marshal. and where I am not there I have a competant now in place
Wind North West early in the morning with Thermometer at zero. At noon wind Southerly and very chilly
Wind Southerly in the morning with rain. Afternoon clear with the wind North West In evening very fresh breeze
Wind North North West. The Thermometer 10' above In evening wind hauled North East. Went to Masonic Hall Ernest S. Rice took the M.M.D. after Lodge the weather looked very much like snow

Wind Easterly and blowing heavy Ther 18' above and snowing hard. In afternoon wind hauled out. the Thermometer went up and rain fell in torrents blowing a gale The Str M & M which is in my care alongside of the wharf lays all night

Wind Westerly and fine. snow all gone Str. M & M. sold at public auction for $718.00 So my care of her as keeper appointed by U.S. Marshal has terminated. She is now in my care for the winter bu the new owners
Wind North North East and snowing hard all day. Ther. 18' above
Wind South West but freezing all day

Wind Easterly and very moderate. Went to Bar Harbor in Packet to see J.A. Peters Esq to make arrangements abt. going to Portland to attend the Court of Admirality case of Str. M & M. came home at night

Wind North East and Thermometer 25 above 0' Getting my accts ready to go to Portland tomorrow to attend the court of Admirality In the case of Str M & M which I run during the last season and which has been Libel for debt

Wind North West good breeze with some snow on the ground. Left home at 7 AM for Portland Via Bar Harbor in Packet. Arriving in Bar Harbor in time, took the train boat at 10.30 got dinner in Bangor and arrived in Portland at 5.40 P.M. and went the Thompsons Boarding house at 335 Congress St. After tea went to City Hall to a lecture by A. Hastings in answer to Robt. Ingersoll who it is said lectures here four weeks ago where subject was The world without a Bible

Wind Westerly and fine Attended the Court of Admirality . Case of the Str. M. & M. holden in Portland before Judge Webb. My claim is for wages for 8 2/3 months at 5.00 per month but surely there was no money after the crew being paid my case is withdrawn and I go on the stand as a witness for the crew

Snow a little in forenoon in Portland at 11 AM cleared up wind North West. At 1.20 PM took the train for Bangor bound home. arrived in Bangor at 6.30 and stop for the night as there is no way. I can get home

Wind West North West. In Bangor Thermometer 6' below zero. At 7 AM took the train for home. came by the M. C. as far as Sullivan and came home at noon by land from Sullivan At sunset at home Thermometer 6' above 0
Wind Easterly and heavy snow storm Thermometer 8' above 0 during the forenoon In afternoon more moderate. and at night began to rain with the wind South

Wind Southerly and warm and a little rain all day by spells In evening went to the Masonic Hall. the Lodge was called to order then we went to the Baptist Church where I publicly Installed the officers. Winter Harbor Lodge after which a supper was served at Globe Hall
local_place: Masonic Hall, Lodge, Baptist Church, Globe Hall

journal_entry: Wind very light air North West and fine weather. Good sledding now Confered the Past Masters degree on James W. Wescott in the presence of G.W. Tracy and W H Parker J W Wescott was Installed Master last night

Wind Northerly very moderate. Wrote Articles of agreement about a decision of the property between Jabez Myreck and his wife Albina Mywick They have separated and he wants a driver and if she will not appear against him at covert. he gives her such a proportion of his property as I may think just she also agrees to the same
Wind Easterly Ther 10' above in the morning at dark Thermometer 30' above and snowing

Wind Southerly and rainy all day. Snow melting fast. Jabez Myrick and wife have agreed between them selves. about the division of their property and the agreement I wrote the ninth I burned as they have no use for it
Wind Easterly and partialy thick with fog In afternoon. Went to Prospect Harbor (with sleigh.) to see about a remonstrance to stop the division of town
Wind Easterly and rain all day. Snow about all gone
Wind Southerly work in forenoon getting signees on Remonstrance on dividing the town Afternoon went to West Gouldsboro
Wind very moderate North West and now good sleighing

Wind South Easterly and moderate. Hauled coal in forenoon Afternoon went to the Lower Harbor. after Signers on Remonstranes At night a little snow and rain mixed. In evening went to Masonic Hall. Exemplified the work I making the corrections as D D G M

Wind North West and very moderate. Went to Bar Harbor in Sail Packet. and in the evening went to Masonic Hall. the first degree was worked. My object of making this trip is to visit all the Lodges on the Island of Mt. Desert in my official capacity as D.D.G.M. Stop the night at Bar Harbor

Wind NorthWest and fine. Left Bar Harbor at 10 am by team for SouthWest Harbor. Stoped at L E Homes to dinner at Somesville and drove to S.W. Harbor in afternoon. In evening went to Masonic Hall and Instructed the Lodge in all the degrees stop the night at South West Harbor
location: Bar Harbor, South West Harbor, Somesville

journal_entry: Wind North North West Thermometer in morning here in South West Harbor 4' below zero. In afternoon went from S.W. Harbor to Somesville Ther 15' above.
