In evening went to Masonic Hall Exemplified the work in the M M D after which I installed the Officers of Mt Desert Lodge. Then went into the basement of Hall to a clam stew. toped through the night at Me. L E Holmes
local_place: Masonic Hall, Mt Desert Lodge, Hall

journal_entry: Wind Northerly and ther 4' above in Somesville. Took dinner with John J Somes and tea with L E Holmes and drove to Bar Harbor in evening and stop at the Hotel Desisle
Wind South Easterly and fine. Took the packet at noon from Bar Harbor for home arriving at 2.30 P.M.
Wind South East and a rain storm all day. cut up a forequarter of beef for myself it came from Portland sleighing spoiled
Wind South West fine soft day. In evening went to masonic Hall Exemplified the work in second degree
Wind South West some time during last night about one inch of light snow fell
Wind North West moderate but cold Thermometer most down to zero. hauled coal in afternoon

Wind South East. very fresh. Went to Bar Harbor in sloop boat going in less than an hour. After getting over. it snowed and blew a gale. Went to Sullivan in Sebenou. got team and came to West Gouldsboro where I stoped for the night raining very hard
location: Bar Harbor, Sullivan, Sebenou, West Gouldsboro

journal_entry: Wind Westerly Came from West Gouldsboro in forenoon
Wind Westerly fresh Thermometer 20 above. hauled coal and getting ready to go to Augusta to the Legislature to remonstrate against dividing the tower of Gouldsboro
Wind North East Started for Augusta Via Bar Harbor there took train Boat to Ferry thence to Augusta by rail. arriving in afternoon and stop at Hotel North

Wind Northerly and the Thermometer 10' below In forenoon went to the state House for pleasure. In afternoon went to the State House to remonstrate against the division of the Town of Gouldsboro Adjourned for supper after supper returned the State House was called on the stand to testify. At midnight L B Deasy Esq finished his argument for the remonstrants

12.02 AM Spencer of Gardmin commenced his argument for the Petitioners and finished at 12.40 AM and the question goes before the commitee and we there went to Hotel North Augusta. Left Augusta at 1.50 AM for Bangor arriving about 5 am stoped in Bangor all day. Wind very light Northerly and the Thermometer down to zero in Bangor

Wind South West and warm. Left Bangor at 7 am by train for Ellsworth where I remained untill after dinner. Then got team drove to Sargentville 27 miles crossed the Reach in a row boat to Deer Isle where I was met with a team and drove 4 miles to NorthWest Harbor to visit Marine Lodge as DDGM In evening went to Masonic Hall. Lodge opened on the F.C.D. passed two candidates and closed the Lodge An Oyster supper was served after which opened on the M.M.D. and the candidate was raised at precisely 12 oclock on midnight
location: Bangor, Ellsworth, Sargentville, NorthWest Harbor, Deer Isle

journal_entry: This day comes in at exactly 12 oclock when yesterday ended. and finds up at Masonic Hall. Deer Isle giving an explination of the raising to the candidate who was raised at midnight after giving Instructions the Lodge closed at 1.30 AM. Went to bed at 2 am and got up at 8 AM. at 10 began to snow. wind Southerly. At 2.30 P.M. Started for Grans Landing, arriving at 3.30 At 7 PM Officially visited Reliance Lodge, no degree worked, but the degrees was exemplified. After Lodge was out drove back to N.W. Harbor arriving about midnight and stoped to Mrs. Geo. Howards. It has snowed some to day but moderate but now cleared of Wind North

Wind Northerly Ther. 10' above Stoped last night at Deer Isle. Got a team and went to the wharf North Deer Isle, arriving at 10 AM. Got a man to set me across the Reach to Sargentville where I found Ex Deputy Sherrif L.F. Hooper waiting for me to take me to Ellsworth. he brought me here friday and has been waiting ever since. Left Sargentville at noon. Stoped at Blue hill to dinner arriving in Ellsworth in afternoon before going to Blue hill I appointed a meeting of Esoteric Lodge for monday night and one for Lygonia Lodge Wed. night next
location: Deer Isle, Sargentville, Ellsworth, Blue Hill

journal_entry: Wind North Easterly commenced snowing in forenoon and snowed all day called at the Office of the Ellsworth Euterpuede to see A.J. Frecent. Ellsworth Have not heard yet about the division of Gouldsboro In evening went to the Lodge as appointed and officially visited Esoteric
Wind Northerly snow blowing and growing cold. Stopping in Ellsworth. In evening visited the Chapter of Royal Arch Masons
Wind NorthWest and the Thermometer 20' below zero and blowing heavy stopping in Ellsworth In evening went to Masonic Hall and Officially visited Lygonia Lodge

Wind Northerly Ther. 20 below in Ellsworth where I stop Took the train at 8.20 for home. Sullivan Harbor being frozen so could not get there and landed at Sorrento and came home by stage. In evening wind Easterly. went to Globe Hall to Hear Professor L C Baterman Lecture. ongoing home the Thermometer at zero

Wind Easterly Ther 18' above snowing hard. Wind hauled out Southerly and kept on snowing and the Thermometer went up to 30' above. In the evening held up snowing went to Globe Hall to hear Pros. Bateman lecture on love and marriage very high tide
Wind out Southerly and what does not very often Happen with The wind this way Thermometer almost at zero. Got sled fixed and in the afternoon hauled coal
Wind North and Ther. 35' above. Staid at home
Wind Northerly shoveled snow in forenoon and hauled coal in afternoon
Wind North West and very fine hauled coal all day
Wind North West. hauled coal all day very pleasant weather In evening went to Masonic Hall and Exemplified the 3d degree

Wind North North West. Chartered Pink stern Sch Julia Ann to take me to Swans Island to see about a lodge of Instructions at that place. left home at 9 AM Landed at Swans Island at 1 P.M. got the Bretham to gather and notified them there would be a meeting of Masons. there in the evening And in the evening not as per notice in the Attic of the Church as the inside of their hall is not finished I had been direct to come here by the M.W. Grand Master Horace H. Brerbank and report to him the result of my investigation as to the necesity of a lodge of Instructions at this place. I shall remain here over night and go home in the vessel tomorrow if chance

Wind North West. good breeze. left Swan's Island at 8.30 AM in the Pinky Sch. Julia Ann for home and arrived at noon. And reported to the Grand Master as directed. I approve of a lodge of Instructions at Swans Island. there being 25 masons already on the Island

Moderate Westerly & warm Hauled coal in forenoon but in afternoon looked after Str M & M which is left in my care. Our daughter is taken sick medical is necessary and Dr Larrabee is called to the rescue
Wind Westerly built fire in Stove on board Str M & M in the Engine room

Wind Easterly Got a small boat and rowed to Bar Harbor. It being a very fine day. Having business with the Bank and several people at Bar Harbor do not get through time enough to get home before dark therefore over
Wind Southerly and snow melts fast came home from Bar Harbor in the skiff that I went over in yesterday
Wind Moderate North West Work on board Str M & M apart of the day In evening went to Masonic Hall Exemplified the work in the E A D
Wind Southerly good breeze and at night commenced to rain. hauled coal

Washington's birthday Wind Northerly and moderate with some snow. The Governors signature to the bill making Winter Harbor a town was celebrated by fireing small cannons ringing of bells and waving of flags. news received to day
Wind North West hauled coal in forenoon and in the afternoon hauled ice for Llewellyn Pendleton
Wind Westerly Ther. from 10' to 20' above staid at home
Wind North West Hauling coal most of the day
Wind North West Hauled ice for Llewellyn Pendleton untill noon. Then hauled coal untill dark. Our daughter still sick
Wind Northerly On account of the hard work done yesterday. I am not able to work to day
Wind moderate N.W. hauled ice in forenoon In afternoon snow to soft hauled coal in cart

Calm all day and the Thermometer 45 snow and Ice melt very fast hauled ice in forenoon but in the afternoon the snow played out and I gave it up. In the evening went to H.R. Westons house where there was a number of voters and it was decided to run me for Chairman of select man against Y R Hammond
Calm all day Very moderate rain in the forenoon. In the afternoon snowed. Went to Bar Harbor via Sullivan. came home at dark via Sullivan very good Sleighing
Calm all day good sleighing, staid at home

Wind North East in morning. Ther. at 20' above Went to West Gouldsboro to a Town meeting although I cannot vote in Gouldsboro as I always have. I go to see the folks. Came home at noon and hauled coal in the afternoon. At night wind hauled out and rain
Wind Northerly hauled coal apart of the day
Wind Northerly and at night little Easterly snow late in the evening

Calm and moderate snow early in the morn This is the first Town meeting ever held at Winter Harbor. My self and J R Hammond are candidates for first select man. Whole number of votes 141 Necessary for chovee 71 J R Hammond had 73 I had 68 We defeated the other side by electing C.E. Pendleton for Treasurer over T. H. Smallidge At 4 oclock P.M. a writ was served on me by the authority of W A Milliken for coal furnished Str M & M for the year 1894
Calm. little fog and some rain Went to Bar Harbor on Str Mascot. Stoped over night went to the Chapter NA Bickford took the Mark Masters degree
Calm an rain untill night when the wind came NW and cleared up Came home from Bar Harbor at noon on Str Mascot
Wind North West and fine weather Staid at home all day

Wind Northerly in the morning Started for Rockland in Schr Julia Ann Capt Loring Rand. Afternoon wind moderate Westerly Anchored at Buckle Island at dark My object in going to Rockland is to see if I can find a steam boat to purchase with the help of my friends

Got underway at Buckle Island at 3 oclock AM Calm. towed vessel out with the dora. afternoon wind South West. Anchored at Rockland at dark, blowing a good breeze. In evening went to the meeting of the Salvation Army in Rockland

Calm all day. Stopping in Rockland Can find no boat here to suit me. and am ready to go home In evening went to a meeting of the Salvation Army  Then went on board of Sch. Julia Ann hauled from wharf to anchor commenced raining

Wind North East and a rain storm. Got underway in Rockland at 9 AM for home Anchored at Froy Island Thoroughfore at noon. Afternoon wind North & clear. Got underway at Fox Island at 5 PM and anchored at Deer Isle at dark. blowing fresh. Sch Julia Ann

Wind North North West in the morning. got underway at Deer Isle at sunrise for home. In Schr. Julia Ann Capt. Loring Rand at noon just East of Bass Harbor Bar wind died out. Then breezed up SouthWest. got home to Winter Harbor at 3 oclock P.M.
location: Deer Isle, Bass Harbor, Winter Harbor

journal_entry: Wind North East and a moderate snow storm in forenoon. At noon wind hauled Northerly and cleared up
Wind Westerly and very fresh. About home
Wind Westerly and blowing a gale with snow squalls in the morning Work on board of Str. M. & M. as I am looking out for her during the winter
Wind West North West Hauling coal all day. Our daughter is sometimes better and then takes her bed again. Dr Larrabee is still tending her
Wind North West Went to Bar Harbor our Str. Mascot to take care of a note got back home at noon In evening went to the Lodge and Chas Martin took the F.C. Degree
Wind Northerly work most all day on Str M & M getting pumps clear of Ice. &ce
Wind North West. Work about home not much coal to haul. orders are scarce
Wind North West in the morning. The Schr. Gen. Banks left my wharf. after lying to it all winter In the afternoon Went to the Lower Harbor after flounders. Wind South West
Wind Southerly Staid about home
Wind Southerly Went to Bar Harbor on Str Mascot to see J.A. Peters Esq in regard to a law suit pending. Plaintiff W.A. Milliken It being for coal furnished Str M & M for the year 1894

Wind South West Hauled coal apart of the day. Corners Bros of Bar Harbor sued and attached my property for the Str Creedmoor Bill It being for services rendered Str M & M last year I claim I did not own any part of the Str M & M
Wind North West Hauled coall all day. fine weather
Wind Easterly and a snow storm from morning untill the middle of the afternoon when the wind cleared up

Wind North North West. Early in the morning very good sledding I hauled one ton of coal from my wharf to Grindstone neck to the Bless house on a sled at one load with any horse The remainder of the day used a cart. Sledding all gone

Wind North West and very fresh. It being warm during the days the snow that was on the ground yesterday is all gone. Put my dora in the water. hauled some coal and wrote mortgage bill of sale of my coal to C.C. Larrabee he lending me $200 and I am to sell coal and collect pay for him
Wind West North West and fresh. In afternoon went to Prospect Harbor to see Dr Ch. C Larrabee social call

Wind North West. moderate. Went to Bar Harbor in my dora to see Lawyer Peters I being sued by WA Milliken & Corners Bros bills contracted by Str M & M I owned no part of her. yet they claim I did came home at night wind south west
Wind Southerly Ground quite free from snow. but the air looks like snow
Wind North East and snow most all day. In evening went to the Hall to a Masonic stated meeting. Ground now covered with snow
Wind North West in forenoon and South West in afternoon. built a coal bin in my cellar and hauled some coal
Wind West North North West and a very fine day Painted my Dora Town roads free from Ice and snow and a plenty of mud

Wind Westerly Painted my Dora out side in the forenoon. And in the afternoon Went to Bar Harbor on Str. Mascot to lease my coal shed and privilege to E.L. Roberts. and agreement is made. but no writing done. went home at night

Wind Westerly and very fine weather Pumped out Str M & M and getting ready to to go to Ellsworth tomorrow to arrange about some Court Matters. In case of W.A. Milliken & Corners Bros who are are trying to make my Nephew C.F. Kingsley and myself pay the bills on Str M & M

Wind South Easterly moderate and rainy Went to Ellsworth Via Bar Harbor thence by train arriving a little after noon. cannot make any arrangements for a settlement with Corners or Milliken by their Atty C.H. Wood. stop over in Ellsworth

Wind South South East. fresh and heavy rain Left Ellsworth at 7.50 AM for home via Bar Harbor was not ready to leave Bar Harbor on arrival of train and the Mascot did not run in the afternoon therefore had to stop over in Bar Harbor and leased my coal privilege at Winter Harbor to Edgar L Roberts to carry on the wood and coal trade
Wind North West heavy went from Bar Harbor home in the forenoon. In the evening went to a masonic meeting
Wind North West fresh. my services looking after the Str M & M is ended. she has been sold to parties in Rockland
Wind South Easterly and moderate & fine Looking after the coal business although it is leased I am interested in the coal now in the shed
Wind South East & fresh I assisted in getting the Str M & M into the wharf, helped coal her up hauled water for her and help get her back into the harbor, without steam
Wind Easterly and a rainstorm
Wind Easterly and a rain storm blowing heavy and rough No boat runs to Bar Harbor from here to day
Wind East North East very fresh. clear in afternoon Took the brush away from the house and burned it
Wind Northerly and very fine. getting ready to go out fishing
Wind Northerly in the morning. got on born Sch Flora Temple & went out fishing At noon calm and calm all the rest of the day. Got 15 fish and rowed in before night in my dora

Wind Southerly My wife and daughter both being sick. I stay abt home. what I can or looking after help to take care of the Sick Went to Birch Harbor and prospect after a girl. Dr Larrabee here twice to day to see Stella
Moderate Wind N. East then hauled out Southerly Went to East Sullivan To see G.E. Simpson and on my way home, hired Colon Bunkers wife to work for us. while my wife and daughter is sick
Wind Southerly My daughter very sick. Telephoned for the Doctor to come
Wind Southerly Went to Bar Harbor to see J.A. Peters Jr. home again in afternoon. At night raining
Wind Easterly and a rain storm in morning Afternoon wind South Collecting debts
Wind Southerly and blowing fresh. Made cart Axle till for. Van Bickford In evening went to the Masonic Hall and Dick Hamilton took the M.M.D.
Wind Southerly Sold to J.J. Roberts for Edgard L Roberts 2 carts 3 screns 3 Coal burrows 4 coal tubs for $110 Afternoon went to So Gouldsboro and back
Wind South West in forenoon Southerly in afternoon. Work around the coal shed. keeping things in repair
WInd Easterly and drizzling apart of the forenoon Work all the forenoon and a part of the afternoon removing rubbish from the house. making flower beds &ce At night done some plowing
Wind Southerly and very fine. My Daughter is recovering from his sickness although she is not able to set up

Wind Southerly Planted two bills of cucumbers. And getting ground ready to do a little gardening. Went to So. Gouldsboro and back to carry Calon Bunkers wife who has been to work for us and is now going to her folks at Bass Harbor
Wind Southerly and overcast. done some plowing and planted one quart of Peas. At night wind Northerly and fine

Wind Easterly in the morning, then hauled around Southerly. A load of wood arrived at my wharf for Mr. E L Roberts Working in my garden sewed some lettuce Went to a masonic Stated meeting at Masonic Hall
Wind Southerly sewed some but seed, also carrot and sage and cucumber seed
Wind Southerly Went to Bar Harbor in yacht Clara M. Sprague back at night and thick with fog
Wind Easterly and thick of fog in the morning but later the wind blew harder and the fog lifted. Collecting coal bills
Wind moderate Easterly and overcast. Staid at home all day

Wind Southerly Left home at 7 1/2 AM for Portland to attend the Grand Lodge. Went Via Bar Harbor. Thence by M.C.R.R. arriving at Portland at about 5.30 P.M. Stoped at 335 Congress St. Mrs Thompsons In evening attended the meeting of the Chapter. The Mark Masters degree was conferred on 4 candidates
Wind Southerly Stoping in Portland Attended the Grand Lodge meeting all day and the Chapter in the evening
Wind South West not Went from Portland to Falmouth Foreside in forenoon and returned back to Portland at noon and attended the session of the Grand Lodge in the afternoon

Wind Southerly and hot. attended the Grand Lodge in forenoon was appointed and Installed D.D.G.M. for the 21st District Lodge closed its session at noon. Got dinner Went to the Depot and to F E Boothby the Gonl ticked Agent. Exchanged my ticket to go home Via of Rockland and Str Frank Jones. Left Portland Depot at 1.20 P.M. arrived in Rockland at 5.30

Wind Westerly and very fine. Went from Rockland to Camden and spent the day with Fred K. Shaw which I have enjoyed very much. going & returning bu the Elected road and going on board Str Frank Jones to stop the night
Calm in morning Left Rockland on Str Frank Jones for Bar Harbor bounf home arriving in Bar Harbor at 2 P.M. and left Bar Harbor on Str Mascott at 3.30 for Winter Harbor wind South South East
Wind Southerly and thick with fog
Wind South West. done some plowing but it rains most of the day and do not do much
Wind Southerly and fine weather. Work all day farming having Colon Bunker to help me with his team. Planted the seed of squash carrot cucumber Cabbage Swis Chard & beet
Wind East South East Commenced raining at 9 AM and ruined the remainder of the day No Lodge meets tonight
Wind Westerly Ground to wet to work in forenoon and made a flower bed around the Lawn basket In afternoon took the turf of a piece of land that I am going to make a garden of
Wind Southerly planted some beans and some cucumbers looking like rain
Wind South Easterly Commenced work farming that of planting peas and potatoes, but at 9 am it began to rain and never let up untill night
Wind Southerly and overcast. Went to So. Gouldsboro with my wife making a social call at Colon Bunkers stopping untill afternoon
Wind Southerly Sewed the seed of Tomatoes parsnip Cucumber turnip carrot &ce
Wind Southerly Finished farming except later I may scow turnip seed. I have planted squash pumpkin potatoes and peas to day
Wind Westerly No work in particular to day having a rest. Stella feels quite well to day and goes out of door

Wind North West. Work in forenoon on boat afternoon went down on Grindstone Neck for pleasure In evening went to Globe Hall to hear a political lecture from the Poperlist stand point. D G Richards speaker South Hope

Wind North West in forenoon & SouthWest in the afternoon. work on boat that I have bought and am going to rig into a Bank to be placed near the house to be filled with dirt and and used for a flower bed
Wind Southerly and fresh Work making spars for the boat that I am going to rig into a Bank for a flower garden
Wind South East rainy all day
Easterly wind and rain all day also thick with fog. Finished making spars for the little bark 17 ft. long that is to be used for a flower bed
Wind Southerly and rough. ground very wet Work all day on boat
Wind South West work all day on boat
Wind Southerly and thick with fog in morning Work about home
Wind baffling Westerly Thermometer 85'
Wind Southerly Thermometer 75' Work about home
Wind NorthWest Thermometer up to 86' in shade

Wind South East and very moderate Went to Bar Harbor in a small boat to see about Reuben Salisbury's bill as Engineer on Str M & M last year but done nothing came home at night The Str Ruth runs to Bar Harbor but I prefer a sail boat
Wind Southerly but fine weather Sewed apart of my garden over where the seed had not come up. In afternoon worked for C. F. Kingsley making outriggers or speaker for his boat
Wind Southerly and damp, overcast all day. Work for C. F. Kingsley making topmast for his boat. In evening went to Masonic Hall to a stated meeting

Wind Northerly Worked in the garden a while in forenoon And in the afternoon. went to the Court House (Globe Hall) to a trial R M Torvy had T. H. Smallidge arrested for opening his store on sunday Smallidge fined one dollar and costs
Wind Easterly and fine weather work about home
Wind Easterly in the morning and hauled around with the sun Work most all day rigging a small Bark
Wind Southerly and fine. Staid at home Stella is some times up and out of door and then sick in bed again. Dr Larrabee is still tending her
Wind Southerly Work on my little Bark in the door yard
Wind Southerly work most of the day for C. F. Kingsley on his boat
Wind South West fresh. Work on my little Bark
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. Work apart of the forenoon for C. F. Kingsley and in the afternoon for myself
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. Ar night heavy thunder and lightning with showers. Work all day for C.F. Kingsley on boat Clara M. Sprague and set her mast. In evening a very heavy thunder shower
Wind Northerly & a little Easterly untill 4 PM when the wind came Southerly and at 5 PM a very heavy shower Work about home
Wind Southerly and fine weather
Wind Southerly Hoeing peas beans &ce at home
Wind Southerly and hot. Went to Bar Harbor in skiff to take up a note at the Bank. came home in the afternoon The Str Ruth runs to Bar Harbor, but I have never been on her
Wind Southerly Work about home Thermometer 70'

Wind Southerly and partially foggy. Paid Int. of $14.00 on note to J P Gordon due the 23d Coal vessel arrived to my wharf for E L Roberts. Sewed my garden over partially for the third time, where bags had destroyed the plants and put in this time peas & cucumbers
Wind Southerly & thick with fog. Sch Kate Walker commenced discharging coal at my wharf of which I am the overseer
Wind South Easterly thick with fog and a little rainy Kate Walker discharged The bark I have been rigging is now done and after the vessel discharged I had her filled with dirt
Wind Southerly and very moderate Staid about home
Wind South East & thick with fog. not feeling will I do not attempt to do my work
Wind South East and a little rainy also thick with fog Worked the forenoon for Jennie Kingsley putting up picture James curtains &ce
Wind Easterly good breeze Work about home
Wind South East moderate and thick with fog. In afternoon a little rainy Work most all day hoeing my potatoes and setting out plants in the garden The ground being very day this little rain is needed
Wind Easterly and moderate rain all day No work done out of doors

Wind South East Went to Bar Harbor to see Fuifield & Haynes about buying my horse came back in afternoon and went to South Gouldsboro to see Colon Bunker who has him hired but as he has gone to Ellsworth I cannot came home in Evening
Wind Easterly and the fog hangs over Schoodic but at Winter Harbor it is clear

Wind Easterly and cleared up wind came North West Sold my horse to Colon Bunker for $80.00 and for pay I take a bill of sale of a yearling bull for $25.00 Cash $5.00 and a Holnes note for fifty dollars to be paid Oct 1 this year
Wind NorthWest and fine Went to Bar Harbor in my dora to look for a job either on a steam boat or as a pilot Not finding anything I stop over to Bar Harbor all night
Wind North West in forenoon and S.W. in the afternoon. Stoped in Bar Harbor last night. Found no job that I am sure of and came home in the afternoon in my dora
Celebration day but I take no part in it. but stay at home Wind moderate South getting a piece & ground ready for turnips
Wind Southerly and thick with fog out side Sewed turnip seed and weeded the garden
Wind Southerly and thick with fog Went to Bar Harbor in my dora to take up a note at the Bank. came home in afternoon. The Str. Ruth makes 4 or more trips a day but I do not go on her
Wind South South East and thick with fog Staid at home
Wind Southerly & thick with fog. transplanted the flower garden and working in the vegetable garden
Wind South fog very heavy with more or less rain
Wind North West and very fine weather. Hoed Jennie Kingsley's garden
Wind South West fine weather Went to Stave Island to see Colon Bunker
Wind South West and fine weather work about home

Wind South Easterly and moderate. Went to Bar Habor in dora to carry a picture of a Steamboat to a M. Garland Jr. to see if wants to Charter her. but not receiving any definite answer. I remain in Bar Harbor over night

Wind Easterly and in the morning rainy Thinking there night be a big storm coming started in the morning for home and arrived at noon. In the afternoon Drs. Larrabee of Gouldsboro & Deer of Philada held a consultation at our house as to the best treotint of our daughter who has been sick fine mouth
Wind Southerly and heavy rain in morning I am sick to day and unable to get out or to sit up but little

Wind Southerly with some fog in morning fueling much better It has now been five months since. Stella was taken sick and she is now very low and attended by Dr. Ch. C Larrabee whom we think is a good doctor
Wind South Easterly and a fog. Feeling much better I go out in the afternoon
Wind Southerly and fog in morning Started for Bar Harbor after dinner with the wind Southerly. after getting there the wind came of North West and came back home going in a sail boat
Wind North West Work about home
Wind South South West. Commenced to cut my hay. mowing a little around the door
Wind Southerly and hot. In afternoon went to Prospect Harbor to Capt. Daniel Deasys making a social call. Came home after tea

Wind South Easterly overcast and somewhat foggy. Went to Bar Harbor in a sloop boat to take care of a note and to look for a job at night thick with fog. Stop the night in Bar Harbor on board the boat I came here in
Calm and thick with fog in morning. At 10 AM the fog scaled up and at 11 AM the wind came of North West. Came home from Bar Harbor in boat. very fine weather
Wind Westerly the forenoon and Southerly in afternoon Work haying
Wind Southerly Haying all day for myself using a mowing machine apart of the time. In afternoon began to grow sick but worked untill night
Wind Southerly I do not feel much better and work is a burden but I get out and do a little
Wind Southerly I cannot work getting in hay and stay in house. Got medicine of Dr. Larrabee at the pain in my stomach is so great I send for the Dr. again
Wind South East and a heavy rain storm untill 8 AM. Rested will last night after the Dr came He also came again to day to see me & Stella. Pleasant in afternoon
Wind West North West and a very fine hay day. Got some one to took out for my har. had it opened and put up. I do not go out
Wind Southerly all the hay I have down. has been put in Chas Pendletons barn. I go to the door but do not walk about
Wind South Easterly and some what overcast. Dr. Homer of Franklin came to see our daughter who still lies low in Bed and Dr Larrabee is done doctoring her at present
Wind Southerly and a fine hay day Stay in the house
Wind Southerly and fine weather. Suffered immense to day with pain. am no better than a week ago

Wind Southerly but good weather for those who have not got through haying my hay is not all cut and doubtful if it is this season. Dr Larrabee made a visit to me to day and says it will be several days before I get at work again

Wind South Easterly Rainy a part of the day. I do not go out but lay a bed most the time. suffering a great deal night Our daughter is no better. suffers day and night with pains and cramps. No relief to be had
Wind Southerly and good weather. I stay in my room know how the wind and weather is outside. but cannot get out to enjoy it

Wind Southerly and thick with fog in morning. At 9 AM cleared up. I feel so much better to day I get out and go to the Barbers shop lost 22 lbs flesh in in 10 days weighed in the Post office to day weight 138 lbs. weight 10 days ago same scales was 160 lbs
Wind Southerly and thick with fog At 9 AM cleared up At noon Dr. Homer came to see our daughter and says she will get well. but will be a long time. a good many weeks. At night rainy
Wind Southerly and fair weather I now go out of doors but am very weak
Wind Southerly and nice weather about home not doing anything
Wind North West and a very fine day Not able to work yet
Wind North West in morning and Southerly in the afternoon Went out in my dora for a little sail
Wind South East. Left home early in the morning in my dora to go to Bar Harbor to carry Andrew Pendleton who is going to take the train for Bangor at 7 A.M. Got back home at 11 AM raining hard
Drizzling rain in the morning wind N.E. later wind Northerly and cleared up do not feel able to do much work
Wind North West in morning and South in afternoon Work a little on my dora putting a mast step Not feeling well do not do much
Wind NorthWest in morning and South West in afternoon unable to work
Wind North West and a very fine day. I get out of door but do not pretend to do any work
Wind Southerly and pleasant. Not able to work
Wind Southerly and rainy most all day. I am not able to get out of the house
Wind Northerly Not being able to do any work. but do get out of the house
Wind South West. Feeling some better I go to picking some cranberries to the Eastward of the house got about 1/2 basked
Wind North West blowing alost a gale for the time of year. Picking cranberries near the house
Wind North West untill about 4 PM when it came in Southerly picked some cranberries near the house
Wind South Thick with fog and rainy
Wind Southerly showery & foggy in forenoon. Went to Bar Harbor stoped overnight in evening very heavy thunder shower My Dora was towed over by Str Ruth
Wind North West very heavy. Stoped at Bar Harbor all day looking after a job to Pilot some yacht that night begin West and in need of a Pilot
Wind South West and fine not finding any yacht in need of a Pilot. came home in the afternoon in my dora but before I came home I foreclosed on a mortgage of a Organ thot I had let $10 on

Wind Southerly At 10 oclock AM Went to B.E. Tracys office to a court. Wm H. Bunker V.S. G.B. & G.J. Gerrish and Andrew & Fred Pendleton for trespass I acted for defendant and appealed to the Supreme Court. without any verdict from the Trial Justice
Wind Southerly fastened the Cuter board of my dora in anew
Calm all day forenoon overcast. Made a dora sail over smaller so to have two sails instead of one
Wind Southerly made mast for Lwellyn Pendleton boat
Wind South and a rough day afternoon a rain storm Our daughter is getting better very fast and came down stairs to day for the first time for most three months
Wind North West very fresh but fine weather
Wind Westerly untill night when the wind hauled out SouthWest. Went to the Dover Harbor after some butter milk. got none will go again tomorrow Our daughter went out of dora She is much better
Wind South West and fresh Went to the Lower Harbor and some buttermilk. My health is much improved since sunday
Wind South West fresh and gof outside. This is our first meeting to night for a masonic meeting but I cannot attend being called to Grindstone Neck on business
Wind South West and outside thick fog. Went to Bar Harbor in dora and stoped all night there

nearly calm all day. left Bar Harbor in morning for Franklin in dora and got towed to Sullivan by the Sebona Then went to Franklin in forenoon in dora and in the afternoon came back to Bar Harbor and remained overnight
Wind Easterly & quite fresh. Came home from Bar Harbor in the forenoon
Calm all day Thermometer 70' At home
Calm in the morning Measured some land which I am in hopes to sell. And in the afternoon Went to Bar Harbor in my Dora to take up a note at the Bank. being moderate stop over in Bar Harbor
Wind Northerly in the morning and SouthWest in the afternoon Came home from Bar Harbor early in the morning Afternoon went to the Lower Harbor after Sour Milk
Wind Southerly and thick with fog in morning. Later some showers when it cleared up
Wind Southerly rain in morning then thick fog Went out fishing
Wind N.N. West. fresh. Got some bait to go fishing but it blew to hard to go
Wind North good breeze. Went Fishing in my dora using 24 lines of troll under run and took got a tub of fish and home at 5 PM
Wind Northerly in morning and South in afternoon very fine day
Wind South South West very fresh breeze Cleaned out over well and put fish on flakes that I cought last Thursday
Wind Southerly out fish on the flakes that I caught Saturday made covering for our well
Wind North West in forenoon and Southerly in the afternoon. Work most all day on dora sail repairing
Wind Southerly Gathered my pumpkins and squashed
Wind Southerly and very fine day work about home
Wind Southerly and thick with in the forenoon made mast for my dora
Wind very light Southerly with the Thermometer up to 85' degrees
Wind South Fresh Working about home
Wind North West. changed my dora's foresail from a sprect to a gaft
Wind Southerly Went to Bar Harbor with Chas Sargent in Sloop Little Nell to renew a note Collected $35.00 of E L Roberts acct of coal
Wind South South East Drizzling rain and fog all day And at night a very heavy thunder storm. raining in torrents untill a very late bed time
Wind North West and very fine
Wind North West untill night when it hauled out SouthWest
Wind South East and overcast. staid at home
Wind South South East very heavy rain and fresh breeze untill night
Wind West South West Very fresh breeze & rough Electioneering for a road to be built from my house to the coal wharf on Grindstone Neck
Wind South West very fresh Went to Lower Harbor after milk for bread In evening went to the Hall to a Stated Masonic meeting Clarence Martin took the M M D
Wind Southerly Went to Bar Harbor in Str Ruth to settle some law cases with Conners and Milliken W A Milliken being gone did nothing with it Came home in afternoon

Wind Northerly in morning. Went to Bar Harbor again to see W.A. Milliken about settling case in covert whereby he has sewed me for the coal bill of Str M & M last year he is not at home and I come home in my dora in the evening

Wind North East moderate In afternoon went to a special Town meeting in this place. and voted to build a road from our house to the coal wharf on Grindstone Neck & to raise $600 for same. Voted to raise $100 to repair the Town road from Chas Pendleton hill to our house
Wind Northerly Went to Bar Harbor to see W.A. Milliken about a settlement Arrived to nithing definite and stop over at Bar Harbor to go to Ellsworth tomorrow

Wind Southerly Went to Ellsworth on business connected with the two lawsuits W.A. Milliken & Conners The case laid before J.A. Peters and think he can arrange for a settlement. Came back to Bar Harbor at 7.30 no boat to get home
Wind South South East and partialy thick with fog. Came home from Bar Harbor in the forenoon on Str Mascot
Wind W.N. West good breeze Dug my potatoes sent note to J.A. Peters for $330.31 to take the two cases out of Covert note payable in 60 days
Wind North Good Breeze Not able to work to day lay on the lounge. shake for a few minutes with the chills then sweat feeling very uncomfortable
Wind very moderate or none in the morning. later it breezed moderate Southerly. Do not go out to day though I do not have any chills. Dr Larrabee called to see me
Wind South East and blowing quite fresh. Went out for a few minutes feeling some better
Wind Easterly Commenced to rain about 1 oclock PM and raining hard when I went to bed at 10 P.M. I feel better and went to the Barber shop this morning
Wind Northerly But rain in the forenoon. In the afternoon the wind North West do no work
Wind North West. Work all day on the highway between our house and Chas Pendletons
Wind North Easterly Work no more on the highway but get ready to go fishing. At night drizzling rain. Went to the Hall to a masonic meeting
Wind Westerly Went out fishing Wind hauled N.W. and blew a gale Got home a little after dinner
Wind West North West blowing a gale all day Work about home
Wind South West a gale. Started to go a fishing and gave it up and worked about home
Wind moderate Westerly Got some bait at night to go fishing tomorrow
Wind North West Went out fishing Got 1/2 tub of fish and a very large shark
Wind Southerly very heavy Went out fishing but the wind blew so hard could not stay out long Got 1/2 tub fish
Wind moderate Westerly Washed out fish that I cought ready to put on the flakes
Wind North West and moderate getting ready to go gunning At night all ready
Wind South West and blew a heavy gale. Started to go a gunning but gave it up Put fish on flake
Wind North West. I went gunning down to the ledges with D W Joy. We got 23 birds
Wind South West Went to So. Gouldsboro to see a bull that I bought of Colon Bunker last spring when I sold him my horse I walked up and Colon brought me back home after supper
Wind Southerly and a little showery. work about home

Wind Westerly and fine weather This is my birthday I am 50 years old being born Oct 29 1845. Work all day on road leading to my house the Town voted to raise $100. but it is not enough and is finished by subscription

Wind Southerly Work all day giving my time to the Town raising the highway higher between my house & Chas Pendletons Hill building up the valley. The Town not raising enough to do it. The work is being done by clunteers
Wind moderate East in the morning and hauled out South. Very pleasant out outside windows on my house in the forenoon. And in the afternoon work rebuilding the road leading to my house
Wind South East, blowing and raining very heavy At noon cleared of wind Westerly Dried my tralls & put them away for another time be used no more this year

Wind North West in morning and hauled North East and died out calm Commenced to sell laths with K.S. Mc Jeer as agents Fror the Schoodic Peninsular Land Co of Winter Harbor. Lots sells for $5 size 40 by 70 ft. or contained 2800 paq ft. Sold one lot on the Installment plan At night commenced to snow moderate the first for the season to stop on the ground
Wind Northerly moderate and fine Some snow on the ground but melts in the sun. The ground is barely covered in the morning
Wind North East in the morning and hauled out Southerly Via the East but a very fine day. Selling lots on land of the Schoodic Peninsular Land Co.
Wind South West Fresh breeze. Work all day selling lots and sold four
Wind Southerly and fine no snow on the ground making sign bound and jigging out letters for same to read Schoodic Peninsular Land Co

Wind Southerly and partialy thick with fog in forenoon Work all day for Geo Mackay building a bridge which will belong to the Town when done This bridge is to connect the highway with to Co's coal wharf at Grindstone Neck East side

Wind Southerly with fog. Work for Geo. McKay on bridge that goes on the Gouldsboro Land & Improvement Cos Coal wharf. Fell from a Pier about 3 ft on a rock and got hurt. How bad dont know sent for the Dr.
Wind Easterly and rainy all day I lay in bed unable to get up on account of the hurt I got yesterday The Dr. said it was not fatal and put a very large plaster on
Wind North Easterly and a rain storm in forenoon. I lay in bed all day unable to get up. although no bones are broken. I have a very lane side
Wind Northerly and very fine. Still lying in bed but am recovering from the shock received last Friday
Wind Northerly and fine Got up at 10 am and came down stairs for the first time since last Friday night I can sit up with out much discomfort
Wind North Easterly but fine. Am done stairs but do not go out of door. This is Lodge night but I do not attend but am getting better
Wind Northerly and Easterly and overcast. I am still in the house and can walk around some. In the evening the weathe looks and acts like a big storm brewing

Wind Easterly and a heavy rain storm all day without any let up simply pouring down in torrents I have nothing to do but sit by the window and look. do not go out. Have not been out of doors since a week to night
Wind North West and fair. Went out to the door am gaming all the time. At night wind Southerly
Wind moderate or none at all and overcast. Am getting better and in the afternoon went over to Jennie Kingsleys In the evening rainy
Wind South West In the afternoon Went back to the bridge where I got hurt. but did not work
Wind Southerly and warm. Went back to the bridge where I got hurt. but did not do any work but bossed the job and finished it to night. The bridge down at the coal wharf is now completed
Wind Southerly and apart of the day rainy did no work

Wind Westerly with snow squalls in the forenoon Went to Prospect Harbor to sell House Lots of land owned by Schoodic Peninsular Land Co Was gone most all day. At night wind West North West and at 9 AM the Thermometer 18' above
Wind North West in morning Thermometer 18' In afternoon very light North East In evening little snowy work about home a little but not able to work much
Wind North East and a little snow in morning In afternoon the wind Southerly and a good deal rainy. snow all gone. Getting signers for a dispensation for Chapter of the Eastern Star
Wind North West and fine. About home
Wind East and fresh. Went to Bar Harbor on Str. Mascot to take up a note at the Bank. Came home in the afternoon. In the evening rainy
WInd South East thick and rainy Bad day to sell lots
Wind North West and a fine day On the road in Winter Harbor Selling lots
Wind South West Thanksgiving fine day Selling lots for house lots owned by Schoodic Peninsular Land Co. of Bar Harbor and controled by my self and K S Macleer of Winter Harbor for one year
Wind Southerly Selling lots
Wind Northerly and fine. Sold lots in the forenoon but in the afternoon put rockweed around the house
Wind Easterly in the morning Thermometer 10' above Wind hauled out Southerly
Wind South and heavy rain Storm

Wind North and overcast. Afternoon M. Rook from Auburn Maine Came here and organized a Chapter order of the Eastern Star Ruby D. Tracy Worthy Matron Myself the Patron and Ethel Hammond associate Matron. Sixteen Charter numbers. We were at the Hall afternoon and evening
Wind North and clear. Got some boards to make outside doors. In the evening went to the Masonic Hall to stated meeting
Wind East North East Made two outside door for myself. No snow on the Ground in the morning but at noon commenced snowing and snowed all the afternoon and snowing hard when I go to bed at 10
Wind North West and more pleasant Staid about home
Calm untill abt. 3 oclock PM. When the wind breezed up Southerly and began to grow dump In the evening rainy But went to Masonic Hall to the Chapter of the Eastern Star Voted to meet monday nights
Wind North West and fine Staid about home
Wind East North East Ther. 4' above zero. Went to Bar Harbor and took up a note of 330.31 at the BH.B & T Co and stay at Bar Harbor over night. stoping with S. J. Clement

Calm in the morning Left Bar Harbor for Bangor in forenoon on arriving in Bangor was told that the Thermometer was at 11' below zero I cam here to sell house lots and to attend a masonic Convention to be held here next thursday
Wind Northerly Thermometer at zero in Bangor. Am trying to sell some house lots but do not sell many. Stop at the Windsor Hotel in Bangor
Wind Northerly in Bangor Thermometer zero Attended a convention of the Grand Lodge held by Geo. E. Raymond Grand Lectures for correcting the work of the Ritual. Do not try to sell house lots to day

Wind North North East Left Bangor at 7 am for Bar Harbor. The Thermometer 6 degrees below zero. Arrived in Bar Harbor in forenoon. But no steam boat runs and to cold to go in a skiff and I stay at Bar Harbor and sell house lots
Wind North North East and rough weather Staid in Bar Harbor untill afternoon There not being any steam boat on the route. I came home in the afternoon in the Pinky Julia Ann Capt Lorring Rand
Wind North West and fine day Thermometer 28' Staid about home
Wind North West Thermometer 32' above Went to So. Gouldsboro and killed my Bull that I bought of Colon Bunker last spring. Dressed him and hauled him home
Wind North West in the morning and in the afternoon calm Work about home getting ready to go away visiting Lodges in the 21st Masonic District as D.D.G.M.

Wind South West left home in the forenoon for Bar Harbor in a sail packet. to take the Steamboat tomorrow morning for Deer Isle To visit the Lodges in my official capacity also to sell house lots sold a number in the afternoon at Bar Harbor where I will remain over night

Wind South West. Sold two lots of land in the morning and at 10 AM left Bar Harbor on Str Frank Jones for Deer Isle. arriving about 2 oclock P.M. and stoped with Geo Howard a very warm and pleasant day

Calm all day and very warm. at North West Harbor Deer Isle in evening went to Greens Landing 7 miles and officialy visited Reliance Lodge. After which I went back to North West Harbor where I am to remain over night

Wind South East very heavy and rain Went from N.W. Harbor Deer Isle in forenoon to North Deer Isle. At noon Wind hauled out South moderated and cleared up. Got set across the Reach and went to Brooklin in afternoon where I shall remain untill Wed. waiting for Frank Jones and selling house lots
Wind Southerly and overcast. Stoping at the Brooklin House Brooklin Maine Sold one house lot to day
Wind North North West and fine. Stoping at the Brooklin House in Brooklin Mc E.D.mayo Proprietor. No lots sold today Will leave here tomorrow for Bar Harbor

Christmas. Wind Northerly and very fine Left Brooklin about 10 am for Bar Harbor on Str. Frank Jones arriving at 2 oclock P.M. and took a skiff and rowed home to Winter Harbor. No Lodge meets here to night on account of a Christmas tree
Wind Southerly and warm work about home
Wind South East and a rain storm cleared up in the afternoon. Work about home
Wind North West in forenoon afternoon calm. Hung a door that leads to out attic and made out to deeds for house lots I have sold lately

Calm all the forenoon with a very light Southerly in the afternoon. It has not been cold enough since the middle of this month to freeze anything I will have to go to Bar Harbor tomorrow after salt to salt out feet it has been killed two weeks and never froze

Very light air of wind Southerly Started for Bar Harbor at 7 AM in sail packet. arrived at noon. Left Bar Harbor at 2 PM got home at 8 P.M. and went to a meeting of the Order of Eastern star at 10 PM rainy

Wind South East fresh and heavy rainstorm. There is no more Ice or snow on the ground them in July and no one frost in the ground. At 9 AM wind hauled South West and cleared up. I have no particular business now except selling house lots for the Schoodic Peninsular Land Co My coal business was Cased to E L Roberts of Bar Harbor for $100 per year. a term of there yes

Wind North West blowing a gale. I have no business no business now except to sell house lots for the Schoodic Peninsula Land Co. of which I have sold quite a number My coal business being leased to E L Roberts for three years from last april In the Evening Elected Officers of Winter Harbor Lodge F. & A.M.
Wind South West and fine. K.S. Marteer has out a lot of Bankrupt stock in a stone and as I have refused to go in partnership with him he wants me to be clerk and I put the goods on the shelves

Wind Southerly in the morning and hauled around North West at night. Work all day in store for K.S. MacDeer in his stone that he has leased here in Winter Harbor. What goods are now in the store came from Steuben
Wind North West a gale at Thermometer down to zero. B. F. Summers Bankrupt stock of goods sold at Auction such goods as is commonly found in a drug store
Wind North North West thermometer in the morning 4' below 0 staid at home

Wind Northerly very heavy. Ther. 18 degrees below zero. Colder than we often see it here. do not pretend to do anything but kept warm. In evening held a stated meeting at masonic Hall of the Chapter of the Eastern star. Known as the order O.E.S.
Wind Northerly. the Thermometer 8 degrees below zero in the morn at night 8' above To cold to do any work away from the fire

Wind North West Ther. at zero in the morning. at noon 10' above. Took acct. of stock of goods in store for K.S. Macteer and which he expects me to be one of the proprietors or clerk In evening went to a Masonic Meeting
Wind North East. Thermometer at zero Staying in the store
Wind Northerly in forenoon and Southerly in afternoon. Ther. 36' staid at home
Wind Westerly and moderate. staid in store. In evening went to the Chapter O.E.S.
Wind North East in the forenoon with a little snow. In the afternoon the wind Northerly and clear. Ther. at 30' above. Working in store for H. S. Macteer
Wind North West. Work in store all day. In evening went to Masonic Hall and publicly Installed the Officers of Winter Harbor Lodge. After which we reprared to the Ocean House (Lewel Davis) to supper
Wind South Easterly a little snow in the forenoon. Work in store
Wind Northerly and very fine A little snow fell last night. but not enough to make any sledding. Work in the store
Wind North East. Went to Bar Harbor with Chas. Miller to be at Somesville monday night to visit Mt Desert Lodge 140 F & AM
Wind North East and overcast all day and looking like snow. stopping at Bar Harbor

Wind East North East Left Bar Harbor after dinner with a team for Somesville. In evening held a meeting of Mt. Desert Lodge. for inspection in my official capacity as D D G M The exemplication of the work was good in M M D
Wind Easterly moderate In evening visited the Chapter Order of the Eastern Star at Somesville
Wind North North East In forenoon drove from Somesville to S.W. Harbor To visited Tremont Lodge F. & AM. Stopping with W K Kean In evening visited the Lodge. worked the M M Degree 50 were present
Wind N.N. East and fine weather Left South West Harbor arriving at 12 M. leaving Bar Harbor at 1.30 PM for home in sail packet arriving at 3.30 P.M.
Wind East South East overcast and looking like a storm. Staying in store for K S Macteer At dark a double team load of goods arrived
Wind Easterly with snow and sleet storm Working in store taking acct of another stock of goods which is a bankrupt stock that came from Cherryfield
Wind North East and a little snowy this is the first sleighing we have had here this winter
Wind North North West Work in store putting goods on the shelves for K.S. Macteer
Wind North West. Ther. 10' above Work in the store
Wind North West Thermometer in the morning 4' below zero at night 10' above
Wind North West and very fine weather working in store
Wind North West Ther 20 above zero work in the store
Wind North East in morning and hauled out South East and snowed most all day
Wind Northerly and and heavy rain in the morning when the wind came around N.W. very fresh and began to grow cold

Wind North Easterly and very fine. Thermometer 35' degrees Stay in Store all day In evening went to Masonic Hall to a meeting of Chapter of the Eastern Star. Myself Worthy Patron This being a stated meeting. Elected James Wescott. Emma F. Vose and Ada Sargent and Initiated them
Wind North East moderate overcast Work all day in store It is now good Sleighing. The people are hauling out their firewood
Wind North East and overcast. Working in store
Wind South East. rain began to fall in the afternoon. and poured down heavy with the gale of wind untill long after 11 PM when I go to Bed. I have been in the store all day
Wind Westerly quite fresh but not cold Work in Store
Wind Westerly & quite fresh but warm snow melts fast all day. The sledding not very good through the place. Work in store for  K S Macteer
Wind Easterly and overcast. At noon commenced to snow and snows hard all the afternoon and evening
Wind North Easterly Work in Store In evening went to Chapter of Eastern Star at masonic Hall
Wind northerly and snowy Work in store
Wind North West fresh but not cold very good sleighing Work in Store In evening went went to masonic Hall

Wind North Easterly left home with a team for Ellsworth went as far as Sullivan Ferry. put team up and went to Ellsworth by train to Visit Eastern Lodge in my official capacity The first degree was worked. Stoped at the Hancock House Ellsworth
Wind North West fresh. Left Ellsworth at 8.20 AM for home by train to Ferry and team home arriving at noon Stoping in store in afternoon and Evening. A J Gerrish stoped in the store during my absence
Wind Northerly in morning and hauled North Easterly Work in store
Wind North North East. Thermometer 8' above zero in morning at night down to zero overcast all day
Wind North Thermometer 15' below zero this is considered very cold. staid in store
very moderate wind Northerly Ther. 10' below in morning. at night 12' above with the wind North East. Work in Store
Wind North East Ther 10' above in the morning & 18 at night with a little snow Staid in store
Wind South West and thick with snow at 6 oclock AM. Later in the forenoon cleared up. Staid in store
Wind North West quite fresh. staid in store for K.S. Macteer
Wind North West in the forenoon. Ther. at zero at 6 AM In afternoon wind Southerly and the Thermometer went up very fine. Working in store Washingtons Birth day
Wind Southerly

Wind Southerly and the Ther. 40' above. At night Wind West North West and growing cold bought into the store with K.S. Macteer where I have been at work for the last six weeks. I am now an equal partner

Wind Southerly and fine. Staid about the store M Mcteer and myself are now in partnership business in the Nathan Hammond Store The goods consists of canned goods paints clothing day good groceries and small wares
Wind Westerly and fine Thermometer 12' above. staid in store but am working hard to be elected Chairman of the board of selectman In evening went to the Hall to the Lodge. Exemplified the M.M. Degree

Wind Westerly & moderate Ther. 10' above Work all day settling with K.S. Macteer for all I have done in the store up to Feb 20 when I bought into the store and Mr. Macteer becomes a silent partner. The goods will be bought in my name. I gave him a note dated Feb 22 for 185.25 10 minutes had in in store
Wind Southerly overcast. Ther 38' Staid in store all day. In evening went to Globe Hall to see the Steuben Dramatic Club play which was very fine

Wind calm in morning and wet. Ther. 42' and little rainy all day Stay in the store of which I am directly interested. having bought out hald interest of K.S. Macteer I am also working for my election for Chairman of the board of Selectmen
Wind South Easterly and rainy

Wind East and heavy rain This is our second anual Town meeting for the new Town of Winter Harbor. we being set off from the Town of Gouldsboro one year ago. I was a candidate for first select man. The votes were cast as follows. whole number 108 I had 79 J M Gerrish had 27 and there were two scattering. Therefore I am elected. Chairman Wm Rand second & H E Tracy thirds The select man are also assesor overdued of the poor and fence viewers
Wind East and raining. and it continued to rain all day. keeping store for my self and K.S. Macteer he being a silent partner. I also get the Town books. being elected yesterday
Wind Northerly and thick with snow. very blustering Staid in store. Do not visit the Lodge to night
weather_condition_am: blustering snow storm, thick with snow

journal_entry: Wind Northerly snow blowing and blustering staid in store
Wind North and very fine. Staid in the store and having charge the town books am kept quite busy
Wind South East and thick with snow and snowed all day
Wind West in the morning & fine. At night wind more northerly & cold

Wind North West quite fresh. Cold at night good sleighing now as can be but the ponds & streams have flown so high. teams cannot make use of them. In evening attended meeting of the C.E.S. Then began to globe Hall to watch the dancing
Wind W.N.W. Ther. 20' above Staying in store being a partner with K.S. Macteer and receiving one half wages from Mr Macteer as he has nothing to do with it. not being in the store at all

Wind very moderate in the morning Ther. at zero. Later the wind breezed up Easterly and in the evening a very tough snow storm. the air moderated during the forenoon Did not attend the Lodge acct storm
Wind Easterly in morning & thick with snow then hauled out Southerly. then Westerly some times lightning up then snow squalls staid in store

Wind Westerly Ther. 20' above zero Quite fine day Staid in store In evening went to Globe Hall to an entertainment got up by the Sisters of the Eastern Star for the benefit of the order to pay for the Jewels
Wind North West Thermometer 20' above tending to business in the store. I have the Town books in the store
Wind moderate Westerly. staid about home
Wind Easterly In afternoon began to snow. In evening went to the Chapter O.E.S. On my way home I found the snow was drifting fast and had appearance of being the bejest snow storm for the winter
Wind Northerly and snowy in the forenoon. This has been the toughest storm for the winter and more shoveling in this town had been done to day than in all the rest of the winter. Staying in store
Wind Southerly and fine weather Went to the Masonic Hall in Evening. but did not stop having town business to attend went into the store where the select mens office is and where I am Interested
Wind South Easterly Soft weather, a little snow in the forenoon and some rain in the afternoon
Wind South and rain in the morning later it cleared up wind Westerly
Wind Westerly and very fine day. Have had a very good trade in the first store to day
Wind South and fine weather At night wind NorthWest and colder
Wind Easterly and overcast. Paid N. Hammond months rent for store $6.67 all previous rent been paid
Wind Easterly and fine weather Staying in store
Wind South West and fine weather but blows a gale work in store
Wind Southerly Thermometer went up to 50' above the snow melts very fast. Work in store
Wind West with snow squalls. ground freezing Got a clerk in the store and worked all day on Sch Sarch Elizabeth E L Roberts owner. Putting new cealing in
Wind Westerly Worked in store in forenoon and in the afternoon E L Roberts Vessel Schr Sarah Elizabeth putting in ceiling

Wind Easterly and fine in the morning. later clouded up and at night began to snow. Previous to this there was no snow on the ground unless it might be in the woods none at all in the roads in Winter Harbor
Wind Easterly and rainy. some snow on the ground that fell last night but is now melting fast. staid in the store

Wind moderate Westerly. Went to Prospect Harbor in afternoon. on Town business to see about the settlement of Gouldsboros debt of which Winter Harbor is to pay 45 percent. Put a clerk in the store while I was away

Wind Westerly moderate and warm Reed valuations of property at the store. In evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting Brad Smith took the E.A.Degree and Dr A E Small was Elected. this was a stated meeting

Wind Easterly and at night a rainstorm Staying in store and receiving valuations of property in the town as required by law I also did what trading & could being an equal partner in the store with K S Macteer he pays me half wages and I pay the other half
Wind West North West and chilly. At night the ground freezing. At 9 PM the ground frozen hard enough to hold kept of a man Staying in the store all day
Wind North West. With snow squalls in the afternoon rather disagreeable weather. Work about the store all day
Wind Northerly and moderate and fine. weather staid about home

Wind Easterly and overcast commenced taking valuation Went to South Gouldsboro in forenoon and got one. came down old road And in the afternoon Went to Birch Harbor, got 11 and the lower Harbor and got 6 all residents of this town. In evening went to Chapter O.E.G.
Wind Easterly Finished taking valuation in the Town of Winter Harbor
Wind Easterly Staying in the store and looking after business in General. To much business to attend the Lodge
Wind Northerly and very fine Went to East Sullivan to hire money of Patrick but no taking any security with me I did not get any. came back in the afternoon
Wind moderate NW or nearly calm in the morning. and a very fine day At night went to Prospect Harbor and got $160 of Dr. C. C. Larrabee

Wind Southerly and fine. Went to Bar Harbor and took up a note of $260 at the First National Bank home at noon In evening went Republican to a Caucus at Hansons this place and was elected on Town comittee and after ward made clerk of the comittee
Wind North West untill night when it hauled out Southerly
Wind Easterly and rainy in the morning later cleared up Commenced to assess taxes and worked all day in the building adjoining the Store Cora Roberts is clerking for me in the Store
Wind Easterly and overcast. Work all day assessing taxes in building connect with the store

Wind very moderate and warm Southerly Thermometer 54' Work all day assessing taxes Could not go to the Lodge of F. & AM on account of the Store but the 2nd Degree was worked on Brad Smith of Sullivan and Dr Small of this place
Wind Southerly and moderate work all day assessing taxes
Wind South Easterly and overcast. At night thick with fog. Work all day assessing taxes
Wind very moderate and thick with fog light air Southerly then cleared up Work in store and assessing taxes
Wind Southerly and overcast stay at home
Wind North west in forenoon and S W in afternoon Work all day assessing taxes
Wind Northerly in the morning but in the afternoon it hauled out Southerly and clouded up. Working in the store and also assessing taxes
Wind North East and a little rainy in the morning later cleared up and fine. Work all day assessing taxes
Wind Northerly very fine. Work all day on taxes and tending store
Wind Southerly good breeze and fair weather. Worked all day assessing taxes and finished except filling out the collectors book which we have not got yet
Wind Easterly in morning & hauled out Southerly in afternoon tending the store
Wind Southerly Went to see Rosco Conners a sick pauper although he is supported by the Town of Cherryfield he has to be looked after by the overseers of the poor of this town
Wind Southerly and fine. work in store in forenoon But in the afternoon plowed for a garden getting ready to sew the seed
Wind Southerly and overcast at night rainy
Wind Northerly good breeze and very fine weather Work about the store. do not go to the Lodge tonight as I am getting ready to go to Portland and filling out warrants
Wind North North East in forenoon and Southerly in the afternoon. We are now all through with the taxes

Wind South Easterly and very fine was qualified as Justice of the Peace and quorum. In afternoon went to Bar Harbor on Str. Mascott and witnessed the work in the Royal Arch degree. got home at midnight
Wind Southerly work about home in the forenoon and in the Store in the afternoon
Wind Southerly and fine Staid at home
Wind moderate & warm Southerly. Left home at 7.30 for Portland Via Bar Harbor. thence M.C.R.R. to Portland. The object of this trip is to visit the Grand Lodge Arrived in Portland 5.35 P.M.

Wind Easterly. overcast and damp with a shower in the morning. Attended the Session of the Gd. Lodge all day At night went to Biddeford to visit Chapter of O.E.S. The Chapter did not meet and I came back to Portland
Wind Easterly and overcast. Do not attend the meeting of the Gd. Lodge in Portland this forenoon. but use the time for the Selection of Goods for the Store

Wind North East and very fine. Attended the Gd. Lodge apart of the forenoon And left Portland at P.M. for home but stopeed of at Ellsworth and visited Esoteric Lodge of F. & A.M. they worked the M.M.D. Stoped for the night at the Hancock House
local_place: Esoteric Lodge, Hancock House, Grand Lodge

journal_entry: Wind Southerly and fine. left Ellsworth on the Freight train at 9.30 A.M. and got to Bar Harbor at 12.30 P.M. and came home at 4 P.M.
Wind Southerly Staid in store all day
Wind Southerly in the morning then came around Northerly and the Thermometer went up to 90 in shade At 8 PM Thermometer at 70' above Then commenced Thunder showers
Wind Easterly and overcast. Stopping in store In evening went to Masonic Hall to Chapter O.E.S.
Wind North West and very fine. Staying in Store Clerking for my self
Wind North West in morning and Southerly in the afternoon Went to a political Lecture by D G Richards Populist
Wind Northerly in morning then hauled out southerly working in store
Wind Southerly and warm at the store
Wind Southerly and very fine day about the store
Wind Southerly and fine. staid about home
Wind Southerly and warm. Clerking for myself. In evening went to the Hall O.E.S.
Wind Southerly and overcast. In afternoon moderate rain At night wind Northerly & clear tending my store
Wind South West. very heavy. At the store In evening went to the Hall to a masonic meeting
Wind Southerly and chilly. afternoon raw and overcast Working in store
Calm and some fog in morning. but soon cleared up with the wind Southerly Staid in store
Wind South West fresh Work in store all day
Wind Southerly fresh and cold. staying at home
Wind Southerly Staying in Store
Wind South & fresh Went to Bar Harbor in boat miz pah after some flour Got home at 10 am raining it also rains all the afternoon While in the store At 9 P.M. raining heavy
Wind Southerly in forenoon & and thick with fog. afternoon cleared up Tending store for myself
Wind Southerly Went to Ellsworth Via Bar Harbor to visit Esoteric Lodge. In evening visited Esoteric Lodge worked the MMD. Stoped the reur of night at Hancock House
Wind Easterly & Rainy Left Ellsworth at 7 10 AM for Home Via Bar Harbor. arrived at noon. But little or no rain has fallen this spring. the ground is getting dry. This may do a little good
Wind Southerly and quite fair. Staying in the store trading. In evening to Hansons Hall to elect a delegate to to attend the State convention to be holden in Bangor
Wind South South E. very fresh breeze and a power of rain. The ground will now get mill soaked. and is what we need. At 4 PM help up
Wind North West and very fine in the morning but later it was some times clear with the wind South then showery and most all kinds of weather
Wind Northerly and fine. Staying in Store
Wind Northerly and fine. Working in Store for myself Do not go to the Lodge
Wind Southerly but very warm At night thunders showers Work in Store
Wind Wind South Work in store
Wind North East in morning and hauled out South Some cloudy but fine weather
Wind moderate or calm with fog in morning
Wind Southerly and overcast. tending store during the day and in the evening went to masonic Hall to the Order of Eastern Star
Wind Easterly and rain most all day Keeping store for myself

Wind Southerly and moderate rain most of forenoon. In afternoon fine At 2 P.M. the Masons of Winter Harbor. Went to the steam boat wharf. to Escort the Masons of Bar Harbor who had the remains of W A Milliken in charge and burried him with masonic honors in this place
Wind first S. West then Northerly with heavy rain squalls and hail. Then Sun shine and rain squalls again. Clerking in store foremyself
Wind North West fresh & fine. had store cleaned and staid in it
Wind Southerly tending to business in the store
Wind Easterly and in the afternoon rainy staid about home
Wind Easterly and rainy Went to Bar Harbor to see an attorney about town business Left Bar Harbor at one P.M. for home In evening to the masonic Hall to a meeting order O.E.S.
Wind South West and fine. staying in Store
Wind Southerly and fine. Clerking for myself
Wind Southerly and fresh. Fog in afternoon tending store In evening went to masonic Hall Special meeting O.E.S. Visit of Gran Matron
Wind Southerly fine weather working for my self in store
Wind Southerly and warm Staying in Store
Wind very moderate Southerly and hot afternoon cloudy Evening very heavy thunder storm
Calm and thick with fog in morning but later cleared up. attending to my business in the Store and to the business of the town, as selectman

Wind North West and a very fine day Attending to business in the store. In evening went to the Republican Caucus and was elected a delegate to the County Convention to be held in Ellsworth the 25 inst.
Wind North West and a very fine day staid in store in forenoon and in the afternoon went to Ellsworth Via Bar Harbor to attend the County Convention to be held tomorrow

Wind Westerly and a very fine day. At 10 AM met at Hancock Hall in Ellsworth to attend the County Convention Nominated John P. Eldridge Co. Commission L F Hooper Sheriff John E Bunker County atty. B. E Tracys name was presented for County atty and had 20 votes Henry Boynlon had 29 & John C Bunker had 64
Wind Southerly and overcast Got some lumber in the forenoon and commenced to build a rail by the shore at the Western end of the sand beach along side of highway heavy shower at noon
Wind Southerly and a hot sun Work all day on rail at the corner of the sand beach that I commenced yesterday
Wind Southerly & fine weather Staid about home
Wind South South West fresh breeze. Work all day building rail around the curve in the road near Western edge of sand beach
Wind Westerly in forenoon and Southerly in afternoon. Finished the rail near the sand beach and in the afternoon Went back into the store
Wind Southerly and very fine Clerking for myself in Store
Wind South West Work in store fine weather
Wind Southerly and fine staid in store

Celebration day Wind Easterly and overcast. At night a down pouring rain. Staid in Store and had a very good trade selling groceries There is no celebrating here except a few boys with firecrackers & horns
Wind Easterly and a power of rain untill 9 AM then cleared up

Calm in forenoon Southerly in the afternoon. I have taken $16.10 Cash in the store to day probably traded $25.00 the County Convention came to day to establish the road bounds by request of the select men my self is chairman
Easterly and rain all the forenoon but cleared up in the afternoon but rained again in the evening Commissioners worked in the afternoon. I staid in the store most of the time
Wind Southerly County Commissioners at work establishing the road bounds and got almost through with their work. I staying in store

Wind Southerly Thermometer 84' Commissioners finished work in forenoon The Surveyor stopping to see that the bounds are set in the right place. myself working with him and other men whom I have hired for the town to assist
Calm and thick with fog in forenoon cleared up in the afternoon Work in store
Wind Southerly Staid in store working for myself
Wind Southerly Thermometer 86'
Wind Southerly Thermometer 84' Working in store At 6 P.M. a very heavy thunder shower a power of rain
Wind Southerly Thermometer 82' working in store
Wind South Easterly and overcast forenoon afternoon rainy work in store
Wind Westerly and fine work in store
Wind South West and very fine Went to Bar Harbor on Str. Ruth back home at night hired a clerk to stay in store during my absence
Wind Southerly and fine staying in Store
Wind Southerly and overcast by spells
Wind Southerly Staid in store At 8 P.M. heavy rain fell. and poured down fearfully
Wind Southerly Partially foggy Staid in Store all day The heavy rain that commenced to fall at 8 PM yesterday did not let up untill 9 this AM
wind Southerly Staid in store in forenoon. Ther. 84' and in afternoon Started to go to Schoodic to see a wreck got to Pond Point. the wind died out. came back and went in to the store. thick with fog
Wind South South East in morning with some fog and rain cleared up later in the day and became fine weather
Wind North West in forenoon and South Southerly in afternoon staid in store

Wind very moderate Southerly with a little rain in morning At 9 AM cleared up At 11.20 AM started for Bar Harbor on Str Ruth came back at 7 P.M. and attended a Republican Caucus at Winter Harbor and was elected a delegate to the district convention at Sullivan to nominate a Representative
Wind Southerly and fine weather Many people got their hay in
Wind Easterly and afternoon rainy. no hay day at all. I have no hay to get it was sold while growing
Wind North West and fine staid in store all day. at 10 PM the Str Ruth brought nearly 300 people for Bar Harbor on an Excurtion
Wind Westerly and fine Went to Bar Harbor on Str Ruth to sell house lots of Schoodic Peninsula Land Co. Stoped over night
Wind South South East and thick with fog. Came home from Bar Harbor in the morning. and staid in store the rem of the day
Wind North West and one of the finest days of the summer Staid in store
Wind NorthWest and very fine until late in the afternoon when the wind hauled out South At night Cloudy Staid in Store all day
Wind South South East and moderate rain from 8 AM untill 2 PM when the sun came out
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. staid in store
Wind Southerly and moderate with some fog in the morning. later it all burned up. Staid in store
Wind Southerly and very moderate Staid in store all day. then Went to Globe Hall to an exhibition Mr Gen Thon Thum at night raniy
Wind South East and rainy all day Staid in store all day
Wind South East and rainy. Staid in store in forenoon and in the afternoon Got Edgar Lord a Civil Engineer to define Mrs D B Flints Right of way from near my house. down on Harbor Point to their land
Wind South East and thick with fog Work in store
Wind Southerly Thick with fog in morning and at night but clear during most of the day
Wind North West Thermometer 86' in shade. This is what we call very hot day Agreed to sell Mr. John G. Moore of New York a price of land for $500 in front of my house on Harbor Point
Wind Westerly with the Thermometer 85' measured the price of land that I have agreed to sell Mr J. G. Moore
Wind Southerly and very fine a little overcast both morning and night. Mr B E Tracy has gone to Ellsworth for an abstract of little of land which I have agreed to sell Mr Moore
Wind Northerly in morning and then hauled Easterly but clear and fine all day Work in Store

Wind Easterly and very moderate. Somewhat overcast poor day for those who have hay out. L. I. Gott of Bar Harbor Bankrupt stock of tobacco pipes cigars Cartridges Ice. sold in the building adjourning my store at Winter Harbor. Clerking in my own store
Wind South Easterly and pleasant Staying in store
Wind Southerly and thick with fog Staid about home
Wind North West and a very fine day Staying in my store
Wind Southerly fine staying in store
Wind North West fresh all day with showers staid in Store
Wind North West in forenoon and South in the afternoon Calm in evening Stayed in store all day
Wind Southerly and fine Staying in Store
Wind Southerly and overcast and in the afternoon a little rainy Staid in store

Wind South East fog in forenoon and rain in afternoon heavy. Six months tomorrow since I bought into the Store with K.S. Macteer. My next move will be to get a settlement he paying 1/2 wages as agreement or dissolve partnership

Wind Southerly and thick with fog. At 8 AM cleared up. The trade I made with Mr. John G. Moore of New York to sell him a pilce of land aug. 10 has been connected by mutual agreement and another trade made. by running the line further Westerly in front of our house we get $150 additional to the trade that was made on the 10 inst. therefore the price we are to get for the land is $650 instead of 500. Deed to be given tomorrow Staid in store apart of the day

Wind Westerly and fine. But in forenoon the wind hauled out Southerly. The title of our land not being perfect. we do not present a deed to Mr. Moore to day for a check But take the day to get our little perfect by getting the wives of Wm. and Albert Rand to sign their right of dower. at night the deeds perfect

Wind Southerly pleasant during the day. At night thick with fog. Title of land being all right. Mr. John G. Moore. of N.Y. gives me his chk for $650.00 and gets his deed of land for same. In evening Went to the Hall and listened to a Republican speech of Hon. Chas. Emory Smith of Philadelphia PA.

Wind South South East and thick with fog. Staid in store Trying to get a settlement with K.S. Macteer About $100 due me for wages. Now I find I am not going to get any wages. I have made a proposition to dissolve partnership which will probably take place tomorrow
Wind North West and very fine and pleasant. Staid in Store No settlement with K.S. Macteer to day he is in Bar Harbor and said he would settle tomorrow
Wind Southerly and pleasant Have not seen Mr Macteer to day therefore no settlement. Staid in Store
Wind Southerly but quite fine Staid about home
Wind Southerly Went to Bar Harbor on Str. Ruth to get check cashed and paid 100 Iowed the Bank & 160 to J A Peters. Stoped over night. rain at night
Wind Southerly came home from Bar Harbor at 11 AM and went into this store in the afternoon
Wind Northerly untill noon when it hauled out Southerly Staying in Store
Wind baffling Easterly but quite moderate Staying in Store
Wind Southerly and chilly Staid in Store
Wind South East and overcast. Staid in store Wrote warrants for state Election Frost in morning
Wind South East heavy blow & big rain storm Staid about home

Wind South and thick with fog Had Warrants posted up for State Election to be held in one week. afternoon fog cleared up staid in Store In evening went to Hall to a meeting of the Chapter O.E.S. Reed application of Mrs Victoria Rand
Wind Southerly Clear most of the day. Evening thick with fog Work in Store
