Wind South East some what overcast. Evening rainy Staying in Store
Wind Easterly overcast and rainy. staid in Store
Wind Southerly and very rough tremendious rain in morning At noon hot. Staid in Store. Revising the voting first
Wind Southerly and at night thick with fog. In evening went to Globe Hall to a Political meeting and to show the voters how to mark their ballots at the comming election
Wind Easterly Overcast and chilly staid about home

Wind Southerly and overcast. State Election. The first state Election since Winter Harbor was set off from Gouldsboro in February 1895. Therefore we vote in Winter Harbor to day for the first time at state Election myself Chairman of the board of select man There were more than 160 voters on the list. but only 112 was cast and was as followers viz. Fror Llewellyn Republican 54 Denverat 16 and populist 38 with one prohibition and 3 spoiled voters not counted

Wind Southerly and overcast. untill noon when the sun came out hot. The report of the Election in the State gives Powers for Governor nearly 50.000 plurality. Republican Candidate This is not official
Wind Easterly and overcast staid in store
Wind Southerly and thick with fog with a little shower. Staid in store
Wind North West and fine weather at night calm staid in Store
Wind South East Fog and rain and rain staid in store In evening thunder and lightning
Wind North West good breeze and fine. Staid about home
Wind Southerly good weather Staying in store
Wind Southerly and wet. Staying in store
Wind North and clear. Chilly Staying in store
Wind very moderate Westerly and overcast look like a storm brewing. Staying in store
Wind Southerly and cloudy Work in store
Wind Southerly and overcast. Staid in Store. In afternoon. Drew J.J. Roberts to serve on the Grand Jurry
Wind Southerly and pleasant. Staid at home
Wind North Easterly and overcast. Staid in store gave an order for a car load of flour of 125 Bbls from F.W. Stock Hillsdale Michigan flor to cost $4.25 landed in Portland
Wind very light East. At day light the old house of the late Saml. Pendleton was on fire and burned down At 10 AM wind Southerly Staid in Store
Wind South East and a heavy rainstorm At noon it stormed to hard to go home to dinner and went to the Ocean House. Staid in store all day had a good trade
Wind Southerly and thick with fog in the morning noon cleared up Staid in store trade very good the last two days
Wind North East and rainy staid in store
Wind North North East and overcast. Staying in store
Wind Northerly and quite fine but a little overcast. Staid at home
Wind North East and overcast Staid in Store all day In evening went Masonic Hall to a meeting of Rubic Chapter O.E.S. Voted on the application Mrs. V. T. Rand
Wind North Easterly and overcast. Signed $15.00 as a guarantee toward Interest on the cost of sinking the water pipe below post from the pondo to my house. Staid in store all day
Wind North East in forenoon and Southerly in afternoon staid in store
Wind Westerly and a fair day Staying in store and trying to get water takers enough to pay interes on cost of sinking the water pipe below frost
Wind North West fresh and clear stoping in store
Calm in morning and later in the forenoon the wind breezed up Westerly Staying in store
Wind Easterly Thermometer at 32'
Wind North East heavy. Went to Bar Harbor on Str Hector & deposited $510.50 to pay for a car load of flour where the flour arrives came home in the forenoon Afternoon in the store
Wind North East a gale. the Hector makes no trips to Bar Harbor to day Stayed in store
Wind Northerly and partialy clear. Staying in store. In evening went to Masonic Hall Brad Smith took the M.M. Degree
Wind North East and a rainstorm Staid in store
Wind Westerly quite pleasant. Staying in Store
Wind Southerly and overcast. looking like rain
Wind South Easterly and rainy staying about home
Wind North West and fine. staying in store
Wind Southerly Cloudy Staying in store
Wind South East and a rain storm staying in store
Wind North West fresh. Staying in Store
Wind Southerly & overcast. Afternoon fresh breeze. Hired $175.00 of Mrs. Hannah Crabtree for 11 months Staying in Store
Wind South South East and a perfect gale with heavy rain Str. Hector does not make any trip to Bar Harbor Staying in Store
Wind West North West blowing heavy and rough. Staid about home
Wind Westerly Went to Bar Harbor on Str Hector took up a note of 192.75 at the Bank. Came home in the afternoon
Wind North North West. Went to Turtle Isle Ledges gunning. but got none. birds are very scarce. Got home at 10 AM. and went in the store
Wind Northerly went to Turtle Isle Ledges gunning got two Birds. home at noon afternoon went in store
Wind Southerly my birthday 51 yrs. Being born Oct. 29 1845 This day is a little rainy. I am staying in a grocery store clerking for myself
Wind Southerly and wet. Staying in Store
Wind Southerly and thick with fog and mist. In store all day Cash trade to day $20.00
Calm and overcast in the morning afternoon wind Southerly and looking like rain Staying about home
Wind baffling all around the compass untill noon. then S.W. untill 3 P.M. then Northerly staid in store all day. In evening went to masonic Hall to Chapter of Eastern Star

Wind Northerly and fine. Presidential Election I am Chairman of the board of Selectman Total No. of votes cast 103. Mc Kinley had 43 Bryan & Swall Dem. 31 Palmer & Buckner National Dem. 1 Prohibition 2 Bryan Watson 23 Defective ballots 3 103

Wind Easterly and fine. Staid in store all forenoon and the returns are commin in that Mr Mc Kinley is Elected Afternoon went to Bar Harbor to see abt a car load of flour I ordered for myself and which left mich more than 3 weeks ago Am getting to Bar Harbor I find it is just being landed from the Str Frank Jones. came home
Wind in the morning South Easterly looking like a storm Afternoon & night a heavy rain storm and a gale of wind
Wind South in the morning with some rain and hauled South Westerly and cleared up. Staid in store
Wind Westerly good breeze and fair weather Staid in store
Wind Southerly and overcast. Afternoon rainy Ruth Pendleton burried in the afternoon

Wind Northerly Received a car load of flour from Michigan and delivered 12 Bbls in town The first cost of flour $3.85 freight from Mich. 60 and hauling .05 cost 4.50 per Bbl and retailing it for $5.50 per Bbl

Wind Westerly and somewhat overcast. Sold H.R.Joy 30 Bbls. at 50 cts profet the taking it from the wharf he saves 05 cts or pays $4.95 Chk ants to $148.50 There were 125 Bbls in the car load from Michigan from F.W. stock Hillsdale
Wind South East and at noon a rainstorm. and in the afternoon a powerful one. staid in store untill dark
Wind North Westerly and overcast. does not look like a clear of Staid in store
Wind Easterly Went to Bar Harbor on Str. Hector and got carpeting for our Dinney room back in afternoon Evening staid in store
Wind North NorthWest very heavy The steam boat makes no trips to day. staid in store
Wind Southerly and blowing a gale Staid about home
Wind Easterly and fresh. I have started this afternoon with with a petition for the position of post master at this place
Wind Northerly but overcast Staying in Store and getting some Signers to my application for the office of post master
Wind South East and foul weather Staying in store
Wind Northerly Left home at 1 PM for Bangor. Via Bar Harbor. then took the train arriving in the evening at Bangor and stoping at the Windsor Hotel

Wind Northerly Left Bangor for Belfast at 7.15 am to see Hon. S.L. Milliken in regard to bring appointed P.M. at Winter Harbor. arrived at 10.15 Saw Mr. Milliken at his house. Took the train at 1.25 PM arrived in Bangor 4.25 Stoped at the Windsor Hotel

Wind South Easterly Ther. 10' above in Bangor Left Bangor at 6.45 AM for home on train Via Bar Harbor. arriving home at 11 A.M. and went in the Store in afternoon. at 1 PM began to snow. at 3 PM it began to rain and rained hard untill bed time
Wind Northerly and fresh. Staid about home
Wind Easterly in the morning Ther. 6' above zero In the afternoon wind out Southerly and clouded up Staid in store
Wind Southerly and rainy all the forenoon. In afternoon cleared up and at night Wind Westerly Staying in store
Wind North East and overcast. Had an invitation Geo R Tracys and Mared Davis wedding which takes place at the Baptist Church this forenoon but I do not attend staying in store
Wind East North East Snow in forenoon rain in afternoon This is Thanksgiving and rather a rough day. working in store for myself
Wind Southerly and wet staying in store
Wind Southerly wet and thick with fog. Staying in store working for myself
Wind Northerly and fine weather
Wind North North East overcast weather No snow on the ground but the ground is freezing a little Staying in store. In evening went to Masonic Hall to a meeting of the Eastern Star
North North West Ther. 30 above zero had 8 tons coal hauled to the house and 2 tons at store Staid in store most all day
Wind North and Thermometer 15' above in morning and at 10 P.M. it was 4' above put out side windows on cook room. and staid in store the remainder of the day
Wind Northerly Thermometer at zero staying in store

Wind North West in the morning. Went to Bar Harbor on Str. Hector to take up a note. In afternoon wind South South West. Str. Hector having blown out a tube left Bar Harbor nearly one hour before her time. Then I got a skiff of Alfred Smith and rowed home. then blowing fresh
Wind Southerly Thermometer 50' very fine day Staying in store have a good trade
Wind Easterly fresh and hauled out Southerly Staid at home

Wind moderate Westerly and warm In forenoon bid in the property of Non Residents for the taxes afternoon staid in store. Evening went to the Anual meeting of the Order of Eastern Star and I was elected Worthy Patron
Wind Southerly and very fine Staid in store
Wind South East almost a gale and heavy rain staid in store
Wind South West in forenoon and in the afternoon Westerly and fine weather Staid in store
Wind North Easterly and very fine Staying in store all day
Wind Westerly and overcast but fine weather Staying in store
Wind Southerly fresh and somewhat overcast
Wind Westerly and warm in the forenoon. In the afternoon wind hauled Northerly and grows colder the ground freezing. Staid in store during the day. In evening went to the O.E.S.

Wind North East Went to Ellsworth Via Harbor. thence on train The object of this is to see Arno King Esq relative to the suit now pending between Gouldsboro and Winter Harbor. got through business at dark then telephoned for a team from Winter Harbor to meet me at sullivan. A few minutes before six took the train in Ellsworth to Waukeag crossed the ferry to Sullivan found the team I had telephones for and came home arriving at 10 P.M.
Wind East North East and blowing heavy Thermometer 15' above and snowing some and piling up as fast as it comes. staid in store all day. trade very slim
Wind North Easterly and clear. A little snow lays along side the roads but the middle of the road all bare staid in store
About calm all day sometimes a little air of wind Southerly then North Easterly. At night very overcast. Wind South and looking like a storm. Staid in store

Wind Westerly Staid in store The ground shows that it rained some last night. Posted up notices for a special Town meeting. to see if the Town wants to Pay Gouldsboro her claim V.S. Winter Harbor or stand a suit. My Daughter published to Andrew Pendleton
Wind North West. Fresh breeze. Thermometer 18' above Called to see Charles F. Kingsley who is sick and no Probability of being any better
Wind North. Thermometer 6' above staid in store
Wind Northerly and about 1/2 in snow fell when it cleared up Thermometer from 4' to 10' above zero. Staying in store
Wind Easterly and fine but cold Thermometer from 4' in morning to 8 in evening above zero Staid in store 9 PM wind North
Wind Northerly Ther. from 4' to 5' above zero Staid in Store
Christmas Wind North West Ther. from 4' degrees in morning to 10' at night above Staid in store

Wind Westerly Ther 12 above in morning noon 130' above. In afternon wind hauled Northerly At 2 oclock P.M. went to Town meeting to see what action the Town would take in regard settling the law suit Gouldsboro again Winter Harbor. Voted to defend the suit. and the Select man is Authorized get the Athys At 9 oclock PM Solemenized the marriage of my daughter at out house
Wind North West Thermometer at zero
Wind Westerly Went to Bar Harbor in packet to see Dr. Paul Castor for my Nephew Chas. F. Kingsley But the Dr. is in Bangor and will be back to Bar Harbor to night

Wind very moderate South West Thermometer abt. 45 Staying in store In afternoon I telephoned to Dr. Paul Castor to come to Winter Harbor from Bar Harbor and he said he would come tomorrow to see Charles F. Kingsley

Wind Southerly and moderate. work about the store and trying to buy the first mortgage of Edmund Young of the Mrs. Harrington store and lot. and have as far as can be done by telephone Dr. Paul Castor came from Bar Harbor to see C.F. Kingsley and went away in the afternoon

Wind North North West. blowing a gale. but not cold enough to freeze I am Propietor of a store and attend to it most of the time. My coal privilege having been leased to E.L. Roberts of Bar Harbor. I have this day bought the first mortgage of the Mrs. A.L. Harrington store and lot. I bought of Mr. Edmund L. Young for $584 paying $250 in land 334 in Cash total amit. 584 and take possession. It is now occupied by J.W. Wescott who will remain the tenant as barbers shop and a shoe store. I have foreclosed the mortgage

Calm about all day Tried to get to Bar Harbor in Sail Yacht. but not wind enough. and got home at dark towing apart of the way. There is no snow on the ground nor has there been any sleighing so far this winter. I am keeping store for my self selling groceries. Have been in the business a year
Wind South West Went to Bar Harbor on Sail Packet. to make some arrangements abt Steamer coming to Winter Harbor to take C F Kingsley to Bar Harbor to go to Bangor. Did not succeed home at night
Wind Southerly and thick with fog. Have agreed with the Capt. of the Steam Smack "Grace Morgan" to take Charles F. Kingsley to Bar Harbor to go to Bangor to be put under Dr. Paul Castor's treatment

Wind South West with a little fog in morning. At 9 A.M. Dr. Small wraped Chas. Kingsley up and he was put into a carriage and hauled to the Wharf. West side of Grindstone Neck & put on board of Str "Grace Morgan" and taken to Bar Harbor put on board Str Sappho. For Mt. Desert Ferry. thence on board of the train for Bangor He has gone to Bangor for treatment. He is very low with consumption and other complaints He will be under the care of Paul Castor. I went to Mt. Desert Ferry with him and came home. Dr Small and Charleys mother went with him to Bangor

Wind Southerly and rainy. all day Staid in Store. In evening went to the Masonic Hall to a public installation of officers of the "Order of the Eastern Star." I was Installled the Worthy Patron. Installation was performed the Grand Watrom Mrs. Eaton of Herron
Wind Southerly Anual meeting of Winter Harbor Lodge F. & A.M. For the Election of Officers Parker Davis & Chas Davis were Elected to take the degrees
Wind North West. Quite fresh. Staying in Store
Wind North East Ther 10 above Staying in Store

Wind North by East. Left home at 8 AM on Packet for Bar Harbor to go to Brownsville to see Charley Kingsley my sisters son who left home last monday to be placed under treatment by Paul Castor. Arriving in Bar Harbor in time. took Str. Sapples to Mt. Desert Ferry thence the train to Bangor arriving at 1.20 PM. At 4.55 took the Bangor and Aroostil R.R. for Brownsville a distance of about 45 miles from Bangor and arrived about 7 P.M. Went to Hotel Herrick where I found C.F. Kingsley and his mother. and I stay with them overnight
Calm about all day stopping all day with C.F. Kingsley and his mother at Hotel. Herrick at Brownsville I cannot see that Charley is any better than when he left home to be placed under a new doctor

Wind North East and fine weather. Left Brownsville at 7.45 AM for Home Via Bangor arriving in Bangor at 9 AM and remained in Bangor untill 4.50 PM when I took the train for home coming to Waukeas station crossing river and hired team to go home arriving at 10 PM snowing hard all the way from Sullivan
Wind North. some snow the first for the season so that the sleds & Sleighs are out
Wind North West blowing heavy. There at zero in morning. staid in store in forenoon but in the afternoon did not feel will enough and went home and staid there
Wind North East. Thermometer at zero Do not go out of the house to day. do not feel will enough
Wind Easterly and fine weather Staid in store

Wind Easterly and fine. Staid in store. Reed letter from my sister in Brownsville that her son was failing. He went to Bangor with Paul Castor to be doctored. then the Doctor took him to Brownsville. His mother went with him
Wind Southerly and fresh. At night received message that Charles F. Kingsley. my sisters son died at Brownsville this morning. where he went from Bangor to be doctored by Paul Castor Sr.

Wind South and a gale with a tremendious fall of rain. Went to Sullivan by team. Crossed the Ferry took train for Bangor arriving at 1.20 P.M. the fall of rain then about over. I found my sister in Bangor where she had just arrived from Brownsville with the remains of her son. We took the train at 5 P.M. for home. got of at Waukeag station crossed the Ferry to Sullivan. Wind North West a gale and growing cold. Took team fro home arriving at 9.30 P.M. The remains came with another team

Wind North West blowing a very heavy gale. Thermometer 14' below in morning. at noon 10' below and at night 12' below. It is so cold that the burial of Charley Kingsley has been postponed untill the weather moderated I do not go in store
Wind North West Thermometer 8' blow At 10 AM zero. at 2 P.M. 10' above zero Charley Kingsley burried from his late home at 3 P.M. Prayer I singing In afternoon about calm looking like snow
Wind South East heavy snow storm in forenoon. But in the afternoon turned to rain. And at night the snow most all gone. Staid in store
Wind North West and moderate Staid in store
Wind Northerly and a little snowy Staid in store
Wind North West Ther. 10' above Staid about home

Wind West North West Thermometer 5' below zero Thimothy Durnton call on the Town for help. and sends for me to go and see him. And I go in the afternoon as an overseer of the Poor. And in the evening send him a few groceries Clarence Came joined O.E.S. myself W.P.
Wind Westerly. Ther 8' above zero Work in store
Wind Westerly. afternoon moderate Work in store. In evening Went to Masonic Hall The Officers of Winter Harbor were publicly Installed by DDGM Mason of Somesville
Wind Easterly very fresh at 8 AM it began to snow and snowed and blowed very hard all day and snowing at 9.30 PM when I go to bed have been in the store all day
Wind North North West Ther 20' above Zero staid in store
Wind North West. and moderate Staid in store Let K.S. Mactein have goods to the amount of ten dollars on a sweing machine. and took a Holmes Note on thirty days time
Wind North West and fine Staid abt. home
Wind Southerly and fine Staid in store do not visit the Chapter O.E. Star
Wind very moderate or calm. not enough in one direction to tell which way it is. staid in store
Wind Easterly and very fresh and clear. Staid in store all day. and Evening do not go to the Lodge
Wind Northerly and fine weather Staid in Store
Wind Northerly and fine Staid in store
Wind South East and fine Staid in store
Wind Easterly Fresh and Stormy Abouth home heavy rain
Wind very moderate Northerly & warm Ther. 40' above. Staid in store The Sledding is spoiled except in the woods
Wind Northerly and fine. work in store. We the selectmen give notice we will meet at James Brodinck's on Grindstone neck. Wed the 17 to decide about laying out the roads for townways
Wind North West and clear. Staid in store. In evening went to Masonic Hall to the Lodge F. & AM Charles Davis took the M. M. Degrees
Wind North West Thermometer 2' above in morning and 6' above at night Working in store and getting the business of the town ready to go in Point
Wind moderate Northerly Thermometer 2' above zero Work in Store receiving goods and working on town report. 3 in of snow fell to day
Wind North and a good breeze. Staying in Store making up town reports
Wind Norther;y and fine weather Staid at home
Wind South East and wet Work all day on the town reports
Wind Easterly and snowy writing up town reports and have got them ready to send away in the morning

Wind Westerly and fine. Went on Grindstone Neck to see about laying out the roads belonging to the Company as per notice given by Selectmen Also put up our notice that we the selectmen will not at my store 4th of march to give permit to set telegraph poles on pineaple sheets
Wind South Easterly and moderate. Work in Store
Wind Northerly and moderate Staid in store
Wind Westerly and fine. Wrote town warrant for annual town meeting
Wind South Easterly and a little snowy in forenoon and pleasant in the afternoon. Staid about home
Wind North East and overcast. Washingtons birthday staid in store
Wind Easterly and some snow in morning then hauled in North and cleared up. Staid in store all day
Calm in morning. at 9 AM wind breezed up W.N.West very fresh. Staid in Store all day and in the evening went to the Baptist Church to a religious meeting
Wind South West Went to Turtle Isle Ledges gunning The wind breezed up rough did not get any birds. In afternoon Staid in Store
Wind North West fresh Work in store
Wind North West Staying in Store
Wind Westerly Staid at home

Wind North Westely Thermometer 6 degrees below zero in morning Town meeting day. I was reelected chairman on the boards of selectmen unanimously. Also voted to accept the roads on Grindstone Neck. In evening went to a meeting of the Eastern Star. at Masonic Hall. 10 PM Wind Southerly
Wind Westerly most of the day. Staid in store most all day Went after the sewing machines at K.S. Macteers that I got claim on Jan 30 Mr. Macteer would not let me have it
Wind South East and snow in the morning but later in the forenoon it turned to rain. And rained most all day Staid in store all day
Wind West North West fresh. all day staid in store Meeting of the selectmen at my store to give permit to have telephone poles set in the Streets of this town Permit granted

Wind Southerly and moderate in forenoon. Fresh in afternoon In afternoon went to Bunkers Harbor with B.E. Tracy on Town business connected with the settlement of Gouldsboro debt. conceiving a Pauper A Lindsey Gril

Wind North West and fine. Staid in Store Got out writ of repleny sent Cornstable to K.S. Macteers and got my sewing machine which I tried to get last tuesday without an officer. Said machine was seemed to me Jan. 30 by a Holmes note for goods our of store
Wind Norther;y and fine weather Staid at home

Wind moderate Southerly Went to Bar Harbor on various business Came back in the afternoon. Received a Fountain As a gift from Mr. John G. Moore of New York for the Town of Winter Harbor. It was sent to me as I am the Chairman of the board of Select men In the evening went to the meeting order of the Eastern Star
Wind Southerly and rainy Staid in store
Wind Southerly and rainy all day. Staid in store
Wind Westerly. Staid in store Sleighing all used up
Wind Southh East and in the afternoon heavy rain Staid in store

Wind Westerly Went to West Gouldsboro to hear the arguments of Council Gouldsboro V.S. Winter Harbor This was a case growing out to the division of Gouldsboro when Winter Harbor was set of in the settlement of Gouldsboro debt. It was entered at the Supreme Court in October. It was then taken out of court and judge Wismell & John F. Knowlton Clerk of court was made refereed the resul will not be made known untill April. turn of Court. Came home at night
Wind South Easterly and snowed most all day. Staid at home
Wind West North West fresh. They sleighs are out again. Staid in Store In evening went to the Order of Eastern Star at Masonic Hall 4 members were admitted
Wind North West and cold. Ther 6' above 0 Staid in store

Wind NorthWest fresh Ther 7' above in morning Ross Connors died sometime this morning living here. but on the town of Cherryfeld I have the remains to look after berry Chairsman of the overseers of poor
Wind Westerly in the morning and Southerly in the afternoon. Had grave dug for Ross Connors and making preparations for a funeral

Wind Southerly and a heavy mist Chas. R. Conners Known as Ross Conners burried from the Church at 2.30 P.M. The whhole being under my charge as Overseers of the Poor. He belonged at Cherryfield The rem. of the day I staid in store
Wind South Easterly and wet. Staid in store
Wind very moderate South Easterly and about four inches of snow fell. staid at home
Wind Southerly and wet. Snow melts very fast. At night rainy Sleighing all gone again. Staid in store during the day and went to the Order of the Eastern star in evening
Wind very moderate all day. in fact it has been calm Staying in store
Wind Easterly At 8 AM began to snow. and snowed all day. At night rain. This makes sleighing again 3 or 4 inches has fallen. Staid in store
Wind South West. Staid in store
Wind Northerly Staid in store in forenoon and in the afternoon went to the Lower Harbor to look after to bridge
Wind Northerly staid in store in forenoon and in the afternoon Went to Bar Harbor to see several people
Wind North West. and good weather Staid about home
Wind North West and fine. Staid in store
Wind North West and very fine Had quite a large lot of goods come from Portland by Sch Julia Ann Staid in store
Wind NorthWest Staid in store all day. In evening went to Masonic Hall A.C.Leighton of Mark Island took the M.M.D.
